title: ResidentsandSchoolchildren Protest 8th Ave. Sex Shops
description: Pimps, prostitutes and conspicuous consumers of pornography were replaced for a brief time yesterday afternoon on three blocks of Eighth Avenue by singing schoolchildren and residents who chanted, Give us back our neighborhood.

title: Millan Says He Has Signed
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Nov. 14 (AP)Felix Millan, the Mets' second baseman, said today that he had signed a twoyear contract with the New York Mets for $100,000 each year. Millan batted .282 last season. He is playing with Caguas in the Puerto Rican Winter League.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Enter Samuel Bronfman 2d, the 48th Witness
description: When Edgar Bronfman gave Mel Patrick Lynch $2.3 million in ransom money in August 1975, for the release of his allegedly kidnapped son, Samuel, enclosed in the darkgreen, plastic garbage bags that held the cash was note in which the chairman of Seagram Distillers vowed that neither he nor any member of my family would ever testify against anyone accused of the abduction.

title: In Memoriam
description: WILKINSON, MargaretIn memory of our beloved mother on her birthday. Family

title: Dance: The Canadian Ballet at 25
description: TORONTO, Nov. 14Dance in North America is getting older. The American Ballet Theater is already 36 years old, the New York City Ballet is 28, even the Joffrey has just celebrated its 20th birthday, and here in Toronto at the O'Keefe Center the National Ballet of Canada is having its 25th anniversary season. For the occasion it is restaging John Cranko's Romeo and Juliet and next week is mounting Frederick Ashton's La Fille Mal Garde, the first time this production has ever been performed by a North American company.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Advertising
description: The HiC Fruit Drink advertising claim that it is the favorite drink of kids and monsters everywhere didn't sit too well with the National Advertising Division of the Council of Better Business Bureaus. As the advertising industry's first line in selfregulation, it cares about such things.

title: Copter Police Corner L.I. Holdup Suspect
description: Nassau County police officers brandishing guns from a hovering helicopter kept a robbery suspect covered on the roof of a fourstory Freeport, L.I., apartment building for several minutes yesterday until foot patrrolmen arrived and took him into custody.

title: Lame Duck Vengeance
description: WASHINGTON  If the New York Daily News headline writer wanted to strike again, he would title the first key United Nations vote of a lameduck Administration with these words: FORD TO ISRAEL: DROP DEAD.

title: Around the Nation
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Nov. 14 (UPI)Four leaders of a citywide firemen's strike began serving 30day jail terms today for refusing to call an end to the fourdayold walkout in compliance with a judge's backtowork order.

title: INDIVIDUAL STATISTICS
description: RUSHESN.Y.: Gaines, 27 for 103 yards; Davis, 18 for 76; Todd, 3 for 37. T.B.: Carter, 19 for 79; Do Bose, 3 for 8; McNeill, 3 for 13.

title: Chayefsky's Network Bites Hard As a Film Satire of TV Industry
description: After a long and rewarding career with the UBS Television network as one of America's most respected news commentators, Howard Beale (Peter Finch) is being given the sack. Because his ratings have begun to slip and his show's share of the national audience is nil, this heir to the ideals of Edward R. Murrow has been found wanting. He's obsolete. The night after receiving the bad news, Howard signs off the air by urging his viewers to tune in to his final show next week. He will, he says cheerily, commit suicide on camera.

title: Stage: Reviving The Rehearsal
description: I like breaking things, says the character called Hero in Jean Anouilh's The Rehearsal. Hero, an alcoholic whose heart has fermented along with his liver, is not the only smasher in the chateau that is the setting of the play. The time is 1952 and these corrupt remnants of an empty aristocracy are bored beyond relief, stewing in their own vapidity.

title: Chapot Leads U.S. Riders
description: TORONTO, Nov. 14Frank Chapot, a fivetime Olympic rider, scored three clean rounds And led the United States Equestrian Team to victory in the Nations Cup competition today at the Royal Winter Fair horse show.

title: Labor: First Move to Put Unionists In a Corporate Board Room Fails
St. Paul Group Fights New Abortion Center
description: ST. PAULSlowly and dutifully, Virginia Sullivan walks back and forth along the short distance in front of the twostory red brick building at 1965 Ford Parkway, which has the words death and Dachau sprayed in white paint on its walls.

title: 2 Senators Ask Shift In NATO Strategy To Counter Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14Two members of the Senate Armed Services Committee today urged a fundamental change in the strategy and a realignment of forces of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization to counter the growing ability of the Soviet Union to wage a conventional war in Europe.

title: Where the Pounds Come Off As the Family Keeps Score
description: MIAMIJerr Briggs suspects that the staff at the Everglades Hotel is beginning to talk. Every morning she breakfasts in the coffee shop with someone else's husband while her husband eats in the dining room with the other man's wife.

title: Ford Ponders Palm Springs Home
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Nov. 14President Ford is thinking seriously about buying a home and settling down in this desert resort city after he leaves office in January. He has been vacationing here for the last week.

title: Foreign Trade Council Urges More Liberalized Commerce
description: The National Foreign Trade Council called for further liberalization of world trade yesterday as the private business group prepared to open its 63d convention in New York today.

title: Julius Frandsen, 69, ExNewsman
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (UPI)Julius Frandsen, former Washington manager and vice president of United Press International and a newsman for 45 years, died today at George Washington University Hospital after a long illness. He was 69 years old.

title: Brezhnev to Visit Yugoslavia Today
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 14With no Soviet flags or other signs of fanfare yet in evidence, Belgrade quietly prepared today for the visit beginning tomorrow of the Soviet Communist Party leader, Leonid I. Brezhnev.

title: Role of Women in Today's World Subject of Montclair Conference
description: MONTCLAIR, Nov. 14Who would hire a female 45yearold management trainee? Would it be unrealistic for a mother to return to school for a master's degree after being out for 20 years? What are the best ways for a middleaged woman who has not worked for many years to Prepare a rsume?

title: ROME JEWS PROTEST RELEASE OF A NAZI
description: ROME, Nov.14A military tribunal ordered the release of Herbert Kappler, a Nazi war criminal, and touched off a series of protests today by members of Rome's Jewish community and others.

title: L.I. Shopping Plazas: Where Business Booms One Day, For Rent Signs Hang the Next
description: OAKDALE, L.I.A new sign has gone up on The, dingy window of what used to be the Man's World clothing store in the Oakdale Shopping Plaza. Watch for Grand Opening, it declares in big bright letters.

title: Carter, With a Long List of Campaign Promises, Now Faces the Problem of Making Good on Them
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14  In 1,495 speeches and hundreds of interviews during a 21month Presidential campaign Jimmy Carter promised a wide range of programs, reforms and innovations if elected, often punctuating his words with the phrase, And you can depend on that. His promises range from a complete reorganizaof the executive branch of Government to a pledge to place on his Oval Office desk a plaque with President Truman's old motto, The Buck Stops here.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Natural gas prices will go up 10 to 20 percent this winter because of curtailments by interstate pipeline companies, New Jersey gas companies are predicting. Officials of the Public Service Electric & Gas Company, Elizabethtown Gas Company and South Jersey Gas Company said they had to increase prices to purchase more expensive supplemental supplies, such as synthetic gas or propane  air mixture to make up for, the shortage of natural gas. Synthetic gas costs three to four times more than natural gas, which ranges from $1 to $1.41 for 1,000 cubic feet. John Ewald of Public Service and William La Londe, vice president of operations for Elizabethtown, said about 10 percent of the natural gas was supplemental, raising the average prices about 20 percent.

title: Steelers Win 5th Straight by 143
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 14The Pittsburgh Steelers remained alive today in the race for pro football's postseason playoffs while the Miami Dolphins expired here at Three Rivers Stadium. The Pittsburgh team won a simple, uneventful contest for its fifth straight victory, 143, as the Steeler defense went through another game without giving up a touchdown.

title: Needed: An Economic Summit
description: When Mr. Carter assumes the Presidency in January, his first and most crucial decisions will be how to resolve economic problemsboth domestic and international. During the campaign, his attention was inevitably focused on domestic unemployment and inflation. But attention to the international economic and monetary situation is at least as urgent. For, if swift action is not taken to rescue many weak and heavily indebted nations, world trade and the United States economy itself could be severely affected.

title: Namath Returns and Jets Rout Bucs, 340
description: For 17 minutes 2 seconds Joe Namath was back on top yesterday, a folk hero springing to life on arthritic knees.

title: Carol J. Bradshaw Bride of Dr. Clayton L. Akin
description: The Larchmont (N. Y.) Avenue Presbyterian Church was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Carol Jeanne Bradshaw, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David Yancey Bradshaw of Larchmont and Cooperstown, N. Y., to Dr. Clayton L. Akin, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Raymond C. Akin of Frewsburg. N. Y. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Gary Hall, the associate pastor.

title: Police Emergency
description: When New Yorkers are in trouble, they can dial 911, the police emergency number. But when Police Commissioner Michael J. Codd runs into his own difficultiesand he has them in spades these dayshe may well have to dial 5390.

title: New Transit Threat
description: Keeping up with the fiscal ups and downs of the deficitridden Metropolitan Transportation Authority beginning to be as confusing as trying to locate the correct train or bus on the city's poorly labeled transit lines.

title: Meadowlands
description: Horses listed in order of post positions

title: Carter's Church to Admit Blacks and Keep Minister
description: PLAINS, Ga., Nov. 14With three Ku Klux Klansmen parading outside and the Rev. Clennon King, a black minister, huddled in a stairwell of an outside entrance, the congregation of Jimmy Carter's church voted today to drop its 11yearold ban on attendance by blacks. It decided to set up a committee to screen all applications for membership, black or white, without regard to race, and to retain its minister, who had opposed its ban on blacks

title: CITIBANK UNWORRIED BY 3D WORLD DEBTS
The U.N. Today
Black ExPilots Recall Exploits Of World War II
description: On March 24, 1945, Roscoe C. Brown Jr. maneuvered his P51 Mustang fighter plane into position behind a German Messerschmitt262 high above Berlin and became one of the first pilots to shoot down a jet aircraft.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, NOVEMBER 15, 1976

title: Article 1  No Title
AntiCastro Extremists Tolerated. if Not Encouraged. by Some Latin American Nations
description: MIAMICuban exile extremists who have been accused of terrorist activities against the Government of Prime Minister Fidel Castro have been tolerated, if not encouraged, by several Latin American countries.

title: Pathologist Studying The Legion Disease Caught a Like Illness
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 14More than three months after the mystifying outbreak of legionnaires' disease in Pennsylvania, scores of researchers around the country are still trying to find the cause, and in at least one instance one of them has fallen ill with a disease strikingly similar to the one she was investigating.

title: Rutgers, With 17 Straight Victories, May Have Captured Berth in a Bowl Game
description: Rutgers stepped into the wonderland world of indoor football Saturday night and needed some time to get used to the surroundings of the big, modern and overpriced New Orleans Superdome. Once settled to the business at hand, these amazing Scarlet Knights played their best offensive game of the season to beat Tulane, 2920, and extend the longest current majorcollege winning streak to 17 games.

title: Deaths
description: BERGSONJack. The Hebrew Congregation of Somers mourns the passing of its member Jack Bergson. Heartfelt condolences to his wife Henlen Bergson, children and grandchildren. Jack Komisar, President Tzvl Berman, Rabbi

title: Syrians in Peacekeeping Force Advance Toward Beirut's Center
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Monday, Nov. 15Syrian combat forces advanced toward the largely devastated center of Beirut this morning to establish a buffer zone between leftist  Moslem and rightistChristian militiamen and try to end the civil war in which more than 35,000 people have been killed in Lebanon in 19 months.

title: 7 GOVERNORS AGREE ON FEDERAL ACTIONS TO HELP NORTHEAST
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Nov. 14The Democratic Governors of seven Northeastern states called today for increased Federal aid, welfare reforms that would give every family a guaranteed income and the creation of a regional superagency to develop energy sources and revive the economy.

title: Rhodesia Moving Squatters and Some Will Get Improved Facilities
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Nov. 14Eunice Nyandor, a black dressmaker and the mother of five children, was eagerly awaiting the trucks that would move the twigs of her dismantled shack from the shantytown where she has lived for the last year to a black township with tarred roads and piped water.

title: Mashpee, Mass.. Fights Suit by Indians to Recover 16,000 Acres Owned by Ancestors
description: MASHPEE, Mass., Nov, 14 (AP)The Wampanoag Indians demanded 500 acres of lush green forest land from this Cape Cod vacation spot last year, and they got it. Now the tribe wants the whole town.

title: Neighbors Protest 8th Ave. Pornography
description: Pimps, prostitutes and conspicuous consumers of pornography were replaced for a brief time yesterday afternoon on three blocks of Eighth Avenue by singing schoolchildren and residents who chanted. Give us back our neighborhood.

title: Cards Win On a Kick By Bakken
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 14The Los Angeles Rams, who tried to solve their quarterback problem by starrting Pat Haden, found themselves unable to solve another kind of quarterback problem todaythe opposing quarterback. Jim Hart, with a sensational secondhalf performance, guided the St. Louis Cardinals to a 3028 victory achieved by Jim Bakken's third field goal of the game, with just four seconds to play.

title: Booklet on Dialing UHF Offered By Public Broadcasting Service
description: It is possible to receive public television almost anywhere in the United States, but not without some difficulty in most parts of the country.

title: Drut, French Hurdler, Banned as an Amateur
description: AMSTERDAM, Nov. 14 (UPI)The International Amateur Athletic Federation banned Guy Drut, the Olympic gold medalist from France, for life today because he admitted accepting appearance money at track and field events, Adrian Paulen, president of the I.A.A.F., announced. But Paulen said Drut would be allowed to keep his 110meter hurdles gold medal, won at Montreal, because the offenses took place after the Olympics in July.

title: SEOUL BIDS LOBBYIST STAY AWAY FROM U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14The Korean Central Intelligence Agency has ordered Park Tong Sun, a central figure in the investigation of alleged bribery of American Congressmen, to stay out of the United States indefinitely, according to a former Korean official with access to information in Seoul.

title: Death Wish Is Discerned in Poetry And Killings by Doomed Convict
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 14Two years ago, locked in a prison cell in Oregon, Gary Mark Gilmore wrote a poem that he called The Land Lord, and in it he presaged a coming rendezvous with death.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Enter Samuel Bronfman 2d, the 48th Witness
description: When Edgar Bronfman gave Mel Patrick Lynch $2.3 million in ransom money in August 1975, for the release of his allegedly kidnapped son, Samuel, enclosed in the darkgreen, plastic garbage bags that held the cash was a note in which the chairman of Seagram Distillers vowed that neither he nor any member of my family would ever testify against anyone accused of the abduction.

title: Events Today
description: Music

title: Bosch Is Still on Wanted List
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14  A Justice Department spokesman has said that Dr. Orlando Bosch is still wanted by the United States Parole Commission for violantion of parole two years ago.

title: Antonio Zapeda Performs On PreColumbian Flutes And Drums at the Kitchen
description: Antonio Zapeda, who presented a solo concert at the Kitchen on Saturday, is a performer in danger of being upstaged by his instruments. He plays preColumbian drums, rattles, whistles and flutes, some of them original, others made by Mexican Indian craftsmen according to models unearthed from archeological digs. Each instrument has a bewitching and, to these ears at least, a novel sound. One funeral whistle has a highpitched primary tone but seems to produce deeper subtones inside the listener's ear.

title: Ousted Korean C.I.A. Aide Linked To Kidnapping of Foes of Regime
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Lee Sang Ho, who yesterday was reported to have been dismissed from his post as the thirdranking Korean Central Intelligence Agency official in Seoul, has allegedly taken part in various incidents involving the agency, including kidnapping.

title: Udall Breaks Arms, Says It Isn't His Year
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (UPI) Representative Morris K. Udall, Democrat of Arizona, who lost his bid for the Democratic nomination to Jimmy Carter, fell from a ladder yesterday while repairing the roof of his suburban Virginia home and broke both his arms.

title: Portuguese Communists Reelect Cunhal and Challenge Government
description: LISBON, Nov. 14The Portuguese Communist Party concluded its national congress today, scarcely half a year after severe election setbacks, by unanimously reelecting its Stalinist leader, Alvaro Cunhal.

title: U.S. Senate Delegation Praises Sadat
description: CAIRO, Nov. 14Senator Abraham Ribicoff, Democrat of Connecticut, and a delegation of 11 other Senators wound up a fourday visit to Egypt today with an expression of optimism for a Middle East peace agreement and admiration for President Anwar elSadat.

title: Giants Beat Redskins, 129, on Danelo's 50Yarder for First Victory
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Nov. 14  The longest losing streak in the Giants' 52year history ended today with a 129 victory over the Washington Redskins and George Allen, of all people.

title: Decriminalization of Marijuana Is Supported by Congress of P.T.A
description: ROCHESTER, Nov. 14 (UPI)The New York State Congress of Parents and Teachers approved two separate resolutions on marijuana laws during its 79th annual convention over the weekend.

title: St. Francis Is 70 Victor Over Holy Cross for Title
description: St. Francis Prep did just what it had to yesterday and as a result the Terriers are champions of the Catholic Schools Football League City Division. The Terriers defeated Holy Cross, 70, at St. John's University in Queens and retained their city title.

title: Elderly Tenants Are Refusing to Leave Apartments in the McAlpin Hotel
description: Scattered among a thousand empty rooms at the McAlpin Hotel on Herald Square are 30 apartments, relics of a gentler time. For the elderly tenants who still live in them, the apartments have been home for many years. And it's a home they say, that they will not leave.

title: MOUFIDA BOURGUIBA
description: TUNIS, Nov. 14 (AP)Moufida Bourguiba, divorced wife of President Habib Bourguiba of Tunisia, has died at her home at the age of 86, the ruling Destourian Socialist party announced today. The cause of death was not disclosed.

title: Federal Aides Are Seeking to Unify Environmental Laws, Made Complex by Their Piecemeal Enactment
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 13Federal officials are pressing for unification of the growing mass of disjointed environmental regulations that have been plaguing industry and communities.

title: FRENCH EXPREMIER BACK IN PARLIAMENT
description: PARIS, Nov. 14Jacques Chirac, who resigned as Prime Minister last August after a dispute with President Valery Giscard d'Estaing over political strategy, took his first step toward creation of a new base of power today by regaining his seat in the National Assembly.

title: Quality of Care Found Inconsistent In New York Municipal Hospitals
description: The man in a bed in Lincoln Hospital almost died because an overworked doctor didn't examine him closely. He lived because a nurse happened by.

title: Paul Hayden, 73, a Civic Leader And Conservationist in Connecticut
description: Paul V. Hayden, retired president of the Connecticut Light and Power Company, a Connecticut civic leader and an environmentalist and a former member of the Connecticut Legislature, died Saturday at Gaylord Hospital in Wallingford, Conn. He was 73 years old and lived in Cheshire.

title: L.I. Shopping Plazas: Where Business Booms One Day, For Rent Signs Hang the Next
description: OAKDALE, L.I.A new sign has gone up on the dingy window of what used to be the Man's Worldclothing store in the Oakdale Shopping Plaza. Watch for Grand Opening, it declares in big, bright letters.

title: One Basement That's Looking Up
description: For as far back as anyone at Macy's seems able to remember, the basement of the store sold housewares. A cavernous and rather ungainly sprawl of merchandise, the area nonetheless offered a larger range of practical domestic items than most other department stores did in the city, When shoppers wanted to check what was available along these lines, or do some comparison shopping, Macy's was often the store from which they started.

title: Gen. Sir Frederick Pile Dies; Led British Antiaircraft in War
description: LONDON, Nov. 14 (Reuters)Gen. Sir Frederick Pile, who was in charge of Britain's antiaircraft defense throughout World War II, died here today. He was 92 years old.

title: Miss Ender Is Retiring
description: EAST BERLIN, Nov. 14 (Reuters)Kornelia Ender, the East German swimming star who won four gold medals, and one silver at the 1976 Montreal Olympics, has retired from competition, the official East German news agency reported today.

title: Not Triage, but Investment in People, Food and Water
description: Now that the House of Representatives has bravely passed its resolution on the right to foodthe basic human right without which, indeed, all other rights are meaningless  it is perhaps a good moment to try to clear up one or two points of confusion that appear to have been troubling the American mind on the question of food supplies, hunger, and America's moral obligation, particularly to those who are not America's own citizens.

title: Proportion of Minority Students Entering Medical Schools Drops Again, Creating Concern About Future
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 14After a six year surge in the proportion of minority members entering the country's medical schools, the percentage has leveled off and future gains may be imperiled.

title: A RECORD ISRAELI BUDGET OF $15 BILLION PROPOSED
description: JERUSALEM, Nov.14 (AP)Finance Minister Yehoshua Rabinowitz presented a proposed record budget of $15 billion to the Cabinet today. It presumes an inflation rate of 30 percent for the 197778 fiscal year.

title: World News Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14The United States was urged today by a civilian panel to take the initiative in curbing foreign arms sales and to enter into negotiations with the Soviet Union for a mutual freeze on their defense budgets.

title: MARY BATES HINDS
description: Mary Bates Hinds, widow of Roger Hinds, a lawyer here in New York City and in East Orange, N. J., where they lived for many years, died Saturday in a nursing home in Cedar Grove, N. J. She nursing home in Cedar Grove, N. J. She

title: Article 8  No Title
GOLD EFFECT SLIGHT IN CONSUMER ITEMS
Soccer
description: SCHAEFER LEAGUE

title: PERLMAN AND KALICHSTEIN IN VIOLINPIANO RECITAL
description: Itzhak Perlman and Joseph Kalichstein proved to be a most compatible duo during their violinpiano recital at the 92d Street YMYWHA's Kaufman Hall Saturday night. Both musicians have much in common, not only their home town (Tel Aviv) and ages (31 and 30, respectively), but their general approach to musical matters as well.

title: Bridge:
description: If there were an intercity contest for women's teams, New York would be an overwhelming favorite to win. Indeed, the New York experts would probably defeat a team representing the rest of the United States.

title: Kialoa Takes Yacht Race
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 14 (AP)John B. Kilroy's 79foot ketch Kialoa defeated Ragtime, a New Zealandbuilt sloop, in the Los AngelestoMazatlan handicap yacht race today. Kialoa, sailing for the host Los Angeles Yacht Club, finished first among Class A yachts in the 1,032mile race, followed by Ragtime, Whistle Wing IV and Zaca.

title: TAX AUDIT SHIFT SAID TO HELP BIG CONCERNS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14A public interest law group charged today that there had been a startling plunge in the number of audits of large corporations done by the Internal Revenue Service and that the decline in these audits had cost the Government at least $1.5 billion in uncollected taxes in 1975.

title: Leader in Struggle for the Rights of Minorities
description: Later today Burton Joseph, an agricultural merchant with worldwide business interests, will embark on one of his frequent trips abroad. But this journey will be a special one, taking him to Jerusalem to be installed as the head of one of the foremost Jewish civic organizations in the United States, the AntiDefamation League of B'nai B'rith.

title: Chirac, French ExPrime Minister, Wins ByElection in Comeback Bid
description: PARIS, Nov. 14Jacques Chirac, who resigned as Prime Minister last August after a dispute with President Valry Giscard d'Estaing over political strategy, took his first step toward creation of a new base of power today by regaining his seat in the National Assembly.

title: Rosewall Captures Final From an Angry Nastase
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 14 (UPI)Topseeded Hie Nastase of Rumania put on one of his worst court performances today and virtually threw away his match against Ken Rosewall of Australia in the $75,000 Hong Kong international tournament. Rosewall, playing one of the best games of his career, won 16, 64, 76, 60, and walked away with the $10,500 winner's check.

title: Green Renewal
description: In the absence of substantial Federal urban renewal grants which did not materialize, Mayor Beanie has decided to use smaller grants which will become available to convert 14 rubblestrewn lots, originally cleared for the anticipated public housing, into neighborhood parks and playgrounds. That could prove to be a sound, longterm investment of public funds.

title: Scouts Aim to Recruit 10,000 Boys in Week
description: A weeklong recruitment drive for Boy Scouts in New York City will start today, sponsored by the Greater New York Councils of the Boy Scouts of America.

title: BEAME, ON ISRAELI VISIT, QUIPS ABOUT A GOLD HUNT
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 14 (UPI)  Mayor Beame quipped about New York's shaky budget today when a delegation of American mayors arrived for a 10day visit in Israel.

title: Vermont's Deer Season Opens, Bringing Joy to Hunters
description: JONESVILLE, Vt., Nov. 14Pete Durovich had been sitting in the dark in his car for two hours at the edge of a dirt road about five miles East of Camel's Hump mountain, his Winchester .30.30 rifle beside him.

title: Chess:
description: The United States victory in the 22d World Chess Olympiad in Haifa, Israel, hinged on the outcome of the last game to finish in the final round.

title: RECD. SEES A LAG IN 1977 RECOVERY
description: even turn out a bit optimistic, the way things seem to be going now.

title: Foreign Borrowing at Year's High With $925 Million in New Bonds
Commodities: Rise of Gold Prices Is Reflected in Futures Trading
German Conservationists Battle Power Plants and Other Projects
description: WEST BERLIN, Nov. 14Every Sunday for the last six weeks many hundreds of West Berliners have marched to Spandau Forest on the outskirts of the city to protest plans to make room for a new power plant by cutting 55,000 trees.

title: Rough Seas Hamper Hunt for 19 Missing From Sunken Freighter
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 14 (UPI)  Rough seas today hampered the search for 19 crewmen missing for three days since a storm sank their freighter, and the Coast Guard said it would be almost miraculous if they survived the 10to15foot waves and icy waters.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: CORRECTION
description: An Associated Press article yesterday erroneously said that a $500 contribution from Park Tong Sun to Representative John Brademas of Indiana had not been previously reported. Mr. Brademas had reported the campaign contribution earlier.

title: FUNERAL SERVICE SET FOR JUSTICE CHIMERA
description: A funeral service will be held at 10 A.M. Wednesday in St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church, Avenue of the Americas and Washington Place, for Justice Thomas C. Chimera of the State Supreme Court, who was killed Saturday afternoon when his car overturned on the New England Thruway.

title: Quebec Jews Hear Liberals Plea
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 14Several hundred affluent Jews gathered for breakfast in their synagogue today and heard a plea from a Quebec minister struggling to keep his party in power to help save Canada, which he said has been good to us.

title: Dixy Lee Ray Exhorts Women
description: PINEHURST, N.C., Nov. 14 (UP) Washington's Governorelect, Dixy Lee Ray, supports the proposed equal rights amendment but says women should stop brooding about being a woman. The 62yearold Democrat says she tells women, If you want to do something, then train yourself and you've got to be willing to work.

title: Jill Susan Kraus Is Married In Jersey to Dennis Schulman
description: Jill Susan Kraus, daughter of Comdr. Walter L. Kraus, U.S.N., retired, and Mrs. Kraus of Little Silver, N.J., was married yesterday afternoon to Dennis Keith Schulman, son of Mrs. Seymour Schulman of Levittown, Pa., and the late Mr. Schulman. Rabbi Alton Winters performed the ceremony at the Shadowbrook in Shrewsbury, N.J.

title: Slovenes Boycott a Language Census in Austria
description: KLAGENFURT, Austria, Nov. 14Slovenes in Carinthia, Austria's southernmost province, derided, boycotted and reportedly sought to sabotage a census today called to determine how many Austrian citizens speak languages other than German.

title: Books of the Times
description: Most readers with a decent streak of greed in them have probably been following the little war that has been going on between Las Vegas gambling establishments and certain practitioners of the game of blackjack, a.k.a. vingtetun or 21. To recapitulate ever so briefly: Over the last two decades certain mathematically Inclined people with access to computers have worked out systems whereby the blackjack player, by mentally keeping track of the cards as they are dealt, may recognize situations in which the betting odds actually favor the player instead of the house. With these systems, hordes of professorial types have decamped for Las Vegas, their heads whirring and clicking, their corneas displaying dollar signs. And it has worked. But of course Las Vegas, morally outraged that anyone should dream of gambling under better than unfavorable circumstances, has quickly struck back. It has simply learned to recognize the socalled counters and excused them from the premises for life.

title: Saturday's College Football Scores
Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: A.D.A. Advises Carter and Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (AP)A full employment program, including creating government jobs if necessary, was urged today by Americans for Democratic Action. The group said it opposed a Federal tax cut. The liberal political organization made its views known in a letter to Presidentelect Jimmy Carter. It was signed by the A.D.A. president, Senator George McGovern, Democrat of South Dakota.

title: Plains Pastor Bases Racial Stand on the Scriptures
description: PLAINS, Ga., Nov. 14The Rev. Bruce Edwards, Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's minister at the Plains Baptist Church and the central figure in a racial controversy here, says that he does not want anyone to misinterpret his belief that there is spiritual guidance behind his stand that his church must be open to all who want to enter.

title: 2 DEPUTY PRIME MINISTERS ARE REPLACED BY ALBANIA
description: VIENNA, Nov. 14 (Reuters)Two Albanian deputy prime ministers were replaced today in apparent continuation of a threeyear shakeup involving major changes in the country's Communist leadership.

title: 2 Groups for the Blind in Dispute On Ouster of 3 Chicago Workers
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 14A labor dispute at The Lighthouse for the Blind here has renewed a longstanding conflict between that organization and a maverick group based in Des Moines, Iowa, called the National Federation of the Blind.

title: T. Wayne Smart Is Dead At 72; Top Driver, Trainer Of Harness Race Horses
description: DELAWARE, Ohio, Nov. 14T. Wayne (Curly) Smart, a nationally known driver and trainer of harness racing horses, died today from a stroke that he suffered on Nov. 5. He was 72 years old.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
Marion Groves, 80, Dies; A Teacher and Archivist For Adelphi University
description: Marion N. Groves, teacher of English and university archivist at Adelphi University in Garden City, L. I., died Saturday at Nassau Hospital in Mineola. She was 80 years old and lived in Garden City.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: Recital: A Fine French Organist
description: MarieClaire Alain is a tasteful, scholarly sort of organist whose elegant understatement of what is clearly a firstclass virtuoso technique is worlds removed from the kind of razzledazzzle a showman like Virgil Fox conjures up. Miss Alain opened Tully Hall's Great Performers of the Organ series yesterday afternoon and demonstrated exactly why many consider her France's finest exponent of the instrument.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: NOVEMBER SONG In the display of Kurt WeillLotte Lenya memorabilia opening today at Lincoln Center, rare, unpublished photographs from Miss Lenya make up about half of the exhibition, a collaborative effort of the Library & Museum of the Performing Arts and Goethe House. There are letters to the composer from Bertolt. Brecht, Albert Einstein, Ira Gershwin, Barbra Streisand and others; stage designs by Caspar Neher, Boris Aronson and Wolfgang Roth, and programs and posters representing the famed Three Penny Opera, Mahagonny, Lady in the Dark, Lost in the Stars (the final Weill score) and other works.

title: Patriots Make It a Horse Race, Beating the Colts, 2114
description: The Baltimore Colts went into yesterday's National Football League game against the New England Patriots at Baltimore with some impressive credentials. They were the league's top offensive team with 278 points and had won 17 of their last 18 regularseason games, eight of nine this season.

title: Vermont's Deer Season Opens, Bringing joy to Hunters
description: JONESVILLE, Vt., Nov. 14Pete Durovich had been sitting in the dark in his car for two hours at the edge of a dirt road about five miles East of Camel's Hump mountain, his Winchester .30.30 rifle beside him.

title: U.S. Exhibit Drawing Long Line in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 14 (AP)Soviet citizens are waiting three to four hours to get into a United States Bicentennial exhibit here, and policemen are turning many away because there is no room.

title: Issue and Debate
description: Strolling north along Eighth Avenue from 42d Street, one passes the Show World Center (Adult XXX Movies, 69 Raw Films, plus LIVE NUDE Girls). Adult MiniMovies (the Best XXXRated Peep Films in New York), the Sensativity [sic] Meeting Place (6 Lovely Girls) and the Cameo, which was showing Les Bordello Girls and House of Kinky Pleasure.

title: Roosevelt
description: ENTRIES

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An article in The Times last Saturday on the alleged looting of a team, sters union welfare fund could be read as implying that the Old Security Life Insurance Company was a defendant in a civil suit brought by the Securities . and Exchange Commission. The suit charges that Old Security was used as a front for transferring union premiums to companies controlled by alleged conspirators, but it does hot name Old Security as a defendant or ask that its assets he frozen.

title: Music: 12 Cellos
description: One of the more bizarre spinoffs of the Berlin Philharmonic's current visit to New York occurred Sunday night in Carnegie Recital Hall, where the orchestra's 12 cellists gathered, to perform a most peculiar program. The small auditorium (300 seats) was packed to capacitymostly, it would seem, by the orchestra's friends and families since German was the predominant language of the evening.

title: Eleanor B. Scott Is Wed To Dean K. Worcester
description: Eleanor B. Scott of Solano Beach, Calif., and Dean K. Worcester of New York, a retired member of the New York law firm of Carter, Ledyard & Milburn, were married yesterday morning in Irvington, N.Y. Rev. Charles R. Colwell performed the ceremony in St. Barnabas Episcopal Church.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Kissinger Plans Mexican Trip
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (UPI)Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger will travel to Mexico City later this month as the special representative of President Ford at the inaugural of Presidentelect Jose Lopez Portillo on Dec. 1.

title: Carter Voices Hope Oil Nations Will Show Restraint on Price Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15Presidentelect Jimmy Carter urged the oilexporting nations today to show restraint and not increase the price of oil at their meeting next month.

title: 14 Die in Floods on Java
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Nov. 15 (AP)Heavy weekend rains caused floods in eastern Java that left 14 persons dead and 30 others seriously injured, provincial officials reported today. They said 21 villages were inundated and a newly built dam near Blitar was damaged.

title: Retail Food Prices Seen Up 3 to 4%
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (UPI)Agriculture Department analysts predicted today that retail food prices would rise only 3 to 4 percent in 1977 and might for the second consecutive year act as a brake on increases in the overall cost of living.

title: SOUTH AFRICAN ULTIMATUM TO BLACK PUPILS WHO FLED
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov. 15 (Reuters)South Africa's Minister of Justice, James T. Kruger, tonight gave black students who have fled the country one week to return. His ultimatum follows reports that more than 600 students from the black township of Soweto have fled since rioting that started there in June.

title: EDWIN J. BARRY
description: Edwin J. Barry a limited partner in the New York Stock Exchange firm of Phelen, Silver, Vesce, Barry & Co., died Sunday in his home at 240 Long Hill Drive in Short Hills, N. J. He was 86 years old.

title: Landlord Shuts Sex Parlor By Hiring 3 to Buy and Tell
description: An East. Side landlord did not want the Hidden Desire massage parlor as a tenant, and so, upon the advice of a City official, he hired three detectives from the Always Lon Guard agency, who Visited the massage parlor and paid three women to perform sex acts.

title: 2,042 Were Queried In Times/CBS Survey
description: The New York Times and CBS News survey was based on telephone interviews with 2,042 men and women of voting age across the continentalnUnited States from Nov. 4 to Nov. B.

title: Mr. Carter's World
description: World events and the world's leaders have been kind to the United States in this election year. No major crisis thrust itself into the Presidential contest. The candidates were able largely to ignore turbulence on the international scene, such as China's leadership change, Civil war in Lebanon, elections in Italy and West Germany, Britain's economic plunge and Europe's monetary disorder. But pressures now building in these and other areas will require Presidential decisions in the early weeks of the Carter Administration.

title: Syria's Role In Lebanon
description: The Syrian Arab Republic is characterized by its people's traditional involvement in national affairs, by its political leadership, and by its strategic location on the map of the turbulent Middle East. Indeed, it is often said in this area that Syria is the heart of the Arab World. All of these features have been Very significant in the Lebanese crisis and the entire Middle East problem.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
Israeli Army Summons Reservists
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 15 (UPI)The Israeli armed forces began an 18hour callup exercise today, summoning thousands of reservists to meeting places throughout Israel. Radio and television announcers began the noon news broadcast by reading twoword code phrases designating particular units being called up. Army! spokesmen would not reveal the exact number of men summoned during the daylong exercise, but an army source said it was at least several thousand.

title: Treasury Bill Yields Off at Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15  Yields declined on Treasury bills in the weekly auction today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: Price of Gold Shows a Sharp Rise
description: LONDON, Nov. 15 (AP)The price of gold went up sharply in the major bullion markets today, hitting its highest point in London since the beginning of the year to close at $139.50 an ounce. Dealers said investors in the United States and the Far East were buying gold.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: RESULTS

title: APPEALS COURT VOIDS STEINGUT INDICTMENT
description: The Appellate Division of State Supreme Court in Brooklyn yesterday threw out an indictment of Assembly Speaker Stanley Steingut and his son, Robert, a City Councilman, on charges of corrupt use of position in offering a job in return for a campaign contribution.

title: About New York; Hockey Mongst the Hookers
description: Even between the strolling hookers on Eighth Avenue and the 10th Avenue variety who cater at corners to slowdriving motorists on carnal prowl, childhood can be a meadow, an asphalt meadow.

title: Higgins Is Moving His Fair Lady to LuntFontanne
description: My Fair Lady, the popular revival of the Alan Jay LernerFrederick Loewe musical adapted from Shaw's Pygmalion, will move from the St. James Theater after the matinee of Dec. 5 to take up residence at the LuntFontanne Theater on Dec. 8. Ian Richardson, Christine Andreas, George Rose and Robert Coote will continue as the show's stars.

title: Tennis
description: AT SEOUL, SO. KOREA DAVIS CUP EASTERN ZONE Quarterfinals

title: People and Business
description: De Butts Defends A. T. & T.'s BillionDollar Profit

title: NewCar Sales Decline 1.5% As Economic Doubts Linger
description: DETROIT, Nov. 15American newcar sales for the Nov. 110 period declined 1.5 percent from last year because of what analysts said was the lingering impact of the Ford Motor Company strike and uncertainty about the overall economy.

title: Jets
description: HEMPSTEAD, W., Nov. 15The defense rested today.

title: William Hecht jr., Retired Justice, Referee for State Supreme Court
description: Justice William C. Hecht Jr., a retired justice of the State Supreme Court and a special referee for that court, died Sunday at Beth Israel Hospital. He was 84 years old and lived at 430 East 86th Street.

title: EnglandItaly at Forum
description: The World Cup qualifying game between England and Italy in Rome tomorrow will be shown live via closed circuit at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum beginning at 8 A.M. Tickets are priced at $10.

title: Meadowlands Results
Steel Output in Week Ended Nov. 13 Declined 1.9% to 2.31 Million Tons
description: Steel production for the week ended Nov. 13, dropped to 2.31 million net tons, or about 1.9 percent from the 2.35 million tons the preceding week, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: High Tides Around New York
Rhodesian Response to Kissinger Ringed on an Ambiguity
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15Crucial to acceptance by the Rhodesian Government of the American plan for black majority rule was receipt of an ambiguous message from Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger that suggested that black leaders had agreed to a Rhodesian proposal that would allow whites to retain the defense and police ministries in an interim government.

title: Court Denies Paroled Convict Plea
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15The Supreme Court ruled 72 today that a convict who is paroled before serving his full sentence and who is then convicted and imprisoned for a second crime, committed while on parole, has no constitutional right to an immediate parole revocation hearing.

title: Market Place
description: The General Cable Corporation's premium bid for the Sprague Electric Company, announced after the close of trading last Friday, powered Sprague shares to a 6 point gain yesterday at 19.

title: Consensus Statement
description: The part played by the United States in arriving at the United Nations Security Council's unanimous consensus statement on Israeli occupation of Arab territories was entirely constructive, and deserved praise instead of the rather hysterical blame it has received.

title: An Old Idea Still Needed
description: This year, a change of only a few thousand votes in one or two states could have made Gerald Ford the first President since 1888 to be elected with fewer popular votes than his opponent.

title: SLOWDOWN OF AIR TRAFFIC AVERTED BY PAY DECISION
description: A nationwide airtraffic slowdown was averted yesterday when the Civil Service Commission supplied the flight controllers union with acceptable assurances on the effect of a new payscale decision.

title: CARTER'S COMIEFFS SPUR RISE IN STOCKS; TRADING STILL SLOW
description: The stock market, reacting favorably yesterday to comments made by Presidentelect Jimmy Carter, posted a moderate gain in continued slow trading.

title: JUSTICES TO REVIEW COURTS'
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 15The Supreme Cottrt announced today it it would review the scope of a Federal court's power to impose programs and orders designed to end illegal segregation in public schools. The review will also embrace the effects of past illegal segregation.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Dour Autumn Garden
description: NEW HAVENLillian Hellman's The Autumn Garden is an endofsummer play. Some of the guests may return to the Tuckerman house next year just as they have in previous years, but the holidayperhaps all holidaysis over. There is an asperity in the wind as these characters make an accounting of the bankruptcy of their livesthe lack of fulfillment that is endemic to everyone in the play. People do not change, the author seems to be salting, they simply grow older and become more ingrained.

title: Quebec Province at a Glance
description: Quebec, one of the 10 federated provinces of Canada, is the largest in area, with 523,900 square miles, or a seventh of the country's land mass. With somewhat over six million inhabitants, it is second only to Ontario in population and constitutes more than a quarter of the national total.

title: CARTER SAYS BURNS VOWS COOPERATION; SEES COMPATIBILITY
description: PLAINS, Ga., Nov. 15Presidentelect Jimmy Carter said today that he had received a pledge of cooperation from Arthur F. Burn's, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, and felt that they will find a substantial degree of compatibility.

title: Texes &
description: The big man on campus these days may be the Internal Revenue agent.

title: Vital Services
description: A special mayoral commission yesterday issued a report showing that New York City spends proportionately less money today than it did 15 years ago on vital city servicessuch as police, fire and sanitationand that this trend had been counterproductive for the city's future.

title: Wood, Field &
description: Some splendid contemporary wildlife paintings may be seen at Sportman's Edge Ltd. during the gallery's current exhibition of the works of David Maas and William Hollywood, which runs through Nov. 27.

title: SEARCH ACCOUNT ANGERS DOCTOR IN MURDER TRIAL
description: MINEOLA, Nov. 15 (UPI)Dr. Charles E. Friedgood, on trial for the murder of his wife, reddened in anger today during testimony by a former detective who helped intercept the physician and take him from a plane at Kennedy International Airport.

title: Lisbon Explosion Damages Home Of Former Agriculture Minister
description: LISBON, Nov. 15 (UPI)An explosion today outside the home of former Agriculture Minister Anthill Lopes Cardoso caused extensive damage but no injuries, a police spokesman said.

title: The Secret of Those Rave Reviews, Or, the Confessions of a Pen Pal
description: Governors do it. Ministers and rabbis do it. Showbiz personalities love to do it. Good neighbors and friends do itespecially if they want to remain on speaking terms. And. above all, fellow writers do it.

title: Straw Poll a Good Predictor
description: BOSTON, Mass., Nov. 15 (AP)A literal straw poll has proved a good predictor of Presidential politics. The General Cinema Corporation's poll, in which patrons at. its 645 theaters are asked to vote with softdrink straws, favored the CarterMondale ticket over FordDole 52.3 percent to 47.7 percent. The margin of victory for Mr. Carter in the election was 51 to 48.

title: Drinking In Beauty Advice With the Breakfast Coffee
description: Mirror, minor on the wall...not again! Yes, indeed, being fair, if not the fairest, continues to preoccupy women. The desire was strong enough for 50 women to be in their seats by 9:30 on a Monday morning, at the Gaffe Orsini in Bonwit's. There was a light breakfast, of course, but the main purpose of the gathering yesterday was a demonstration by the people from Helena Rubinstein on how to be healthier, sexier and prettier.

title: Hailing the Romantic Treasures of Tutankhamen
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15Everyone said the Treasures of Tutankhamen show would be magnificent, and everyone was right.

title: Harvard Has Surplus After Deficit Year
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 15 (AP)Harvard University reported today that; it had ended its 197576 year with an operating surplus of $900,000 egaintit a deficit of nearly $1,600,000 the pre;..: vious year.

title: Greeks Are Urged to Abandon Political Favoritism, but They Don't Believe That Reform Will Work
description: ATHENS, Nov. 15  Prime Minister Constantine Caramanlis urged his Cabinet ministers recently to eradicate personal favoritism from government. This curse, he said, undermines efficiency at a time when Greece must modernize its methods in order to compete against the more advanced countries of Western Europe.

title: Going Out Guide
description: AHOY AGAIN New Yorkers still savoring one of the city's proudest July 4 celebrations can relive Operation Sail pictorially tonight at a free colorslide show at 7:30 o'clock in the South Street Seaport Museum district at 165 John Street (behind the museum).

title: British Soccer Standing
A Fourth of High School Students in Jersey Found Not to Graduate
description: TRENTON, Nov. 15 (AP)  A special study shows that nearly onefourth of all students who enter high schools in New Jersey never graduate.

title: Around the Nation
description: FORT LEE, Va., Nov. 15 (UPI)An anthropologist who directed the integration of women at the United States Military Academy at West Point says women pushed themselves beyond, their endurance to keep up with their male counterparts.

title: College Results
French Premier Returns to Paris After Talks With Egypt's Leaders
description: CAIRO, Nov. 15 (Reuters)  Prime Minister Raymond Barre of France flew home today after a fourday visit to Cairo that ended with an affirmation of French and Egyptian support for a just and durable peace settlement in the Middle East.

title: Selection Board Rejects 3 Sites for OTB Parlors After Residents Protest
description: The Offtrack Betting Corporation suffered an upset yesterday when the Mayor and the city's Site Selection Board bowed to community pressures and turned down three sites proposed for OTB parlors in the Bronx, Brooklyn and Queens.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 16, 1976

title: Alaska Selling Gas To Three Companies
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15The State of Alaska announced today that it will sell its share of natural gas production from the North Slope to three companies that will transport it to the lower 48 states and resell it, beginning in 1982.

title: College Football
description: COACHES POLL

title: TAXI OWNERS SAY LEASING WOULDN'T INVOLVE LAYOFFS
description: The taxi industry in New York City told union negotiators yesterday that no licensed union driver would be laid off as a result of the proposed program for leasing individual taxis to drivers.

title: Willie Turnesa Voted Award
description: Willie Turnesa, winner of two United States Amateur golf championships and one British Amateur, has been designated the 1976 recipient of the Distinguished Service Award of the Metropolitan Golf Association. Turnesa, one of seven brothers distinguished in American golf, is a lifelong Westchester County resident who began winning tournaments in 1937. He founded the Westchester Golf Association's Caddie Scholarship Fund in 1956. He has served as president of the M.G.A. and the State Golf Association, and for 11 years was a member of the United States Golf Association.

title: Yunevich Ends 45Year Coaching Career
description: Alex Yunevich, a successful coach, who decided 45 years ago that he preferred the smallcollege football atmosphere to the highpressure world of major college football, retired yesterday after 36 seasons as the head foot

title: Teachers End 2Week Strike
description: NORTH SYRACUSE, N. Y., Nov. 15 (AP) Teachers in the North Syracuse School District returned to their classrooms today, ending a twoweek strike. Details of the agreement, reached early this morning, were not disclosed.

title: John P. Stevens Jr., 79; Headed Textile Concern And Was Civic Leader
description: John P. Stevens Jr., who retired in 1965 as chairman of J.P. Stevens & Company, the textile concern that was founded by his father and that grew into one of the giants of the industry, died Sunday at his home in Edison. N.J. He was 79 years old.

title: Schuler Urges Increase Of 12% in Transit Subsidy For the New York Area
description: State Transportation Commissioner Raymond T. Schuler proposed yesterday a 12 percent increase in the level of annual state and local subsidies for New York City's transit operations.

title: 3 Appear at Deportation Hearings In Killing of Civilians Under Nazis
description: Three elderly men accused of killing civilians in Nazioccupied Europe more than 30 years ago appeared in Federal courtrooms yesterday to face rare deportation proceedings for allegedly lying about their past so they could immigrate here after World War II.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Music: Berlin's Rapid Requiem
description: The Mozart Requiem, inexhaustible work that it is, lends itself to any number of interpretations, but two extremes may easily be recognized. There is, on the extreme Romantic side, the kind of brooding meditation that Karl Bohm favored in recent years. With its sometimes ponderous tempos and portentous gestures, this Mozart Requiem paints a tragic picture of man's life and death, and is in a definite Germanic tradition.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
Actions Taken By High Court Are Summarized
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Cowboys Win,17 to 10, From Stubborn Bills
description: IRVING, Tex., Nov. 15 (AP)The Dallas Cowboys blinded the Buffalo Bills with a 61yard touchdown blitz in 13 seconds late in the first half tonight, and the Cowboys tripped the battling Bills, 1710.

title: Study on Korean Apparel Exports
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (AP)The Treasury Department announced today that it had begun a formal investigation into whether leather apparel from South Korea was being exported to the United States with the help of bounties or grants. If the Treasury Department does find that the Korean Government is subsidizing the apparel, it is required to impose a special duty equal to the subsidies being granted manufacturers or exporters.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: N.F.L. Standings
description: AT MONTREAL

title: Helitzer Is Chosen For Hot Items Toys
description: Now here's a hot item: Helitzer Advertising, specialists in advertising to the young, has become the agency for Hot Items Inc., a toy company with headquarters in Newark. Helitzer said its new client would be spending a record $1 million in TV this spring. The previous agency was Robert S. Block in Milwaukee.

title: Jean Gabin, 72, French Film Star Who Played HeroVictim, Is Dead
description: Jean Gabin, the craggy and sardonic nerovictim of a hundred French films, died yesterday of a heart attack at the American Hospital in Neuilly, on the edge of Paris. He was 72 years old.

title: Electoral College Reform
description: The closeness of the vote in the Presidential election has once again revived interest in reform or abolition of the Electoral College.

title: Flexible Transition Period Proposed by Britain to End Rhodesia Parley Deadlock
description: GENEVA, Nov. 15Britain sought today to end a deadlock over the timetable for majority rule in Rhodesia by proposing a flexible transition period. Ivor Richard of Britain, chairman of the conference on Rhodesia's future, suggested either March 1 1978, or Dec. 1977 as possible dates for formal independence with the black majority in control.

title: Zukerman Offers Dual Talents
description: A number of fine violinists arc expert violists as well (and vice versa), but not too many would relish the task of performing concertos on both instruments at the same concert. Pinellas Zukerman is obviously one who does, and Sunday afternoon at the Metropolitan Museum he brought distinction to both halves of his double assignment with Frederic Waldman and the Musica Aeterna Orchestra.

title: Industrial Production Off In October for a 2d Month
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15Industrial production, a major indicator of the performance of the economy, declined in October for the second consecutive month, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: Groh Is Indicted on Bribery Charge; $10,000 Political Payoff Alleged
description: Robert T. Groh, a former Sanitation Commissioner and former Deputy Borough President of Queens, has been indicted on bribery and grandlarceny charges in connnection with an alleged $10,000 political payoff in Queens for a motel zoning change.

title: Companies List Earnings Results
Associated Press; GREETED IN BELGRADE: Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, being welcomed by President Tito. Page 3.; Brezhnev, in Bel rade, Mocks Talk of Soviet Peril
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 15 Chiding those who would compare SovietYugoslav relations with those of the wolf and Little Red Ridinghood, Leonid I. Brezhnev arrived here today for three days of talks with President Tito.

title: MEXICAN ENERGY PRICES ARE INCREASED SHARPLY
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 15 (AP)  The !Slices of gasoline, bottled gas, diesel fuel and electricity were sharply increased today to raise money to further develop Mexico's energy resources.

title: Poll Links Sense of Powerlessness, Not Disillusionment, to Low Vote
description: The relatively low turnout in the Presidential election appears to reflect demographic factors, as well as a sense of powerlessness among the less privileged and the young, rather than active disillusionment with the American system or institutions of government, according to a survey conducted by The New York Times and CBS News.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
Madrid Is Confident Deputies Will Approve Plan, to Change Parliament
description: MADRID, Nov. 15Spain's largely unelected right  wing Parliament, which under Generalissimo Francisco Franco was given little to do, steps to center stage this week and, in its most consequential hour, votes on a political reform bill that is also its own death warrant.

title: Canadiens Tally 3 Goals In 2d Period, Beat Blues
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 15 (AP)Mario Tremblay, Yvan Cournoyer and Doug Risebrough all scored in the second period, leading the Montreal Canadiens to a 42 National Hockey League victory over the St. Louis Blues tonight.

title: A Reminder of Newark's Rich Past Restored
description: Exterior and interior or the Ballantine House in Newark, which the Newark Museum, adjacent to it, has restored. Above, Philip Curtis, curator of Decorative Arts at the museum, stands behind a table in the dining room. Top The New York Times/Frank C. Dougherty left: A portrait of John H. Ballantine, a son of founder of P. Ballantine & Sons. He started construction of the house in 1884. The house, last of those houses that once circled Washington Park, will open to the public Friday.

title: Abducted State Trooper Is Slain
description: DURHAM, N.C., Nov. 15 (AP)A Virginia state trooper abducted today at gunpoint in his unmarked patrol car died with more than 21 bullet wounds in his body. Officials said they did not know whether he had been killed by his captor or had died in a hail of police gunfire at a roadblock.

title: BOUZA IS CLEARED IN POLICE INCIDENT
description: Police Commissioner Michael J. Codd disclosed yesterday that a departmental investigation of former Assistant Chief Anthony V. Bouza had cleared him of charges of mishandling demonstrations by offduty police officers. The demonstrations occurred during the Muhammad AliKen Norton heavyweight championship fight in September at Yankee Stadium and were accompanied by vandalism by youths.

title: Syria In a Period of Economic Growth
description: A visitor to the Syrian Arabic Republic today might well think he is touring a huge workshop; throughout the country one sees factories under construction, roads being built, and recently finished bridges and buildings. The vitality and energy in the country's economy can best be seen in its main harbor cities of Lattakia and Tartous where scores of ships have to wait for days for their turn to unload their cargoes. New modern highways have been constructed linking all the cities and towns of Syria.

title: FAYE ROBINSON PORTRAYS VIOLETTA IN LA TRAVIATA
description: The New York City Opera ended its strikeabbreviated fall season Sunday night with a tepid performance of Verdi's La Traviata. The evening's chief interest was Faye Robinson's Violetta, her first with the company.

title: CARTER SAYS BURNS VOWS COOPERATION; SEES COMPATIBILITY
description: PLAINS, Ga., Nov. 15Presidentelect Jimmy Carter said today that he had received a pledge of cooperation from Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, and felt that they will find a substantial degree of compatibility.

title: United Press International Crewmen of Syrian tank survey a scene of destruction as they enter Beirut's commercial district
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 15The Syrian Army took total control of Beirut today, forcing peace on the battlerayaged downtown area of the capital and in effect halting a civil war in which at least 35,000 people have been killed in 19 months.

title: OPEC ECONOMISTS MEET IN VIENNA ON PRICE RISE
description: VIENNA, Nov. 15Economic experts of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries met here today for secret discussions on proposals to put up the price of crude oil by 10 to 25 percent.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rateslor Ma relay.

title: Rosenbaum to Remain Chairman Of the G.O.P. in New York State
description: Richard M. Rosenbaum ruled out yesterday his rumored ambition to run for Governor and said that he would remain as Republican chairman of New York State through the 1978 election.

title: The Canadians Take a Glance At Ballet Past
description: TORONTO, Nov. 15  Yesterday afternoon the National Ballet of Canada, now in its 25th anniversary season at the O'Keefe Center, took an affectionate glance at its past. The ballet was the company's restaging of John Cranko's Romeo and Juliet, but the performance became a collector's item not only because it featured some of the older dancers in the ballet, but also because the audience was full of the company's former members. And at the end they all trouped up on stage to take part in the curtain calls.

title: Commodities Down, Except for Wheat, On Soybean Slump
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 15 (AP)Soybean futures fell more than 23 cents a bushel on the Chicago Board of Trade today and, except for wheat, dragged most of the other commodities lower.

title: Jury in 2d Trial of. Rubin Carter Hears Victim's Earlier Testimony
description: PATERSON, N.J., Nov. 15The jury in the second murder trial of Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis was told today that one of the victims of the 1966 Lafayette Grill shootingswho was shot in the head but survivedfailed to identify the two defendants when they were brought by the police to his hospital room here.

title: DR. DOROTHY KLUGHAUPT, GYNECOLOGIST IN JERSEY
description: Dr. Dorothy K. Klughaupt, a gynecologist and pediatrician at the Passaic (N.J.) General Hospital since 1941, died at the hospital Saturday after a short illness. She was 66 years old and lived in Passaic, where she also had a private practice.

title: Basketball Scoring
CarRental Units Studied by F.T.C. Over Allowances
description: The Federal Trade Commission said yesterday that it had begun an investigation to determine whether certain promotional allowances paid by the Big Three automakers to autorental companies were discriminatory.

title: Agency Says Beame Perils Charter Reform
description: The Community Service Society accused the Beame administration yesterday of dragging its feet on Charterrevision, especially in regard to the decentralization of city government.

title: New York Extends Instant Lottery: $980.000 to Be the Top Prize
description: New York State's instant lottery will be extended to Dec. 21 instead of ending Nov. 26 as scheduled, it was announced yesterday. A top prize of $980,000 was set for the new weekly lottery for which 50cent tickets go on sale today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Grant to Port Authority

title: Trade Bloc Rejects Comecon Plan
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 15 (UPI)The European Economic Community todayreject ed a proposal for fullScale trade links with the Eastern European economic bloc, Comecon.

title: Medical Deans
description: SAN FRANCISCOThe deans of most United States medical schools joined together here the other day to open the latest front of the general war against the ever more intrusive dictation from Congress and the bureaucracy in Washington.

title: Northeastern Agenda
description: Governor Carey's dream of forging a strong regional alliance to press for more Federal aid for the depressed Northeast moved a big step forward last weekend at a conference in Saratoga Springs sponsored by the infant Coalition of Northeastern Governors.

title: More Carrots, No Appeasement
description: PITTSBURGH  While chopping vegetables the other night, I listened to the radio. The question was, who might succeed Mr. Kissinger? Suddenly, I thought, Why shouldn't I be his successor?

title: Nuclear Commission Refuses to Finance Participation of Opposition Groups at Hearings
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15The Nuclear Regulatory Commission has anonunced that it will not begin a broad program of financial assistance for private groups that wished to express their views about the Government's nuclear policies at commission hearings.

title: Transcript of a News Conference Held by PresidentElect Carter in Georgia
description: I'm glad to have you all here. I noticed the number of cars outside was two or three times larger than my total audience was a couple of years ago.

title: State Senate Votes Fines of Up to $100,000 for Corruption by Officials
description: TRENTON, Nov. 15The State Senate approved tonight a bill to increase penalties for official corruption, voting 33 to 0 to raise the maximum fine from $2,000 to $100,000. The bill also provides for jail terms in certain cases.

title: Uplift Ahead for 14th St.Union Square Area
description: A threeyear plan to revitalize and beautify the 14th StreetUnion Square area through private contributions and government cooperation was announced yesterday by a combination of business and community groups.

title: The New Beaujolais: Some New Highs
description: PARIS, Nov. 15 (UPI)The new beaujolais wine went on sale today with both higher alcoholic content and higher prices.

title: Shell and Exxon Deadline Runs Out For Oil Agreement With Malaysiq
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Tuesday, Nov. 16A deadline ran out at midnight on attempts by the Malaysian Government to reach production sharing agreements with Shell and Exxon oil companies and, despite lastnrnute talks, the two sides failed to announce a compromise.

title: $8 Million Is Paid To Addressograph By Xerox in Accord
description: The Xerox Corporation yesterday paid $8 million to the AddressographMulti. graph Corporation as part of a settlement of counter claims between the two companies involving alleged monopolistic practices and patent infringement in the office copier and duplicating industry.

title: United Airlines Reports Profit Rose to $8.04 Million in October
description: United Airlines reported yesterday that its consolidated net earnings from airline operations rose in October to $8.04 million, compared with $1.4 million for October, 1975.

title: 11 Businessmen in Hudson County Are Indicted in I.R.S. Bribe Case
description: NEWARK, Nov. 15A Federal grand jury indicted 11 Hudson County businessmen today on charges of bribing an agent of the Internal Revenue Service to overlook more than $250,000 in taxes between January 1971 and March 1975.

title: Open Interest
description: Mondoy, Nov. 15, 1976

title: Supreme Court Refuses to Review Ruling on Concorde Flights to U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (AP)The Supreme Court refused today to review the circumstances of the Government's decision allowing commercial flights of the BritishFrench supersonic jet Concorde to the United States.

title: 9 Blacks Killed and 55 Injured In Clashes at South African Mine
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 15 (ReutersAt least nine black Africans were killed and 55 injured last night in fighting at the Impala platinum mine at Wildebeestfontein, 60 miles northwest of Johannesburg, a police spokesman said today.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: 28 Sex Places Midtown Limit In Zoning Plan
description: A maximum of 28 adult establishments would be allowed to dispense commercial sex in midtown Manhattan under theantipornography zoning concept announced last week by the Beame administration.

title: US VETOES HANOI BID FOR U.N. MEMBERSHIP
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 15The United States today vetoed the admission of Vietnam to the United Nations on the ground that Hanoi had failed so far to give an accounting of the 800 American servicemen who are still officially listed asmissing in action in the Vietnam war.

title: Navy Is Seeking Funds to Revive Condor Missile
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15The Navy seeking to revive its Condor missile program that was canceled earlier this year by Congress after the weapon became entangled in technical difficulties and suggestions of conflict of interest on the part of Pentagon officials.

title: Officer Fatally Shot as Comrade Fights With Suspect
description: MINEOLA, L.E., Nov. 15A Nassau County police officer was shot and killed last night when another policeman's service revolver discharged accidentally in a struggle with an ISyearold suspect seized after a chase in a stolen car, the Nassau County police said today.

title: Meadowlands
description: Horses listed In order of post positions

title: APPEALS COURT VOIDS SHIRT INDICTMENT
description: The Appellate Division of State Supreme Court in Brooklyn yesterday threw out an indictment of Assembly Speaker Stanley Steingut and his son, Robert, a City Councilman, on charges of corrupt use of position in offering a job in return for a campaign contribution.

title: Dividends
description: MONDAY, NOVEMBER 15, 1976

title: Car Insurance Rates Found Burdening Some Groups
description: A growing body of evidence suggests that the system used to determine automobile insurance rates is based, in part, on faulty statistics and unfairly burdens groups of drivers who can least afford, to pay the highest premiums.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: ExL.I. Park Supervisor Is Convicted of Extortion
description: John McGrath, former park maintenance supervisor for the Long Island State Park Commission, was convicted by a jury in Federal District Court, Brooklyn, yesterday of extorting more than $22,000 from three towing service operators in return for granting them franchises.

title: Nooren, a Dutch Rider, Takes Stake at Toronto
description: TORONTO, Nov. 15Henk Nooren of the Netherlands recorded his first victory of the RoyalWinter Fair Horse Show when he rode Jaegermeister to victory tonight in the ImperialBank of Commerce Stakes.

title: House Panel Picks 170 to Investigate Kennedy and King Slayings
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (UPI)The House Committee on Assassinations, meeting formally for the first time, announced today that a study group of 170 persons would conduct what it hoped will he the definitive investigations of the murders of President Kennedy and Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: Cozza Steps Down as Yale Coach; Seifert Is Reassigned
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 15Carmen Cozza, the most successful football coach in Yale University history, announced tonight that he was stepping down to devote full time to his duties as athletic director. He made the announcement at the team banquet.

College Conference Standings
