description: ENTRIES

title: Grand Prix Organizers Face Threat of Boycott
description: PARIS, Nov. 19 (AP) Grand Prix auto racing organizers will stick to their current financial agreement despite a threat by leading racing teams to boycott many of the traditional world championship circuits in 1977 and run their own championship, spokesman for the organizers said Friday.

title: Prices of Commodity Futures
description: Friday, November 19, 1976

title: Decline in Gold Prices Halts Abroad as Pound Recovers Some Ground
description: LONDON, Nov. 19 (AP)The price of gold halted its slide on Europe's bullion markets today while the pound had another good day on the foreign exchanges. The dollar was marginally down against most currencies.

title: L.I.U., Oneonta Gain Final In Division I Soccer Play
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I. Nov. 19Lort Island University and Oneonta eliminated Manhattan and Providence today and gained the Division I northern regional final of the Eastern College Athletic Conference.

title: Mikva Is Declared The Victor in Race In Illinois for House
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 19After two weeks of legal maneuvering in Cook County Circuit Count, Penresertative Abner Mikva, a Democrat who had been the dccl red the today in Illinois's Tenth Congressional !District.

title: Where Page Three Counts
description: LONDON, Nov. 19The Sun is the spectacular success of Rupert Murdoch, the man who is buying The New York Post. The Sun is a newspaper, in the sense that it appears every morning but Sunday and is published on newsprint. But its news is rarely what the editors of other newspapers call news.

title: Books of The Times
description: Let us hedge. Max Apple isn't yet a major American writer, which means that the professors who write book reviews don't feel they have to compete with him for the attention and approval of their students. It also means that he can travel light and move fast, leaving a story here and a story thereAmer ican Review, Esquire, Georgia Review,

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Friday.

title: Wayne Millner, 65; AllAmerica End For Notre Dame
description: FALLS CHURCH, Va. Nov. 19 (AP)Wayne E. Miliner, an allAmerican at Notre Dame and an outstanding Washington Redskins receiver, died today at the age of 65.

title: Motherhood In Bondage
description: Every great new movement in hu man consciousness arouses both hope and terror. The understanding that malefemale relationships have been founded on the status of the female as the property of the male, or of maledominated institutions, continues to be difficult for both women and men.

title: Canadian Riders 1, 2 in jumping, Narrow U.S. Margin at Toronto
description: TORONTO. Nov. 19The Canadian Equestrian Team captured the first two places in the international jumping competition tonight and pulled to within 5 points of the United States Equestrian Team in the race for the championship at the Royal Winter Fair horse show.

title: Neil Young Sings at Palladium
description: Neil Young, who performed the first of three soldout shows at the Palladium on Thursday, is a poet of the romance of the edge. His songs mix images of intoxication and romance, violence and escape. In Too Far Gone, which could serve as his theme song, he recalls the first blossoming of romance through a bleary haze, considers marriage, and asks, Am I too far gone? Apparently he was, for many of his other songs deal with lost love as well as with dreams, drink, and drugs.

title: Auto Union and General Motors Reach Accord to End Brief Strike
description: DETROIT, Nov. 19The United Automobile Workers and the General Motors Corporation reached tentative agreement today on a threeyear national contract, ending a ministrike against G.M. that started only 12 hours earlier.

title: Getting Out, And Up
description: When I went to City College in 1972, my vocabulary was limited to a few choice phrases like Move over rover and let Petey take over. I still hung out on a Bronx street corner with a group of guys who called themselves the Davidson Boys and sang songs like Daddylolo. Everything we did could he summed up with the word snap. That's a snap. She's a snap. He had a snap.

title: Rising Star in Indian Politics.
description: GAUHATI, India, Nov. 19When Sanjay Gandhi, Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's 29yearold son, paid a ceremonial visit to Maharashtra a few weeks ago, The state's Chief Minister, S. B. Chavan, called him a new star rising in the political firmament of India, with achievements Man in the News written in letters of gold. Mr. Chavan also asked the visitor to stay on a while in Bombay to guide us in slum clearance.

title: Move by Bank From 61/4% Unexpected
description: The Morgan Guaranty Trust Company the nation's sixth largest commercial banktook the rest of the industry by surprise yesterday when it unexpectedly cut its prime lending rate for its most creditworthy customers from 61/2 percent to 61t percent, effective Monday.

title: Carter Confers With C.I.A. Chief; Bush Calls Him Well Prepared
description: PLAINS, Ga., Nov. 19George Bush, the Director of Central Intelligence, came to Plains today to share his organization's portfolio of secrets and spy techniques with Presidentelect Jimmy Carter.

title: THE NEW YORK POST HAS A LONG HISTORY
description: Always a voice of strong opinions since Alexander Hamilton founded it in 1801, The New York Post has been sustained by some of the great names in American journalism to become the oldest daily newspaper published continuously in the United States.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
GIUSEPPE COSTA
description: GENOA, Italy, Nov. 19 (AP)Giuseppe Costa, a member of the Genoese family of businessmen and shipping tycoons, died today after a heart attack. He was 78. His brother Angelo, a former head of the Italian Manufacturers Association, died in July.

title: Britain's Tories Shuff
description: LONDON, Nov. 19Margaret Thatcher, the Conservative Party leader, today shuffled part of her front benchher main spokesmen on public issues and the people she is presumably grooming to take government posts if the Tories win the next general election.

title: Around the Nation
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 19 (UPI)Nicole Barrett, the fiancee of convicted killer Gary Mark Gilmore, was ordered committed to the, Utah Mental Hospital today at the request of her mother, who said she feared her daughter would try again to carry out a suicide pact with the condemned man.

title: Investments From U.S. in HydroQuebec Up $50 Million Since Separatist Victory
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 19Quebec's electric power authority has obtained $50 million on the American market since a Separatist government was elected here Monday.

title: LIVING COSTS RISE 0.2% IN METROPOLITAN AREA
description: Consumer prices in the New Yorknortheastern New Jersey area rose, twotenths of 1 percent last month and 5.3 percent from October 1975, the smallest annual increase in more than three years, the Bureau of Labor Statistics reported yesterday.

title: Italian Retains Ring Title
description: RANDERS, Denmark, Nov. 19 (AP)Germano Valsecchi of Italy retained his European middleweight boxing title today by knocking out Paul Knudsen of Denmark in the seventh round of scheduled 15round bout.

title: Saudis Put 10% Lid on Increases In Oil Prices as Iranians Ask 15%
description: Saudi Arabia is unwilling to vote ail oil price increase greater than 10 percent, while Iran believes that 15 percent should be the minimum, according to two magazine interviews released yesterday.

title: Stanford Drops Football Coach
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Nov. 19 (AP)Jack Christiansen, who guided Stanford University's football team to 55 wonlost record this season, was dismissed today by Joe Ruetz, athletic director.

title: Carter Adviser on Resources Quits, Citing Friction
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 19Jimmy Carter's top adviser on natural resources and the environment, Joseph Browder, has quit, attributing his action to frictions with political strategists in the Presidentelect's transition organization.

title: Aides Log Shows How Howard Hughes Spent Day
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Nov. 19 (UPI)The aides who tended Howard R. Hughes in the billionaire's waning days kept meticulous log that noted what he did, minute by minute, down to when he sat down, ate or went to the bathroom.

title: Mariners Name Coach
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 19 (AP) The Seattle Mariners announced today the appointment of Don Bryant, formerly of the Boston Red Sox, as bullpen coach for the American League expansion team. The club also hired Steve Ray of the Bronx, to scout the metropolitan New York and New Jersey areas.

title: Music: Holliger's String Quartet
description: Though best known as a virtuoso oboist, Heinz Holliger is also a composecr, having studied with Pierre Boulez. His avantgarde String Quartet (1973) was one of two works to receive first American performances at a concert of contemporary Swiss music Thursday night at Carnegie Recital Hall.

title: Smith and Vorster: A Different Perspective
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov. 19Some Western diplomats in Pretoria and some political observers in Salisbury believe that if the Geneva peace initiative were scored like a tennis match, the team of John Vorster of South Africa and Ian D. Smith of Rhodesia would be holding a twoset lead.

title: HOWARD H. FOSTER
description: Howard H. Foster, founder of the Allied Boat Company in Catskill, N.Y., in 1962, died yesterday morning in his home at 315 East 72d Street. He was 64 years old.

title: Brazil's Catholic Bishops Condemn Military Regime
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 19The Roman Catholic Church came out this week with its strongest condemnation of the rightwing Brazilian military Government since President Ernesto Geisel assumed office In 1974.

title: G.A.O. Asserts Army Overspent Millions
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 (UPI)Over several years the Army spent at least $205 million more than it was given by Congress as a result of a serious breakdown in its financial management, according to the General Accounting Office.

title: Flames Control Play, Top Black Hawks, 53, As Orr Makes Cautious Return to the Ice
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 19 (AP)Bobby Orr came back to the ice after a threeweek absence, but the superstar's presence Was not enough as the Atlanta Flames defeated the Chicago Black Hawks, 53, in an N.H.L. game tonight.

title: Runaway Utility Rates
description: The request by New York Telephone for a $393 million (118 percent) rate increase on top of $345 million in increases already received during the past 13 months can only be viewed as a blow to the embattled economies of this city and state.

title: Philippine Student Takes World Title in Bowling
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Nov. 19 (AP) Paeng Nepomuceno of the Philippines won the 12th World Bowling cup today by defeating Carlos Lovera of Venezuela, 571567. The new champion rolled games of 181, 222 and 168, while Lovera hit 200, 188 and 179. Each had three splits in the final game.

title: People and Business
description: The flying nightclub, which its promoter said was scheduled to take off on the first flight to nowhere, on Dec. 11, will not get off the ground.

title: Kubelik Leads Philharmonic in Two Works By Beethoven and the Dvorak New World
description: Ratael Kubelik, starting the second week of his guestconducting engagement, led the New York Philharmonic on Thursday night in a solid if not terribly imaginative program consisting of Beethoven's Egmont Overture, Beethoven's Piano Concerto No. 3 in C minor and Dvorak's New World Symphony.

title: Miss Newman Stresses Fluid Dance
description: Rosalind Newman is interested in movement at the expense of structure. Her pieces celebrate sharpedged phrases, anyone of which is virtually independent of the ones that precede or follow it. It is luxurious motion of the moment that can be enjoyed at the Moment out Leaves a ense of incompleteness in its wellturned wake. Miss Newman presented an evening of her works at the American Theater Laboratory on Thursday.

description: DEL APACHE, N. M., Nov. 19 (UPI)The whooping crane population in central New Mexico now stands at five, and a sixth whooper is apparently headed toward its winter grounds.

description: LAFAYETTE, La., Nov. 19 (AP)An investigation has found nothing to back up charges that the University of Southwestern Louisiana hired an illegal football recruiting coach, a state investigator said today.

title: Bridge

The mixed pairs, the first of five major events to be played during the next 10 days, began with 560 pairs in play in the first of Iwo qualifying sessions.

title: United Press International
description: A cheering crowd greeting passengers as they disembarked yestesrday from a Middle East Airlines jet from Rome, the first plane to land at Beirut International Airport since fighting caused it to close last June.

title: MAN KILLED IN CLASHES WITH POLICE IN ECUADOR
description: QUITO, Ecuador, Nov. 19 (Reuters)A man was shot to death today and 20 students were arrested following clashes with the police as antigovernment demonstrations continued in Ecuador.

description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 19The Roman Catholic Church came out this week with its strongest condemnation of the rightwing Brazilian military Government since President Ernesto Geisel assumed office in 1974.

title: Michigan, UC.L.A. Are Picked Today

Such a game, which last occurred in 1964, will probably not take place again until balance is restored to football in these two major college leagues.

description: The RCA Corporation announced yesterday that it was retaining ownership of its British food companies, Oriel Foods Ltd. and Morris & David Jones Ltd.

description: New Yorkers who are concerned with runaway utility costs may turn for a useful lesson to the recent experience of New Jersey, where the Public Utilities Commission not only turned down New Jersey Bell's bid for a $150.2 million rate increase but actually ordered a onemilliondollar rollback for lowuse customers.

title: HewlettPackard Net Sets Records
description: The HewlettPackard Company, a large maker of electronic measuring instrumentri, reported yesterday profit increases of 58.9 percent for the final guarter and 8.4 percent for the fiscal year ended Oct. 31., Sales and earnings for both periods set records. The quarterly figures were the highest for any quarter in the company's history.

description: A State Supreme Court, justice in Brooklyn disclosed yesterday that he would impose the death sentence Monday on Joseph James, the 28yearold convicted murderer of a correction officer.

title: CONSUMER PRICE RISE OF 0.3% IN OCTOBER LEAST SINCE MARCH
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19The pace of inflation continued to abate in October as consumer prices registered their smallest increase since March, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Early American Styling Is Still Making News
description: Early American, the nation's style favorite in furniture for more than a decade, gained again at this fall's wholesale showings, according to a marlcet survey just released by the Fine HardwoodsAmerican Walnut Association.

title: EMILY B. LEWIS
description: Emily B. Lewis of Hackensack, N.J., mother of Milton F. Lewis, vice chairman of Howard, Weil, Labouisse, Friedrichs Inc., stockbrokers at I State Street Plaza, New York City, died yesterday in her home. Mrs. Lewis, widow of Edmund A. Lewis, who was a police lieutenant in Weehawken, N.J., is survived, besides her son, by a daughter, Dorothy Molteni; six grandchildren, and six greatgrandchildren.

title: Soybean Futures Soar, Then Fall Back Sharply On Late Profit Taking
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 19 (AP)Soybeanfutures prices soared to near the allowable limit on the Chicago Board of Trade today, then fell back sharply under late nrofit taking.

title: Accounting Standards Planned For Announcement by YearEnd
description: The Financial Accounting Standards Board announced yesterday that before the end of the year it would issue final statements by accounting for leases and on financial reporting for segments of a business enterprise. Neither statements will be effective for financial reports issued for fiscal years ended Dec. 31, 1976.

title: Mexican Peasants Get 200,000 Acres Of Rich Farmland
description: CIUDAD OBREGON, Mexico, Nov. 19The Mexican Government today expropriated over 200,000 acres of rich farmland owned by a handful of wealthy families and ordered its distribution to thousands of landless peasants.

title: Reluctant King Sung at Juilliard
description: The things that are coming up these days! During the last few years there has been a healthy trend, from musical organizations all over the country, of looking into the forgotten works of the past. Some shoddy stuff inevitably turns up, but also some treasures.

title: Regents Dismiss Nyquist as Edutation Commissioner
description: The New York State Board of Regents voted S to 7 yesterday to dismiss Ewald B. Nyquist as Education Commissioner not later than June O.

title: DOUGLAS W. AMBRIDGE, 78, EXHEAD OF PAPER COMPANY
description: TORONTO, Nov. 19 (AP)Dougla White Ambridge of Toronto, former president of Abitibi Paper Company, died Tuesday after a long illness. He was 78.

title: Muskie Quits Race for Leadership Of Senate to Support Humphrey
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 (UPI)Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine said today that he was withdrawing from the race to be the Senate's next Democratic leader in favor of Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota.

title: A Night At the Opera Bouffe
description: The whole family went to see the current revival of The Transition, the show that propelled John Kennedy to stardom in 1960. As soon as the curtain went up, the hero walked on and desegregated a church.

title: Nadjari, Cont'd
description: Maurice Nadjari must be in deep and earnest agreement these days with William Faulkner's observation, The past is never dead; it is not even past. The new report by the State Commission of Investigation on the relationship of the Special Prosecutor's office with the press, when Mr. Nadjari held the post, has revived many of the charges that abounded when he was fighting to stay in his job last spring. IL has also elicited the same kind of heated contention that passed for public debate about the quality of Mr. Nadjari's service.

title: Harvard Freshman, 63 Years Old, Has an Advantage inHis History Class
description: Harry Gersh IS me second generation in his family to go to Harvard. The first was his son.

title: New Orders Up For First Time In Four Months
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 (AP)A surge in business spending in October triggered the first increase in four months for new orders of durable goods, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: NEW JUDGE ORDERED IN THE BOLLES CASE
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 19A motion, requesting a change of judge for the murder trial of the man accused of killinga reporter of The Arizona Republic, Don Bolles, was granted here today.

title: Wild Plays an Exacting Liszt Array
description: It is hardly news nowadays that Earl Wild has one of the fleetest sets of fingers in the world and that his playing of piano music by Liszt can be enormously satisfying. But have we known up to now that Mr. Wild is also a performer of extraordinary endurance, one who can begin a Liszt recital shortly after 8 P.M. with an imposing rendition of Funerailles and, after working his way through an incredible array of exacting works, can bring it to an end some three hours later with a hairraising account of the Mephisto Waltz, Everythng memorized and virtually noteperfect, of course.

title: Bando Signs With Brewers And Garland With Indians
description: With the move of Sal Bando to Milwaukee and Wayne Garland to Cleveland, baseball's nouveau riche continued to confound baseball's vieux riche yesterday. wealthiest teams or the teams in the most attractive cities. Some of the players aren't even going where the most money is,

title: Balanchine's Bugaku Danced; Peter Schaufuss in Male Role
description: George Balanchine's Bugaku is a strange work. It has music composed by Toshiro Mayuzumi, and well recall that, when it was first given at the City Center in 1963 (the score itself is a year older), at most performances the audience gently giggled. Nowadays no one giggles. You could say we have become that sophisticated. Or you could say, if you were in a nastier mood, that we had discovered this plangently oriental score to be just a trifle boring, and that even David Hays's unquestionably brilliant setting had its moments of fashionbook despair. And the Karinska costumes still look more invented than designed. Yet the work works.

title: CARTER'S WIFE PROMISES MENTAL HEALTH PANEL
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 19Wearing blue delegate's ribbon and a tiny gold peanut pinned to her blue dress, Rosalynn Carter announced today that her husband had promised to establish President's commission on mental health after he takes office.

title: OneOffice Bank That Toppled Moratorium on Big City's Notes
description: In a newly expanded building a story and a half high in suburban Flushing, Queens, is the only office of the Flushing National Bank.

title: Suspect in Attack on Woman, 82, Is Held for a Mental Examination
description: AState Supreme Court justice in the Bronx refused yesterday to set bail for Ronald Timmons, and instead ordered 30day psychiatric examination of the 19yearold youth who has become the focus of a controversy over Family Court records, the bail process and concern about crimes against the elderly.

title: Cornelius Keeley, Dies at 80; Former Advertising Manager
description: Cornelius (Bud) Keeley of 24 West 55th Street, for 45 years advertising manager of Beauty Fashion, a trade magazine, died yesterday in St. Luke's Hospital. Mr. Keeley had a heart condition. He was 80 years old, had been a consultant since his retirement in 1973. He was a founder of the Foragers and BIMS, both cosmetics industry organizations.

description: ExFlower Child Exults in Free Enterpris

description: Dorothy Schitt, editor in center and publisher of The New York Post, announced yesterday that she had agreed to sell the afternoon daily to Rupert Murdoch, the Australian publisher whose vast empire includes newspapers in his country, the United States and England.

title: Smith Denounces Black Demands
description: SALISRURY, Rhodesia, Nov. 19 (AP)Prime Minister Ian D. Smith said today that there was still a chance for the Geneva conference on Rhodesia's future to succeed despite the demands that were being made there by black nationalist leaders.

title: Teacher Union Rivaling Shanker's Is Set to Recruit in New York City
description: A national teacher's organization with million members announced yesterday that it would begin recruiting New York City public school teachers to form radon against the United Federation of Teachers.

description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 19 (AP)John Williamson connected on a 15foot baseline shot with three seconds to play, giving the New York Nets 90'83 National Basketball Association victory over the Phoenix Suns tonight.

title: Rita Taylor Denny Wed To George E. McElwee
description: Rita Taylor Denny, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Paul E. Taylor of Overbrook, Phila., was married there yesterday afternoon to George Edward McElwee, a widower and resident vice president in BalaCynwyd, Pa., of Merrill,'Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith Inc.

title: Aerosol Industry Is Trying Hard To Find Fluorocarbons Substitute

title: Strike by U.A.W. Against G.M. Will Trim Week's Output Level

title: Mets Name Tidewater Pilot

He succeeds Tom Burgess, who is joining the Mets coaching staff. Also, Bob Wellman will manage the Mets Jackson team in the Texas League and Toni Egan will manage the Wausau, Wis., team in the Midwest League.

He immediately decided to bring that production to New York. and last night the Metropolitan Opera, by arrangement with the San Francisco Opera, presented Esclarmonde to bowl audienceswith Joan Sutherland, trf course, for whom the opera had been revived.

title: CONSUMER PRICE RISE OF 0.3% IN OCTOBER LEAST SINCE MARCH
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19The pace of inflation continued to abate in October as consumer prices registered their smallest increase since March, the Labor Denartment reported today.

title: Watershed in Spain
description: In demanding that the Francocreated Cortes reject the Spanish Government's bill to reestablish an elected Parliament, one of the late Generalissimo's idolators exclaimed that the measure would dismantle Franco's life work. At the end of the debate, the 531member Cortes voted itself out of existence and approved Spain's first parliamentary elections in 41 yearsto take place in 1977by the astonishing margin of 425 to 59, with 13 abstentions.

title: U.S.Soviet Arms Talks to End Till Carter Inaugural
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19The United States and the Soviet Union have agreed to suspend negotiations for a treaty curbing longrange bombers and offensive missiles until after Jimmy Carter assumes office, Ford Administration officials said today.

title: Appeal Set on Minority Admissions

title: Upstate Urban Sprawl Is Robbing Wilderness Trail of Its Wilderness
description: PAWLING, N.Y., Nov. 9The Appalachian Trail, a wilderness foot trail that existed in large part long ago as the Great Indian Warpath, is in jeopardy in New York State according to state and Federal officials and hikers who have walked the trail recently.

title: New &Noval
description: This novel of the 1950's is about what used to be called a mixed marriage. But it operates under more stresses than the fact that Hyman (Feen) Feinstein, 42, is a Jew from the Bronx and Jenny Sue Massengill, 22, is a lapsed Catholic from Bronxville. Hyman is also a perpetual sonny boy, who continues to water his dead mother's rubber plant even though he lives in Manhattan and the plant grows in the Bronx. He suspects that people are putting eggshells in his food. He clings to a petty government job, and he is a meanspirited man.

title: Science
description: On the floor of the Pacific Ocean alone there are believed to be at least 1.5 trillion tons of metallic nodules, carpeting the deeper regions with what look like misshapen black potatoes. While the manner of their formation is controversial, there is no doubt about their composition. They are rich in such critical metals as cobalt, copper, manganese and nickel, offering to a metalhungry world a vast reserve of raw materials.

title: The Wind Tides
description: Autumn ebbs away into winter, but there is flow rather than ebb in the unseen wind tides that now lap at the hills and send invisible breakers to hiss softly in the upper woodlands. They are the tides that curl about this earth, forever restless and eternally moving, tides that obey some subtler master than the moon.

title: Signs of Life On 42d St.
description: Perhaps more than any other street in the world, 42d Street epitomizes urbanity. Crowded within its relatively ?? reach in unrivaled intencity me offices, hotels and stores, highrise apartments and tenements, landmark skyscrapers and bustling transportation terminals.

description: DES MOINES, Nov. 20 (AP)  Jack Wallace, head football coach at Drake University for the last 12 years, resigned today. Wilbur Miller, the school president, said Drake would begin searching for a new coach immediately. Wallace will stay at Rrake as assistant athletic director.

Japan's Watergate: Made in V.S.A.
description: Like the black ships of Commodore Matthew Perry's forcible opening of Japan in 1853, like the American victory of 1945 that restored Japan to the path of parliamentary democracy, a shock wave loosed in the United States has jolted the Japanese into a fundamental reappraisal of their political system. That shock is the Lockheed scandal. It is the biggest issue in the national election two weeks from now. It may cause the Liberal Democrats, the conservative party that has governed Japan for a generation, to lose their absolute majority in the House of Representatives, the lower and more important House of Parliament, thus sending Japanese politics veering off on an uncharted course. Even more important, the scandal, and the selfsearching it has aroused, is putting Japanese democracy to a critical test and may be moving it to a new stage in its struggle to develop genuine representative government.

title: Marcie L. Serchuch And Miles M. Stuchin Plan a May Wedding

title: STAGE VIEW
description: Saint Joan heard voices, I hear voices, Harold Pinter hears voices. Joan tended to hear hers in the open fields, I hear mine mostly intermissiontime on opening nights. During the single intermission for Harold Pinter's No Man's Land, I heardclearly, out of the verbal crossfiretwo distinct plaints from contrary directions, one on top of the other. The first voice, a woman's, was raised in arch inquiry to an escort: You are going to explain this play to me tomorrow, aren't you? The second, a man's, mused vaguely to a companion: I seem to be ;spending an awful lot of time this evening saying hello to people I don't know.

Nov. 20 (Reuters)Punchuncayi detention camp, once the home of hundreds of Chilean political prisoners, is to be turned into a summer resort for students, it was announced here today. The camp, which faces the Pacific some 9,1 miles west of here, was formally closed yesterday.

title: Repayment Pledged in Theft
description: ELIZABETH, N.J., Nov. 20 (AP)A 53yearold former garage foreman for a construction company has agreed to repay $200,000 that he admitted stealing from the company. The man, Michael Maluso, a former employee at the Houdaille Construction Materials garage in Springfield, interrupted a civil trial here this week to enter the settlement. The company had sued him in an effort to recover some of the estimated total of $500,000 that the authorities say had been stolen by Mr. Maluso and six others between 1968 and 1974.

title: Paper Back Talk
description: Rx for a superseller. First take a generous helping of the devilish brew that made Rosemary's Baby so successful a novel and film. Toss in a pinch of its background, Central Park West's storied Dakota apartment house. Add to the cauldron dollops of the occult pabulum that made The Exorcist and The Omen enormous hits in the bookstores and movie houses. Flavor it with that primal parental passionfear of losing one's child to a stranger, exploited so profitably in this season's best seller, Where Are the Children? Lace it all with belief in life eternal, a conviction strongly held these days by enthusiasts of Eastern religions and even many readers of such scientific studies as Life After Life.

title: Notes: A Campaign To Curb the NoShow
description: About one in every 10 reservations made for hotel rooms in the United States turns out to be a noshow: the guest fails to arrive and doesn't bother to cancel. The result, the American Hotel and Motel Association complains, is that every year about 10 million rooms are not sold. Says Harry Mullikin, the group's chairman: Since the average price of a room these days is around $30, and noshow rooms generally go empty, the loss to the lodging industry is $300 million year. Consequently the association has launched an educational campaien to teach travelers better manners. It includes a contest in which hotel and motel guests will compete for prizes by writing anti noshow slogans.

title: Exhibit Gives Engineers

title: Racing Group Withdraws
description: MODENA, Italy, Nov. 20 (AP)Ferrari and other members of the Formula One Contractors Association will not participate in the Argentine Grand Prix in January, Enzo Ferrari announced today. Ferrari told a news conference that the withdrawal from the Argentine event was prompted by a change in sponsorship asked by the Argentine Automobile Club. Ferrari also said negotiations for the Grand Prix of Brazil were proceeding normally.

The explosion destroyed the building and shattered hundreds of windows in neighboring apartment. blocks.

title: Arsonist Plagues Upstate Farmers; 33 Fires Have Been Set Since April
description: LOCKPORT, N.Y., Nov. 20Alarmed by a series of 33 incendiary fires that have swept through rural areas of Niagara County in recent months, some jittery farmers are sleeping with shotguns at their sides to protect their property. Rewards totaling $9,500 have been offered for the arrest of the arsonist. .

title: Body, Mind, Behavior
description: In a charming introduction to this collection of essays on medical and psychological topics, journalist Maggie Scarf describes how she happened to become a popularizer of behavioral science research and how she actually prepares a magazine piece. She then states two conclusionsboth, as happens, relevant to an evaluation of her book. First, in Mrs. Scarf's view, current work in the behavioral sciences can be easily understood by any intelligent person': as one who must, in fashioning an article, educate herself from scratch, she is in a favorable position to effect public understanding. Second, as a consequence of her preparation of a score of articles, she finds interesting interconnections among the various topics investigated by behavioral scientists.

title: New York City Residents Resist Flu Shots and a Poll Learns Why
description: Most of New York City's residents are refusing swine flu vaccinations, apparently because they do not think they are necessary, because they arc afraid of them or because their physicians have advised against them.

title: Gregorek an Undefeated Runner
description: John Gregorek completed an unbeaten season and led St. Anthony's of Smithtown, L.I., to the team title yesterday in the New York State Federation crosscountry championships at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx.

title: U.S. DISPUTE IN 1948 ON ISRAEL RELATED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20Secretary of State George C. Marshall told President Harry S. Truman in a heated meeting in May 1948 that if the President recognized the state of Israel it would be only for domestic political reasons and he would have to vote against Mr. Truman in the Presidential elections that autumn. The details of the meeting, which occurred May 12 in the White House, are included in the latest volume of historical materials released by the Slate Department today. The volume, covering American diplomacy in the Middle East in 1998, centers on efforts to contain the ArabJewish fighting associated with Britain's withdrawal from Palestine.

description: While the United States Power Squadrons and the New Jersey State Division of Civil Rights continue their power struggle, the free public safe boating course has gone by the boards.

title: Title to Allegheny Squad
description: BETHPAGE, N.Y., Nov. 20 (AP)Robin Holland of Johannesburg, South Africa, led Allegheny Community College to its first title ever today in the National Junior College crosscountry championships. Holland, a 21yearold sophomore, covered the fivemile course in 23 minutes 20.2 seconds and finished 45 yards ahead of his teammate, Tom Frye, who was timed in 23:36. The Cougars also took third and fourth places. Carlos Bedine ran the course in 23:37 and Bill Steware finished in 23:38.

description: Ted Blackwell has an idea that flying a crapduster plane would be fun. He'd like to try itsomeday.

title: Pitt, Georgia in Sugar Bowl; Michigan and U.S.C. Matched
description: Pittsburgh, undefeated, untied and ranked No. 1 in the nation, yesterday accepted the bid to play Georgia in the Sugar Bowl on Jan. 1, thus putting the official stamp of approval on last Tuesday's vote by the Panther players when they made the Sugar Bowl their choice. Georgia, which has a 91 wonlost record, earned the host spot in the New Orleans Superdome game when the Bulldogs clinched the Southeastern Conference championship on Nov. 13.

title: Militancy and the Abortion Fight
description: LAST year, about 500 people attended a prolife convention at the Holiday Inn in Hempstead. We heard experts from many fields recount the horrors of abortion and discuss strategy for the passage of a Constitutional Amendment that would protect life at every stage of development. But a few blocks away in a Main Street abortion chainber (not a clinic, which is where sick people go to get well), it was business as usual, just as it was in the deathdealing wing of the local hospital and in the other abortion mills in Nassau.

title: Bills Lose Green for Season
description: ORCHARD PARK, N.Y., Nov. 20 (UPI)The Buffalo Bills today placed Van Green, a defensive back, on the injured reserve list today. A team spokesman said Green, who suffered a knee injury four weeks ago, will undergo surgery for a torn cartilage Tuesday and will be out for the remainder of the season. Green's place on the roster was taken by NFL Clifford Brooks..

title: Fashion
description: Glenda Jackson was reclining on a red velvet couch in a Sarah Bernhardt pose, having her picture taken, when the fire broke out. The photographer, who first noticed the smoke through her viewfinder, said that for a moment she thought someone had changed the fstop on the camera, and then suddenly there were flamesno one knows how they startedcoming from the window behind Glenda Jackson, and people started pulling down the drapes and pouring vans full of water on the furniture. A lot of fairly destinationless running began then, and a good deal shouting about opening windows and calling the fire department and watching out for faking embers. Glenda Jackson, meanwhile, stoodvery quietin a navy and white silk John Anthony pants suit, tapping out sparks with the heel of her shoe.

description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., Nov. 20 (AP)Maryland's Terps completed pn unbeaten and untied season with a 28.0 trouncing of Virginia's Cavaliers today, then accepted an invitation to play in the Cotton Bowl on New Year's Day.

It is the amalgam of history, function and aspiration that adds up to a communal purpose. And it is a human artifact, at worst a fortuitous jumble of buildings, at best a work of art.

Ruffels beat a fellow Australian, Geoff Masters, 61,06, 64. Fairlie, a New Zealander, led Dick Crealy of Australia, 76, 32, when Crealy quit because of tiredness.

title: Dostoevsky
description: Dostoevsky is one major writer who will never harden into a classic. He forces his readers to grapple with his books in a personal way, with some of the same intensity he brought to writing them. The author of this definitive new biography, Joseph Frank, describes the unusual sense of excitement that Dostoevsky manages to create from page to page, and the almost hypnotic fascination, quite aside from plotting, that he never fails to exercise on his readers. At moments Dostoevsky seems to reach out and grab the reader, enclosing him in an atmosphere of emotional violence that is sometimes comical but can also come to feel suffocating.

title: So Far, Not Much Sign that Carter's Will Be Different
description: WASHINGTONWhen the White House is passing from one party to another, the Presidentelect traditionally uses the process of selecting a Cabinet for much more than assembling the people who will hold top positions in his Administration. He uses it for healing the wounds of the election campaign, for consolidating his position among friendly interests, for broadening his base of support in Congress and across the country and for quieting fears about his approaching Presidency.

description: In 1889, when people were flocking to Paris for the Exposition Universelle with its new marvel, the Eiffel Tower, ona of the side attractions was the latest Massenet opera, Esclarmonde. The ninth of the composer's 27 operas to be staged, it was a huge success, and after its premiere at the OperaComique on May 15, it was given on an average of four times a week for over six months.

title: Maigret And the Apparition
description: How important a writer is Georges Simenon? The greatest storyteller of our day, a writer comparable with Balzac at least in the variety of his themes and characters? Or a marvel of industry and ingenuity who has given us each year six books that must be called productionline rather than custommade? When one looks again at some of the huge output, the balance drops heavily in favor of the second view. You are too literary. Supall the literature and it will work, Colette said to the young Simenon. It is advice he has taken all too wholeheartedly. The formula has worked, certainly, but on a level far distant from Balzac and well below that of such modern storytellers as Graham Greene and Ernest Hemingway.

title: PEOPLE
description: EVERY year around this time yor read about the college homecoming queens, and this year won't any exception. But first, a word about the homecoming king. AL Hofstra, for the first time in the university's 41year history, the school had a homecoming king, in keeping with the trend toward equality between the sexes. Ile is Christopher Hurnm, a 21yearold major in personnel management who itails from Baldwin. The homecoming queen, Bum Huntington, was 21yearold Joanne Ridob who was crowned by the university's president, James M. Shuart, during the halftime ceremonies of the FlofstraFordhem football game

title: Sleep It Off, Lady
description: Probably the most gratifying literary rediscovery of the 1960's was the revival of Jean Rhys. ,It was she, in fact, who rediscovered herself, after 27 years of silence, with the publication of Wide Sargasso Sea, a tale of the mad Mrs. Rochester, spun off from Jane Eyre. And, thanks to that, we now have those fine, somber Rhys novels of the 1930'slargely about the lives of lonely women submerged in the depths of great citiesavailable again in paperbacks.

title: British Football Results
Congress Finds A New Interest In Georgia Bloc
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20Representative John J. Flynt Jr. beamed as he told a telephone caller the other day, There was more power in Griffin, Ga., yesterday than there'll be until they take me hack and bury me.

title: A Smaller Bang for a Buck
description: VARAVILLE, FranceIn the nasty simplified cold war days which nobody in his right mind hearkens back to, advocates of a strategy of allout nuclear response to even the slightest aggression argued that this could be a less expensive as well as more deadly means of defending the West because it was based on a bigger bang for a buck. This meant more calculable megadeaths for each military budget dollar spent.

title: Margaret Stout To Wed Dec.18
description: Mr. and Mrs. Richard R. Stout of West Allenhurst, N. J., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Margaret Tucker Stout, to John C. Pogue 3d.. son of Mrs. Justin Jason Stevenson Jr. of Cincinnati and Mr. Pogue of Geycrsville, Calif. The wedding will take place. Dec. 18 in Allenhurst.

title: 2 Big Races at Daytona Next Sunday To Top Off the Best Season for IMSA
description: The most successful season in the sixyear history of the International Motor Sports Association (IMSA) will end next Sunday in Daytona Beach, Fla. Two major races are scheduled on Davtona's 3.84mile road course  a About Motor Sports 150mile Radial Challenge Series event for Racing Stock (RS) cars and a 250mile test for the Camel GT Challenge Series machines.

title: Miami Beach Police Say Youth Stole From Them for a Year
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Nov. 20 (AP)A 13yearold boy who lives across the street from police headquarters has stolen enough equipment in the last year to supply a small police department, detectives say.

title: NEW YORK OFFICIALS DEVISING NEW PLANS TO RAISE $1 BILLION
description: State and city architects of New York City's fiscal rescue began meeting yesterday to devise new plans to raise $1 billion in cash for the owners of shortterm notes frozen by a yearlong moratorium that has now been thrown out by a court decision.

title: A LongPlaying Price War
description: When Barry Mlot bought the Platterpuss Record Shop early this year, he expected the going to be rough. The 26yearold entrepreneur knew that the retail record business was keenly competitive and marked by a higherthanaverage failure rate.

title: Bernini Is Dead?
description: This impressive volume (it weighs nearly four pounds) is by a former dean of the School of Humanities and Social Science at M.I.T. whose aim is to show some people quite unknown to me, how they, too, might, in time and on their own terms, acquire the memory of the happy day on happy day

title: Suspicions of Bungling and Cover. up Still Linger
description: WASHINGTONOn the eve of the 13th anniversary of the assassination of President John F. Kennedy, subpoenas have been sent out in search of new information about his murder and that of the Rev. Or. Martin Luther King Jr. The investigation launched by the newly established House Select Committee on Assassinations is the sixth to be conducted on a large scale by Government officials since the 35th President was killed Nov. 22, 1963.

Plainfield Gets Revenge And Spot in Group Final
description: In the first high school football game at Giants Stadium in the Meadowlands, Plainfield avenged a regularseason defeat by stopping Thomas Jefferson of Elizabeth. 2714, yesterday before 3,400 fans. It earned Plainfield a berth in the North Jersey Section 2 Group final Dec. 4 against Westfield.

title: Gail Glaser to Be Bride Of W. B. Fritz in Spring
description: Marrill Jonas of Beverly Hills, Calif., and Bernard Glaser of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Gail Glaser, to William B. Fritz, son of Marie Hurles of New York and John F. Fritz of Louisville, Ky. A wedding in the spring is planned.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Nightmare Role
description: Massachusetts new director of the Division of Fisheries and Wildlife, Matthew B. Connolly, seems confident that he will be able to surmount the bureaucratic difficulties so onerous to two of his predecessors that they resigned.

title: JOB SEEKERS BUY UP FEDERAL PLUM BOOK
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The bestiseller here in this, the first major transition of Presidential power in eight years, is a 139page yellow paperback listing 5,000 Federal jobs that Presidentelect Jimmy Carter may fill soon. Commonly called the plum book, the volume is officially named Policy and Supporting Positions and is available for purchase at the Government Printine Office for $2.90.

title: Deadlocked Rhodesia Parley in 4th Week With Major Issues on Transferring Power to Blacks Untouched
description: GENEVA,..Nov. 20In its fourth week since it opened on Oct. 28, the conference to decide the future of Rhodesia remains deadlocked and the substantive issues of the transfer of power from the white minority Government of Ian D. Smith to a black majority government have not even been broached.

title: Some Unanticipated Images of Istanbul
description: Since my first encounter with Edward Gibbon a couple of decades ago, my imagination has been cluttered with characters and scenes from the ups and downs of Rome and Byzantium. And so I arrived in the city of Constantine last month with visions of an empire declining into mere gorgeousness, of prodigous clashes between Muslim and Christian, of the sweet Ottoman decadence.

title: Title Volleyball Dec.
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Nov, 20 (AP)University of California, Los Angeles,the defending champion, and 23 other teams will participate in the national women's volleyball championships here Dec. 8 to 11. The other teams are Hawaii, Houston and the host team, the University of Texas.

title: Syrians Heading for Ports
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 20 (AP)Syri an military reinforcements in about 75 trucks and armored cars, towing 120millimeter mortars and antiaircraft guns, drove from the central Lebanese mountains today to the edge of the port of Tripoli, CO miles north of Beirut. There they poised for entry tomorrow morning into the longbesieged port city.

title: Wolverines Trounce Ohio State by 220 for Rose Berth
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 20The frustration finally ended for Michigan today with a convincing 220 victory over Ohio State.

title: COUNCIL DISTRICTING IS PLEDGED BY CUITE
description: Thomas J. Cuite, majority leader of the City Council, responding to pressure from several sources, said yesterday that the Council would act promptly to set up a nonpartisan commission to redraw district lines in time for the municipal election next November.

title: Card of Thanks
description: COHENThe family of Irving Callon wishes to thank all of his friends for their thoughtful expressions of sympathy.

title: Irish Beat Miami, Take Bowl Bid
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Nov. 20 (UPI)A substitute quarterback, Rusty Lisch, ran for two touchdowns and passed 42 yards to Dan Kelleher for another today as he led Notre Dame to a 4027 victory over Miami of Florida and kept victory over Miami of Florida.

title: Fashion Designers: Names You Should Watc
description: Julio Espada's first shop on Lexington Avenue was so successful that he moved to larger quarters on Madison, where he has attracted the likes of Pat Buckley, Nan Kempner and Jacqueline Onassis as customers.

title: The Mall the Merrier, or Is It?
description: THE modern shopping mall is the allinclusive center of our culture. Perhaps the only institution that has not yet invaded the mall is the funeral home. You can shop, worship, dine, be entertained, exercise and receive medical attention at your local downtown mall. The age of the neighborhood is gone. We now have clusters of housing developments ringing shopping centers, much as Old West wagon trains circled the campfires of old.

title: History in Verse, for Better or Worse
description: THE late Paul Bailey of Amityville was a former State Assemblyman, Suffolk County Historian, publisher of several Long Island weekly newspapers and founder and publisher of The Long Island Forum, a monthly magazine devoted to local history. He also had a talent for writing light verse, and was one of several poetasters who have celebrated the Island over the years.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: WHEN I annually visited Walt. Whitman's house at 330 Mickle Street in Camden in the late 1940's and early 1950's, it stood on a narrow, dusty street in a dingy neighborhood. Recently, when I returned, I found the twostory building unchanged, except for a recent coat of gray paint. But only one adjoining house was still standing, and the two houses faced a wide, busy boulevard instead of the back street the poet knew.

title: 2 Prison Sentences Delayed
description: SCRANTON, Pa., Nov. 20Two persons caught up in a Federal investigation of the harboring of four fugitives, including Patricia Hearst, had been scheduled to surrender here Monday to begin a prison term for contempt of court, but their incarceration was delayed yesterday by United States Supreme Court Justice William J. Brennan Jr.

Eating in America

title: Roddey Reid 3d, Student, To Wed Miss De Raedt
description: Martine De Raedt, daughter of Mr. And Mrs. Paul De Raedt of Bierges, Belgum, and Roddey Reid 3d, son of the Rev. and Mrs. Reid Jr. of Bronxville, N. Y.. plan to be married next month.

title: Mary Cahill Engaged To John Kinsella 3d
description: Mr. and Mrs. Thomas J. Cahill or Bethlehem. Pa.. have made known.the engagement of their daughter, Mary Elizabeth Cahill of New York, to John Joseph Kinsella 3d of Brooklyn. son of Mr. and Mrs. Kinsella Jr. of Holmdel, N.J.

title: What's Doing in HAITI
description: OVERVIEW  Haiti occupies the western third of the island of Hispaniola, the Dominican Republic the eastern twothirds. The intensely poor Haitians (the 1976 population was 5.2 million) have a per capita income of about $100 a year, an illiteracy rate exceeding 80 percent, few schools, fewer hospitals and few good paved roads. he signs of poverty are everywhere, except within the confines of the posh hotels that dot the island. Yet Haiti is exotic and fascinating, possessed of a rich culture, a tempestuous past and a smiling, friendly populace.

title: Cozza Reverses Field, Remains as Yale Coach
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 20Less than week after announcing that he was stepping down as head football coach to become the athletic director at Yale University, Carmen Cozza has changed his mind, He said today that he would continue his 12year coaching assignment with the team that he led to five Ivy League championships, including share of the title with Brown this year.

title: Saving a Preserve From a City Auction
description: IN its zeal to dispose of unwanted land and raise some revenue, New York Cityonce one of the biggest individual propertyowners on the Islandalmost sold an undeveloped tract that turned out to belong to Nassau County.

title: JAPAN WATCHING SEA T0 SIGHT NEW ISLES
description: TOKYO, Nov. 20  A patrol ship of Japan's Maritime Safety Agency sailed from here today to check underwater volcanos amid mounting territorial interest and concern here over the possible emergence of a new island or two in the Pacific.

title: Money Matters
description: The highest court in New York State has identified the joker in the stack of cards on which New York City's financial recovery plan is built, and thrown it out of the game. The socalled debt moratorium, the court said, was not the legal product of financial wizardry but simple and unconstitutional avoidance of the obvious: The city owed money to its noteholders and didn't pay it when it was due.

title: Veteran Seeking Damages for Bias
description: GEORGE NAPIER, a 62yearold pensioner from East Orange, will file an unusual complaint tomorrow in Federal District Court in Newark. Mr. Napier will charge that he has suffered irreversible psychic damage and incapacitating physical ailments as the result of being compelled to serve in an allblack Army infantry unit during World War Ff.

title: Will Glue Outlast Auden?
description: Like a lot of people, W.H. Auden grew curmudgeonly as he got old. His was not an extreme case, but still, the more he saw of the modern world, the less he liked it. He wrote a poem blaming Rudolf Diesel for carchoked cities, even though it wasn't really Diesel's doing, and he wrote another confessing that while he might pay taxes in 1969, the mental world he lived in was Edwardian,

title: Industry Mellows In South Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG  A few weeks ago, with smoke still rising from the riottorn streets of Soweto, one of South Africa's most, powerful businessmen was asked whether he thought there was a future for whites in South Africa. He smiled. The question never occurred to me, he said, leaning back in his chair in the private dining room of his corporate headquarters. I'm committed. I don't ask whether we'll get out of this fix I ask how.

title: Bias Found in Michigan Indian Area
description: SAULT STE. MARIE, Mich., Nov. 19 (AP)A civil rights report released today charges the City of Sault Ste. Marie with widespread discrimination against its InI dian residents and calls for a slate and Federal inquiry into alleged city misuse of millions of dollars in Federal funds.

title: Design
description: After several seasons of bright colors, largescale patterns and lots of batiks, the freshest fabrics for draperies and slipcovers show geometric Art Deco designs. Variations of the 1930's themes include dots, lines, squiggles and freeform repeat designs. There's scarcely a hardedged geometric to be seen. Colors are also Art Deco inspired: There are watery blues and greens, toneddown apricots, mauves and oranges, as well as deep, muted neutral tones such as plum, russet and burgundy.

title: Toms River South Prevails Behind Sica's Scoring Runs
description: Larry Sica scored two touchdowns yesterday to pace Toms River South to a 210 victory over Pemberton at Toms River, in the South Jersey Group 4 semifinals. It was South's eighth straight success after an openinggame tie.

title: Changing Houses an Act Of True DerringDo
description: The art of selling one house and buying another can be a tricky and risky juggling act. Particularly is this so if the sellerbuyer must use proceeds from the sale of the first house for the purchase of the new onethe usual situation. Each year thousands of homeowners go through the agonizing process.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP)As of Dec, 1, members of Congress and other highranking officials no longer will be able to avoid paying duty in America on goods purchased in foreign countries.

title: Second City Vying to e First in Finance
description: CHICAGOFor Robert A. Donahue, then a seasoned floor trader on the American Stock Exchange, 1 he decision to quit his native New York for Chicago was made on Columbus Day in 1973.

title: Catholics Contribute $5 Million to Wage A War on Hunger
description: Roman Catholics in the United States gave $5 million this year to combat hunger worldwide.

title: Japan Looks to Economic Parley
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Nov. 20 (AP)Prime Minister Takeo Miki said today that apan planned to propose an economic meeting in Tokyo of advanced Western industrialized nations shortly after Presidentelect Jimmy Carter takes office in January.

title: Levitt Cites Deficiencies In Coop City Agreement Ending Strike of Tenants
description: State Comptroller Arthur Levitt said yesterday that the compromise agreement. that settled the long Coop City tenant. strike last summer contained serious deficiencies because it did not require the huge, troubled. Bronx project to meet all its expenses and debts.

title: ART VIEW
description: The history of modern art in Europe can boast a great many odd characterseccentrics, misfits, madmen, compulsive fantasists, paranoids and outright cranks and impostorsbut even in this crowded roster of strange types, the Belgian painter James Ensor has a special place. It was as if fate, in Ensor's case, deliberately conspired to deprive him of the bearings that guide the rest of us through the normal course of things. Everything in his life climate, geography and family, his own temperament and the provincial culture that he could neither endure nor escapeguaranteed that his art, like his experience, would be like no one else's.

title: The Nation
description: Although two months remain before Jimmy Carter is inaugurated the attention normally focused on the Presidency has already begun to shift toward him and away from the man who will hold the office until Jan. 20. That shift is also normal for transition periods, but Mr. Carter has accentuated it by adopting a more Presidential style of activity than many of his predecessors as Presidentelect.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: The question of stimulating the economy is no longer whether but how. The chances of an immediate tax cut in the remaining days of the Ford Administration seem remote. Which leaves it up to Presidentelect jimmy Carter to have prepared, as of Jan. 20, a tax cut proposal that will not only be readily adopted but that can go into effect swiftly and painlessly.

title: CINY PUSHES CUOMO AS DEMOCRATIC CHIEF
description: But Cunningham Has Yet to Agree to Step Down as Head of Party Governor's Choice Has Doubts

title: English Humour
description: Foreign Shakespeare criticsand especially French onesare puzzled and even sometimes quite resentful at the intrusion of low farce into some of the tenser moments of the tragedies. The Porter scene in Macbeth is the most famous of these occasions, but a little story will reveal how Shakespeare does it again and again: the Fool's appearance with Lear in the storm on the heath; the Clown's arrival with the asps for Cleopatra's suicide. One elaborate explanation relies on the deliberate use of contrapuntal emotion and bathos to heighten tension and add an element of macabre unease. Perhaps these scenes have that effect on superhumorless French academic audiencesneither Racine nor Corneille has a single joke that I can remember but. an English audience usually roars with laughter. Mr. Priestley has

title: Dance: Sylvia Whitman's Humor
description: Tasks, such as hauling, tugging and the like, are austere sources of choreographic inspiration ordinarily, but Sylvia Whitman finds an odd humor in everyday chores. Her concert Friday evening at the Kitchen was a series of set pieces entitled Clear View that combined both advanced means and warm humanity. a rare combination.

title: The Cats
description: Like all Phipson's work, The Cats, is set in Australia and the country itself plays a major role. Jim and Willy, teenage brothers whose parents have just won a big lottery prize, are kidnapped by Socker and Kevin, two local coves. The boys are driven to an abandoned farmhouse in the far reaches of the outback where the relationship between criminal and victim begins to change.

title: Miss DuPom Gains Final
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 20 (UPI)Laura DuPont of the United States defeated Raquel Giscafre of Argentina, 60, 0.6, 63, today and reached the final of the Argentine open. Miss DuPont will face Argentina's Beatriz Araujo, who overpowered Janet Newberry of the United States, 60, 64, in the other semifinal.

title: KLARA ROTSCHILD
description: BUDAPEST, Nov. 20 (Reuters)Klara Rotschild, Eastern Europe's bestknown fashion designer, has died here under tragic circumstances, her family announced. The 74yearold designer, who built her reputation in Budapest and in Paris before World War II, ended her career by managing a slateowned couture salon here that was exceptional in the Soviet bloc.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Shahmak is the ancient Persian word for checkmate, as in chess, and one of the central characters in SHAHMAK by Alan Williams (Coward, McCann & Geoghegan, $8.95) is a chessplaying Arab potentate of incredible wealth and power who hires a Frenchman to arrange for histhe Ruler's death. That is a blockbuster right at the start. The Frenchman gets an excaptain of the British Army and an African soldier of fortune to work out the assassination. There is also the girlfriend of the captain; she too gets involved.

title: Inquiry Pressed on Tranquilizers at Bedford Hills Women's Prison

title: Christmas in That Other Town o Bethlehem
description: Whenever Christmas approaches, I think back to my mother's enchanting tales of the town where she was born 100 years ago. There were ambereyed deer in the forests, gypsy wagons with kettles and lanterns clanking on their doors, iridescent pheasant and sweetvoiced quail and tender doves. Bad children were told they would be spirited away by gypsies or bears, or gypsies and bears, the two traditionally

title: Ball State Wins, 523 Takes Conference Title
description: YPSILANTI, Mich., Nov. 20 (UPI)Art Yaroch passed for three touchdowns and ran for another today in leading Ball State to a 523 victory over Eastern Michigan for the MidAmerican Conference chamnionshin.

title: F.B.I. SECURITY CHIEF SEEN UNDER SCRUTINY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20James O. Ingram, head of the Federal Bureau of Investigation's reorganized domestic intelligence operation, is being investigated by Federal prosecutors who are looking into illegal bureau activities, according to authoritative sources.

title: FOOD
description: BSPORE bananas and oranges were shipped regularly from the tropics and when apples knew nothing of controlledatmosphere storage, the only fruits available out of season were dried or sugared. Raisins, currants, figs, dates and bits of candied fruit peel were rationed throughout the winter. Pieces of dried or candied fruit scattered through the dough of a sweet bread such as stollen were a festive luxury. The ultimate holiday delicacy was fruitcake, a dense amalgam of rich morsels bound together with a minimum of batter.

title: Lisa Sheble Is Married to James R. Bird Jr.
description: Lisa Newell Sheble, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Newell Sheble of Plainfield, N.J., was married in New York yesterday afternoon to James Raymond Bird Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Bird of Bay Head, N.J., The Rev. Thomas F. Pike performed the ceremony in the chapel of the Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest.

title: Italys Price Index Up Sharply
description: ROME, Nov. 20 (Reuters)Italy's con sumer price index rose by 3.4 percent in October, almost twice the 1.8 percent September increase, the Statistics Institute said last week. The rise, coming after a 19.9 percent increase in the past 12 months, was mainly due to a 25 percent increase in gasoline prices.

description: Col. Lawrence P. Flynn, of ihe National Guard and Mrs. Flynn of Peekskill, N.Y., have announced I.he engagement of their daughter, Barbara Ellen Flynn, to Cadet Jeffrey Lewis Yeaw of the United States Military Academy at West Point, N., Y. lie is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Lewis Yeaw of Newport, Vt.

title: Miss Guthrie Bride Of Ricardo Peixoto
description: Ariane Lansdale Yokana Guthrie, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lucien Davis Yokana of Princeton. N.J., and Biddeford Pool, Me., was married yesterday afternoon to Ricardo Chaves Peixoto. He is a son of Mauricio Matos Peixoto and the late Marina Chaves Peixoto of Rio de Janeiro.

description: The Fresh Air Fund has raised $820,000 in the first phase of its $2 million centennial campaign, it was announced yesterday by Fra1dr S. Streeter, president of the fund, aria Arthur Ochs Sulzberger, chairman of its centennial committee.

Adelphi University, Her liance is a student at the College of Physicians and Surgeons of Columbia University, where his father is on the faculty.

description: How many American writers have published firstrate imaginative books over a 30year period? Perhaps three, Henry James, Faulkner and now Bellow.

title: New Chinese Fallout Is Over U.S.; Little Immediate Danger Foreseen
description: A massive cloud of radioactive debris from another Chinese nuclear blast is drifting across the western United States and is expected to be over the East and Southeast today, the Environmental Protection Agency announced yesterday.

title: Descendant Buys Lafayette Sword
description: A gilded steel sword commissioned by Congress for the Marquis de Lafayette in 1779 for his Revolutionary War services to the United States was sold to a Lafayette descendant, Rene de Chambrun, of Paris, for $145,000 yestercay in an auction at the Sotheby Parke Bernet Galleries, 980 Madison Avenue. The sword was consigned by an anonymous French owner.

title: Planes in Beirut
description: The first civil airliners since last June landed at Beirut airport this weekend. Both symbolically and practically, the landings represented the nearest approach to normal conditions that the tortured city has seen in a long time.

Fagley performed the ceremony in the First Congregational Church in Chappaqua.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
Simplified Techniques for Patching Plaster Walls and Ceilings
description: Although most home handymen and handy women will not hesitate to tackle the job of patching minor cracks in plaster walls and ceilings, many are afraid to make large patches or repairs when leaks cause sections to fall out or decompose, or when alterations leave large openings that must be filled in. Yet, with a basic knowledge of the rather simple techniques involved, and using only one or two comparatively inexpensive tools that are readily available in all hardware stores, anyone capable of following the directions given here can do a satisfactory job of making patches in plaster walls and ceilings.

title: Aeros 5, Roadrunners 2
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 20 (AP) Houston scored all its goals in the second period and defeated Phoenix, 5.2, in a World Hockey Association game tonight. The victory was the 11th straight for the Aeros over the Road. runners. Larry Lund scored twice for Roust on.

title: Regents
description: When European educators visit American schools, the one feature that usually surprises them most is the extent to which education in the United States is a local operation.

title: Refugee Official in U.N. Says Governments Do Not Need Human Rights Commitments
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 20Prince Sadruddin Aga Khan, the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, has charged governments with paying little heed to the human rights pact they adopted as a basis for humanitarian laws.

title: Pensioners Found To Have Received A Billion Too Much

title: Demography
description: Sometime near the beginning of this decade, the rate of growth of world population peaked and began to slow. The primary reason for the reversal of a longstanding trend is that birth rates are falling impressively in nations with 40 percent of the world's population. A secondary, and more sobering reason, is a shortage of food that has led to rising death rates in the more densely populated, poorer countries. The consequence of these trends, at once encouraging and ominous, is that the longexpected doubling over the next generation of the world's current population of four billion is not likely to materialize.

title: Remember Me
description: The troubled and confused characters in Fay Weldon's new novel are Londoners of a fairly ordinary sort, and by the time they are through leaping over the obstacles and dealing with the bizarre problems Miss Weldon invents for them, they are bedraggled lot indeed. Rather like people in a breathless, ongoing comic opera, they speak to the reader directly, introducing themselves in the least imaginative of ways, defining themselves almost exclusively in terms of two or three other people.

title: Fur Rides High on Fashion

Rosenberg, who retired about eight years ago as president of the National Studios in Manhattan, producer of photographic and title slides for television, died Saturday in his home at 150 East 69th Street. A woman in the crowd drinking wine from a bottle in a paper sack said, Do something, you police.

title: Guess What's Happening to Baseball
description: Seventeen shopping days have passed since the market opened on baseball's new breed of freedmen, and almost every day has hrought fresh evidence of how little the men who own baseball know about their own business. Throughout this century, and even earlier, owners have insisted and perhaps believed that if players were allowed a voice in their own future it would be the end of the game as we know it. They have ??? the point with such doomfui persistence that the general public, most players, a large segment of the press, many members of Congress and even the Supreme Court of the United States accepted their prophecies as revealed truths. Through the agency of Andy Messersmilh, Dave McNally, Peter Seitz and two Federal courts, these arguments are being tested for the first time. Up to now, no single one of them has proved valid. There is excellent reason to believe that the men who own baseball have been talking through their hats all along.

title: How to Truss a Turkey
description: Make a gash two inches from the tail tip of the turkey and push the tail tip into the cavity. Truss cavity opening with string. Push legs forward and shove the needle through one leg at the point where the cavity and thigh meet. Push needle through cavity and bring it out the other side, going through opposite leg where cavity and thigh join.

title: King's Gamble Succeeds as Spain Takes a Step Toward Democracy
description: MADRID, Nov. 21King Juan Carlos,. and his handpicked Prime Minister, Adolfo Suarez Gonzalez, have won a gamble that many had predicted they would losebreaking with the Francoite past through the very institutions bequested to Spain by the dictator. Two words, starkly posed as opposites, have dominated political discourse since Franco died a year ago, rupture and reform. Cajoled, flatered and threatened, an overpowering majority of deputies in Parliament, many of them creatures of the old regime, voted Thursday for what amounts to a rupture with the past. With only minimal protest, Parliament Ivoted itself out of existence, to be replaced next year by what should be Spain's first democratically elected legislature since 1936.

From East 59th Street, say, to no farther north than 86th Street (actually, it begins to thin out after East 79th Street), the dinner party is ubiquitous. Women who are unmarried and otherwise unattached are ubiquitous, too. This is why the extra man is important. This is why hostesses were unhappy when Robert Goelet got married, He was the king of the extra men.

title: The Labor Scene
description: Lost, strayed or stolen: 1.3 million jobs. Two sets of employment figures, both based on identical samples taken in all 50 states and calculated under rules laid down by the Federal Bureau of Labor Statistics, have been getting so far apart in recent months that the difference now accounts for more jobs than there are in the whole .state of Connecticut or of Louisiana.

title: Books of The Times
description: JOHN KEEGAN is a senior lecturer in war studies at England's Royal Military Academy at Sandhurst. John Keegan, like most Europeans under the age of 45, has never been in a battle. So John Keegan has turned to military history to discover and convey to his students what being in a battle is really like. And, in so doing, he has discovered an interesting point. Most traditional military historians, don't tell very much about what being in a battle is really like. They tell who won. They puff up the winner or rationalize why the loser lost. They offer the perspective of the generals and staff officers. But they don't individualize the experience of the average man in the line. And so, Mr. Keegan concludes in The Face of Battle, what is needed is a new approach to military historyan inquisitional approach in place of an accusatorial one (to parallel the distinction between the French and English judicial systems); or one that seeks to inquire what exactly happened instead of pronouncing verdicts on the final outcome.

title: Chorizo Sausage
description: America is living in an age of unprecedented basics and Luxuries for the kitchen, catering to a nationwide involvement in cooking as a pleasure, a hobby to be ranked with other indoor sports. In that respect we are rank hobbyists and our chief new acquisitions are fantastic additions to a kitchen, already loaded wall to wall, storage drawer to storage drawer with worldwide gadgets ranging from an inexpensive $3 knife sharpener called ZipZap to, of course, the essential Cuisinart food processor.

title: Bergen Reenacts Washington's Retreat
description: HACKENSACK, Nov. 21Fifteenyearold Robin Miller of Lodi rode at a fast gallop up to the recreation of Fort Lee on a bluff of the Palisades overlooking the Hudson River.

title: Film: 'Rocky,' Pure 30's Make-Believe
description: NOT SINCE "The Great Gatsby" two years ago has any film come into town more absurdly oversold than "Rocky," the sentimental little slum movie that opened yesterday at the Cinema II. As a former head of Paramount Pictures said to me with some irritation at the time "Gatsby" came out, movies shouldn't be penalized for being effectively promoted. That's true. Yet the sort of highpowered publicity (most of it free, it seems) that's been attending the birth of "Rocky" must, in turn, subject the movie to impossible expectations that can boomerang. Be warned.Sylvester Stallone, who had a role in "The Lords of Flatbush," another "sleeper" that never quite measured up as a hit, both wrote the original screenplay and plays the title role. Rocky is a young man who, by day, is a small-time Mafia collector, the sort of fellow who shows his heart of gold by hesitating to break a client's thumbs, and at night pursues a third-rate boxing career in fleabag sporting arenas.Under the none too decisive direction of John G. Avildsen ("Joe," "Save the Tiger"), Mr. Stallone is all over "Rocky" to such an extent it begins to look like a vanity production. His brother composed one of the film's songs and appears briefly, as does his father, while his dog, a cheerful mastiff named Butkus, plays Rocky's dog. It's as if Mr. Stallone had studied the careers of Martin Scorcese and Francis Ford Coppola and then set out to copy the wrong things.The screenplay of "Rocky" is purest Hollywood make-believe of the 1930's, but there would be nothing wrong with that, had the film been executed with any verve.It's the story of Rocky and his girlfriend Adrian (Talia Shire), when Rocky, due to circumstances too foolish to go into, is granted the opportunity of his lifetime. He is given a chance to fight the heavyweight champion of the world, a black fighter named Apollo Creed (Carl Weathers), modeled on Muhammad Ali so superficially as to be an almost criminal waste of character. It's not good enough to be libelous, though by making the Alilike fighter such a dope, the film explores areas of latent racism that just may not be all that latent.That Mr. Weathers is no actor doesn't help things, though there are some very good actors in other supporting roles, and they don't help in any significant way. Burt Young is effective as Rocky's best friend, a beer-guzzling mug, as is Burgess Meredith as Rocky's ancient trainer.The person who comes off best is Miss Shire, Mr. Coppola's sister who made brief, effective appearances in the two "Godfather" films. She's a real actress, genuinely touching and funny as an incipient spinster who comes late to sexual life. She's so good, in fact, that she almost gives weight to Mr. Stallone's performance, which is the large hole in the center of the film.Mr. Stallone's Rocky is less a performance than an impersonation. It's all superficial mannerisms and movements, reminding me of Rodney Dangerfield doing a nightclub monologue. The speech patterns sound right and what he says is occasionally lifelike, but it's a studied routine, not a character.It's the sort of performance that could have been put together by watching other actors on television. Most of the film was photographed on location in seedy, Philadelphia neighborhoods, and it's one of the film's ironies that a production that has put such emphasis on realism should seem so fraudulent.The problem, I think, comes back to Mr. Stallone. Throughout the movie we are asked to believe that his Rocky is compassionate, interesting, even heroic, though the character we see is simply an unconvincing actor imitating a lug."Rocky," which has been rated PG ("parental guidance suggested"), contains some barroom language and a climactic boxing match that is effectively brutal.
