title: Music:
description: The Choros Woodwind Quintet; which first joined forces at Juilliard in 1974, made its New York debut. Saturday afternoon in Carnegie Recital Hall. The group chose a pleasantly offbeat program that included music by Danzi (Quintet, Op. 56, No. 2), Andrew Thomas (Twos Studies); Janacek (Mladi Suite), lientzon (Racconto, No. 5) and Milhaud (La Cheminee du Roi Rene).

title: Jack Anderson Selling Holdings After Role in Bank Is Questioned
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (UPI)  Columnist Jack Anderson said Sunday that he is divesting himself of most of his financial holdings because of questions about his role in a bank owned in part by backers of the South Korean evangelist, the Rev, Sun Myung Moon.

title: Ambitious Exhibition of California Art Aids San Francisco Museum
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 21The most ambitious exhibition of modern California painters and sculptors ever attempted has drawn 30,000 viewers to the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art and helped add 1,000 members to the museurn's membership rolls. The show, which closed this weekend, will open a fourmonth, East Coast run in Washington next spring.

title: Eastern Ky. Eleven in Playoff
description: RICHMOND, Ky., Nov. 21 (AP) Eastern Kentucky will play North Dakota State here next Saturday in an National Collegiate Athletic Association Division II football playoff. Both teams have 82 wonlost records. The winner of the game will be hostfor the Grantland Rice Bowl the following Saturday.

title: NOTES BY EXU.N. AIDE CITED IN FRAUD CASE
description: A professor of political science at Hunter College has pleaded guilty to concealing during a Federal investigation that, while he was a highranking official at the United Nations, he wrote false letters of recommendation that were used by a woman friend in an alleged fraud.

title: Private Lives
description: CALL him Eric. Or Dmitri, We have to call him something, and he has never been satisfied with his real name, which is like Bill or Pete or Tom, a thin name, almost a pronoun, all, edge, lacking a dimension, no muscle, no hair, no fat pads. Dmitri he associates with the calisthenics of the soul in 19thcentury Russian novels. Eric he associates with thpse sexy television commercials for Scandinavian cigars in the early 1960's. Eric sounds serious and sincere, while not being quite so gloomy as, say, Soren.

title: Radio
description: 7:308:55 WNYCFM. Fireworks Music, Handel; Chaconne, Bach; Flute Concerto, Graun; Danza Espagnola No. 5, Granados; Ballet Suite No. 3, Shostakovich.

title: Couple Says Their House Suffered $15,000 in Damages in Rental to ExGuatemalan Delegate to U.N.
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y.A professor and his who rented their Westchester county home to a former Guatemalan representative to the United Nations have charged that $15,000 worth of damage was done to the house and furniture and that restitution has not been made by his Government.

title: Niederhoffer Defeats Sharif Khan in Final
description: Victor Niederhoffer, the world's secondranked professional squash racquets player, upset topseeded Sharif Khan yesterday in the final of an $8,000 open squash tournament.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A man who reportedly had been arrested three times on homicide charges was shot and killed by a customer in Brooklyn grocery when he and an accomplice, who fled, allegedly attempted to rob the store. A 16yearold girl, Anita Dixon, who also was in the store at 1082 Dekalb Avenue in the Bedford Stuyvesant section, was wounded accidentally when the male customer, not identified, fired four shots from his pistol and then disappeared.

title: Insurgent Steel Union Candidate Urges U.S. Supervision of Vote
description: Ed Sadlowski, the insurgent candidate for president of the United Steelworkers of America, called on the Labor Department yesterday to step in and give full and complete supervision to the upcoming union election.

title: A SmallTown Tree Destined for Rockefeller Center
description: MONTCLAIR, Nov. 21A crane will pull up to the home of Florence and Edward Praisner tomorrow morning and will hold their majestic 65foot Norwegian spruce tree in place while workmen saw through its base.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A woman and three sons were killed in Edison yesterday when they tried to douse a kitchen fire and were trapped by smoke and flames. A fourth son escaped. Fire officials said Joseph Covert, 18 years old, was cooking at 3 A.M., when grease from a tippedover frying pan ignited papers and then a wooden cupboard, For several minutes, Joseph, his mother Gladys, 37, and his brothers Eric, 10, Chris, 12, and Scott, 15, tried to connect a garden hose to a faucet to spray water on the flames, but they were unsuccessful. Scott ran to a neighbor's house to call the Fire Department, but his mother and brothers sought refuge in a bedroom and were overcome by smoke.

title: Carter Makes Plea for Brotherhood at His Church
description: PLAINS, GA., Nov. 21Presidentelect Jimmy Carter, deeply involved in preparations for his new administration and a White House meeting tomorrow with President Ford, took time out this morning to plead with members of his church to resolve their differences over the desegregation of worship services.

title: KEY LEBANESE PORTS QUIETLY TAKEN OVER BY SYRIA'S TROOPS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 21The Syrian Army completed what is expected to be the final phase of its occupation operation in Lebanon today, meeting no resistance as it took control of Tripoli and Saida and the highways leading from Beirut to those two port cities on the Mediterannean.

title: Chess:
description: Because chess is to a great extent a subtle interweaving of options it is strange and surprising to see a strong player make an irrevocable commitment to a concrete line of attack in the early stage of a game. Telegraphing your signals to your opponent is usually a result of ignorance or bravado, but when it succeeds, it produces an awesome impression.

title: Shelley Newell Married To Michael L. Fishman
description: Shelley M. Newell, a technical consultant, was married yesterday to Michael L. Fishman, a lawyer with the Legal Aid Society of New York. The ceremony was performed at the Woodcrest Club in Syosset, L.I., by Rabbi Lawrence Colton of the Union Reform Temple in Freeport, L.I.

title: Darwin Aid Funds Called Misspent
description: DARWIN, Australia, Nov. 21 (Reuters) The Mayor of Darwin, the city in northern Australia devastated by a cyclone on Christmas Day 1974, said today that much of the $8.5 million raised internationally for the victims had been either gambled away or spent on drink.

title: Redskins Down Cards As Thomas Stars,1610
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 21Today was one of those On Any Given Sunday clays. The cliche is that on any given Sunday any team in the National Football League can beat any other team. The St. Louis Cardinals and Washington Redskins were made aware of that before the kickoff today when the result of the AtlantaDallas game was posted on the scoreboard. Somehow Atlanta had won.

title: The Leadership of Congress
description: The newly elected 95th Congress will have a more sweeping change in leadership than any previous Congress in this century. Mike Mansfield of Montana, the majority leader, and Hugh Scott of Pennsylvania, the minority leader, are retiring in the Senate, while Speaker Carl Albert of Oklahoma is retiring in the House. In both chambers, party whips are seeking the top leadership posts and, if unsuccessful, are unlikely to continue in their present jobs, thereby opening up those positions.

title: Faces Old and New
description: WASHINGTON  As Jimmy Carter considers his appointments, and Washington waits, there is much talk about the need for reassurance. To reassure the world, it is said, Mr. Carter should pick a known figure as Secretary of State. To reassure Wall Street, he needs a familiar face at the Treasury. To reassure labor, he should bring back a former Secretary.

title: Arthur Young Wins a Court Fight Against Charges in Geotek Case
description: A Federal judge has given Arthur Young & Company, one of the nation's largest accounting firms, a clearcut victory in its 3year defense of its ??? work against Federal charges of fraud involving Geotek Resources Fund Inc., a speculative oil and gas drilling venture.

title: Fairlie Defeats Ruffels
description: MANILA, Nov. 21 (UPO)Bridn Fairlie of New Zealand struggled to beat Ray Ruffels of Australia, 75, 67, 76, today in a grueling 3hour18minute match and won the Philippine Grand Prix tennis tournament.

title: Arts in America
description: In Washington people talk rather fast and walk rather slowly. As in New York, the sidewalks fill up with a morning crowd of pedestrians, but Washingtonians look as if they'd had eggs for breakfast. Maybe it slows them down.

title: Doctors Query Bypass Surgery As Aid to Heart
description: MIAMI BEACH  More than 60,000 Americans will undergo a costly, controversial openheart operation this year to bypass coronary arteries that are clogged by the country's most common lifethreatening disease, arteriosclerosis.

title: Trail Blazers 121, Braves 98
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Nov. 21 (AP)Dave Twardzik led a balanced Portland attack with I??? pints today as the Trail Blazers defeated the Buffalo Braves, 12198.

title: Mrs. Abraham H. Lass, 68; Assisted Husband in Work On His Educational Books
description: Mrs. Abraham H. Lass, who had assisted. her husband, the educator and writer, in his work on a score of educational books, died of a heart attack Saturday in her doctor's office in Brooklyn. She was 68 years old and lived at 1384 East 10th Street in the Flatbush section.

title: NEW 8INCII NAVY GUN TERMED INACCURATE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21The Navy is proposing to spend more than $700 million producing a new eightinch gun that the General Accounting Office contends is so inaccurate at longer ranges that it would use up all its ammunition before hitting a target.

title: China Is Linking Gang of 4 To Its Economic Troubles
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 21Months before Chiang Ching and three other disgraced members of the Politburo were arrested on charges, among others, that they had sabotaged industrial production the Chinese press was inveighing against certain class enemies who engage in sabotage and heating, smashing and looting. While it was difficult to judge exactly what was involved, American businessmen who import textiles from China got some hint of the problem recently when they discovered that garments, most of them from Shanghai, were arriving with peculiar faults. In some cases a white blouse had one green button, in another case a shirt had holes; in still another, packages of $60 silk shirts were perfect except for ink spots, some on the collar, some on the front.

title: AvantGarde: Max Neuhaus And His 32 Loudspeakers
description: MAX NEUHAUS'S ROUND: Sounds for Concave Surfaces was a sound installation in the rotunda of the old United States Customs House on Bowling Green this weekend. It was designed to make an attractive musical statement at the same time that it was calling attention to the building itself. To judge from the crowdsunusually large and heterogeneous for an avantgarde musical eventit succeeded in both tasks admirably.

title: Big Board's Short Interest Increases in Month
description: Short interest on the New York Stock Exchange in the month ended Nov. 15 rose 1,585,544 shares to 24,777,197 shares, the Big Board reported over the weekend. This was the highest since last May 15 when the short interest was 24,837,458 shares. The short interest is now equal to onetenth of 1 percent of the total shares listed on the exchange.

title: The Charlotte Russe? It Survives
description: The Charlotte Russe, that venerable New York specialty that left generations of city kids with white mustaches on their faces, is not extinct hut, like ancient Chinese jade, it is hard to come by.

Miss Evert beat Renata Tomanova, Czechoslovakia's No. 1 player, 60, 62, in a match that lasted only 38 minutes. Sue Barker of Britain beat Francoise Durr, 64, 75.

title: Senator Finds Fear at Camp for Rhodesian Refugees

title: Should Mankind Hide?
description: An extraordinary warning has come from Sir Martin Ryle, Britain's Astronomer Royal and Nobel laureate physics. Sir Martin is worried that some of his fellow scientists may give away the fact that the human race exists to alien intelligences elsewhere in the cosmos.

title: FREDERICK DVONGH, 64, A BROADWAY CONDUCTOR
description: Frederick Dvonch, violinist, music director for many productions and a conductor for Broadway shows, died of a stroke last. Thursday night while being taken to Polyclinic Hospital. He was stricken at the Imperial Theater, where he was assistant conductor of the musical Pippin. He was 64 years old and lived in Rego Park Queens.

title: Final Race Of Season To Pearson
description: ONTARIO, Calif., Nov. 21 (AP)David Pearson kept a steady pace while his closest competitors dropped out one by one, and the Spartanburg, S.C:, driver brought his Mercury home a lap ahead of Lennie Pond today and won the $185,000 Los Angeles Times 500, the season finale of NASCAR Grand National stock car racing.

The Syrians, acting as the Arab peacekeeping force, now dominate Lebanon exceptfor a strip along the Israeli border. [Page AI, Column 3.]

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SILVER AND GOLD From the bar of the Barclay Hotel's restaurant the other evening, the face of the woman pianist in the corner somehow matched her playing. The features were pleasant, the smile as becoming as her short silver hair. And so was Joan Bishop's keyboard style, harmoniously darting from show tunes to old ballads and classical numbers. The harmony, around 8 o'clock, was a fringe supplement to dominant conversation by table diners in this attractive room. You can hear the music better later.

title: Dealers Feel Court Ruling. Won't Upset Bond Market
description: If the predictions of bond dealers are accurate, the Court of Appeals decision that the Moratorium Act of New York State is unconstitutional will have no disastrous impact on the municipal bond market.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: Lyn Revson and Mollie Parnis already have them, and whole bunch of other fashionables are awaiting. What's the newest thing intriguing all these people who love newest things? It's a new kind of potpourri, with a stilllife effect of whole flowers rather than the traditional flower petals. The potpourri is made by Winnie Fuerbringer, who has a garden, meadows and greenhouse at High Pine Farm in Greenwich. She uses her favOrite flowersamong them roses, delphinium, hollyhocks, marigolds, peonies, pansies and dahliaspounds of spices, pine chips, lots of citrus peel and sandalwood chips and oilS. The floWers are dried in silica gel, which looks salt and is powdered over the blossoms when they are at their peak. The arrangeffients are put in baskets of various sizes to sell for $12.50. $18.50. The fashionables are buying theirs in huge baskets, each containing four or five of the smaller baskets. These go for $75 to $150. The whole lot is in Home Accessories the 7th floor at Bonwit Teller.

title: Independence Referendum Promised by Quebec Leader
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 21Ren Lvesque says that the new provincial government he will establish in Quebec next Thursday will respect its commitment to govern within the present federal structure, but that it does not expect Canada to oppose by force any majority will for the independence of the province.

title: Music: Clues In Rarities
description: David Edward Collins, a violinist who was formerly assistant concertmaster of the Milwaukee Symphony, and John Gates, a pianist on the faculty of Indiana Central University, have separately revealed their predilection for unusual programming. Mr. Gates made his debut in 1966 with sonatas by Dukas, Dussek and Sarabji; Mr. Collins celebrated the Ives centennial two years ago by playing all four of the violin sonatas at the same concert.

title: Personal Health
description: Impotence, the inability to achieve or sustain an erection, is a far more common problem than most into realize. An estimated 10 percent of men are impotent all the time and as many as 50 percent have potency difficulties some of the time.

title: Pupils Poor in Spanish Helped in Puerto Rico
description: SANTURCE, P. R.  Edward McKay Colon, who is 15 years old, was in the ninth grade at Brooklyn Technical High School when sudden family problems took him from his home in Corona, Queens, back to the island of his mother's birth, He knew a little Spanish from home but was not really fluent in the language, and soon he felt lost in his new surroundings.

title: Notes on People
description: Broadway had 70 theaters, from Herald Square to Columbus Circle when Nat Dorfman began his career as a theatrical press agent in 1920. He was a graduate of Townsend Harris High School and still a student at Columbia University. Mr. Dorfman has gradually given up his Broadway assignments during the 17 years he has been publicity director for the New York City Opera. And now he will retire from that, too, when his contract ends May 29.

description: ALGIERS, Nov. 21 (Agencc FrancePresse)Luis de Almeida Cabral, head of state of GuineaBissau, arrived here today for talks with President Houari Boumediene of Algeria. Mr. Cabral arrived here after a fourday visit to Cairo and was to discuss general issues with President Boumediene.

description: LONDON, Nov.21 (AP)The Rev. Martin Cyril D'Arcy, a leading Jesuit philosopher who converted a number of famous people to Roman Catholicism, has died. A JeSuit spokesman said the 88yearoid priest died Saturday night.

He was 72 years old and lived in Sarasota, Fla., where he had moved when he retired 10 years ago.

description: Six conservatively dressed and courtly robbers herded 24 guests and five employees of the Regency Hotel on Park Avenue into a lounge yesterday morning sand punched out the locks of 41 safedeposit boxes, stealing many thousands of dollars in cash, jewelry and other valuables.

title: Living Abroad: Paris
description: F renchmen have changed their way of eating. A recent study by Dr. Henri Dupin pointed out that during the Revolution, the people cried for Bread and freedom. By 1936, the year of Popular Front upheavals, the slogan was Steak and paid vacations.

title: KEY LEBANESE PORTS QUIETLY TAKEN OVER BY SYRIA'S TROOPS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 21The Syrian Army completed what is expected to be the final phase of its occupation operation in Lebanon today, meeting no resistance as it took control of Tripoli and Saida and the highways leading from Beirut to those two port cities on the Mediterannean.

title: Meriden's Publisher and Its Mayor Exchange Insults
description: MERIDEN, Conn.  To Carter H. White, the publisher of this city's principal newspapers, Mayor Abraham G. Grossman is a tyrant and a buffoon, who drinks on the job, holds secret meetings and perpetrates sinister transgressions and illegalities at City Hall.

title: Janice Weinman Bride of Stuart Shorenstein
description: Janice Jennie Weinman, assistant director of the State Temporary Commission on the Future of PostSecondary Education, was married yesterday to Stuart Alan Shorenstein of New York, a lawyer with Fly, Shuebruk, Blume, Gaguine, Boros & Schulkind. Rabbi Joseph Sternstein performed the ceremony in Temple Beth Shalom in Roslyn, L.I.

title: The Spectacular, AllTogether Phoebe
description: Phoebe Snow, who will be singing at Carnegie Hall one week from tonight, was back at her parents home in Teaneck, N. J., last week with a case of the flu. Because of the illness, she had to cancel several concerts in the middle of her first tour in over a year, but such calamities ai e nothing new to Miss Snow. Her relatively brief career as a nationally known pop ginger has already included an abrupt change of record labels and managers, with attendant lawsuits, and the premature birth almost a year ago of a daughter, Valerie Rose, who has required extensive hospitalization. It has also included three albums that synthesize blues, soul, jazz, and middleofthe road pop influences in a strikingly mature manner, and Miss Snow is still only 25 years old. She stands alone among the singersongwriters of her generation because of this eclecticism, and because of her spectacular musicality.

title: TownGown Relations Are Frayed As University Grows in Stony Brook
description: Around here still sport bumper stickers that read, Stony Brook, Campus and Community. To the giant university center here, it's a plea for cooperation and acceptance, but to some stubborn residents of this quiet suburban community, it's just wishful thinking.

title: TheVoice of Food
description: LAST THOUGHTS Of A TURKEY

title: Dickran Atamian: Gifted, Unorthodox Piano Energy
description: DICKRAN ATAMIAN, winner of the 1975 Naumburg Piano Competition, gave an extremely wellreceived debut recital last February. Saturday night the21yearold pianist returned to Tully Hall, reinforcing the impression that he is not only unusually gifted, but is also a very individual musical personality.

title: Six Hold Up Regency Hotel
description: Six conservatively dressed and courtly robbers herded 24 guests and five employees of the Regency Hotel on Park Avenue into a lounge yesterday morning hand punched out the locks of 41 safekleposit boxes, stealing many thousands of dollars in cash, jewelry and other valuables.

title: Golden Gate Bridge Helps to Pay for Public Transit
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 21The Golden Gate Bridge, recognized nationally as a symbol of the supposedly sybaritic life of this city, is gradually gaining a more mundane identification locally.

title: Help for Late Birds
description: New York is filled with people who lives are so busy that is entirely possible that there is someone around who has invited a dozen people to diner on Thursday and had time to do nothing more than elan to buy a turkey.

title: Money Is Outpacing British Supply Goal
description: LONDON, Monday, Nov. 22 (Reuters) Britain's domestic money supply, a key factor in the nation's battle with inflation, is still rising higher than the target set by the Labor Government, the Bank of England disclosed today.

title: Fog on Coast Cancels Flights
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 21 (UPI)Heavy fog caused cancellation of scheduled takeoffs and landings at Los Angeles International Airport this morning for alidut two hours. Incoming flights were rerouted between 5:30 A.M. and 7:30 A.M. to inland airports at Ontario and HollywoodBurbank.

title: CARTER TAX PROGRAM IS FACING OBSTACLES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's hope of being able to work out, in advance, with key members of Congress his expected emergency antirecession tax program may run afoul of some complicated internal Congressional politics and other problems.

description: Horses listed in order of Posl posilions Letter designates OTB listing.

title: Jacob's Gift to French Cooking
description: Chefs, like other men, amuse themselves, and the man who gave lentil soup the name that has appeared on French menus for generations must have been pleasantly amused. It is potage Esau (pronounced Azeahue in French). An obvious name, and there is a bit of sophistication in its naivele.

title: Jazz 97, Cavaliers 92
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 21 (UPI)Pete Nlaravich scored 41 points, 10 of them during a threeminute stretch in the third quarter, to pace the New Orleans Jazz to a 9792 triumph tonight over the Cleveland Cavaliers. Maravich had 15 points in the first half, then scored 16 of his team's 23 points in the third quarter.

title: Advertising
description: Back in 1948 Nestle introduced its Quik milk additive in the United States, where Ovaltine was the dominant product. Top Ovaltine management in Switzerland immediately tagged it as a loser. But today Quik has a 64 percent share of the $110 million market.

title: Now, the Oil
description: MILWAUKEEOne of the unhappy realities that Jimmy Carter must soon face is that his election has not put an end to his need for extensive political campaigning. He must now persuade the American people to support his programs.

title: Ailing Connors Beats Tanner In 3Set Final
description: WEMBLEY, England, Nov. 21 (AP}Jimmy Connors, playing with a bad back and a twisted ankle, beat Roscoe Tanner, 36, 7.6, 64, today in the final of tht! $125,000 international lennis tournament aL Wembley Empire Pool.

title: 5440 and No Fight
description: WASHINGTONAt a small reception following a State Dinner in Paris in February, 1969, I found myself standing next to President Charles de Gaulle. Anxious to appear knowledgeable in world affairs, I mumbled something about how he had really stirred Canadians up a couple of years before with his cry of vive le Quebec Libre to a crowd in Montreal.

title: Prisoner Holds a Hostage 9 Hours
description: WOODBRIDGE, Nov. 21 (AP)A state prison inmate who held a woman hostage for nine hours says he did it to get publicity for his grievances and never intended to hurt the woman.

title: Tide Is Turning Against Greek Magnates As Athens Expands Its Economic Control
description: ATHENS, Nov. 21  Several of Greece's wealthiest and bestknown tycoons are in the news these days, and the news is almost all had.

title: Canadiens Rout Leafs
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 21 (UPI)  Steve Shutt had his second three goal game of the season today as the Montreal Canadiens routed the Toronto Maple Leafs, 95.

title: Intensive Campaign Draws Many To Vasectomy Clinics in India
description: CHITLAPAKKAM, IndiaAfter giving it a good deal of thought, Chinnasamy Narayanan presented himself at the oneroom yellow concrete dispensary here to have a vasectomy.

title: When Home Is One Room
description: Lots of New Yorkers do, by choice or necessity, when they decide to live in a single room.

title: Newsprint Prices Are Mounting Although Demand Grows Weaker
description: In many industries rising prices usually Indicate continued good demand for their products.

title: Morris Eisenstein, Doctor Who Made Headlines, is Dead
description: Dr. Morris r. Eisenstein, a retired obstetrician and gynecologist who made headlines 10 years agn when he told a state legislator about conditions in Harlem, where he was an associate attending physcian, died Thursday in Lawrence Memorial Hospital in New London, Conn. He was 70 years old.

title: Curbed U.S. Tour of Europe Ending
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 21A commission of the United States Congress, checking progress toward relaxation of tensions in Europe, is ending its tour of Europe after having been barred from all Communistruled countries except Yugoslavia.

title: CARTER TAX PROGRAM IS FACING OBSTACLES

title: Deborah A. Schesch Wed to D.L. Wernick
description: Deborah Arndrea Schesch, daughter of Elizabeth Yassin Schesch of Paramus, N.J., and the late Carl Jacob Schesch, was married yesterday afternoon to David Louis Wernic.k, son of Mr. and Mrs. Hyman Wernick of Holyoke, Mass. Rabbi Isaac Swift performed the Orthodox ceremony in Temple Ahavath Torah in Englewood, N.J.

title: But SomeDoubts Linger From Early in Year
description: Although store sales have wavered in recent months, retailers across the country expect record Christmas business. They believe the results of the 29day holiday shopping season will top the inflation rate sufficiently to sustain the quarter's normal high profits.

title: Dining Out on Thanksgiving: Wide Choice of Restaurants
description: Considering all of the planning, shopping, cooking, serving and cleaning up involved in producing a Thanksgiving dinner at home, it's small wonder that this holiday is the second biggest day of the year for restaurants, exceeded only by Mother's Day.

title: Fire Levels New Orleans Prison
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 21 (AP)A fire destroyed the psychiatric building of a minimum security prison in a New Orleans residential area late last night, causing heavy damage but no injuries. Guards evacuated 44 inmates as flames spread through the onestory frame structure. Firemen cut prison fences to string hoses to the building, and guards stood at each hole while the police watched nearby with shotguns.

title: Miss Heilbrunn Is Bride Of Jeffrey Ruthizer on L.I.
description: Monica Emily Heilbrunn, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Fred R. Heilbrunn of Rego Park, Queens, was married yesterday to Jeffrey Ruthizer of New York, a vice president in charge of labor relations for RKO General Inc.

title: Cyclone Kills 29 in India
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 21 (Reuters)At least 29 people have died in the second cyclone this month to hit the state of Andhra Pradesh on India's east coast, the press agency Sdmachar reported last night. Earlier this month, a cyclone in the Machilipatnam area further north left 25 dead.

title: Jets Todd Also VictimTwiceof Patriots
description: We killed them Strange words from Ed Galigher, the defensive tackle, whose team, the Jets, lost by 3824 yesterday to the New England Patriots.

title: Plains Residents Fill Inauguration Train
description: PLAINS, Ga., Nov. 21 (AP)On Jan. 19 an Amtrak passenger train will pull into this town's 19th century railroad station for the first time in decades and 396 residents of Plains and Sumter County will climb aboard for an18hour trip.

title: Personal Finance: Aid For Retirement Plans
description: HOUSEWIFERY has never been long on fringe benefitsa potted plant on Mother's Day, maybe, and a couple of weeks off in August if there is some place to park the children.

title: The Big Wrap Up To Keep the Chill Out
description: Women have the whattowcaron.abriskday problem all wrapped up. They're tossing on ponchos, capes, hooded burnooses, serapes, blanketlike shawls. All the garments that have traditionally kept out the cold since biblical times are on the city streets. And with all the blessings of the fashion makersyou don't have to be ethnic to love looking like a market woman; it's the in thing.

title: Monsanto Hopes for 4 to 5% Growth in 77 Economy
description: A projected 4 to 5 percent real growth rate for the United States economy next year is about right for business, John W. Hanley, chairman and chief executive of the Monsanto Company, said here recently in an interview.

title: CARTER AND SIMON WILL DISCUSS CRISIS IN CITY FISCAL PLAN
description: Mayor Beame said yesterday that Presidentelect Jimmy Carter had promised to discuss New York City's revived fiscal crisisthe courtordered obligation, to repay $1 billion in shortterm debtat his meeting today with Treasury Secretary William E. Simon.

title: Queens Factory Blast Injures 45; Burn Hospitals Capacity Exceeded
description: A powerful explosion ripped through a Queens chewinggum factory early yesterday, injuring more than 45 workers, including about two dozen with burns so severe that the city's capacity to care for them was exceeded and a major evacuation to hospitals outside the state was necessary.

description: QI am planning to roast my first turkey this Thanksgiving. There will be about 20 guests for dinner, and i wonder, what size turkey will need and instructions for roasting it. The turkey will he stuffed.

description: Unilever Ltd. (British), which is linked with Unilever N. V. (Dutch) and run as one company, posted the biggest percentage gain of any issue on the New York Stock Exchange last Wednesday and Wall Street merely yawned.

description: A 22foottall, 30footlong bug with a red head, yellow eyes, ears, tongue and legs (six) and a blue and green body went for a walk in Central Park yesterday to the delight of several hundred spectators.

Doctors Query Bypass Surgery As Aid to Heart
description: MIAMI BEACH  More than 60,000 Americans will undergo a costly, controversial openheart operation this year to bypass coronary arteries that are clogged by the country's most common lifethreatening disease, arteriosclerosis.

description: The disconcerting strength gathered by sepratism Canada contains a relevant lesson for the United States and its approach to ??? education. While language is by no means the only factor in caindian discord, there can he no question that the linguistic division between French and Englishspeaking Canadians has severely intensified their other differences.

title: A Mother Church for Catholics Celebrates 150th Year in Newark
description: NEWARK, Nov. 21Two Archbishops, a Bishop, a Governor and a United States Representative today helped celebrate the 150th anniversary of Little St. John's downtown Newark, the mother church of Roman Catholicism in New Jersey.

title: Colts Win By Blocking Extra Point
description: MIAMI, Nov. 22 (AP)Bert Rules burned the Miami Dolphins with his passing, including a 25yard touchdown toss to Raymond Chester, and Mike Barnes blocked a critical extrapoint attempt, leading the Baltimore Colts to a 1116 victory over the Dolphinsin the National Football League tonight.

title: 2 Magazines Say Soviet Lasers Destroyed a U.S. Space Satellite
description: The Soviet Union has used laser beams to destroy an American space satellite and damage another, two national magazines report.

title: Fortunes of Jackson and Grich, ExTeammates, Are Still Linked
description: Reggie Jackson and Bobby Grich, who this year worked for and as free agents left the Baltimore Orioles, found yesterday that their fortunesfinancial and otherwisecontinued to be linked.

title: Nonfatal Case of Swine Flu is Confirmed in Missouri
description: Missouri and Federal scientists have confirmed a case of swine influenza in Concordia, that slate's epidemiologist said last night. The case, which involved a 32yearold telephone lineman who has recovered, is believed to be the first since the virus was discovered last February at Fort Dix. N.J.

title: Chamber of Commerce is Shifting Emphasis to a More Activist Role
description: The New York Chamber of Commerce and Industry in a major expansion of its traditional role, announced yesterday that it would become more of an activist in attracting new industry to New York City and retaining companies already operating in the city.

title: GOVERNOR AND MAYOR SAY PLEA FOR U.S. AID WILL BE LAST RESORT
description: Governor Carey and Mayor Beanie yesterday ruled out appealing to the Federal Government, except as an absolute last resort, for assistance in raising $1 billion to pay New York City's shortterm noteholders.

title: Chamber Expanding Role
description: The New York Chamber of Commerce, expanding its traditional role, plans a more activist course, seeking new industry while retaining companies now operating in the city Page 45.

title: If Hot Dogs Won't Do
description: What's the big deal just a pushcart selling soup and hard rolls? asked Morris Shooer, a passerby who yesterday noticed a lunchhour mob huddled around the green and white polkadot umbrellashaded food wagon.

title: Bridge:
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 22Two young experts from the Washington area headed into the final session of the life master men's pair championship at the American Contract Bridge League's fall nationals here tonight with an excellent chance of regaining a title they held in 1972. Kit Woolsey of Arlington, Va., and Steve Robinson of Alexandria, Va., led the field of 112 pairs by about 1 boards and were strongly favored to win.

title: Austria Puzzled by Suicide Rate Amid Affluence and the Good Life
description: VIENNA, Nov. 22A surge in the number of Austrians who die by their own hand has underlined the question why this prosperous country has the highest suicide rate in the West.

title: RUPERT DAVIES, 59, DIES; KNOWN FOR MAIGRET ROLE
description: LONDON, Nov. 22 (AP)Rupert Davies, who won prominence for his portrayals of Maigret, the pipe smoking French detective created by Georges Simenon, died today of cancer. He was 59 years old.

title: Texasgulf Discloses $109,000 in Payments
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22Texasgulf Inc. made commission payments of $109,000 to an agent who may have passed on snow of the money to an unidentified foreign government or its dominant political party, according to an amendment to a Texasgulf registration statement made available at the Securities and Exchange Commission today.

title: Failure of Giants ExtraPoint Try Not Line's Fault: Kick Was Too L,ow
description: When the Giant players report back to work today, eight won't.

title: Another Carter Trial Witness Says He Saw Bullet and Shotgun Shell
description: PATERSON, N.J., Nov. 22A second witness testified today that he had seen two key bits of evidence in the triple murders at the Lafayette Grill in 1966a live bullet and a shotgun shell allegedly taken from the car in which Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis were riding when they were arrested.

title: Thomas E. Mullaney
description: COATESVILLE, Pa.  Most of the corn planted on the rolling farmland around this region in eastern Pennsylvania still stands in the fields, drying on its stalks and imparting a golden glow to the countryside at this Thanksgiving season. But the serer The ity of the view masks mounting problems at some Economic of the small steel companies Scene in the surrounding area. Communities within a 25mlie radius of this small town constituted an important center of ironmakmg before the Revolutionary War, and they subsequently became a significant source of steel manufacturingenough to give this part of the Keystone state the label, Pittsburgh of the East. That title is no longer appropriate in view of the somewhat diminished role that steelmaking has occupied in recent years in this area.

title: World News Briefs
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, Nov. 22The Gover??? forbade all demonstrations on public highways today and threatened to arrest students found outside schools and universities during working hours. The actions were interpreted as a move anticipating an islandwide strike called for Friday to protest the killing of a university student and the wounding of over 50 others by the police 10 days ago.

title: Sports Today
description: Knicks vs. Kansas City Kings, at Madison Square Garden, Eighth Avenue and 33d

title: Kohl, Assailing Strauss's Party, Tells of Plan for Rival Bavaria Unit
description: BONN, Nov. 22Seven weeks ago the opposition leader, Helmut Kohl, came within a percentage point of defeating Chancellor Helmut Schmidt in the West German national elections.

title: Study Finds Many lndians Sterilized by U.S. Agency Without Full Explanation
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (AP)The Indian Health Service sterilized more than 3,400 Indians during a fouryear period, often apparently without telling them such operations were not mandatory, the General Accounting Office said today.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: BOB REID PLAYS SECTIONS OF AFRICA IS CALLING ME
description: Bob Reid describes his Africa is Calling Me as a modernday black opera, and although a fullscale version has not been seen in New York, he has been performing excerpts with his jazz group, the Emergency Sound. A recorded versionof music from the opera's Paris production has been released on Kwela records, but the performance Mr. Reid offered on Sunday at Jazzmania was more satisfying.

title: Fireman Dies After Amputation
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 22 (AP)  One leg of Walter Watroba, a fireman trapped under a collapsed beam, was amputated in a vain attempt to save him last night during a spectacular fire at a Commonwealth Edison generating plant. Officials said that thousands of homes had been left without power and that damage would run into millions of dollars. Mr. Watroba remained conscious throughout, much of the ordeal but was pronounced dead on arrival at Mercy Hospital.

title: Andean Arms Race
description: Three recent developments in Peru provide a dismal commentary on a problem that afflicts many developing countries and that should command urgent attention from the Carter Administration  especially in the Americas.

title: Shlockton Greets You
description: The last time I went to St. Louis, I found that I wasn't in St. Louis at all. I was in a place called Clayton, Len miles from downtown St. Louis, and it seemed that a considerable part of downtown St. Louis was there too.

title: PGA Plans to Construct $15 Million Headquarters
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Nov. 22 (AP) The Professional Golfers Association announced today it had signed ah agreement for construction of a new national administrative headquartets; including three golf courses.

title: Louis Camu, 71, Banker in Belgium World War II Resistance Leader
description: Louis Camu, former chairman of the Banque de Bruxelles in Belgium, died Nov. 12 at his home in Alost, near Brussels. He was 71 years old.

title: Flood Victims in Java Put at 136
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Nov. 22 (Reuters) The death toll in floods that have devastated parts of Java has risen to 136, and weather experts have warned that there may be more torrential rain. In eastern Java, guards have been posted to warn villagers at night of new floods rind landslides. At least 14,500 people have been evacuated to safer areas.

title: Einstein on the Beach Transforms Boredom Into Memorable Theater
description: Singularity is possibly an overrated quality in the arts. Hamlet on a bicycle could have its idiot charms, yet would do little for Shakespeare, except possibly to point out the difference between text and context. The avantgarde always runs the risk of the ridiculous the peril of the irrelevant.

title: GOVERNOR AND MAYOR SAY PLEA FOR U.S. AID WILL BE LAST RESORT
description: Governor Carey and Mayor Beame yesterday ruled out appealing to the Federal Government, except as an absolute last resort, for assistance in raising $1 billion to pay New York City's shortterm noteholders.

title: Notes on People
description: I owe everything to the French, said Henry Miller, the novelist who has just been made a member of the French Legion of Honor. Mr. Miller, whose books with detailed sex were published in France before such details were accepted in the United States, said in Los Angeles, am more close to France than America even though lived there only 10 years, from 1929 to 1939. The author of, among other works, Tropic of Cancer and Tropic of Capricorn added, Those years in France meant everything to me and formed my whole career. of today's authors, Mr. Miller, who is 84 years old and has sight in only one eye, says, There is such junk writing today. It's horrible.

title: SALLIE EGLINTON SKYBERG
description: Sallie Eglinton Skyberg, a former antiques dealer in Spencertown, N.Y., died yesterday in a nursing home in Albany. She was 83 years old.

title: Article 2  No Title
Financiers Flock to Invest in Booming Capital of Alberta
description: EDMONTON, AlbertaA new breed of prospector has replaced the oldtime sourdoughs who once stopped here for supplies on their way to the Yukon gold fields.

title: A Killer Gets Chair But 2 Others Don't
description: A Brooklyn judge yesterday sentenced the convicted killer of a prison guard to die in the electric chair, while a judge in Manhattan dealt a 25yeartolife sentence to the confessed murderer of two policemen because of the prosecution's fear that the state's new deathpenalty law might he invalid.

title: Madras Region, Its Flavor Unique, Typifies India's Forces of Division
description: MADRAS, IndiaOn the airplanes that fly from this sweltering state capital to other parts of the southern state of Tamil Nadu, the flight attendants make announcements in English, India's colonial language, and in Hindi, the language of northern India, but never in Tamil, which is what almost all the people here speak.

title: Y.M.C.A. Branches Stress Social Activism
description: To generations of Americans, the Y.M.C.A. has meant a leisurely swim in a heated pool, a brisk game of basketball and a hustling week at summer camp. But that gym and swim image is rapidly being supplemented by a growing social awareness.

title: ExU.N. Aide Tells Jury He Had a Love Affair With Woman Defendant
description: A former United Nations official who teaches at Hunter College in New York City and at Princeton University testified yesterday at a criminal trial that he had been having a love affair with a woman when he wrote letters for her that she allegedly used in defrauding a bank and a businessman of $260,000.

title: Henry C. Wolfe, Writer, Dies at 78; Article Foresaw NaziSoviet Pact
description: Henry C. Wolfe, a retired foreignaffairs writer and lecturer who predicted the alliance between Nazi Germany and the Soviet Union before the outbreak of World War II, died Saturday at Doctors Hospital in Manhattan. He was 78 years old and lived at 205 West 57th Street.

title: MELVIN KERR WHITELEATHER
description: SWARTHMORE, Pa., Nov. 22 (AP)Melvin Kerr Whiteleather, former Associated Press foreign correspondent and foreign affairs analyst for The Philadelphia Bulletin, collapsed Sunday during morning worship services at a church here and was pronounced dead on arrival at a hospital. He was 73 years old.

title: Record Cranberry Crop Expected
description: BOSTON, Nov. 22 (AP)This year's national cranberry crop is estimated at a record 2.4 million barrels, the United States Department of Agriculture reported today. The expected harvest this year compares with 2.1 million barrels last year and 2.2 million barrels in 1974.

title: First National Bank of Chicago Follows Cut in Prime to 6%
description: Another general reduction in the rate at which banks lend to their key customers appeared to be shaping up yesterday when First National Bank of Chicago cut its prime rate from 61/2 percent to 6 percent.

title: City's Notes Climb; M.A.C. Bonds Rally
description: New York City notes jumped sharply in price yesterday in response to a ruling Friday by the New York State Court of Appeals that the threeyear moratorium on their repayment was unconstitutional.

title: Jamaica's Prime Minister Schedules A National Election for Next Month
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, Nov. 22This island, still under a state of emergency declared in June, will hold national elections on Dec. 15, just before the start of the winter tourist season.

title: Carter, in Visit to Ford, Raises Idea of a New Summit
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22Presidentelect Jimmy Carter called on President Ford at the White House today in the first meeting between the two men since the election and immediately raised the idea of another economic summit meeting with foreign leaders.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Fair Housing Council of Bergen County has received permission to continue a lawsuit against nine real estate brokers for allegedly manipulating the housing market by practicing a policy of racial steering. in United States District Court, Judge Herbert J. Stern refused to dismiss the council's suit against the brokers charged with showing black customers homes only in black or integrated neighborhoods and showing white customers homes only in white neighborhoods.

title: Recital: Diane Walsh, Fleet Pianist
description: Diane Walsh, whose recital on Saturday at the Metropolitan Museum hegan a series of Introductions to young artist, is an accomplished planist. Her fingers are fleet and accurate, and her range of touch and color is considerable. As an interpreter she is full of ideas and maintains a distinctive approach to the music.

title: Boe of Nets is Under Fire On Tickets, Two Loans
description: Roy Boe, the general partner of the Nets who has been beleaguered by fans since selling Julius Erving to the Philadelphia 76ers last month, got some more trouble yesterday from the National Basketball Association and the New York State attorney general.

title: Robbery Suspect Critically Wonded
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif.; Nov. 22 (UPI) A man wanted for a series of southern California restaurant robberies was shot and critically wounded last night by policemen while the suspect held nine coffee shop employees at gunpoint. The suspect, Edward Lee Krantz, 26 years old, of Orange, Calif was shot in the neck and was reported in critical condition at Riverside General Hospital.

title: A Decade Old, MilanModern Comes to Manhattan
description: To many enthusiasts of Italian design, Milanmodern has finally made it to Manhattan with the opening today of Ambienti.

title: Fluorocarbon Sprays Curb Backed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The Consumer Product Safety Commission granted today an environmentalist group's petition to begin regulatory action against fluorocarbon propellants in spray cans on the ground that these gases endanger the planetary ozone layer.

title: Volkswagen Studies Possibility Of Assembling Its Autos in Iran
description: WOLFSBURG, West Germany, Nov. 221 (UPI)Volkswagenwerke A.G. said today that it was exploring possibilities for the assembling of automobiles under license in Iran.

title: New York's Medicaid Mills: A Growing Number of Inquiries, With Patients Caught in the Middle
description: Juanita Diaz was puzzled and upset. The Lexington Family Medical Center at 137 East 116th Street in East Harlem had just been closed down by the New York City Department of Health for alleged Health Code violations, and now Mrs. Diaz and her three children would have to travel to some other, less accessible, shared health facility for treatment.

title: TV: Flipping Over Instant Hero
description: The process of making and exploiting a celebrity is wondrous to contemplate. Television is hardly the only machine in the game, but it's probably the most prominent one. Make it on the tube, either as a magpie on the talkshow circuit or the attractive new star of a dumb new series, and your picture is bound to show up on the covers of magazines and gossip sheets for a season or two, until public boredom thrusts you back into humiliating anonymity.

title: Israel Cautions Syrians Not to Approach the Border
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 22Using the United States as an intermediary, Israel has reiterated its warning to Syria against moving its troops in Lebanon too close to Israel's northern border.

title: Cordial Meeting Of Adversaries
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22After the thaumas of the Vietnam War and Watergate, President Ford's calm, cordial reception at the White House for Jimmy Carter was almost anticlimactic, a symbol of American politics returned to normal. Just 13 years ago today, the nation suffered its most stunning Presidential transition in the modern era the assassination of John F. Kennedy in Dallas and the sudden accession to power of Vice President Lyndon B. Johnson.

title: Hawkins is Named New President Of LockheedCalifornia Company
description: Willis M. Hawkins was named president yesterday of the LockheedCalifornia Company, a unit of the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation.

title: Court Subpoenas Files on Interpreter In Croatians Case
description: A New York State Supreme Court justice yesterday ordered the Central Intelligence Agency, the Justice Departmentand the Federal Bureau of Investigation to turn over all records concerning an interpreter assigned to the Croatian airliner hijacking case who has been accused of serving as a police informant.

title: The Warm Weather Forecast is for Shorts, Not Minis
description: Shorts, si. Minis, no. That's the way the fashion scene for warmweather clothes is shaping up in this country.

title: WILLIAM STAPLETON JR.
description: DETROIT, Nov. 22 (AP)Dr. William Stapleton Jr. believed to have been the oldest practicing physician in the United States when he retired nine years ago, died Friday at University Hospital in Ann Arbor. He was 99 years old.

title: Events Today
description: ECCENTRICITIES OF A NIGHTINGALE, a Play by Tennessee Williams; directed by Edwin Sherin; with Betsy Palmer, David Selby, Shepperd Strudwick and Nan Martin; at the Morosco Theater, 217 West 45th Street, 7.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Wearing his trench coat and his sour smile, Al Davis always looks as if he's a spy searching for a nuclear secret to steal. All he really wants is the enemy's game plan. Al Davis operates the Oakland Raiders with a warmth that only the C.I.A. would understand. But occasionally even he is embarrassed by his image.

title: CALL THIS TOLLFREE NUMBER TO ORDER HOME DELIVERY OF THE NEW YORK TIMES8003256400, Advt.
description: CALL THIS TOLLFREE NUMBER TO ORDER HOME

title: Christmas Season Adds to the Impact Of Parcel Strike
description: The prolonged teamster strike against the United Parcel Service is having an increasingly serious impact on retailers, mail order houses and other businesses the busy Christmas season approaches.

title: Administration May Seek Authority to Continue Guarding Kissinger
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22Ford Administration officials said today that because of continued threats to Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger's life, they were considering asking Congress for emergency authority to permit the Secret Service to guard him after he leaves office on Jan. 20.

title: Aide Asked to Study Upstate Graft
description: Governor Carey has asked Peter D. Andreoli, chief of the frauds bureau in the Manhattan District Attorney's office, to be special prosecutor in Onondaga County for a political corruption investigation there, law enforcement sources said.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 22 (UPI)The Soviet Union and the Occidental Petroleum Corporation have signed a major agreement for shipment of ammonia to the United States. Tass, the Soviet press agency, said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Certainly the orders issued last week to the Auxiliary Police in New York to aid in an effort to stop assaults and robberies on the elderly must come as good news for New York's senior citizens. The disturbing news came the following day when Mr. Weaving, president of the Policemen's Benevolent Association, stated that such function for auxiliaries constituted scab labor.

title: GREENWICH SCHOOLS STRUCK BY TEACHERS
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 22  More than 500 striking teachers picketed in the heart of town today while children, locked out of the community's 16 schools by the Board of Education, sat on benches and watched or chased each other across the green.

title: Carey and Beame Say U.S. Funds Will Be Sought as Last Resort
description: the attorney for Flushing National Bank the plaintiff in the moratorium lawsuit met with highlevel M.A.C. officials and began discussions on what the noteholders affected by the court decision might accept as payment for their notes. Mr. Richenthal said one proposal put forward was for the noteholders to accept payment in the form of a package consisting of both cash and longterm bonds, issued by either the city or the M.A.C.

title: BERTHA BOOKBINDER, 60, WAS CIVIL RIGHTS ACTIVIST
description: Bertha Bookbinder, a longtime civil rights and social welfare activist, died of heart disease Saturday at a hospital in Washington representative of the Amerbad lived in Bethesda, Md., with her husband, Hyman Bookbinder, now the Wcshington representative of the American Jewish Committee.

title: Moderate Regime Seen for Quebec
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 22Studies of the present makeup of the Para Qubcois and the men closest to Rend Levesque indicate that the new provincial premier is likely to name a cabinet that at least in the beginning will eschew political and economic radicalism.

title: Meadowlands Bids for ArmyIrish and Other Major Games
description: Negotiations are near completion to play the ArmyNotre Dame football game at Giants Stadium next year as part of a longrange plan to make the New Jersey sports complex the capital of Eastern college football.

title: BRITAIN PLANNING REFORM OF ITS WIDE SECRETS ACT
description: LONDON, Nov. 22 (Reuters)  The British Government today announced that it would reform the country's allembracing scerecy laws.

title: LAST VACANT HOUSE SEAT WON BY TEXAS DEMOCRAT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The results of a ballot recount confirmed today that a Democrat had won the last undecided seat in the House of Representatives. Thus, there will be 292 Democrats and 143 Republicans in the House when the 95th Congress convenes in January.

title: Ramirez Earn's $190,000 In Grand Prix Tennis
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 22 (AP)  Raul Ramirez of Mexico has clinched, the top spot in the Grand Prix of tennis, taking the firstplace prize of $150,000 in singles and $40,000 in doubles. The standing was announced today by the Commercial Union Grand Prix.

title: Mrs. Smith Quits as G.O.P. Head
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22Mary Louise Smith announced her resignation today as chairman of the Republican National Committee, setting the stage for a struggle for nominal control of the party between its moderate and conservative factions.

title: All Sees a Foreman (and Bobick) in Future And Changes His Retirement Plans Again
description: The onagain, offagain retirement of Muhammad Ali is apparently off again. The heavyweight champion announced his retirement from boxing last month in Turkey after defending his title against Ken Norton. Yesterday in Houston All said he wanted to fight the former champion, George Foreman. Meanwhile, there was a report in New York that Ali would fight Duane Bobick, the undefeated heavyweight, at Madison Square Garden in February.

title: Democrats Withdraw Accusation Of Improper G.O.P. Contributions
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (AP)As the Federal Election Commission was on the verge of rejecting its complaint, the Democratic National Committee withdrew charges that 32 Republican Congressional candidates had improperly accepted campaign contributions.

title: Y.M.C.A. Branches Stress Social Activism
description: To generations of Americans, the Y.M.C.A. has meant a leisurely swim in a heated pool, a brisk game of basketball and a bustling week at summer camp. But that gym and swim image is rapidly being supplemented by a growing social awareness.

title: Stage: Yiddish David Levinsky Begins the Folksbiene's Season
James Anderson Jr., Zoologist at Rutgers, Killed in Crash at 46
description: Prof. James Anderson Jr. of the Rutgers University zoology department, was killed in a twocar accident early last Saturday morning in Summit, N.J. He was 46 years old, and lived in West Orange, N.J.

title: Mrs. Carter Looks Over School, Then Goes on White House Tour
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22Rosalynn Carter had tea with Betty Ford at the White House today after inspecting a more than 100yearold public school that her daughter, Amy, may attend.

title: Chase is Arranging Loan to Egypt Of $250 Million by Western Banks
description: CAIRO, Nov. 22A subsidiary of the Chase Manhattan Bank is arranging a $250 million loan to Egypt from Western banks to offset a portion of the country's balanceofpayments deficit, sources close to the negotiations said today.

title: How They Voted
description: TRENTON, Nov. 22 (AP)Here is how the State Assembly voted tonight on the death penalty bill:

title: Article 1  No Title
Rono Wins Run
description: DENTON, Tex., Nov. 22Henry Rono of Washington State defeated Samson Rimombwa, a teammate, and Craig Virgin of Illinois for individual honors and the Univesity of Texas, El Paso, retained its title as African runners dominated the National Collegiate Athletic Association crosscountry championships today at North Texas State.

title: FULL ISRAELI RIGHTS IN UNESCO RESTORED
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Nov. 22Israel today was restored to full membership in the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization as a twoyearold decision barring it from the organization's European grouping was reversed.

title: Justice Dept. Opposes the Release Of Prisoner in Attack on House
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (AP)The Justice Department asked a Federal judge today to deny the immediate release of a Puerto Rican nationalist serving a prison term for an armed attack on the House of Representatives 22 years ago.

title: Tennessee Eyes Majors As Battle Resigns Post
description: Bill Battle resigned under fire as head football coach at the University of Tennessee yesterday and Johnny Majors, bead coach of the undefeated and untied Pittsburgh team, became the prime candidate for the Tennessee job. Tennessee officials are expected to offer the job to Majors after Pitt plays its regularseason finale against Penn State on Friday night.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Nov. 23, 1976 GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Treasury Bill Yields Off at Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22  Yields declined on Treasury bills in the weekly auction today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: Bronfman Case is a Hoax, Fireman Tells the Court
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 22Mel Patrick Lynch, alleged to be the prime mover in the abduction of Samuel Bronfman 2d in August 1975, took the stand today and, as expected, accused Mr. Bronfman himself of devising a hoax to extract millions of dollars from Edgar Bronfman, his father.

title: Soybeans Lead Commodities Rise
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 22 (AP)Soyhean futures advanced 18 cents a bushel on the Chicago Board of Trade today and the gain strongly influenced a demand and higher prices for other commodities on the floor.

title: In Memoriam
description: HOFFMANBeatrice. November 23, 1963. Lovingly remembered, deeply missed. Al, Shirley, Millicent & Ellen

title: The $1Billion Decision
description: The Appeals Court decision, holding unconstitutional the state's threeyear moratorium on more than $1 billion in city notes, could prove of longrun benefit to New York.

title: Mary Childs Draper, Early BirthControl Advocate
description: Mary Childs Draper, the first woman to head what is now the Brooklyn Bureau of Social Service and an early associate of Margaret Sanger in advocating birth control, died yesterday in Long Island College Hospital in Brooklyn. She was 90 years old and lived at 1 PierrePont Street in Brooklyn Heights.

title: Korea C.I.A. Said to Recall Aide In Apparent Effortto Limit Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The Korean Central Intelligence Agency has recalled to Seoul a senior officer here in an apparent effort to limit a Federal investigation into improper Korean lobbying activities, according to a Korean with access to highlevel decisions in Seoul.

title: INQUIRY IS ORDERED ON COST OVERRUNS OF ALASKA PIPELINE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 22The state of Alaska announced in Anchorage today that it had contracted for an investigation of the reasons for the cost overruns in the construction of the Trans Alaska Pipeline.

title: Costello and Quit Bucks
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 22 (AP)  Larry Costello, whose, team was saddled with a. 315 yonlost record, announced his resignation tonight as coach of the MilWaukee Bucks.

title: Rail Track Work Will Reduce Train Time to Albany by Hour
description: A $33million, threeyear track improvement program to cut nearly onehour from New YorkRensselaer (Albany) rail passenger schedules will be under contract before year's end, State Transportation Commissioner Raymond T. Schuler predicted yesterday.

title: Vietnam Reconstructs Rail System
description: SINGAPORE, Nov. 22 (Reuters)The reconstruction of Vietnam's warravaged railway system is nearing completion, with the first train due to run the full length of the country next month. This opens the possibility of traveling from Saigon to Paris by rail.

title: Bidder Gets an ExPolice Station, But Hasn't Decided on Use for It
description: With three loud raps of an auctioneer's gavel a building that for almost threequarters of a century was a short term home for lawbreakers moved yesterday toward becoming the longterm home for West Villagers.

title: Vote by Security Council Clears Way for Angola To Become U.N. Member
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 22The Security Council recommended Angola's entry to United Nations membership tonight by a vote of 13 to 0. The United States abstained and China did not participate.

title: A MINNEAPOLIS JAZZMAN MAKES NEW YORK SCENE
description: Jazz activity tends to concentrate in New York, to a degree many residents lake for granted, but the provinces conAinue to be the principal source of fresh talent. Various musicians from Chicago, St. Louis and the West Coast have been making impressive contributions to New York jazz during the last few years and this week, another new voice has been heard, a vibraphonist from Minneapolis teamed Steve Kimmel.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Nov. 22A man whose father was murdered in Elizabeth in 1963 was in the State House today lobbying quietly against a new state deathpenalty law that could take the life of his father's killer.

title: Open Interest
description: Monday, Nov. 22, 1976

title: The Fed and the White House
description: For all its confusing aspects, the clash by night between Chairman Arthur Burns of the Federal Reserve Board and the economic advisers of Presidentelect Carter has served the useful purpose of focusing national attention on the critical issue of whether, and how, the Carter Administration should seek to stimulate a more rapid rate or economic expansion soon after it takes office in January.

title: Women Cautioned on Use of Xrays In Effort to Detect Breast Cancer
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22Women who plan to have their breasts examined by mammography were advised here today to ask first what radiation dose they will be receiving from the Xray examination.

title: WILLIAM B. OAKES
description: William B. Oakes, who had been with Charles Francis Press in Manhattan for 41 years when he retired in 1967 as treasurer, died yesterday in White Plains Hospital. He was 73 years old and lived in Scarsdale.

title: Market Place
description: The investment emphasis of mutual funds shifted from chemical and petroleum refining companies to telecommunications companies and oil and gas field service and extraction companies in the quarter ended Sept. 30. 1976.

title: About New York
description: Felix G. Rohalyn said he had some new ideas while shaving yesterday. No nicks or plugs of bandage marred his face, so we may presume that the ideas Were more interesting than startling, and that before long some of these musings may come forth in still anOther round of $100 million prescriptions for the city to move on through the latest plague in its book of fiscal exodus.

title: Sarkis Faces Huge Problems in Rebuilding Leb anon
description: BEIRUT, LEBANON, Nov. 22With Syrian troops occupying virtually all of Lebanon, President Elias Sarkis is faced with the task of rebuilding the economic, political and social fabric of a country devastated by 19 months of civil war.

title: U.S. Traffic Safety Unit Warns of Brake Failures On Older School Buses
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (AP)The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration warned today that brakes on older school buses, particularly those built before 1969, might fail because of corrosion and rusting of the hydraulic tubing.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: THAT TIME AGAIN One of the traditionally early signs of Christmas in the Rockefeller Center area is the arrival of that tall tree, set up to overlook the skating rink. Early arriving visitors and office workers in the midtown sector can watch its installation on the plaza at about 8 o'clock this morning.

title: U.S., Soviet Heavyweights Set for Rematch
description: More than two tons of American and Soviet heavyweight boxers will be throwing punches in the ring at Madison Square Garden on a 10bout card between the Russian national team and a squad of American amateurs on Dec.

title: CARTER ADVISER BIDS U.S. ASSUME TOP ROLE IN SPURRING ECONOMY
description: PARIS, Nov. 22one or rresioenteiect Jimmy Carter's closest economic advisers, Lawrence R. Klein, asserted today that the United States, West Germany and Japan should be aiming for faster growth to steer the world away from a threatened cumulative recession.

title: DeathPenalty Backer Gets Threat on Life
description: TRENTON, Nvv. 22 (UPI)The life of Assemblyman Richard J. Codey, the sponsor of the state's deathpenalty bill, has been threatened, according to State House sources.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: Because of an editing error, an article in The Times on Nov. 12 incorrectly attributed to Dataquest Inc., a California analytical concern, the semiconductor sales of the entire San Francisco area.

title: For a Sound Defense Industry
description: LOS ANGELES  The General Accounting Office's recent report on the status of the country's major weaponssystems procurement programs revealed that nearly SO percent are suffering cost overruns. Some program costs have increased more than 200 percent. Some are delayed a year or more. This sad record has become so repetitive there seems to be a tendency to consider cost overruns, schedule delays and technical disappointments part of the price we must pay for national security.

title: Jersey House Backs Death Penalty
description: TRENTON, Nov. 22The State Assembly overwhelmingly approved tonight a death penalty bill, rejecting arguments by black legislators that it would mark a return to racism and could have a dehumanizing effect on society.

title: News Summary
description: A Labor Government bill to nationalize Britain's aircraft and shipbuilding industries was stalled when the House of Lords voted to reject it unless a dozen profitable shiprepair yards were exempted. The Callaghan Government cannot reintroduce it until Parliament's new session, which opens tomorrow, complicating an already crowded legislative calendar. [Page 1, Column 4.]

title: Artist on Scaffold Resists Urge for Perspective
description: All artists, even novices, know to step back from their canvasses to check perspective and see the blend of colors. If Paul Chin did this, he would topple 60 feet.

title: Changes Already Affect Spain
description: Social and political transformation is already apparent Spain, even as the Government of King Juan Carlos prepares for general elections next yearSpain's first free election since 1936. Here are some of those changes.

title: Interior Department Planning Sale of Atlantic OilGas Leases
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (UPI)The Interior Department today took the first step toward a second MidAtlantic sale of oil and gas leases off New York, New Jersey. Maryland, Delaware and Virginia in mid1975.

title: Sears, Roebuck Net Up 34% for Quarter As Sales Set a High
description: 1 Sears, Rcehuck & Company reported yesterday a 34 percent rise, in consolidated net income for its third quarter ended Oct. 31 on record sales, which gained 19 percent.

title: Music: O'Dette Excels on Lute; Helen Boatwright Sings Brightly
description: The lute was to the Renaissance and the Baroque what the piano was to the 19th century the instrument everyone played, more or less. Until recent years, however, the art of playing the lute lay all but buried by history, despite exploratory excavations by a few scholars. Now, with Julian Bream and other virtuosos taking the lead, the lute is again demanding its place as an indispensable ensemble and solo instrument in old music.

title: CONGRATULATIONS Al, BINSTOX from Stembers Zittel Assoc. See business section page 55.Advt.
description: CONGRATULATIONS Al, BINSTOX from Stembers

title: Concert: London Philharmonic
description: Carnegie Hall, which has been vibrating to the sounds conjured up by Sir Georg Solti and Herbert von Karajan over the last two weeks, played host to a third major conductor and orchestra Sunday night, Bernard Haitink and the London Philharmonic in the first of two New York concerts.

title: MEXICO SUSPENDS CURRENCY DEALINGS FOR INDEFINITE TIME
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 22The Mexican, Government today suspended foreignex change dealings for an indefinite period after a wave of rumors that led to new speculation against the peso and a fresh of ranital.

title: Housing Prices in the Capital Astound Carter Staffers
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The people in the new Carter administration may be prepared to tackle the worst problems the world has to offerthe Mideast, unemployment, nuclear proliferation. But few of them were quite ready for the Washington realestate market.

title: Bonds Head Toward Higher Prices and Lower Rates
description: The bond market, continuing its strongest surge in years, headed toward higher prices and lower interest rates yesterday. The market advanced sharply during the first part of the day and dropped back during the late afternoonbut still closed with substantial gains in some cases. The Treasury's 8 percent notes that mature in 1986, for example, traded as high as 106 10/32, where they yielded only 7.09 percentalmost a full point lbelow their original 8 percent rate when they were first offered to investors in early August. The S's were later quoted at 10529/32bid, a gain for the day of 17/32.

title: 12Hour Crew Work Limit Delays Two Washington Amtrak Trains
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 22 (AP)One Amtrak passenger trains's arrival here was delayed for almost four hours and another for two hours because of a Federal law requiring train crews to work no more than 12 hours at a time, railroad officials said.

title: Jersey House Backs Death Penalty
description: TRENTON, Nov, 22The State Assembly overwhelmingly approved tonight a death penalty bill, rejecting arguments by black legislators that it would mark a return to racism and could have a dehumanizing effect on society.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 23, 1976

title: Shutt Credits Lemaire With Increase in His Scoring
description: Steve Shutt, the most prolific goalscorer in the National Hockey League this season, attributes part of his success to the presence of Jacques Lemaire on his line. Shutt scored three more goals Sunday night as the Canadiansdefeated the Toronto Maple Leafs, 95. Those goals give him 23 in 23 games and his other linemate, Guy Lafleur, has 17 goals. With Jacques Lemaire centering our line, said Shutt, we've been picking up more points. Lemaire is a very fast skater and I get a chance to break faster on the wing. But it's a bit too early for me to claim an 80 goal season [a goalagame pace]. Pete Mahovlich used to play at center with Lefleur and Shutt.

title: Books of The Times
description: Not every non sequitur opens the door to serendipity. Randomness is not necessarily a salutary counterpoint to rigidity. The bourgeois is no longer pat by the incongruous: He eats it for breakfast. Deadpan language is not a postponed laugh. The arbitrary does not yet qualify as a literary conceit. Bafflement is not always evocative. The unconventional can be just as much a tyranny as the conventianl.

title: Dead Man Identified in Nevada
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Nov. 22 (AP)A man who died here Nov. 12 was identified today as Geoffrey Quentin McCaull.y Hubbard, son of L. Ron Hubbard, who founded the Church of Scientology. Mr. Hubbard, 22 years old, was found semiconscious in an auto on Oct. 28 and failed to respond to treatment at a hospital.

title: Success of Search for Roots Leaves Alex Haley Surprised
description: Alex Haley's burrowing into his family's past, his search for his black ancestor who was the link between the family's American and African history, is surely not the first a black man has made. But Mr. Haley's account of that quest in Roots will undoubtedly supplant those that preceded his. For in the vividness and fervor of its telling, in the wealth of authentic detail, in the evocation of African life, it has no rival as a popular study.

title: Around the Nation
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 22 (AP)American Motors Corporation will pay the largest air pollution fine ever collected by the State of California, officials said today.

title: Jet Rookie's Meal Intrigues, His Waiters and Watchers
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.T., Nov. 22  The defensive coaches were trying to figure out today whether the Jets had played a better defensive game all season than they had yesterday.

title: Waste Program Climbing in Cost In Westchester
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 22The Westchester Board of Legislators learned today that the major component of a proposed countywide program for disposing of solid waste had increased in cost by nearly 50 percent within one year.

title: Taxes & Accounting
description: In the final weeks of William E. Simon's tenure, the Treasury Department intends to decide a highly technical tax dispute involving hundreds of millions of dollars in higher taxes on multinational corporations.

title: MOBIL IS STILL TOP BIDDER OF 3 VYING FOR IRVINE
description: LOS ANGELES, NNov. 22The Cadillac Fairview Corporation Ltd. and the AllenTaubman Company have until noon Wednesday to submit a higher offer than the Mobil Oil Corporation to purchase the Irvine Company, a Californialand developer, for $279.8 million in cash and 10year notes.

title: Carter, in Visit to Ford, Raises Idea of a New Summit
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22Presidentelect Jimmy Carter called on President Ford at the White House today in the first meeting between the two men since the election and immediately raised the idea of another economic summit meeting with foreign leaders.

title: Rutgers Votes To Spurn Bid To Bowl Game
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Nov. 22 Rutgers football players, who have put together the longest current major college winning streak at 17, voted unanimously tonight not to accept a bid to the new Independence Bowl that is scheduled for Shreveport, La., Dec. 13.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: Because of an editing error, an article in The Times on Nov. 12 incorrectly attributed to Dataquest Inc., a California analytical concern, the semiconductor sales of the entire San Francisco area.

title: HERBERT WALKER, JUDGE; SENTENCED 20 TO DEATH
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 22 (UPI)Herbert Walker, the judge who sentenced Sirhan B. Sirhan. Caryl Chessman and 18 other men to die in the gas chamber, died of a heart attack Saturday. He was 77 years old.

title: Queens Explosion Victim, 34, Dies of Burns
description: One of the more Loan 40 workers injured in an explosion early Sunday at a chewinggum factory in Queens died yesterday. Seventeen other victims remained in critical conditions.

title: Advertising
description: It could well he that in the United Statcs the moped (moped) is an idea whose time has come.

title: Housing Prices in the Capital Astound Carter Staffers
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The people in the new Carter administration may be prepared to tackle the worst problems the world has to offerthe Mideast, unemployment, nuclear proliferation. But few of them were quite ready for the Washington realestate market.

title: HOUSE OF LORDS WINS ROUND IN ITS BATTLE AGAINST GOVERNMENT
description: LONDON, Nov. 22The House of Lords fought the Government to a draw today over a controversial proposal to nationalize Britain's aircraft and shipbuilding industries.

title: FULL ISRAELI RIGHTS IN UNESCO RESTORED
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Nov. 22Israel today was restored to full membership in the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization as a twoyearold decision barring it from the organization's European grouping was reversed.

title: Dance: City Ballet Royal Jewels
description: The New York City Ballet wears its chreographic diadem Jewels as proudly as royalty carries the gem variety.
