Critical opinion was undividedly warm when the ballet first appeared nine years ago and hasn't changed much since, although there have been some changes in the work itself. it hasthe distinction of being one of the few ballets in the company repertory in which each section is applauded before the actual dancing begins as well as after. Sunday afternoon at the State Theater the ballet saw some new casting in its Rubies section.

title: Production of Steel 2d Lowest of Year
description: Steel production last week plunged 4.1 percent to 2.21 million tons, the American Iron and Steel institute reported yesterday.

title: COURT MOVES TO CURB WITNESSLAW ABUSES
description: NEWARK, Nov. 22A woman who told the police she was a rape victim and was then detained in a jail cell as a material witness to the crime has won a court order designed to end abuses of the materialwitness statute, the woman's attorneys disclosed today.

title: Enrique Rodriguez, Uruguayan in U.N., Helped Set Up Israel
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 22 (Reuters)Enrique Rodriguez Fabregat, former delegate to the United Nations who played a leading role in setting up the state of Israel in 1948, died here yesterday, members of his family said today.

title: Emergency U.S. Loan Will Give Portuguese Time to Regain Their Feet
description: LISBON, Nov. 22Washington's plan to grant Portugal a $300 million emergency loan could save the country from the prospect of imminent bankruptcy and would give the young democracy a chance to get on its feet.

title: Elderly Couple Slain in Apartment In Luxury Building on East 66th St.
description: An 84Yearold lawyer and his 76yearold wife were found murdered in their seventhfloor luxury apartment at 201 East 66th Street late yesterday morning.

title: SIMON TELLS CARTER OF NEW YORK CITY AID
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22Presidentelect Jimmy Carter and Treasury Secretary William E. Simon, both of whom have expressed their determination to prevent New York City from collapsing into bankruptcy, met today to discuss the city's fiscal problems and other monetary matters.

title: No Title
Quake Shakes Los Angeles Area
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 22 (AP)A light earthquake centered on Santa Monica Bay shook a wide area of Los Angeles today, but apparently caused no damage or injury, the authorities said. Seismologists at the California Institute of Technology in Pasadena said that the quake measured 3.8 on the Richter scale and was centered in the ocean seven miles off Santa Monica.

title: House Hearing Studies Shortfall in Federal Spending
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22Strong differences of opinion emerged today between Congressional and Administration experts on the extent and the probable consequences of the failure of the Government to spend all the money that it had planned to spend in the first nine months of this year.

title: Thriving Capital Filling the Void In Mauritania
description: NOUAKCHOIT, Mauritania, Nov. 20 This subSaharan nation is for the rugged, a land the colonizing French called simply the Void.

title: MARION C. PUGH
description: COLLEGE STATION, Tex., Nov. 22 (AP) Funeral services for Marion C. Pugh, quarterback of Texas A. & M.'s 1939 national championship football team, will be held tomorrow in Bryan

title: Formidable Leader of Carter Transition Team
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22There is a popular new practical joke in town, which requires only a telephone and the lightest of Southern accents: You call a friend and say, Hi, my name is Jack Watson and we were wondering Man in the news if   This joke has reportedly brought tears of laughter to a number of merryandrews and less easily classified emotions to its victims. These days, a call from 38yearold Jack Hearn Watson Jr., a name nearly unknown until the election, is seen as almost the same thing as an invitation to Plains, Ga. Mr. Watson heads Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's transition team, and inauguration day is only eight weeks away.

title: Off the Top of de Tocq.
description: Someone has sent a copy of Alexis de Tocqueville's Democracy in America, which reminds me that I have never read it, although I have quoted it frequently in writings which sought to masquerade as learned. Driving home your points with quotations from books you haven't read is a science taught in college, and de Tocqueville is one of the first authorities freshmen; learn to cite.

title: A Losing Coach Rehired
description: LAS CRUCES, N.M., Nov. 22 (UPI)  The New Mexico State football coach, Jim Bradley, has been given new oneyear contract, the school announced today, despite four consecutive losing seasons

title: A Killer Gets Chair But 2 Others Don't
description: A Brooklyn judge yesterday sentenced the convicted killer of a prison guard to die in the electric chair, while a judge in Manhattan dealt a 25yeartolife sentence to the confessed murderer of two policemen because of the prosecution's fear that the state's new deathpenalty law might be invalid.

title: Strike in Greenwich Closes 16 Schools As Teachers Picket
description: GREENWICH, Nov. 22N1ore than 500 striking teachers picketed in the heart of town today while children, locked out of the community's 16 schools by the Board of Education, sat on benches and watched or chased each other across the green.

title: Rangers Top Canucks, 32 As Davidson Excels in Net
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Nov. 22 (AP)  John Davidson continued his goaltending mastery over Vancouver as he stopped 33 shots and led the New York Rangers to a 3.2 National Hockey League victory over the Canucks tonight.

title: Pound and Dollar Fall
description: LONDON, Nov 22 (UPI)The British pound fell more than 3 cents against thedollar on foreign exchange markets today, while the dollar had substantial losses on all European markets.

title: Theater: Riding With the Devil
description: At a recent, sparsely attended performance of Joseph Renard's Riding With the Devil, the latest in Alan A. Gabor's Mystery Theater Series at the Greenwich Mews, there was woman in the front row who was cackling like a chicken. The egg was laid on stage. The showboth play and productionis abysmal, fathoms below rock bottom in fact, it is so irredeematbly awful that it can be used as a measuring stick for future misadventures in the theater.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Monday.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: It will be a merry Christmas after all for 150 New York City firefighters who were laid off in July 1975 because of the fiscal crisis. Fire Commissioner John T. O'Hagan announced yesterday that they would be reappointed on Dec, 24 and would be back in action on Christmas Day.

title: City's Notes Climb; M.A.C. Bonds Rally
description: New York City notes jumped sharply in price yesterday in response to a ruling Friday by the New York State Court of Appeals that the threeyear moratorium on their repayment was unconstitutional.

title: Rutgers Alumni Ask, but in Vain, About invitation to a Major Bowl
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Nov. 22All last week, Rutgers alumni, exuberant over the university's undefeated football team, were calling Tony Oliva, fundraiser for the athletic department, for news about possible invitation to a major bowl.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: KALINOWSKI (Gdynia). Gdynla Dec. 14; sails from Newark N. J.

title: Man Killed Jumping From Car
description: MOUNT OLIVE, N.J., Nov. 22 (AP)A Brooklyn man was killed yesterday when he jumped out of a car traveling on Route 80 here and was hit by passing vehicles, the state police said. The victim, Thomas J. Demenna, 32 yearn old of 457 Stratford Road, was a passenger in a car driven by Barbara Werbelow, 23, of Brooklyn, the police said.

title: Stocks Up 7.07 on Dow After Fed Moves to Stimulate the Economy
description: The stock market advanced along a broad front yesterday in response to signs that the Federal Reserve Board had acted to stimulate the economy.

title: Nothing Like a Deer
description: Two letters on this page today out readers in Vermont take some of the mystique out of the mystical joys of deer hunting. Our East Barnard correspondent graphically describes the mayhem normally accompanying the opening of the deer season in Vermont  or for that matter in any other state  when fearless marksmen take to the woods to pursue thesavage beast, and often end up shooting a cow, or the side of a barn, or each other.

title: Brezhnev Arrives On Visit to Rumania To Meet Ceausescu
description: BUCHAREST, Rumania, Nov. 22Leonid 1. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, arrived here today on a visit aimed at smoothing over the sometimes troubled relations between the two Communist neighbors.

title: Black Jobs: Dilemma For Carter
description: If Presidentelect Carter, as now appears likely decides upon safe and sound businessmen and conservatives for the major economic posts in his Administration, it can reasonably he assumed that he does not aim to move rapidly toward sweeping economic and social change.

title: Nadjari's Day in Camera is Over, But on Camera, It's just Starting
description: Maurice H. Nadiari. the former special state anticorruption prosecutor appeared on the steps of City Hall with a clipboard and a television camera crew yesterday and disclosed that he had become a freelance news commentator for WNEWTV.

title: Levitt Predicts Gains From Moratorium End
description: ALBANY, Nov. 22 (UPI)The moratorium on New York City's debts has cost state and local governments nationwide huge amounts of extra money and a Court of Appeals decision that it is illegal will restore investor credit in municipal bonds and notes, State Comptroller Arthur Levitt said today.

title: WHICH common drugs can cause Impotence?
description: WHICH common drugs can cause Impotence? Before you take another pill, get THE PEOPLE'S PHAHMACY, by Graedon. the book that belongs near every house hold medicine chest. (New York Marrazine.) St. Martin's Press,Adel.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Aid for Waterfowl Hunters
description: This is the second year that waterfowl identification courses are being offered to New York State hunters by the state's Department of Environmental Conservation and the United States Fish and Wildlife Service.

title: Carter Press Aide Asks a New Start, With Some Open Cabinet Meetings
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 Jody Powell, who admitted to several flareups with the press in Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's campaign, today proposed a new beginning to the Washington press corps and offered greater access to Mr. Carter as President and more open government procedures, including some open Cabinet meetings.

title: Ford Backers Ask Ohio Recount
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 23 (AP) A recount of Presidentelect. Jimmy Carter's 9,333vote victory over President Ford in Ohio will begin next Monday, Secretary of State. Ted W. Brown said today. The recount is expected to take about a week.

title: About Real Estate
description: Cheek by jowl with the bustling Fulton Street shopping district in downtown Brooklyn lies the cleared development sites of the Schermerhorn Pacific urban renewal area, in Boerum Hill. The 1973 version of the city's plans for the area called for 992 units of mixed income housing in highrise towers and townhouses, plus retail space.

title: Bringing Jobs Back to New York
description: There are gathering signs that 1977 might be the first year in a quarter century that New York City will make some headway in attracting mid retaining jobs. Attitudes and economic& are improving while areas competing with New York are beginning to lose some of their advantages.

title: Symbol of Stalinist Science
description: A zealot with the burning eyes of a Savonarola and the narrow mind of a dogmatist, Trofim D. Lysenko was a symbol of Soviet science under Stalin.

title: Special Anti crime Strike Force For Southern New York Closing
description: The Justice Department announced yesterday that it planned to close down the special strike force set up in 1969 to direct the Federal campaign against organized crime in southern New York and return the job to the United States Attorney's office.

title: Bizarre GambleSkogmo Fight Leaves Founder as Winner and Still Champion
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 23Internal struggles for control of giant corporations generally take place behind closed mahogany doors. However, one such battleinvolving an unsuccessful attempt to remove the 78yearold founder of GambleSkogmo Inc., a $1.55 billion merchandising giantrecently burst into public view.

title: Technology Hopes for a Mobile Viking on Mars
description: Now that the Viking craft on the surface of Mars and in orbit around are temporarily silent, because Mars has moved behind the sun until about midDecember, engineers can review their hopes for sending a mobile Version of Vikine to the surface of Mars.

title: School Results
Around the Nation
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 23 (AP)Gary Gilmore, a convicted murderer, dismissed his lawyer, Dennis Boaz, today. Mr. Boaz said that Mr. Gilmore was now by himself in his fight to be executed.

title: For Cancer Patients and Their Families, Dishonesty May Also Be an Enemy
description: NEW HYDE PARK, L. I., Nov. 23People directly confronting cancerpatients, their families and their doctorswere urged at a conference today to be open and honest in discussing the disease.

title: 0, the Gallant Fisher's Life
description: Winter was in the air when Scotty the mailman delivered a slender hook entitled lzaak Walton, the Compleat Angler and His Turbulent Times, by J. Lawrence Pool and Angeline J. Pool with an accompanying letter from Herb Shultz, friend of the authors, brother of the Angle, baseball fan pledged to the St. Louis Cardinals, and Vassar's vice president for development. Larry Pool, Herb writes, is a man of several facets. His real career is brain surgery and he retired a year or two ago as head of the Brain Surgery Department 01 Lolumina Presbyterian Hospital. He has written half a dozen books on the general topic, Brain Surgery Made Simple, though the titles were not that jazzy. In the 1930's he was twice national singles squash champion. An internationally known sailor, he crossed the ocean four times under sail. Raced three times in the Pastnet Race, which is sort of the Grand National of ocean racing. Life member of the British Royal Ocean Racing Club. Now that he is retired; his main pursuits are dryfly fishing for brown and rainbow trout, and honoring the memory of Izaak Walton.

title: NEW YORK ASSAILED Oil TISE OF JAIL FUNDS
description: State Comptroller Arthur Levitt yesterday issued a critical audit on the New York City jail system's use of Federal grants for pilot projectsalong with an unusually caustic city reply charging his office with errors and a desire to justify more auditing.

title: The Observer of London is Sold To Anderson and Atlantic Richfield
description: The Atlantic Richfield Company, one of the nation's largest oil concerns, said last night that it had reached an agreement in London to acquire The Observer, an influential 185yearold British weekly newspaper with a worldwide readership.

title: BETTER UTILITY BONDS SLIP IN RATE TO 8.25%
description: Interest rates on highgrade utility bonds yesterday moved down a notch to 8.25 percenttheir lowest level since February 1974but investors were unreceptive to this lower rate of return. Meanwhile, the push toward higher bond prices that got under way a week ago lost some of its strength.

title: Swine Flu Victim, Back on Job, Asserts Regular Flu Was Worse
description: CONCORDIA, Mo., Nov. 23In retrospect, said Larry E. Hardison, swine flu was not as bad as other types he had experienced.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: RESULTS

title: TV: Turkeys, Songbirds and Some Capitalist Pigs
description: On Thanksgiving eve, television schedules are sticking to standard fare. NBC is following up its Monday horror movie, Savage Bees, with a disaster movie, Flood. CBS shows itsviolence nana wan a repeat of The French Connection film. And ABC, playing to the kiddies and dirty old men, begins with The Bionic Woman and ends with Charlie's Angels. In between, ABC has Baretta, which registered the highest rating ever recorded on one particular violence scale.

title: 350 on L.I. Questioned In Slaying of Mrs. Zorn, Who Ran Poultry Farm
description: FARMINGDALE, L.I. Nov. 23More than 350 people were questioned by Nassau County detectives today in an investigation of the holdup and slaying yesterday of the wife of the owner of Zorn's Poultry Farms, a wellknown establishment on Long Island.

title: Marlborough Gallery Takes Over Disco Stock of RothkoSuit Figure
description: Marlborough Gallery, one of the country's bestknown art galleries, has embarked on an enterprise in a new fieldthe fastgrowing discothque industry. It has taken over virtually all of the stock of a corporation formed by one of its customers, M. Yoram Polany, to open a discothque in the former CBSTV theater at 254 West 54th Street.

title: China Confirms Hua Has a Family
description: PEKING, Nov. 23 (Reuters)China confirmed today that Hua Kuofeng, the Communist Party Chairman, has a wife and family.

title: Belief in Limited Breast Surgery Is Supported by Cancer Research
description: WASHINGTON, D.C., Nov. 23Studies of various approaches to treating breast cancer continue to suggest that less extensive surgery may be as effective as radical mastectomy in treating patients with early breast cancer.

title: Andre Malraux, 75, Dies in Paris; Writer, War Hero, de Gaulle Aide
description: PARIS, Nov. 23  Andr Malraux, writer, hero of the French Resistance in World War II and President de Gaulle's longtime Minister of Culture, died today at the age of 75.

title: HERSEY WORK PULLED BY SATURDAY REVIEW
description: An article by John Hersey, one of America's foremost journalists and novelists, has been pulled out of the Saturday Review by the magazine's longtime editor, Norman Cousins.

title: A Malraux Sampler
description: On the theme behind his most famous novel, Man's Fate:

title: Culture for Employees
description: The KimberlyClark Corporation keeps employees mentally stimulated by providing outside education. The courses do not have to be jobrelated, Page 53.

title: State May Enter Into Agreement For Television News Programs
description: TRENTON, Nov. 23Rebuffed thus far by the Federal Communications Commission in its efforts to require New York City and Philadelphia television stations to open news productions bureaus in New Jersey, the state may enter into an agreement with Channel 13 in Newark to produce its own news program.

title: Careers
description: Dollars for culture are part of the KimberlyClark Corporation's plan in keep employees mentally stimulated. The big paper producer spent $700,000 in 197475 and $800,000 in 197576 and expects to pay even more this school year for employees outside educationeven courses in tole painting.

title: U.S. Orders P.L.O. Representative to Leave Country
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23A Palestinian who came to Washington with plans to open an office for the Palestine Liberation Organization was told by the State Department today to leave the country by the end of the month.

title: Mexico Allows Private Brokerage In Money at Freely Floating Rates
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 23  Private Mexican brokers were today authorized to enter the foreignexchange market to buy and sell dollars at a freely floating rate, but official dealings are expected to remain suspended until after next week's change of government here.

title: About Education
description: Parents and educators have been concerned for some time about how reading and arithmetic are faring in American schools. Now, another basic is coming into its own.

title: Events Today
description: SHOUT AT THE DEVIL, directed by Peter Hunt; starring Lee Marvin, Roger Moore and Barbara Parkins, at neighborhood theaters.

title: Pentagon Fearful of Soviet Effort To Develop HunterKiller Satellites
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23The Defense Department has been watching with growing concern a longterm Soviet program to develop hunterkiller satellites for destroying other satellites, a step that some Pentagon officials fear could extend warfare into space.

title: Budget Expert Says a 9Month Lag In U. S. Spending Slowed Economy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23  The director of the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office said today that the Government's failure to spend all the money it had planned in the first nine months of this year had measurably slowed the growth of the economy.

title: Barbara Walters, After 7 Weeks On ABC, Raises Rating Slightly
description: Barbara Walters has now been on the air for ABCTV seven weeksor 5134,610 worth of her $1millionayear contractand her impact on the ratings for the ABC Evening News has been slight.

title: Bus Drivers Strike Over Fear
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Nov. 23 (UPI)Bus drivers for the Toledo Area Regional Transit Authority went on strike today because of continued harassment of drivers by students, a union spokesman said. The 215 drivers did not report for work because the transit agency had refused to provide protection for the drivers.

title: House Inquiry on Legion Disease Told of Lag in Checking for Toxin
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 23Pennsylvania medical authorities testified today that toxicologists should have had a larger, earlier role in the investigation of an unknown, unidentified illness that struck an American Legion convention in Philadelphia last July.

title: They Want Life in Ulster, Enriching Life
description: The kindly Ulster people, and they are many, have suffered enough from the violent death and destruction inflicted on them, without having to endure attributions of blame from illinformed and prejudiced commentators. A look at facts, as opposed to distortion, might help. It could at least be a pleasant change.

title: Times Correspondent Fined $250 On Drug Misdemeanor in Idaho
description: BOISE, Idaho, Nov. 23 (AP) Grace Lichtenstein, a correspondent for The New York Times based in Denver, pleaded guilty today to a misdemeanor charge of frequenting a place where controlled substances are known to be located and was fined $250.

title: Music: Busy Akiyama Conducts
description: Kazuyoshi Akiyama is not one of the most celebrated conductors on the international scene, but he certainly one of the busiest. He shuttles from continent to continent as conductor of orchestras in Canada, Japan and New York (where he is the head of the American Symphony Orchestra), and in his spare time he teaches and makes guestconducting appearances. Last night in Carnegie Hall he led the Philadelphia Orchestra in Mozart, Takemitsu, Debussy and Brahms.

title: ANTHONY CLARK, 52, MUSH DIRECTOR
description: Anthony M. Clark, director of the Minneapolis Institute of Arts from 1963 to 1973 and chairman of the department of European paintings at the Metropolitan Museum of Art from 1973 until his resignation last year, died of a heart attack in Rome on Monday. He was 53 years old and lived at 970 Park Avenue.

title: Sports Today
description: Nets vs. San Antonio Spurs, at Nassau Coliseum, Uniondale, L.1., 8 P.M. (TelevisionChannel 10(Manhattan Cable). 8 P.M.) (RadioWMCA, 8 P.M., WGBB, 10 P.M., delayed broadcast)

title: ATTORNEY FOR BANK AGREES TO NEGOTIATE ON NEW YORK'S NOTES
description: The attorney for the bank that successfully challenged New York City's moratorium on repaying its shortterm notes agreed yesterday to try to devise by Dec. 15 a joint proposal with the city and state for the repayment of $1 billion due.

title: A Stunned Nelson Assumes Post as Bucks Head Coach
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 23 (AP)Don Nelson, who became assistant coach of the Milwaukee Bucks after retiring from playing last spring, says he is numbed by the string of events that vaulted him into the team's head coaching job.

title: 17 in Colonial Cup Field; OTB Bets Start Friday
description: Two American and two foreign horses head the list of favorites for the seventh running of the $100,000 International Colonial Cup on Saturday in Camden, S.C. America's richest steeplechase event has attracted a field of five Tracksimports and 12 American entries for the 2mile test over 17 brush fences at Springdale Race Course. The victor will earn $60,000. New Zealand's Grand Canyon, the English entry Lanzarote II, Mrs. Miles Valentine's Tan Jay and Mrs. Ogden Phipps's Straight and True have drawn the most attention.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: Birmingham 3, Calgary 1. Minnesota 4, Cincinnati 0. Houston 5, Edmonton 3. Indianapolis 4, New England 3. Quebec 7, Winnipeg 4.

title: London Observer Reported Sold To Anderson of Atlantic Richfield
description: Robert O. Anderson, chairman of the Atlantic Richfield Company, is understood to have reached agreement on the purchase of The London Observer, an influential 185yearold British weekly with a worldwide readership, informed sources reported last night in New York.

title: Meadowlands Results
Article 3  No Title
Astros Switch Affiliation
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 23(UPI)  The Houston Astros said today that their Triple A farmclub affiliation would switch from Memphis to Charleston, W. Va., for the 1977 season. The Memphis manager, Jim Beauchamp, will manage the Charleston team of the International League.

title: Dow Closes Off by 6.57 to 949.30; Chrysler's Cut in Forecast a Spur
description: A lowered projection by the Chrysler Corporation for industry car sales in the 1977 model year sent the stock market lower yesterday.

title: U.S. Proposing I.M.F. Oversee Aid to Portugal
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23A United States proposal for a large package of help for Portugal includes a new concept in international financial rescue packages that the International Monetary Fund administer and manage a fund of about $1.5 billion to be provided by individual donor nations.

title: Pro Transactions
description: MONTREAL (NHL)Traded John Van Boxineer, defenseman, to Colorado for cash and future consideration.

title: Chief Candidates for Carter Jobs Expected to Be Named in 10 Days
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 23 Presidentelect Jimmy Carter is expected to announce in the next week to 10 days the lists of persons being given nearfinal consideration for most major Cabinet and White House posts, according to members of the Carter organization.

title: Acrobats of Taiwan Good as Ever
description: The Chinese Acrobats of Taiwan are back in town, this time for two weeks. Last night the company opened at the Minskoff Theater and proved that what was last year's surprise spectacular is still as good as ever. The company is definitely this year's Thanksgiving treat for the entire family.

title: Lefkowitz is Investigating Whether Nursing Homes Violated Antitrust Laws
description: Attorney General Louts J. Lefkowitz said yesterday that his office would investigate whether nursinghome owners in New York State were conducting a boycott of the Medicaid program in violation of the state's antitrust laws.

title: ARGENTINA SET TO RESUME ITS EXPORTING TO CUBA
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 23  Argentina has successfully renegotiated the resumption of industrial exports to Cuba, ineluding automobiles built by subsidiaries here of United States companies, under a trade agreement that was interrupted in August.

title: Striking Teachers in Greenwich Come to a Tentative Agreement
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 23A tentative agreement was reached tonight the twoday old Greenwich teachers strike, the first in this century, after a Superior Court judge at both sides down in his Bridgeport court chambers for an allflight bargaining session.

title: Tulsa Accepts Invitation To Independence Bowl
description: TULSA, Okla., Nov. 23 (AP)The University of Tulsa accepted today a bid to play in the Independence Bowl on Dec. 13 at Shreveport, La. Rutgers of New Brunswick, N.J., rejected the, bid last night.

title: This Is No Time for Literature
description: PARIS  The often dotty judgment of the Swedish Academy could not have been better confirmed than by the fact that in all the years it has been awarding Nobel literary prizes to those it considered outstanding among world writers, it never conferred one upon Andre Malraux, the great Frenchman who has just died.

title: Planes Over Stadium Draw Formal Protest
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, Nov. 23 (UPI) The Sports and Exposition Authority said yesterday that it had coin plained to officials of Teterboro Airport about the lowflying planes that carried advertising banners over the Giants Stadium during football games. How ever, the planes are based in Asbury Park not in Teterboro.

title: Market Place
description: Relatively cold weather for this time of the year and diminishing supplies of natural gas have once again led some brokers, to recommend shares of leading distributors of bottled gas, or propane.

title: Alexander, ExYank, Signs Rangers' Pact
description: Doyle Alexander, who left the Yankees because they refused to guarantee him 20 starts a season, became last night the second free agent to sign with the Texas Rangers.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Nov. 23The State Department of the Public Advocate filed suit in Federal District Court today in a move to end what it termed discrimination against 143,000 women who were members of state employee and public schoolteachers pension funds.

title: Soybean Futures Prices Show Decline in Chicago; Late Liquidation is Heavy
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 23 (AP) Soybean futures declined 18 cents a bushel on the Chicago Board of Trade today in heavy liquidation during the last 30 minutes of the session. The late trade was a duplicate of Monday's activity except that prices then advanced 18 cents under strong demand and short covering.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The former president of the State Bank of Bloomfield, indicted in a $3 million scheme to cheat the hank, lied when he pleaded poverty to obtain a courtappointed lawyer, Judge Herbert J. Stern of United States District Court in Newark has ruled. The judge ordered the former executive, Robert L. Prodan, 35 years old, of Morganville, to post an additional $50,000 in bail to make sure he does not flee before he goes on trial in January.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The prolonged pause in the current economic recovery has led to consideration of a oneshot expansionary boost by the Federal Government. Most talk centers on a tax rebate on 1976 taxes or a shortperiod cut in income and payroll taxes. Such proposals have two negative features: The last onesoot boost was by no meansas expansionary as had been hoped, and such measures take no direct account of regional imbalances in prosperity and unemployment.

title: Guerrillas Draining Mauritania's Slim Resources
description: NOUAKCHOTT, Mauritania, Nov. 20The resources of this desolate developing country in northwestern Africa are being drained by a military campaign to suppress Algeriansupported guerrillas of the Polisario Front.

title: Stage: William's Eecentricties
description: Perhaps the most eccentric thing about Tennessee Williams's new (yes new) and pungently atmospheric play The Eccentricities of a Nightingale is its provenance. It opened at the Morosco Theater last night and, I suspect like most people, I had been expecting a rewrite of Summer and Smoke. It is really no such thing, but a different play with different characters and even a different theme.

title: The Energy Challenge
description: Three years after the Arab oil embargo and fivefold price increaseand the many programs triggered by these events to achieve reduced American and allied dependence on imported oilthe United States is more vulnerable than in 1973.

title: Byrne Reaches Accord With Shapp On Levying of State Income Taxes
description: TRENTON, Nov. 23Governor Byrne announced today after a meeting in Harrisburg with Gov. Milton J. Shapp of Pennsylvania that they had signed a reciprocal tax agreement that would become effective if the New Jersey Legislature gave its approval.

title: Knicks Lose To Kings at The Buzzer
description: Two free throws by Brian Taylor with no time left gave the Kansas City Kings a 10098 victory over the Knicks last night at Madison Square Garden. Taylor, noted for his defense, was fouled by Walt Frazier after he had intercepted the Knick captain's inbound pass and raced for the basket.

title: Lynch Says Bronfman Assured Him He'd Get Aid if Things Went Wrong
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov.24 Mel Patrick Lynch testified today that Samuel Bronfman 2d had assured him that his father would have Mr. Lynch freed from jail and aided financially if anything were to go wrong in their plot to extort millions of dollars from the elder Mr. Bronfman.

title: Oratorio By Handel Presented
description: After his Messiah, and a long way after, the most popular of Handel's oratorios is Israel in Egypt. Scholars have always treated the work skittishly, with reason much of it was shamelessly plagiarized from such Handel contemporaries as Stradella, Karl and Erba. More importantly, the work as a whole is weakly constructed and lacking in narrative line.

title: CARTER SETS 1977 AIM OF 6% ECONOMY RISE AND A CUT IN JOBLESS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23Presidentelect Jimmy Carter said today that he had set a 6 percent growth in the nation's economy and a reduction of unemployment by at least 1.5 percentage points as goals for his administration in 1977.

title: A Paper, High in Quality, Has Fallen on Hard Times
description: LONDON, Nov. 24The Observer something of an institution in this country. It is a weekly, published on Sunday mornings, that generally runs to 36 pages.

title: To Help the Services
description: Most people know the United Service Organizations bring music, theater, Bob Hope, Martha Raye or Guys and Dolls to stages wherever people in the military are hungry for entertainment or a taste of home. But the U.S.O. brings far more than familiar sights and sounds to strange places. To the young wives of servicemen, who may be abroad for the first time, it offers a helping hand through its counseling programs. If children of the military are teenagers facing problems of adolescence, it brings an understanding ear through other counseling programs.

title: Chrysler Cuts Back On Sales Estimate
description: DETROIT, Nov. 23The Chrysler Corporation today lowered its estimate of 1977 model domestic new car sales by about 3 percent, or 300,000 units, because the new model year was starting at a slower pace than expected.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: Fried. Krupp G.m.b.h., announced in Essen, West Germany, yesterday that it had signed an agreement with Iran for that country to buy an interest in two Krupp subsidiaries in Brazil for $104.25 million.

title: Notice of Final Extension of Invitation for Tenders of All
description: Alison Mortgage Investment Trust (the Trust), a California business trust, has made a final and extension of its Invitation for Tenders of all of the Trust's outstanding 8% Senior Subordinated Notes May 15, 1979 (the Notes). issued pursuant to an Indenture dated as of May 15, 1973, in exchange for $300 cash net per $1,000 principal amount of Notes without payment of accrued interest, upon the terms and conditions forth in the Invitation for Tenders (the Invitation) and in the related Letter of Transmittal.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Meets at 10:30 A.M.

title: Brigsh at Geneva Talks Make New Offer to End Deadlock on Rhodesia
description: GENEVA, Nov. 23 (Reuters)Britain, seeking to break the deadlock at the Rhodesia conference here, today gave what appeared to be its firmest commitment so far that the breakaway British colony would achieve legal independence and black majority rule by March 1, 1978, conference sources said.

title: Television
description: Television

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: UP THE LADDER The trio of young people rendering foot light songs by Richard Maltby Jr. and David Shire in tonight's new cabaret hill at the uptown Manhattan Theater Club are already making names for themselves.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: DART EUROPE (Dart). Antwerp. Der. 2 and Le Havre 3, sails from Global Marine Terminal, N.J.

title: Georgia Banker Due For U.S. Budget Job
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23Presidentelect Jimmy Carter has selected Thomas Bartram Lance, president of the National Bank of Georgia, to be director of the Office of Management and Budget in his administration, a source in the Carter camp disclosed tonight.

title: A Housing Effort In Harlem is Seen As Model for U.S.
description: Lucille Rose, the New York City Employment Commissioner, urged the incorning Carter Administration yesterday to consider modeling a national jobsandhousing program on city efforts that have used unemployed persons to rehabilitate dilapidated buildings.

title: Israeli Housing for Gaza Refugees Spurs Friction With U.N.
description: GAZAFour months ago, Salim Kahlout, a Palestinian refugee, moved from a densely populated refugee camp in the teeming Gaza Strip to a modest house built by the Israeli Government that he is expanding to accommodate the 15 members of his family.

title: Open Interest
description: n contracts)

title: Bridge:
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 23Two successful young players on the tournament trail captured the life master men's pair title here last night at the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals. The two, Roger Bates of Las Vegas, Nev., and John Mohan of La Jolla, Calif., members of a team that has dominated national knockout competition for the last two years and will compete in January for the right to represent North America in the world championship, outdistanced the competition in the final session to win by a board and a half.

title: FELDMAN FAILS IN BID TO KILL INDICTMENTS
description: NEWARK, Nov. 23Senate President Matthew Feldman tried unsuccessfully today to have his indictment on charges of commercial bribery dismissed on the ground that the action against him Vas novel and inspired by his being a politician.

title: City Prepares For Holidays
description: City Prepares

title: Several Have Hand in Missed Dolphin Kick
description: MIAMI, Nov. 23 (UPI)In the aftermath of. last night's 1716 victory by Baltimore over Miami, the credit and blame for the key play were widespread. I blew it, said the Dolphinscenter, Jim Langer.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: Montreal 5, Islanders 1.

title: Trucker Arrested in Cargo Theft
description: CAMDEN, N.J., Nov. 23 (UPI) Camden man was arrested late yesterday and charged with transporting $6,000 worth of stolen paper towels. The man, Barry Moore, 24 years old was picked, up when he hitched his tractor to a trailer containing 400 cases of Scott Towels. They were stolen last week from a shipping platform in Eddystone, Pa.

title: Community Boards Given A Pledge of Consultation On Property Disposition
description: Community boards in New York City will be assured of a substantial voice in the disposition of cityowned property, Victor Marrero, chairman of the City Planning Ccmmission, promised yesterday.

title: BIANCA LEALE CERF
description: Bianca Leale Cerf, the founder and president of the Pelham United Nations Discussion Group, died Monday at New Rochelle Hospital. She was 72 years old and a resident of New Rochelle.

title: Cash Prices
description: (Price in N.Y. unless otherwise noted)

title: News Summary
description: The Observer, a London weekly with worldwide readership, is to be sold to Robert O. Anderson, chairman of the Atlantic Richfield Company, according to informed sources here. The oil company executive is said to have agreed to maintain its present character and editorial policy. [Page 1, Columns 23.]

title: Increased Marijuana Use is Found
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (AP)More than half this year's class of high school seniors tried marijuana and three out of 10 were users at graduation, according to Government surveys.

title: Warning Labels Proposed By Federal Drug Agency For Aerosol Spray Cans
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 23 (UPI)  The Food and Drug Administration today proposed putting warning labels on some one billion aerosol spray cans to tell consumers that they contain fluorocarbon gas that may harm public health and the environment.

title: Tyler to Coach South
description: STARKVILLE, Miss., Nov. 23 (AP)Bob Tyler, who coached the Mississippi State football team to a 92 wonlost record this year, will coach the South in the NorthSouth Shrine game on Dec. 17 at Pontiac, Mich.

title: Pound Shows a Decline As Dollar Gains in Europe; Gold Loses Some Ground
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 23 (UPI)  The pound declined again today but recovered somewhat in late trading and the dollar closed slightly higher on European money markets.

title: British Football
description: By Reuters

title: AntiSoviet Art Shown in Paris
description: PARISThe major surprise in the exposition of contemporaryand denouncedSoviet painting now being shown at the Palais des Congress here is how comfortably the persecuted painters of Moscow and Leningrad fit in the various currents of modern art.

title: Westchester Official to Ask Carter For Aid to His and Other Counties
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 23Alfred B. DelBello, the Westchester County Executive and the first major elected official in the state to support Jimmy Carter for President, is planning to ask the Carter Administration for substantial financial assistance for this and other counties.

title: Coach is Chief Casualty of Stanford's Quest for Football and Academic Heights
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Nov. 23The dramatic dismissal of Jack Christiansen as Stanford's football coach on the eve of last Saturday's Big Game again31. California made vivid the problems faced by even so rich and prestigious a school as Stanford in trying to maintain a major football program on a reasonable level. In a display of storybook emotion,. the Stanford players carried Christiansen on their shoulders onto the field before the game, and carried him off again after winning, 2724, with a touchdown in the last couple of minutes. That gave the teama 65 record, the fifth straight winning season of Christiansen's regime, and produced a flood of player comment praising the coach and expressing regret at the decision to buy up the remaining two years of his contract (at $27,500 a year).

title: DYSON URGES CHANGE IN OFFICIALS STATUS
description: John S. Dyson, the New York State Commissioner of Commerce, proposed yesterday that all middle managers in the state government be stripped of their Civil Service status to make them more effective, innovative and responsive to the needs of the public.

title: DOW OFF 6.57 T0 949.30
description: ment policy of Reynolds Securities, noted that despite yesterday's market weakness two groups of stocks improved slightlyrailroads and utility issues.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in early editions of The Times on Saturday reported incorrectly that the American Federation of Teachers and the National Education Association were merged nationally. Although there was a merger between affiliates of the two groups in New York State, the two organizations never merged nationally.

title: Malik, Soviet Delegate to the U.N., Relinquishes Post
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 23 (Reuters)Yakov A. Malik, the Soviet Union's chief delegate to the United Nations since 1968, has quietly relinquished his post and working in Moscow as a Deputy Foreign Minister, it was disclosed today.

title: Radio
Chess:
description: While most players prefer to have White, there still are those who do a considerable part of their winning as Black. These are the ones who, by temperament, do not care for forcing the play but would just as soon counter the opponent's maneuvers.

title: Books of The Times
description: If Diogenes went around with a lantern looking for an honest man, Norman Thomas carried a spotlight at the ready to shine on whatever was the injustice of the moment. In a life of 84 incredibly crowded, busy, dogooding years, he found a lot of dark corners in America, although the Socialist Party to which he devoted his life did little directly about any of them. He was an evangelical reformer, but his most effective opponent was reform. Franklin D. Roosevelt did in the Socialists more than any Wall Street plutocratsmore even than the party's own internal schisms, says W. A. Swanberg, author of this biography.

title: Carter Visits Hill to Get Acquainted
description: Carter Visits Hill to Get Acquainted

title: News Summary
description: The Observer, a London weekly with worldwide readership, is to be sold to Robert O. Anderson, chairman of the Atlantic Richfield Company, according to a spokesman for the oil concern. Mr. Anderson is said to have agreed to maintain its present character and editorial policy. [Page 1, Columns 23.]

title: People in Sports
description: With some of the money they've been saving by not getting into the bidding war for free agents, the New York Mets signed Jerry Koosman yesterday. The 32yearold leftbander, who won 20 games for the first time in his nineyear career last season and finished second in the Cy Young Award voting to Randy Jones of San Diego, signed a threeyear contract reportedly worth close to $150,000 a year.

title: Jets Plan to Start Todd Again
description: Richard Todd will start again as the Jets quarterback Sunday against the firstplace Baltimore Colts, but Coach Lou Holtz promised the secondplace New England Patriots that Joe Namath would continue to take over early in the game.

title: Factory Brings Sculptors Massive Dreams to Fruition
description: NORTH HAVEN, Conn.Claes Oldenburg wants to turn City Island into a huge piece of sculpture.

title: Cards Need Victory Tomorrow, But Cowboys Are Favored by 5
description: There will be two pro games televised tomorrow, Buffalo at. Detroit (Channnel 4) at 12:30 P.M. and St. Louis at Dallas (Channel 2) at 3:30 P.M. The first is just another game, but the second could be something special.

title: Mondale Names Press Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (AP) Albert Eisele, a Washington correspondent for the KnightRidder newspapers, was named press secretary today to Vice Presidentelect Walter F. Mondale, Mr. Mondal's office said that Mr. Eisele. 40 years old, a native of Blue Earth, Minn., wold also have a policy and advisory role.

title: Israelis, in Warning To Syrians, Display Arms Near Lebanon
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 23Israel paraded tanks and armored personnel carriers on its side of the Lebanese border today in a new warning to Syrian troops and Palestinian guerrillas not to approach the frontier.

title: Publicity Drive to Urge Flu Shots
description: A countrywide publicity campaign aimed at convincing more people to take the swine influenza shots was announced here yesterday by Dr. W. Delano Meriwether, director of the Federal immunization program.

title: Boston U. Linebacker Dies of Anesthetic Allergy
description: BOSTON, Nov. 23 (AP)A Boston University football player, Tony Danckert, of Clarksville. N.Y., who was in the hospital to have his fractured leg reset, died today ate r he had an adverse react ion to an a nest het lc.

title: Factory Brings Sculptors' Massive Dreams to Fruition
description: NORTH HAVEN, Conn.Claes Oldenburg wants to turn City Island into a huge piece of sculpture.

title: Fighting the Mob
description: An interesting battle is raging behind the scenes at the Department of Justice that underscores the importance of a little noted but critical task that will confront Presidentelect Carter soon after he takes office. Richard L. Thornburgh, the Assistant Attorney General in charge of the Criminal Division, is moving to Luck the hitherto fairly independent strike forces against organized crime under the wings of the United States Attorneys in a number of major cities around the country. He is being accused of undermining the present method of attack on organized crime and of attempting to tie the new Administration to his own notions of how organized crime ought to be dealt with.

title: Israelis, in Warning To Syrians, Display Arms Near Lebanon
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 23Israel paraded tanks and armored personnel carriers on its side of the Lebanese border today in a new warning to Syrian troops and Palestinian guerrillas not to approach the frontier.

title: A Losing Bidder for The Observer Puts the Selling Price at Nothing
description: It was always considered, even by its shrillest critics, to be a jewel of British journalism. But in recent years, it suffered financial misfortunes, and almost inevitably, The Observer of London was out up for sale.

title: In a Shattered Lebanese Town, Refugees and Fear
description: DAMUR, Lebanon, Nov. 23In this shattered town on the Mediterranean, as in many towns and villages in Lebanon, the civil war has produced only losers.

title: Columbia and Harvard Ask Funds To Save Centers for Soviet Study
description: The presidents of Columbia and Harvard announced yesterday the start of an unusual joint $8 million fund drive to save the Russian study centers at the two universities from what one of the educators called slow financial strangulation.

title: World News Briefs
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 23 (AP)Government troops, backed by artillery and air strikes, seized a Communist guerrilla camp and killed about 20 insurgents in a major sweep along the ThaiMalaysian border, a military spokesman said today.

title: Advertising
description: Certainly among the more enjoyable commercial interruptions are the musical moments with Petula Clark promoting the various products of Burlington Industries.

title: People and Business
description: Frank Borman was named chairman of Eastern Air Lines yesterday, effective Dec. 15, and will retain his position as president and chief executive officer.

title: Suit Opposes Demolition Of the West Side Highway From Jane to 26th Street
description: The West Side Ad Hoc Committee Against the Interstate Highway and 50 other plaintiffs opposed to the Westway plan filed suit in United States District Court in Manhattan yesterday to block announced plans for demolition of the old, elevated West Side Highway between Jane and 26th Streets.

title: Banker Due to Get Carter Budget Post]
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23Presidentelect Jimmy Carter has selected Thomas Bartram Lance, president of the National Bank of Georgia, to be director of the Office of Management and Budget in his administration, a source in the Carter camp disclosed tonight.

title: CARTER APPOINTS 131 TO SPEED TRANSITION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 A strong hint about the shape and priorities of the new Carter administration emerged today with the release of a list of 131 people who will conduct the transition of power from Gerald R. Ford to Jimmy Carter.

title: FORD AIDES TRY TO END GASOLINE PRICE CURB
description: The Ford Administration proposed yesterday the elimination of all controls on the price of gasoline, despite expected opposition from the Democraticcontrolled Congress.

title: Wandering Bull Sold To Help Pay Its Way
description: SHARPSTOWN, Nov. 23 (UPI)A bull found wandering in the streets of a Salem County community went on the auction block today to help pay the costs of its room and board.

title: Cloud From China
description: The greatest danger from the radioactive cloud that has just passed over the Northeast and moved out to sea lies in the casual way it has been treated. One left with the impression that so long as the nuclear cloud did not encounter rain en route, it presented no problem. Thanks to the weather, there was no serious fallout from China's most recent atmospheric nuclear test (the second in two months)so the less said about it, the better.

title: Islanders Bow to Candiens, Ending 10Game Streak 51
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Nov. 23The irresistible force beat the immovable object again.

title: 10 ARAB OIL NATIONS SEEK PRICE ACCORD
description: KUWAIT, Nov. 23 (AP)Ten Arab oil nations met today to seek a common position on oil prices, but they appeared far apart on the amount of increase they would seek when the oil cartel meets next month. Iraq said it insisted on 25 percent, while some want an increase held to 10 percent or less.

title: East German Payment Offer to Jewish Victims of Nazis is Rejected
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23An East German offer of $1 million in compensation for East German Jewish victims of Nazi persecution now living in the United States has been rejected by the New Yorkbased organization designated by the American Government to negotiate restitution.

title: Police Say They Took No Notes On Witness in Rubin Carter Trial
description: PATERSON, N.J., Nov. 23A police captain and a detective to whom Alfred P. Bello first identified Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis as the Lafayette Bar and Grill gunmen testified today that they made no notes during their meetings with Mr. Bello in the summer months that followed the June 1966 triple slaying.

title: DELAY OF VOTE ENDS BANGLADESH ANXIETY
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 23The decision by the martiallaw Government of Bangladesh to postpone indefinitely the parliamentary elections that were to have been held early next year ends months of uncertainty, during which political pressure has been building against the threeman military junta.

title: Neighborhoods: The FishBay Association Is the Mortar of a Tightly Knit Community
description: Within a week after a family or a per son moves into tile northern Bronx community roughly bounded by Boston, Gunhill and Eastchester Roads, a small committee from the FishBay Neighborhood Association pays a welcoming visit.

title: U.N. Calls on Israelis to Rescind Resettlement of Gaza Strip Arabs
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 23By an overwhelming vote, the General Assembly today called on Israel to halt refugee resettlement efforts in the Gaza Strip and immediately return all the Palestinian refugees of Gaza to their old camps.

title: Chief Auditor in Canada Questions Use of Funds To Promote Atom Sales
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 23 (AP)An official Canadian report made public today raised questions about payments totaling $10.5 million by a Governmentowned company to promote the sale of nuclear power plants to Argentina and South Korea.

title: JUSTICE DEPT. ASKS F.C.C. INVESTIGATION OF 3 TV NETWORKS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (AP)The Justice Department asked the Federal Communications Commission today to investigate whether the three major television networks should be forced to sell some or all of the television stations they own and operate. It also urged the F.C.C. to investigate whether, the three networks dominate the programming decisions of their affiliated stations.

title: Honoring Galanos in Retrospect 25 Years in the Lap of Luxury
description: It was one of those fashion celebrations that everybody will remember. James Galanos, 52, acknowledged by practically everybody as the genius among American fashion designers, was honored at the Fashion Institute of Technology last night with a retrospective show covering his 25 years in the business.

title: In Rural Georgia, a Prep Boarding School for Blacks
description: KEYSVILLE, Ga.When a traveler heading South down the Jefferson Davis Highway here in rural Georgia sees the road sign pointing the way to Boggs Academy, his first thought is that it is just another of toe seg academies the allwhite private schools that have sprung up across the South since the school desegregation orders.

title: CARTER SETS 1977 AIM OF 6% ECONOMY RISE AND A CUT IN JOBLESS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23Presidentelect Jimmy Carter said today that he had set a 6 percent growth in the nation's economy and a reduction of unemplopyment by at least 1.5 percentage points as goals for his administration in1977.

title: The $1Billion Payoff
description: The agreement among parties in the moratorium dispute to work toward a joint solution of the courtordered SIbillion payoff suggests that city and state officials are trying to manage this latest budget crisis without immediate resort t r fresh Federal aid. This is all to the good, since in any case it would be impossible to obtain such aid before the Dec. 15 target settlement date.

title: ATTORNEY FOR BANK AGREES TO NEGOTIATE ON NEW YORK'S NOTES
description: The attorney for the bank that successfully challenged New York City's moratorium on repaying its shortterm notes agreed yesterday to try to devise by Dec. 15 a joint proposal with the city and state for the repayment of $1 billion due.

title: Macy's Makes Sunday Selling Permanent; Finds It Good for City and Employment
description: Sunday operations at Macy's Herald Square store, the area's largest, and at the Macy group's other 15 stores in the state, have passed the test phase and will now be permanent at all those stores, the heads of the parent company, R. H. Macy & Company Inc., said yesterday after the annual meeting.

title: CORRECTION
description: The inadvertent omission of the word not reversed the meaning of an item in the Metropolitan Briefs column in The Times yesterday. The item should have said that Community Board 7 had demanded that the Bridge. Inc., not move its mentalhealth facility into the Brewster Hotel at 21 West 86th Street until all feasible alternatives have been explored and the board had given final approval to a new location.

title: FORD AIDES TRY TO END GASOLINE PRICE CURB
description: The Ford Administration proposed yesterday the elimination of all controls on the price of gasoline, despite expected opposition from the Democraticcontrolled Congress.

title: Giants Hicks In Rebuttal To Critics
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., Nov. 23 John Hicks's left leg and Jack Gregory's right leg were in hot water together today at the Giants training camp.

title: Politicians Find G.O.P. Fighting For Its Survival
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23In the wake of the 1976 election, the Republican Party is fighting for survival, according to political professionals of both major parties and is perhaps closer to extinction than ever before in its 122year history.

title: Notes on People
description: Ali Landon, the 1936 Republican Presidential candidate, had some words of praise and advice for President Ford this week, based on Mr. Landon's own career. You fought a good fight and on your record deserved to win, Mr. Landon wrote to the President. After each Presidential election the Republican standard bearer has had the responsibility of continuing to lead the party. But it is not always assumed that leadership goes with the Presidential candidate, Mr. Landon said, pointing out that after his own defeat by President Roosevelt 40 years ago, President Hoover, who had been defeated by Mr. Roosevelt four years earlier, had tried unsuccessfully to promote aninterim Republican National Convention. It was obvious that Herbert Hoover was interested in trying to get himself back in the position of trying to run the party instead of me, Mr. Landon said in an interview.

title: Andre Malraux, 75, Dies in Paris; Writer, War Hero, de Gaulle Aide
description: PARIS, Nov. 23  Andr Malraux, writer, hero of the French Resistance in World War II and President de Gaulle's longtime Minister of Culture, died today at the age of 75.

title: Likable London Philharmonic
description: The London Philharmonic Orchestra, which presented the second of its two Carnegie Hall concerts Monday night, is not one of the very greatest orchestras of the world. But this was still about as enjoyable an orchestral concert as this listener has heard in a good long time.

title: Tandy Informs S.E.C. 01 Questioned Deals And Contributions
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23The Tandy Corporation, operator of 3,000 Radio Shack stores across the country, has informed the Securities and Exchange Commission of $2.65 million of questionable transactions, including $850,000 in booking commissions apparently paid illegally by shipping companies.

title: Bowling Green Coach Quits
description: BOWLING GREEN, Ohio, Nov. 23 (AP)The Bowling Green football coach, Don Nehlen, citing a wave of negativism on campus and in the community, resigned last night after the school's football dinner. Nehlen compiled a wonlosttied record of 53354 in nine seasons, including a 65 mark this year.

title: Politicians Find G.O.P. Fighting For Its Survival
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23In the wake of the 1976 election, the Republican Party is fighting for survival, according to political professionals of both major parties and is perhaps closer to extinction than ever before in its 122year history.

title: EXPERTS WIDEN STUDY OF FLU IN MISSOURI
description: WASHINGTON Nov. 23Health officers are surveying pigs as well as people in and around Concordia. Mo. in efforts to gauge the significance of the first confirmed human case of swine influenza since the outbreak at Fort Dix in February.

title: UConn, Hartwick Told to Play Tomorrow in Soccer
description: A National Collegiate Athletic Association committee ruled yesterday that the soccer game between Connecticut and Hartwick, for a berth in the N.C.A.A. semifinals, he played tomorrow. The decision was not received favorably by either team, but it was made necessary because the schools could not reach agreement themselves on a playing date before the Sunday night deadline.

title: In Rural Georgia, a Prep Boarding School for Blacks
description: KEYSVILLE, Ga.When a traveler heading South down the Jefferson Davis Highway here in rural Georgia sees the road sign pointing the way to Boggs Academy, his first thought is that it is just another of the seg academies the allwhite private schools that have sprung up across the South since the schooldesegregation orders.

title: A Fashionable Store Accents Fashions for the Home
description: So chic have cooking and entertaining become that it is no surprise when a fashion department store clears off 18,000 precious square feet of selling space and turns it over to things for the home.

title: New Tourney to Replace World Open on Golf Tour
description: PINEHURST, N. C. Nov. 23 (AP)The fouryearold World open golf tournament at the Pinehurst Country Club will be replaced by a new, richer tournament next August, it was announced today. Its place on the Professional Golfers Association tour schedule will be taken by the ColgateHall of Fame classic, a 72hole, $250,000 tournament to be played Aug. 25 through 28. First prize will be $50,000.

title: 3 ELDERLY RESIDENTS OF S.I. MUGGED AGAIN
description: Three elderly people were neaten and robbed in a Staten Island housing projec yesterday. All three had been mugged be fore within the last year.

title: Lysenko, Science Overlord Under Stalin, Dead at 78
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 23 (Reuters)Trofim D. Lysenko, an agriculturist who dominated much of Soviet science under Stalin but was later attacked as a charlatan, died on Saturday at the age of 78, the Government newspaper Izvestia reported today.

title: New Bache Head Asks a Study Of Earlier Big Board Opening
description: Harry A. Jacobs Jr., who was elected chief executive officer of Bache Halsey Stuart yesterday, called for a study to determine the feasibility of opening the New York Stock Exchange at 9:30 A.M., instead of the current 10 A.M. opening.

title: AliBobick is Blocked by NortonBobick
description: The only sure thing about the Muhammad AliDuane Bobick fight is that it isn't a sure thing.

title: New Books
description: A Death in Canaan, by Joan Barthel, with an introduction by Wiliam Styron (Dutton, $9.95). The murder case of Peter Reilly.

title: Nuestro New York! Revue By Miss Artau, Portrays Grit
description: It is too early to look critically at Estrella Artau, a writer, composer and performer who is the leading spirit behind the Spanishlanguage revue Nuestro New York! playing at the INTAR Theater.

title: Censored Version Issued Of Secret Hoover Files On Officials Misconduct
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (AP)  The Justice Department shed another glimmer of light today on J. Edgar Hoover's secret files on rumors about sexual escapades by members of Congress and other prominent persons.

title: O.E.C,D, FORECASTS ASSAILED BY FRANCE AND WEST GERMANY
description: PARIS, Nov. 23France and West. Germany took issue today with what they consider excessively pessimistic forecasts of their economic growth next year by the staff of the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development.

title: Three Burned in New Jersey Fire
description: VINELAND, N.J., Nov. 23 (UPI)A man and two of his three children were burned last night in a fire that damaged their home. The man, John Koerkel, 36 years old, of East Chestnut Avenue, Buena Vista, was admitted to Newcomb Hospital in serious condition with multiple burn. His children, Christine, 11, and Andrew S, were in satisfactory condition with burns of the hands. The police said the man's wife and a third child escaped from the fire. The cause of the fire was not determined.

title: Making It, as a Black, at Harvard and Radcliffe
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  So much has been written about the illegitimacy of special recruiting efforts for minority students, black students disillusionment and reverse discrimination that the mere presence of blacks at selective institutions has more and more begun to imply substandard credentials or relaxed admissions policies. Why is this? One reason is the almost total absence of newsmedia coverage of the successes of black students. This onesided coverage has, in many cases, become an excuse for inaction and a belief that nothing can be done without lowering the standards.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: El Salvador's former army chief of Staff, Col. Manuel Alfonso Rodriguez, was sentenced yesterday to 10 years in prison for his role in a plot to supply 10,000 sub machine guns to gangsters, who were in fact, undercover agents for the Treasury Department. Judge Kevin T. Duffy of Federal District Court in Manhattan told Colonel Rodriguez: You have brought shame to yourself  you have brought shame to your country and you have violated my country. The colonel was convicted last Oct. 8.

title: U.S. Shipowners and Federal Aides Deplore Low Soviet Shipping Rates
description: Government and shipping leaders yesterday renewed charges that predatory rate practices of the Soviet merchant fleet and its steady growth in recent years were damaging the role of American flag lines in ocean trade.

title: Thanksgiving Day
description: Tomorrow is Thanksgiving Day, and most post offices, schools, banks, stock and commodity exchanges, government offices and most businesses and stores will be closed. Sunday parking rules will be in effect.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Nov. 24A New YorkNew Jersey joint legislative committee will hear testimony from Federal, state and regional experts on Dec. 7 to find to speed the closing of the Atlantic Ocean as a dumping ground for raw sewage and sludge.

title: Pattern of Life in Saudi Arabia Is Becoming Swifter and More Complex Under Khalid
description: JIDDA, Saudi ArabiaThe pattern of life has been changing in this wealthy desert kingdom since King Khalid succeeded his murdered brother, King Faisal, last year. It has grown more complex, mnra swift in snore ways more harsh.

title: Scranton Charges Soviet Attempt To Manipulate Developing Nations
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 24William W. Scranton, the United States delegate, warned third world countries today against what he said were Soviet attempts to manipulate them.

title: Reilly Freed in Mother's Murder As Suppressed Evidence Is Bared
description: LITCHFIELD, Conn., Nov. 24Charges against Peter A. Reilly in the murder of his mother were dropped here today after the new State's Attorney announced that he had discovered evidence in the files of his predecessor that tended to clear the youth.

title: Job Complaint Backlog
description: The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission still faces a backlog of 122,000 complaints, despite efforts to cut it down. Page 47.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Doctors offices were closed in the Spanishspeaking neighborhoods of Hudson County yesterday to protest the sentencing of Dr. Ramon Garay of Union City on Medicaid fraud charges. One hundred people, including most of the Cubanborn doctors in the area, filled the courtroom and shouted their disapproval of the action.

title: Israelis Seek ChristianHeld Lebanon Border Zone
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 24Israeli officials are promoting the idea that the best way to avert a confrontation between Israeli and Syrian forces at the Lebanese border would be the creation of a buffer zone patrolled by Lebanese forces responsible to President Elias Sarkis.

title: Navy and NASA Indicate Interest in Reactivating Hughes's Big Plane
description: LONG SEAM Calif.. Nov. 24 (AP)Hidden 29 years in a cavernous hangar, Howard R. Hughes's giant wooden flying boat, the Spruce Goose, is getting a new look from Government officials who say they may try to send it aloft.

title: U.N. Backs Palestinians on Issue Of Rights in Israel and Own State
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 24The General Assembly formally proclaimed today the right of Palestinian Arab refugees to establish their own state and to reclaim their former homes and properties in what has become the state of Israel.

title: For Active Opposition
description: DALLASThe Democratic Ins have 2,200 slots to fill, and the Republican Outs have only one. Curiously, political interest focuses on who shall be the chairman of the Republican National Committee.

title: World News Briefs
description: MANILA, Nov. 24Guerrillas of the Communist New People's Army raided a town near here today to seize guns. The attack was the first organized guerrilla action in the Manila area since martial law began in 1972 to counter what was officially described as a Communist threat.

title: TRUDEAU GIVES PLEA FOR CANADIAN UNITY; HINTS BID TO QUEBEC
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 24Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau, his position shaken by the overwhelming victory of the separatist party in the Quebec provincial elections last week, appealed to Canadians tonight for a renewal of national unity.

title: Progress in UNESCO
description: In a lowkeyed opening address at the general conference of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization in Nairobi early this month, Ambassador John Reinhardt of the United States made an eloquent plea for halting the politicization of UNESCO and returning the agency to the specialized work implied by its title. The conference has not attained that lofty objective, but it has brought UNESCO part of the way back.

title: BIANCA LEALE CERF
description: Bianca Leale Cerf, the founder and president of the Pelham United Nations Discussion Group, died Monday at New Rochelle Hospital. She was 72 years old and a resident of New Rochelle.

title: PAUL W. WARD DEAD AT 71 ; WON PULITZER PRIZE IN 48
description: Paul W. Ward, a former Baltimore Sun, reporter who won a Pulitzer Prize for overseas reporting died yesterday at Georgetown University Hospital in Washington. He was 71 years old.

title: Phone Service With Lower Rates For Some Users Regins Saturday
description: NEWARK, Nov. 24Starting Saturday, New Jersey telephone users can reduce the cost of their basic monthly service by up to 30 percent simply by going to a business office and asking for a new a lifeline rate, the State Board of Public Ulilily Commissioners announced today.

title: 'Shout' Whispers on Screen
description: At the start of "Shout at the Devil" the viewers, who are about to see a lot of elephant hunting, are told that "not a single animal was injured." The collapsing beasts were shot with stupefying darts.The audience at "Shout," an adventure film that opened yesterday at showcase theaters, is treated with similar humaneness. No injuries, a thorough use of stupefying darts and some mild entertainment. There are about 60 minutes of mild entertainment, along with a few first-rate effects, in a film that is an incredible 128 minutes long.The movie is set in East Africaalthough, in fact, it was shot in South Africajust before and during World War I. It is divided into fairly distinct parts. In the first, we follow the adventures of Flynn (Lee Marvin), an alcoholic ivory poacher who lives on a plantation in Mozambique with his daughter, Rosa (Barbara Parkins), and does his ivory hunting across the border in Tanganyika, then held by the Germans.Flynn, joined by an expatriate Englishman, Sebastian, has some rough encounters with the local German district commissioner, Fleischer, who likes to shoot and hang people. In between sorties, Sebastian marries Rosa after a protracted and mock-comic fistfight with her father.In the second part, war is declared and Fleischer crosses the border, sets fire to Flynn's house, and kills Sebastian and Rosa's baby. This turns Rosa into a woman with the single obsession of killing Fleischer; meanwhile the three are sent by the British Navy to scout out a German battle-cruiser hidden up a river, and then to blow it up. These things are eventually accomplished.The movie has too much plot. All that action, conducted by characters without characterexcept for Fleischer, whose childlike joy in hurting people is almost appealing  produces lethargy. Roger Moore is rather good as Sebastian, a muted Errol Flynn type, but Miss Parkins plays her part with the verve of a damp rope. And Lee Marvin, who does toughness well enough, is insufferable when he is trying to be the comic Irishman. His doubletakes come like delayed mail.All this said, the movie has its compensations. Rene Kolldehoff, as Fleischer, manages to be entertaining in his exaggerated villainy, and there is a lovely slow chase when, in an ancient paddle-boat steamer, he pursues Marvin, in a sailing dhow, down a winding jungle river. There is a good head-on charge by a crocodile, and the blowing-up of the warship has moments of interest and excitement. The movie is a passable midget in absurdly long pants."Shout" has been rated PG ("Parental Guidance Suggested"). There are some fairly graphic scenes of natives being shot, and one that depicts, although we don't actually see it, a baby being thrown into a fire. Nevertheless, the film seems suitable for all but very young children.

title: Andre Malraux Is Buried Without Any Ritual, Conforming to His Wish
description: PARIS, Nov. 24  Andre Malraux, who died yesterday or lung cancer at the age of 7?? was buried today at the cemetery of VerrieresleBluisson, not far from Park.

title: A FourDay Weekend
description: A fourday Thanksgiving weekend lies ahead for many New Yorkers. The public schools and Board of Education offices will be closed today and tomorrow. Libraries, banks, department stores and most other businesses and offices will be closed today, along with stock and commodity exchanges.

title: The Transition
description: Transition has become the fashionable word Washington. The interval between the election in early November and the inauguration of the new President on Jan. 20 was once a mere timespan in which the Presidentelect chose his Cabinet and personal staff has evolved into an elaborate process in which scores of individuals are involved, the names and qualifications of thousands of others are being sorted out by computer, and $2 million will be expended.

title: Sports Today
description: Suns vs. Washington Bullets, at Phoenix. (TelevisionChannel 2, 1 P.M.)

title: Children on Runway, And Chaos Everywhere
description: There were thumbsuckers and balkers, absolute hams who waved at the crowd and tried to get back on the runway yelling Wanna do it again Three hundred parents, sisters and brothers, grandmothers and nextdoor neighbors, armed with Instamatics, jostled to get pictures of Lesie or Jonathan or Jennifer. Flashbulbs popped as fathers called out Alexis, look over here Professional, photographers hardly had a chance.

title: Ellis Is Guest of Chamber Society
description: Osan Ellis, the Welsh harpist, was guest of the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center in its Tuesday concert at Alice Tully Hall (and for the preceding companion event on Sunday afternoon), and he was soloist in three works of different character that added much charm to the program.

title: BUSH WILL QUIT C.I.A. ON INAUGURATION DAY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24George W. Bush announced today that he was resigning as Director of Central Intelligence effective Jan. 20, the day President Ford will leave office.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP)A Federal grand jury in Portland, Ore., returned an ?? piracy indictment today in the case of the man known as Dan Cooper, who parachuted from an air liner with $200,000 on Thanksgiving Eve in 1971, the Justice Department announced. The indictment named a fictitions John Doe also known as Dan Cooper.

title: Steel Prices Raised By 2 Big Producers; U.S. Orders Inquiry
description: Two major steelmakers announced yesterday that they would raise the price of sheet steelused by the automobile, appliance and construction industriesby about 6 percent on Dec. 1.

title: Books of The Times
description: Lord knows it's easy to fault people for their mistreatment of the English language, as the newscaster Edwin Newman continues to do indefatigably in A Civil Tongue, a sequel to his widely read first book, Strictly Speaking: Will America Be the Death of English? Good language requires clear thought, as teachers of composition Used to tell us in the days when composition was still taught; and it's as hard to think clearly as it is to identify your feelings, which takes about a lifetime of groping here and there in the murky interior of your behavior. As the compositionteachers also used to say, one's writing style reflects one's character, or, more succinctly, the style is the man.

title: About New York
description: The pilgrims keep coming, blemished by jet lag now, but with the same timelessly tight grasp on their possessions and anxious eve for this new place, America. Customs agents seized a cooked chicken with a friendly apology, and some apples, too, but otherwise the group of 49 Soviet Jews who arrived on Alitalia Flight 610 moved into this new land largely unnoticed Tuesday night.

title: Delivery Boy Is Accused of Rape; Returning Husband Rescues Wife
description: A 16yearold delivery boy was charged with assault, robbery and rape yesterday in an attack on a 25yearold East Side woman who was rescued by her husband when he arrived home from work and found the youth menacing his wife with a knife, the police reported.

title: NEW YORK OFFICIALS SUGGEST NEW BONDS TO PAY NOTEHOLDERS
description: The outlines of a possible plan that would enable New York City to repay the holders of $1 billion in shortterm notes without involving the Federal Government were presented yesterday to the city's bankers and union leaders.

title: 2 Women Are Wounded By a Sniper's Pellets At 10th Ave. Intersection
description: A sniper armed with a pellet gun shot and slighly wounded two women in midtown Manhattan last night, according to the police, who were at the scene invesigating the first shooting when the second shot was fired.

title: News Summary
