description: An earthquake in eastern Turkey took at least 574 lives, according to first reports, and the government said the total could be at least: 3,000. Striking at midafternoon in Van Province, was recorded at 7.9 on the Richter scalethe same intensity as the shock that killed 30,000 in the Erzincan area in December 1939. [Page 1. Cols. [56.]

title: People in Sports
description: The National Collegiate Athletic Association will present Mayor Tom Bradley of Los Angeles with the annual Theodore Roosevelt award, the N.C.A.A.'s highest honor, at the association's annual luncheon on Jan. 11 in Miami Beach, it was announced yesterday. Bradley, an outstanding middledistance runner on the University of California, Los Angeles, track team in 1938 through 1940, was selected for the Teddy, which goes each year to a person for whom competitive athletics in college and attention to physical wellbeing thereafter have been important factors in a distinguished career of national significance and achievement. Bradley became the first black mayor of Los Angeles in 1972, following a career as a Los Angeles policeman and councilman.

title: Publicity Drive Set By City University To Bar Beame Cuts
description: The newly reconstituted Board of Higher Education is initiating a publicity campaign to generate public support for keeping $94.3 million that the Beame administration has proposed to cut from next year's budget for the 10 senior colleges of the City University of New York.

title: MCA IS FINED $5,000 ON BARRY GRAY TALK
description: Radio station WMCA was fined $5,000 earlier this year by the Federal Communications Commission for permitting Barry Gray, the talkshow moderator, to promote Greek tourism without logging his promotional remarks as commercials.

title: A Businessman And a Humanist
description: A few years ago Robert C. Anderson, chairman of the Atlantic Richfield Company, learned that Sinclair Oil was being threatened by an unfriendly takeover attempt lie Immediately called the head of Sinclair and told him that if he needed help, Atlantic was ready to act. Two days later the chairman of Sinclair, Pendleton Thomas, called back, and within four days of the original conversation the two oil giants had agreed to merge. By that time Bob Anderson was already off on an expedition in the Western wilds.

title: Cassidy Wins on Decision
description: Alightheavyweight boxing contender, Bobby Cassidy of Levittown, L. I., avenged his defeat at the hands of Ramon Ranquello last May with a unanimous 10round decision over Ranquello last night at Sunnyside Arena. Cassidy cut Ranquello, of Union City, N. J., over the left eye in the final round. He used a right jab and strong combinations to keep Ranquello retreating throughout the bout.

title: Infant Deaths High in Indonesia
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Nov. 24 (Reuters) About 14. percent of all Indonesian babies die of malnutrition and disease within a year of birth, Health Minister G. A. Siwabessy said at a conference of Asian pharmacists here.

title: ERNEST L. IRIAN, 70, FORMER MACY CHIEF
description: Ernest L. Molloy, former director and chief executive, officer of R. H. Macy & Co. Inc., died Tuesday in San Francisco after a brief illness. He was 70 years old and lived in Incline Village, Nev.

title: Justice Dept. Cites Antitrust Issue In U.S.Soviet Accord on Shipping
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24The Justice Department has attacked on antitrust grounds a major, informal shipping agreement between the United States and the Soviet Union that would bring the fastgrowing Russian fleet into world ratesetting conferences, it was disclosed today.

title: Pro Transactions
description: CALIFORNIA (AL)Signed Bobby Grid), sec. and baseman, as free agent.

title: Rutgers Favored to Stay Unbeaten
description: If Rutgers beats Colgate tonight at Giants Stadium and Pittsburgh defeats Penn State tomorrow night in Pittsburgh, it will be the first time since 1940 that two Eastern major college football teams managed to get through the same regular season undeated and untied.

title: Thanksgiving 355 Years Later: Indians Sue for Land
description: MASHPEE, Mass., Nov. 24When the Pilgrims sat down to their first Thanksgiving in New England 355 years ago, Massasoit, the leader of the Wampanoag Indians, and 90 of his braves sat among them and provided five deer for the feast. The festival celebrated not only survival through the first harsh winter and the gathering of the harvest, but also the friendship and help of the Indians.

title: Bank Lends Carter 51 Million
description: PLAINS, Ga., Nov. 24 (UPI)The National Bank of Georgia, headed by Mr. Lance, has given loan credit of more than $1 million to Mr. Caner and his family for construction of a peanut sheller and a warehouse, Mr. Carter's, office said today.

title: Jury Told Mrs. Friedgood Spoke On Phone 8 Hours After Death
description: NIINEOLA, L. I. Nov. 24A key de Tense witness in the murder trial of Dr. Charles E. Friedgood testified today that she had spoken to Sophie Friedgood on the telephone eight hours after the prosecution contends that the woman had been killed by her husband.

title: Cause to Give Thanks
description: In his two terms as President, Thomas Jefferson refused to issue the annual Thanksgiving Proclamation that had already come to be a Presidential ritual. A reading of the often pompous sermonettes that have over the years emanated from the White House gives some justification for Jefferson's view of such official notices as monarchical practice.

title: Switzerland Arrests 2 On Espionage Charge.
description: GENEVA, Nov. 24 (UPI)Swiss authorities today announced the arrest of a man and a woman on charges of working for Soviet espionage agents employed at the International Labor Organization and the Geneva offices of Aeroflot, the Soviet national airline.

title: Kennedy and Franks Get Top Cub Posts
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 24 (UPI)Bob Kennedy took charge of the Chicago Cubs baseball operations today and immediately announced a switch in field managers, replacing Jim Marshall with 63yearold Herman Franks.

title: West German Bank Robbers Seized With $900,000 After Police Chase
description: FULDA, West Germany, Nov. 24 (Reuters)Two bank robbers who escaped with two hostages and $900,000 were arrested here today, and the police said all the money was recovered.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Liggett Group Inc. of Durham, N.C., announced yesterday that it had reported to the Securities and Exchange Commission results of an investigation that uncovered questionable foreign payments by subsidiaries, as well as gratuities and rebates totaling $252,000 from Jan. 1, 1971, to Sept. 30, 1976. The company produces cigarettes, alcoholic beverages and food.

title: Steel Prices Raised By 2 Big Producers; U.S. Orders Inquiry
description: Two major steelmakers announced yesterday that they would raise the price of sheet steelused by the automobile, appliance and construction industriesby about 6 percent on Dec. 1.

title: Tremor Felt in Soviet Armenia
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 24 (Reuters)Tremors from the earthquake in eastern Turkey were felt in cities and towns across the Soviet republic of Armenia today but no damage was reported, the press agency Tass??said.

title: Virgil Thomson Vigorous at 80
description: Virgil Thomson is 80 years old today, but he does not seem unduly weighed down by age. We live a long time in my family. the distinguished American composer and critic said cheerily the other day. MY sister's 91. She's in a nursing home now because she broke both lees. We do fall down.

title: LABORITES TO PRESS INDUSTRY TAKEOVER
description: LONDON, Nov. 24 (Reuters)Britain's Labor Government today declared its determination to nationalize the aircraft and shipbuilding industries despite opposition in Parliament.

title: Alleged Warning of Danger Before Chicle Plant Blast Is Being Checked
description: A deputy chief fire marshal said last night that the Fire Department had begun to investigate a report that the American Chicle Company in Long Island City, Queens had been warned in 1975 that its continued use of volatile chemical dust as a gummachine lubricant could cause an explosion.

title: ALEXANDER'S NET IS DOWN 25% IN FISCAL QUARTER
description: Alexander's Inc., a leading New York area retailer, told its shareholders at the annual meeting in Paramus, N. J., yesterday that its net profit in the first fiscal quarter ended Oct, 23 declined about 25 percent from the yearearlier level.

title: Publicity Drive Set By City University To Bar Beame Cuts
description: The newly reconstituted Board of Higher Education is initiating a publicity campaign to generate public support for keeping $94.3 million that the Beame administration has proposed to cut from next year's budget for the 10 senior colleges of the City University of New York.

title: Brezhnev Ends Rumanian Parley
description: BUCHAREST, Rumania. Nov. 24Leonid 1. Brezhnev today ended three days of talks with Rumanians with a call for unity and cohesion among the Soviet Union and its East European allies.

title: MAJOR QUAKE STRIKES EASTERN TURKEY AREA; TOLL MAY REACH 3,000
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Nov. 24A major earthquake struck a mountainous area of eastern Turkey today, and the Government said the death toll could be at least 3,000.

title: LEGION ILLNESS STUDY DEFENDED BY U.S. AIDE
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov, 24The director of the Federal Center for Disease Control today defended the Government's investigation of a mysterious disease in Pennsylvania, while acknowledging flaws in the nation's capacity to deal with illnesses caused by toxic chemicals.

title: Frederick M. Davenport Jr. Is Dead; Lawyer and Son of House Member
description: Frederick Morgan Davenport Jr., a retired lawyer, of 1115 Fifth Avenue, New York City, died early Tuesday morning in a Greenwich, Conn., nursing home after a lengthy illness. His age was 76.

title: CARDINAL BACKS EFFORT TO FREE IMPRISONED CUBAN
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 24 (AP)Chile's Roman Catholic Cardinal today received the son of Huber Matos, a political prisoner in Cuba, and said that he would support humanitarian efforts to secure the father's release.

title: NORTHERN LIFE SALE IS STUDIED BY ORION
description: The Orion Capital Corporation of Parsippany, N.J., said yesterday that the company might sell the Northern Life Insurance Company of Seattle, one of its principal assets.

title: Tennessee Singer Is Ordered Arrested After Ignoring Court
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 24 (AP)A City Court judge ordered the arrest of Jerry Lee Lewis today after the entertainer did not appear in court to answer a drunkenness charge.

title: J. STUART RIEDEL IS DEAD; FORMER TRANSIT COUNSEL
description: J. Stuart Riedel, former general counsel of the New York City Transit Authority, died Tuesday at Phelps Memorial Hospital, Tarrytown, N. Y. He was 67 years old and a resident of White Plains.

title: U.S. Seeks to Calm Israel
description: WASHINGTON,Nov; 24State Department officials say they are less concerned than Israel that the recent Syrian moyes in Lebanonin particular developments in southern Lebanon near the Israeli borderpose a serious danger to stability in the area.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT Wednesday, Nov. 24, 1916 Petition filed by:

title: Donation of Van Helps Elderly to Enjoy Facilities of Teaneck. Services Center
description: TEANECK, Nov. 24For members of the Senior Services Center of Teaneck Inc., this Thanksgiving is a special day of gratitude.

title: Syrian Troops in Lebanon Appear to Halt in the South
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 24There was no indication today that Syrian troops in Lebanon were moving closer to the border of Israel from positions they occupied three days ago.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The 1,700 wooden light poles along 78 miles of Long Island parkways will he removed over the next three years as an economy measure, the State Transportation Department says. The state parkways adorned by the wooden poles are the Northern and Southern State, Sagtikos, Sunken Meadow, Wantagh and Robert Moses. Aluminum poles will be installed along heavily traveled parts and major intersections of the parkways, but 30 miles of roadway will be outfitted with roadside reflectors instead of lights, the department said.

title: Capital Bar Loses Test Vote to Limit Lawyers Job Shifts
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24A proposed change in the conflictofinterest rules of the bar here, which would limit the shuttling of lawyers in Government agencies to new jobs in Washington law firms that have cases before the agencies, failed to win approval in a test vote last night in the legal ethics committee of the District of Columbia Bar Association. It may still he revived, however.

title: A FourDay Weekend
description: A fourday Thanksgiving weekend lies ahead for many New Yorkers. The public schools and Board of Education offices will be closed today and tomorrow. Libraries, banks, department stores and most other businesses and offices will be closed today, along with stock and commodity exchanges.

title: News Summary
description: An earthquake in eastern Turkey took at least 574 lives, according to first reports, and the government said the total could he at least 3,000. Striking at midafternoon in Van Province, it was recorded at 7.9 on the Richter scalethe same intensity as the shock that killed 30,000 in the Erzincan area in December 1939. [Page 1. Cols. 56.]

title: Wang, Rival for Power in China, Is Accused of Factional Strife
description: PEKING, Nov. 24 (Reuters)Wang Hungwen, the Shanghai radical once considered a likely successor to Mao Tselung as leader of the Chinese Communist Party, was accused today in the Peking newspaper Jenmin Jih Pao of stirring up political strife in the southeastern city of Hangchow.

title: Giants PassRusher Is Coming On Quickly
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., Nov. 24Jim Zorn, the Seattle Seahawk quarter back who will face the Giants on Sun day, is lefthanded.

title: Nets Beat Spurs, 99 91, As Archibald Sparkles
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: David Yunich's proposals for drastically cutting masstransit service in order to save the 50cent fare show the bankruptcy of current leadership in providing decent mass transit in this region.

title: Crack Volunteer Rescue Squad is a Pride of Newark
description: NEWARKWithin the Newark Fire Department is a 20man allvolunteer unit called the Rescue Squad that re sponds to any fire in the city where there is potential danger to life.

title: CORRECTION
description: In a dispatch yesterday on the voting in the United Nations General Assembly that called on Israel to return Palestinians in the Gaza Strip to their refugee camps, the United States stand was erroneously reported. It abstained.

title: T.W.A. Told to Stop OnTime Ads
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (UPI)A Civil Aeronautics Board judge ordered Trans World Airlines today to stop calling itself the ontime airline and to spend $1.6 million telling the public previous claims to that effect were wrong.

title: Moderate Quake Reported Off Bermuda
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (Reuters)A moderate earthquake occurred today about 90 to 100 miles east of Bermuda on the socalled Bermuda rise, the United States Geoloeical Survey reported.

title: Broniman Case Prosecutor, Rips Into Lynch's Story
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 24With a mixture of sarcasm, irony and derision, the prosecution attempted today to undermine Mel Patrick Lynch's testimony that he did not kidnap Samuel Bronfman 2d but was engaged with the alleged victim in an extortion plot against young Bronfman's father. Edgar.

title: CORRECTION
description: In a dispatch yesterday on the voting in the United Nations General Assembly that called on Israel to return Palestinians in the Gaza Strip to their refugee camps, the United States stand was erroneously reported. It abstained.

title: Events Today
description: WERNER HERZOG SHORTS, a series of documertaries, at the Film Forum Theater.

title: Plan for Midtown Copter Flights Is Debated
description: The proposed resumption of helicopter service at the Pan Am Building after a lapse of nearly nine years was pictured alternately at a hearing yesterday as a boon to the city's economy and a noisy hazard to residents and businesses in the Grand Central area.

title: French Send Henri Ronse's Version of Rodogune
description: Corneille's Rodogune is an ironhard and beautiful play about the rigorous workingout of a passionate evil. The evil is Cleopatra. Instead of Shakespeare's multifarious creature, she is one whose magic has turned all black as if, instead of killing her, the aspbite had changed her into the asp.

title: What? Yams? No Mallows? Eschew Them Or Getthe Bird At HalfTime
description: This may be a Thanksgiving in which fewer Americans partake of sweet potato casseroles with marshmallows on top, a dish that has risen to ritual food status over the years and somehow managed to stick there.

title: Soybeans Up
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 24 (AP)Soybean futuresrclosed today with a gain of 7 cents a bushel on the Chicago Board of Trade but most other farm commodity futures were uneven or a shade lower at the close.

title: Red Grover, on Thanksgiving
description: The play takes place in the Dixie Dinette, a favorite eatery for many of the fine citizens of Bradleyville, a small West Texas town. The Dixie Dinette run by Arch and Clovis Ritchie. Arch does the cookin and Clovis does the waitressin'. Arch learned his trade in the Navy and she learned hers by heist the oldest in a family of 12. As the scene opens, it is eight o'clock on the mornin of Thanksgivin Day. Clovis is stackin small boxes of corn flakes, when the door opens and Olin Potts and Rufe Phelps, two of the town locals, enter.

title: Unemployed Auto Worker Kills Himself, His Wife and Son, 18
description: DETROIT, Nov. 24 (UPI)  A 52yearold automobile worker, apparently despondent over losing his job two years ago after he had surgery and was called unable to work, shot and killed his wife and 18yearold son and then turned his shotgun on himself, the police said today.

title: Americans to Eat Turkey With Bicentennial Dressing
description: Prepared to celebrate whatever they have harvested from the Bicentennial year, Americans will gather around mostly bountiful boards today for the first national day of Thanksgiving since crossing what. President Ford called in his holiday proclamation the treshold into our third century.

title: Thanksgiving 355 Years Later: Indians Sue for Land
description: MASHMEE, Mass., Nov. 24When the Pilgrims sat down to their first Thanksgiving in New England 355 years ago, Massasoit, the leader of the Wampanoag Indians, and 90 of his braves sat among them and provided five deer for the feast. The festival celebrated not only survival through the first harsh winter and the gathering of the harvest, but also the friendship and help of the Indians.

title: Meet the Real Georgia: You May Be Surprised
description: ATLANTA; Nov. 23What is the rest of the nation, t he nonSouth, to make of all these Georgians soon to march north?

title: Youth Freezes to Death, 2 Survive in Upstate Ordeal
description: BOONVILLE, N.Y., Nov. 24 (UPI)A weekend of deer hunting in the Adirondack wilderness ended yesterday in death for one Lewes County youth and shock and frostbite for two others.

title: Jets Give Green Light to Green Backfield for Sunday
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Nov. 24The Jets future became the present today when Coach Lou Holtz decided to start an allrookie backfield this Sunday.

title: U.S. JURY STUDYING TRADING IN STOCKS OF TWO SPECIALISTS
description: A Federal grand jury is investigating trading in the stocks handled by two competing specialist firms on the New York Stock Exchange, Wall Street sources disclosed yesterday.

title: Strauss Breaks Away
description: West Germany's FranzJosef Strauss has threatened the past to end the electoral and parliamentary alliance of his Bavarianbased Christian Social Union with the larger Christian Democratic Union. Now the ambitious former Defense and Finance Minister has broken up the 27yearold tandem in an action widely interpreted as last desperate bid to salvage whatever chance he may have to become Chancellor of the Federal Renublic.

title: Tennis
description: AT KOBE, JAPAN

title: Invalidation of Moratorium on New York City Notes Is Called Dawn of New Reality
description: Like a thunderclap, the State Court of Appeals decision invalidating the moratorium on the payment of $1 billion in shortterm New York City notes sent all the participants in the city's longrunning fiscal drama scrambling for cover in different directions in the last week. Suddenly, the elaborate structure that has kept the city solvent for more than a year seemed shaky as it had not been since the height of the fiscal crisis. Only one thing appeared clear as a result of the startling reversal in the state's highest court: A new reality had descended on the city's financial picture, giving its problems greater urgency and insuring that the solutions would be more complicated than ever.

title: Barkless Dog Story Spurs Creation of Basenji Kennel
description: Twenty years ago, Shirley Chambers read a story about Basenjisthe barkless dogsand became intrigued. When I saw an ad for some puppies, I drove to the breeder and left with an 8weekold red and white, Khajah of Storybook, said the Altoona, Pa., fancier. A year later, we both made our ring debuts at Harrisburg. He went winners dog and best of winners for 3 points. I was rather bewildered, the ring procedure being somewhat puzzling, but we both learned quickly, and Khajah finished his championship undefeated in the breed in just eight shows.

title: Carter Aide Confirms That Georgia Banker Will Get CabinetLevel Post, but Declines to Specify Which One
description: AMERICUS, Ga., Nov. 24Presidentelect Jimmy Garter will appoint Thomas Bertram Lance, a millionaire Georgia banker, to a Cabinetlevel position, but not necessarily director of the Office of Management and Budget, a spokesman said here today.

title: Cosmos 867 Launched by Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 24, (Reuters)The Soviet Union has launched another satellite, Cosmos $67, in its continuing series that explores outer space, Tass, the official press agency, reported today. Equipment on the satellite, which was launched yesterday, is functioning normally.

title: Loss of Innovation in Technology Is Debated
description: American innovation and ingenuity have lost their momentum, the chairman of the President's Committee on Science and Technology told the National Academy of Engineering in Washington last, week.

title: The Knock At The Door
description: BOSTON, Nov. 24Two American writers, long resident in are Visited by policemen and told they are being expelled from the country. They are not allowed to know the specific reasons, or the names of their accusers; they have no right to a hearing. They learn only that the authorities suspect them of such things as disseminating information harmful to the security of the state.

title: U.S. Station Pinpoints Epicenter
description: The National Earthquake Information Center in Denver placed the epicenter of the Turkish quake almost directly under Mount Ararat, giving the severity as 7.4 compared with 8.0 for the July 27 quake in the Tangshan area of northern China. The Chinese quake is presumed to have killed tens of thousands, although no official toll has been announced by the Chinese:

title: Previous Most Valuable Winners
Patti Smith Personalizes Rock Act
description: Patti Smith, whos at the Bottom Line for a weeklong run through Sunday, is laboring under something of a backlash at the moment, and it's partly her own fault. Originally she was a totally individual artrocker, who chanted poetry over rockflavored minimalist accompaniment.

title: New Stockpile Goal Requires Purchases Totaling 6.8 Billion
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24The Government would be required to purchase $6.8 billion worth of metals and raw materials to meet its new objective of establish:ng a threeyear stockpile of strategic materials, the Joint Congressional Committee on Defense Production was told today. Under the new policy, which requires adoption by Congress, the General Services Administration also would dispose of $3.9 billion worth of materials in the present stockpile, including large amounts of silver and tin.

title: Rubin Carter Trial Hears Judge Give Views on Witness
description: PATERSON, N.J., Nov. 24A Passaic county Court judge explained on the stand today in the triplemurder retrial of Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis some of the factors that went into his sentencing of Alfred P. Bello a key prosecution witness, in their trial and in the first murder trial nine years ago.

title: REDEMPTIONS IN OCTOBER OF MUTUAL FUNDS DOWN
description: Net redemptions of mutual fund shares in October were the lowest since December 1975 as sales exceeded redemptions by $72 million, compared with September's excess of $234.4 million, the Investment Company Institute reported yesterday.

title: REDUCED PHONE RATES AVAILABLE IN JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 24Starting, Saturday. New Jersey telephone users can reduce the cost of their basic monthly service by up to 30 percent simply by going to a business office and asking for a new lifeline rate, the State Board of Public Utility Commissioners announced today.

title: CALLS FOR FLU SHOTS REPORTED TO SURGE
description: Federal epidemiologists intensified yesterday their investigation into an apparent case of swine influenza in Missouri as health departments elsewhere reported an upsurge in demand for swine flu shots.

title: Braniff Told to Pay $1 Million Penalty In Job Bias Claims
description: SAN ANTONIO, Nov. 24 (UPI)A judge has told Braniff Airways to begin paying $1.1 million worth of penalties to employees involved in a job discrimination case.

title: Leonard Silk
description: Mexico is in the midst of its worst financial panic since the revolution of 1910. The peso, which had been pegged at a rate of 12.5 to the dollar, has lost about half its value: Capital has been fleeing out of pesos into dollars.

title: ABC Will Show Roots in January
description: Taking what it called an unprecedented approach to presealing a novel for television, ABC has announced that it will broadcast Roots for a total of 12 hours on eight consecutive nights in January.

title: Americans to Eat Turkey With Bicentennial Dressing
description: Prepared to celebrate whatever they have harvested from the Bicentennial year, Americans will gather around Mostly bountiful boards today for the first national day of Thanksgiving since crossing what President Ford called in his holiday proclamation the treshold into our third century.

title: Harold Rome Sings Harold Rome
description: Harold Rome is singing songs he wrote for Pins and Needles, Call Me Mister, Fanny, Wish You Were Here and other shows this week as part of the Broadway at the Ballroom series at the Ballroom, West Broadway just below Houston Street. But while it is delightful to hear his casual, roughvoiced performance of such songs as South America, Take it Away, Military Life (with that deathless couplet, through the slush and the slosh and the mish and the mash) or his proof that a deliberate pastiche of cliches can be turned into a very ?? pop song, All of a Sudden My Heart Sings, the most provocative aspect of his performance is the sampling he offers of songs from a new musical, Give My Regards to Broadway and Remcmher Me to Harold Rome.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: ROOTS & RHYTHMS Since its local advent in 1970, the Ballet Hispanico has presented numerous aspects of the Spanish heritage, from classical flamenco to Latin American folk traditions and street dances of New York, with a growing reputation for its young performers on a national level, under the direction of Tina Ramirez. Tomorrow night at 7:30, the ensemble opens a sevenprogram engagement at the Henry Street Playhouse, 466 Grand Street.

title: 3 RHODESIA AIRFIELDS REPORTED BEING BUILT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP)Rhodesia is reportedly building three airfields capable of handling transport planes even as discussions continue in Geneva on proposals to turn over control of the whiteruled nation to its black majority.

title: ROBERT F. M'NAMARA
description: Capt. Robert F. McNamara, master of the United States Lines cargo ship American Ranger, died of a heart attack aboard his vessel off the coast of Scotland on Nov. 15. He was 53 years old and lived at Sag Harbor, L.I.

title: Aviation Takes Soccer Title
description: Jairo Ruiz and Eleazar Escobar scored in the first half to give Aviation 20 victory over Bushwick in the Public Schools Athletic League B Division soccer championship game at Queens College yesterday. It was the third shutout in four playoff games for Aviation's goalie, Walter Moran, and his 10th of the season.

title: NEW YORK OFFICIALS SUGGEST NEW BONDS TO PAY NOTEHOLDERS
description: The outlines of a possible plan that would enable New York City to repay the holders of $1 billion in shortterm notes without involving the Federal Government were presented yesterday to the city's bankers and union leaders.

title: A Touch of Make Believe To Keep the Hands Warm
description: When Pat Bond drops into Gino's for lynch on a chilly day wearing her fur or navy cloth coat and clutching her big teddy bear, people sit up and take notice all right. Not to worry though. It isn't a case of arrested development. This teddy isn't a toy, but a cozy fake fur muff with hidden zippered compartment for change and cosmetics, just one in a kooky line designed and produced by Miss Bond and Nolan Drummond.

title: WILLIAM T. HUTCHINSON, 81, HISTORIAN AND BIOGRAPHER
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 24 (AP)William T. Hutchinson, an authority on American constitutional history and author of number of historical works, died yesterday. He was 81 years old.

title: Ohio Supreme Court Upholds State's Death Penalty
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 24The Ohio Supreme Court upheld today the constitutionality of the state's death penalty because it is imposed only in cases of purposeful murder and when other factors are involved.

title: New York State Tax Load Found Highest in U.S. and Going Higher
description: A taxpayer research group has reported that combined state and local taxes in New York State are taking an increasing share of personal income, in addition to continuing the nation's highest tax load in dollars per resident.

title: Chateau Margaux, a Monument to Fine Wines, Faces Being Sold in Wake of Financial Woes
description: MARGAUX, FranceThe colonnade of sycamores slopes gently from the road through acres of vineyards cultivated since days of knights and halberds, and swings round towards a brook and the neopalladian chateau Pierre Ginestet calls home.

title: COUNTESS M. K. TOLSTOY, AMERICAN IN PARIS, 92
description: Countess Mary Koutouzow Tolstoy, a leading figure in the American colony in Paris for more than half a century, died in Paris last Sunday at the age of 92, according to news received here by United Press International.

title: Jennifer Muller's Beach Danced
description: Jennifer Muller's choreographic attention in the last several years has flickered back and forth between neat, formal performing vehicles and untidy life as art works. On Tuesday evening at the Roundabout Stage One she presented one of the untidiest works that she has ever given. It was only part of a larger piece but had a sloppy panache that will not easily be forgotten.

title: Oklahoma Judge's Press Gag Upset
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP)The Oklahoma City newspapers cannot be barred by a county judge from publishing the name and picture of an 11yearold boy found delinquent by reason of seconddegree manslaughter, the Supreme Court ruled today.

title: BUSH WILL QUIT C.I.A. ON INAUGURATION DAY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24George W. Bush announced today that he was resigning as Director of Central Intelligence effective Jan. 20, the day President Ford will leave office.

title: BANKER CALLS LANCE FISCAL CONSERVATIVE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24The Atlanta Constitution published today a picture of Thomas Bertram Lance, Presidentelect Jinimy Carter's likely appointee to a high Cabinetlevel job, seated in a rocking chair.

title: Notes on People
description: Despite the change of administrations in Washington, Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr. expects to retain his job as chief of the United Staates forces in Europe and the post of NATO Commander General that traditionally goes along with it.

title: U.A.W. Unit in Chrysler Pact
description: WINDSOR, Ontario, Nov. 24 (AP) Tentative agreement was reached today Ion a threeyear contract between members of United Automobile Workers Local 444 and Chrysler Corporation of Canada. The tentative settlement came in time to avert a strike set for 8 P.M. today by nearly 8,000 Local 444 members.

title: 4,800 Jars of Cherries Recalled Because of Excessive Red Dye
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (UPI)The Food and Drug Administration announced today the recall of 4,800 jars of maraschino cherries colored with excessive amounts of Red No. 4, which was banned in September as a possible health hazard.

title: Swiss Are Shaken by Spy Case Involving General and Wife
description: BERN, Nov. 19If the watches began to tell the wrong time or the Swiss franc took a nosedive, the effect on national morale could not have been more crushing. Even the more conservative newspapers do not shy from comparisons with Watergate and a demand for the introduction of the death penalty has been heard in Parliament.

title: Market Place
description: Major bank trust departments were clearly not on the same wavelength as the mutual funds in the quarter ended Sept, 30, 1976, according to figures just released in Spectrum, a publication of Computer Directions Advisers Inc.; of Silver Spring, Md.

title: People Who Crave Nuts for the Holidays Are Really Having to Shell Out This Year
description: People who went out shopping for nuts for their Thanksgiving holiday tables might, have been astonished to see that some prices have soared since last year. If they were curious enough to check into the reasons behind this, they would have found that an unlikely collection of eventsfrom turmoil in Africa to bad weather in Californiaall contributed to the higher prices of pecans, walnuts, cashews and other favorite nuts.

title: SolidWaste Plant in Westchester Will Seek Steady Garbage Flow
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 24 Westchester County communities interested in joining a proposed countywide plan to convert solid waste into gas and electricity will be asked to sign contracts insuring a steady flow of garbage to the plant, County Executive Alfred B. DeBello said today.

title: 2 VIKING CRAFT TAKE THE HOLIDAY OFF, TOO
description: Thanksgiving, it so happens, will be a day of quiet for the Viking spacecraft on and around Mars. The motions of the planets have reached a point at which the sun today is directly between Mars and Earth, an alignment known as solar conjunction that produces a blackout of VikingtoEarth communications.

title: BaysideSt. Francis Clash Isn't Just Another Rivalry
description: Bayside and St. Francis won their League football titles on Saturday; today they play for bragging rights, The two Queens schools are trying to establish a neighborhood rivalry with a Thanksgiving Day game. Bayside routed Clinton, 296, for the Public Schools Athletic League title, and St. Francis wrapped up the Catholic Schools Football League crown with a 440 destruction of Holy Trinity. A game between the Catholic League champion and the P.S.A.L. winner has never occurred in New York, but it is a common occurrence in other cities and always attracts a big crowd.

title: VIEWS OF BLACKS DIFFER ON NEW PLAN IN RHODESIA
description: GENEVA, Nov. 24Black nationalist leaders were unable today to agree on a joint response to the latest British effort to find a compromise formula on a date for independence under black rule.

title: Market Climbs, With Oil Stocks Among Leaders
description: Stock prices moved generally higher yesterday in steppedup trading, although the Dow Jones industrial average posted only a modest gain.

title: Meet the Real Geor You May Be Surprised
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 23What is the rest of the nation, the nonSouth, to make of all these Georgians soon to march north?

title: S.E.C. STUDYING CONDUCT OF GAMBLESKOGMO CHIEF
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 24The Securities and Exchange Commission has initiated an inquiry into questions raised about the conduct of Berlin C. Gamble, chairman and chief executive officer of GambleSkogmo Inc., according to sources close to the situation.

title: ETHEL DAVIDSON CRYSTAL
description: Ethel Davidson Crystal, a retired elementaryschool teacher, died yesterday at Montefiore Hospital. She was 66 years old and lived at 3980 Orloff Avenue, the Bronx.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rotes for Wednesday.

title: Reilly Freed in Mother's Murder As Suppressed Evidence is Bared
description: LITCHFIELD, Conn., Nov. 24Charges against Peter A. Reilly in the murder of his mother were dropped here today after the new State's Attorney announced that he had discovered evidence in the files of his predecessor that tended to clear the youth.

title: Lorin Hollander Plays Schubert
description: Lorin Hollander set himself an unusual challenge in his recital on Tuesday night at the 92d Street YMYWHA. He played two piano sonatas by Schubert, the one in G (Op. 78) and the one in B flat (Op. post.). It is the kind of program one might have expected in an earlier age from Artur Schnabel or today from that seasoned veteran Rudolf Serkin.

title: Rangers Get 22 Deadlock With Flyers
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 24  John Davidson offset the sometimes weak play of his teammates at the Spectrum tonight, making 37 saves on shots by the Philadelphia Flyers to preserve a 22 tie.

title: U.S. Board Sees Catch In Bargain CB Radios
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP) Shoppers who see citizensband radios offered at big discounts this month should be wary, the Federal Trade Commission says.

title: Bridge
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 24Two young New York experts were among the leaders at the halfway mark in the blue ribbon pair championship of the American contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals at the William Penn Hotel here tonight.

title: In Memoriam
description: HYTOWNNoel. In fond and loving memory of my beloved who passed away eleven years ego. Always with me Cell.

title: State Holidays Pose a Problem Of Absenteeism
description: TRENTON, Nov. 24Last Thursday, Governor Byrne signed an executive order making the Friday after Thanksgiving a nonwerk day for 70,000 state employees. Thousands of those employees made it a fiveday weekend by also taking today off. Thousands of others took the afternoon off.

title: Rhodesia Air Force in on Fighting
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Nov. 24 (UPI)Rhodesia has sent its air force into action against Mozambican Government positions in response to what it called unprovoked aggression against its troops hunting guerrillas in Rhodesia, the military command announced today.

title: GOLD
description: Selected world gold prices Wednesday. London: Mornins fixing $131.10, down $2.35; afternoon fixing $130.75, down $2,70. Paris afternoon gold fixing $131.35, down $2.21.

title: British Football
description: British Football

title: COLD WEATHER CUTS STOCKS OF OIL FOR HOME HEATING
description: The unusually cold weather over most of the nation so far this winter, pushed stocks of homehealing oil down sharply last week, the American Petroleum Institute reported yesterday.

title: ARMY CLOSING ARSENAL DESPITE MONDALE PLEDGE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21. (AP)  The Pentagon said today it would go ahead with the closing or reduction in operaLions of seven military bases, including the Philadelphia's Frankford Arsenal, which Vice Presidentelect. Waller F. Mondale had promised to keep open. The arsenal will be closed next September.

title: Harassment on Job Ruled Cause to Quit
description: TRENTON, Nov. 24 (AP)An employee who is shunned by her coworkers has good cause to leave her job and may collect unemployment, according to a ruling of the Appellate Division of the Superior Court.

title: DELIBERATIONS GO ON IN MOSQUE MURDER
description: The jury at the Harlem mosque trial sat down to its eighth day of deliberations yesterday, and after two jurors said they thought there was still hope of reaching a verdict, the presiding judge ruled that deliberations would continue after a day's recess for Thanksgiving.

title: Dole Sees President And They Discuss Closeness of Race
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (UPI)President Ford today held his first postelection meeting with Senator Robert Dole, his VicePresidential nominee, who said they had talked alone about how we almost put it together for a victory.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Social, Humanitarian and Cultural Committee10:30 A.M.

title: Plane Crash Kills Jerseyan.
description: SHERBURNE, Vt., Nov. 24 (AP)sOne New Jersey man was dead and another was in critical condition today, following the crash yesterday of a small plane on Mount Killington near here. The dead man was William Herbert, 52 years old, of Cranford, N.J. Listed in critical condition at Rutland Hospital was Maurice Stafford, 29, of Fords, N.J.

title: Rome Airport Closed a Night
description: ROME, Nov. 24 (UPI)Rome's Leonardo da Vinci International Airport will be closed from nightfall tomorrow to dawn Friday because of threats by strikers to switch off runway lights, the airport director, Raffaele Casagrande, said today.

title: Quake Reported From Moluccas
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Nov. 24 (AP)A moderately strong earthquake occurred today near the Molucca Islands in Indonesia, the government meteorological office said. No damage or casualties were reported. A spokesman said the quake registered 5 on the Richter scale and was thought to be centered in the Banda Sea about 80 miles southwest of Ambon.

title: Carter Is Said to Be Considering Zuccotti for Housing Secretary
description: John E. Zuccotti, New York City's First Deputy Mayor, was reported yesterday by sources at City Hall as being one of those under consideration for Secretary of Housing and Urban Development in Presidentelect Jimmy Carter's Cabinet.

title: Carter's Control of Some Agencies Is Months Off
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24Jimmy Carter will be unable to gain control of many regulatory agencies for five or six months and, in a few cases, a year or more after he becomes President. The delay will be caused primarily by the timeconsuming process of selecting nominees to fill existing vacancies and obtaining their confirmation by the various Senate committees and the full Senate.

title: JOY OF SEX AUTHOR GAINS ON ROYALTIES
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 24Federal District Judge David W. Williams has ruled that a California institution must restore to Dr. Alexander Comfort, author of the bestselling The Joy of Sex, a portion of the royalties it shared with him under a complicated contract that enabled the British physician to collect American profits from the book in dollars instead of English sterling.

title: The Reds Inner Conceit Is Showing
description: As the canonization of the Cincinnati Reds continues, the inner conceit, as Johnny Bench calls it, increases on what could be the first National League team to win the World Series three consecutive years. Joe Morgan was named the National League's most valuable player yesterday for the second consecutive year, the fifth time in the last seven seasons that a member of the Reds has been anointed by the baseball writer's panel, Johnny Bench was voted the award in 1972 and 1970, and Pete Rose in 1973  each without much debate. But the inner conceit of the Reds is beginning to seep to the surface. At the recent draft of liberated major league muscle, the Reds front offire arrogantly chose not to participate. When the former ace of the Reds pitching staff, Don Gullett, signed with the New York Yankees, the Reds manager, Sparky Anderson, erased the words Don Gullett from his vocabulary. And several Reds players soon will be seeking security similar to the estimated $2 million in a sixyear contract that Don Gullett obtained as a free agent.

title: Junior League Ball at Plaza Honors 29 Young Debutantes
description: Twentynine young women were honored last night at the annual Junior League Ball in the Grand, Ballroom of the Plaza Hotel. The debutantes, all provisional members of the Junior League of the City of New York Inc., were presented to Mrs. Alan L. Bain, the League president.

title: Yale Infuses Chekhov's Ivanov With Vivacity
WABC Suspends Tex Antoine After a Flippant Remark on Rape
description: Tex Antoine, the WABCTV weather reporter, was suspended indefinitely by station officials last night after he made flippant remark on the air about rape.

title: London Observer: How U.S. Oil Outfit Came to the Rescue
description: LONDON, Nov. 24What started as a vague idea over dinner at a London restaurant 12 days ago became a reality today with the formal announcement that an American oil company, Atlantic Richfield, was acquiring a 90 per cent interest in The Observer, one of Britain's most prestigious, and troubled, newspapers.

title: TRUDEAU GIVES PLEA FOR CANADIAN UNITY; HINTS BID TO QUEBEC
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 24Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau, his position shaken by the overwhelming victory of the separatist party in the Quebec provincial elections last week, appealed to Canadians tonight for a renewal of national unity.

title: Jackson Is Reported Near a Decision
description: The California Angels, acting more aggressively with Gene Autry's bank account than Autry ever did on his horse, Champion, signed Bobby Grich last night, filling their quota of three free agents.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: CAR SALES STEADY FOR MIDNOVEHER, CLOSINGS ARE SET
description: DETROIT, Nov. 24Domestic new car sales remain essentially flat, reports today from the leading automakers for the midNovember period indicated.

title: Yonkers and Roosevelt Granted 1977 Dates
description: Yonkers and Roosevelt Raceways received approval yesterday from the State Racing and Wagering board for a combined total of 313 programs in 1977. The board approved 163 nights of racing for Yonkers and 150 nights for Roosevelt. It also granted Monticello Raceway 184 programs.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: U.S: Sees Moscow Retaliation In Arrest of Pan Am Employee
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 24 (UPI)The Soviet police have arrested an American airline employee and charged him with drunken driving and speeding, the United States Embassy said tonight, calling the arrest apparent retaliation for the arrest of a Soviet Aeroflot official in the United States.

title: Capt. Bligh's Notebook Auctioned for $91,000
description: LONDON, Nov. 24 (AP)Just before sun rise the People mutinied, seizing me while I slept in my Cabin.

title: Dollar Shows Gain As Gold Price Dips For the 2d Session
description: LONDON, Nov. 24 (AP)The dollar had a good day on European foreign exchanges today while the price of gold slipped back for the second consecutive trading session.

title: Cuba Ends Free Public Phone Calls; Local Service Will Now Cost 5 Cents
description: HAVANA, Nov. 24 (Reuters)Free calls from public telephones, an early fixture of Premier Fidel Castro's Government come to an end today, the Communications Ministry announced. Local threeminute phone calls will cost 5 cents.

title: Washington & Business
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, which has been criticized and at times, ridiculed for its vast and growing backlog of complaints, decided this summer what to do about it. It would simply spend less time dealing with the complaints, and in business parlance, write down many of the oldest complaints, which more than likely had been made moot by the passage of time anyway.

title: Rise in Productivity Slowed in 3d Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24The rise in productivity, or output per hour worked, in the nonfinancial corporate sector of the economy slowed markedly in the third quarter, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Greenwich Teachers Settle Strike For 6.8% Raise and a 3Year Pact
description: GREENWICH, Nov. 24Details of a tentative agreement between Greenwich's 700 teachers and the school system were disclosed today.

title: Amy Ingersoll Married To Stephen P. Schnetzer
description: Amy Frances Ingersoll and Stephen Paul Schnetzer, who are members of the repertory company of the American Conservatory Theater in San Francisco, were married there yesterday in the Swedenborgian Church. The Rev. Erwin D. Reddekopp performed the ceremony.

title: PIETRO VALDONI
description: ROME, Nov. 23 (AP)Prof. Pietro Valdoni, who headed the surgical team that removed Pope Paul VI's prostate gland in 1967, died at his home in Rome early today. He was 76 years old.

title: Likable Show By Natalie Cole On Broadway
description: Natalie Cole, who opened a sixnight run at the Winter Garden Tuesday, is the consummate professional soulpop singer of the day. She works hard, and she gives demonstrable pleasure to her audiences in a nice range of musical idioms. One feels almost churlish to point out that so far she lacks that ultimate individuality and force of personality that distinguish great stars.

title: Germans Propose $1.25 Billion Plan To Spur Economy
description: BONN, Nov. 24A Governmentappointed group of economic advisers today submitted a report recommending a $1.25 billian program of tax incentives for West German industry, inexpensive credits for new companies and aid to the unemployed.

title: THEE PLEAD GUILTY IN MURDERFORHIRE
description: Three men pleaded guilty yesterday to killing Thomas Wright, a brother of City Councilman Samuel D. Wright, in a murderforhire plot allegedly hatched by Mr. Wright's partner in a Brooklyn checkcashing business.

title: Art People
description: LOOKING remarkably unfazed for a man giving birth to an art museum, Pontus Hulten, director of the vast new Centre Beaubourg, in Paris, was in town this week with a crossedfingers date for its deliverythe end of January. The glass shoebox of a building, startlingly wrapped in the colored noodles that form its service pipes, has set Paris on its ear. But Mr. Hulten, a savvy museum man imported from Stockholm three years ago to get the Beaubourg under way, is not only proud of its looks, he also thinks it works fine.

title: Soviet Research Satellite Put Up
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 25 (Reuters)The Soviet Union launched a new Prognoz (forecast) research satellite into earth orbit today with scientific equipment aboard developed in France and Czechoslovakia the press agency Tass reported. The satellite will study the effect of solar activity on interplanetary space and the earth's magnetic field, Tass said.

title: Tanaka Will Go on Trial Jan. 27 On Lockheed Bribery Charges
description: TOKYO, Nov. 25 (UPI)The former Prime Minister, Kakuei Tanaka, will go on trial Jan. 27 on charges that he received $1.6 million from the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation, the Tokyo District Court said today.

title: M.I. GUREVICH DIES; HELPED DESIGN MIG
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 25 (AP)Mikhail 1. Gurevich, mathematician and aircraft designer who collaborated with Col. Gen. Artem 1. Mikoyan in designing the Soviet Union's MIG series of fighter aircraft, died Sunday at age 84, the Moscow newspaper Sovetskaya Rossiya reported today.

title: At the Movies
description: CAROL KANE is on her way to a funeral, and she couldn't be happier. The petite, 24yearold actress, who won an Oscar nomination last year for her subtly anguished performance as the abandoned wife of a Jewish immigrant in Hester Street, is flying to England for a tearful farewell to her deceased sweetheart, Rudolph Valentino. Never mind that the actor's flamboyant funeral was actually held in New York; this Valentino is being directed by Ken Russell, the uncrowned king of literary license, and it stars Russia's Rudolf Nureyev as the immortal Latin loverwho will be shown dancing a tango with France's Leslie Caron, as the Russian tragedienne Alla Nazimova.

title: Restaurants
description: IIN SEARCHING OUT inexpensive restaurants that offer decent, complete meals in pleasant surroundings for $7.50 or less, it is interesting to note that the proportion of bad food one encounters is no greater than when seeking out more expensive places. Anyone planning a night in the East or West Village for Off Broadway theater or other diversions would do well to consider either of the two restaurants that follow.

title: Religious Groups Take Holiday Spirit To Needy and Aged
description: Food for the needy, solace for the aging and the spirit of brotherhood were the preeminent themes as churches, synagogues and charitable organizations marked Thanksgiving Day.

title: Address Labels Lost On 100,000 Magazines
description: Every magazine publisher certainly has his favorite horror story of a business calamity, If Allen A. Raymond, editor and publisher of Early Years, didn't before, he has now. It's entitled, The Month That the Address Labels Didn't Stick.

title: Who'll Fill Carter's Key Economic Posts?
description: As the time nears for the announcement of key appointments in the Carter Administration, the business world's interest is being piqued by speculation over the likely nomineesespecially in the economic areasand over the forthcoming meeting that the Presidentelect has said he would hold with leading representatives of business. Only one post has definitely been filled so far in the new Administration, but another seems to have been. It was no surprise that Jody Powell was named as Mr. Carter's press secretary. But it was at least a mild surprise when it was reported on Thanksgiving eve that Mr. Carter had chosen Thomas Bertram Lance, the president of a relatively small Atlanta bank, for a highlevel position as the new director of the Office of Budget and Management. It had been expected though that Mr. Lance would be given some assignment by Mr. Carter, with whom he has been closely associated for some time.

title: Developing Countries Oppose A Delay in Economic Meeting
description: PARIS, Nov. 25 (Reuters)Developing countries ruled out today, for the time being at least, any postponement of a ministerial conference expected to wind up 10 months of talks with industrial nations.

title: Black Nationalist Decries Time Lost At Rhodesia Talks
description: GENEVA. Nov. 25 Bishop Abel Muzorewa, one of the four leaders of black nationalist factions at the conference on Rhodesia said today that real independence would be achieved with the transfer of power to the projected interim government by the white minority regime of Prime Minister Ian D. Smith.

title: GIRL, 15, IN BRONX
description: ?? eral Assaults on Women By MAX H. SEIGEL

title: Ella and Some Friends Play Carnegie Hall
description: When Ella Fitzgerald went to hear one of Norman Granz's Jazz at the Philharmonic concerts in 1948, the jazz impresario was not one of her fans.

title: Woodbridge, Westfield Win Playoff Previews
description: Woodbridge broke up a tough defensive battle with a 52yard drive for a lastquarter touchdown that defeated Edison Township, 70, yesterday in Edison before a standingroom crowd of 4,000.

title: KENTUCKY TO INVESTIGATE DEATH OF 26 IN COAL MINE
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Nov. 25 (UPI)Kentucky's Mines Commissioner, H. N. Kirkpatrick, said today that a meeting would be held next Tuesday at the Scotia coal mine to determine the nature of future investigations into two explosions at the mine that killed 26 persons last March.

title: Plastic Litter
description: On Election Day the voters of Michigan and Maine were on record overwhelmingly in favor of mandatory deposits on most beverage containers in order to encourage the reuse of bottles and the recycling of ??. The same objective was only narrowly defeated in Massachusetts (although decisively so in Colorado). It is already the law in Oregon, South Dakota and Vermont and will soon be the rule on Federal installations as well.

title: Private Placement of Debt by Insurers Is Increasing
description: PORTLAND, Me.The private placement of debt securities is being done increasingly with insurance companies, some of them quite small.

title: World News Briefs
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov 25 (Reuters) The security police today raided a building here housing a number of church organizations opposed to apartheid and spent the day searching their offices.

title: OFFICIAL OF U.S. EMBASSY DIES IN ISRAELI CAR CRASH
description: TEC AVIV, Nov. 25James C. Dean, First Secretary in the economic section of the United States Embassy, died yesterday in a road accident in the Negev.

title: An Orchestra That Mellows With Age
description: Some 5,000 years of life experience will walk out on stage at the High School of Fashion Industries on Sunday afternoon, in the collective personage of the Senior Concert Orchestra of New York.

title: The Truth Heals
description: Richard Sprague, chief counsel of the new investigation by the House of Representatives into the murders of President John F. Kennedy and Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., is a thorough and persistent man. For years he pushed forward the prosecutions of those who had murdered Jock Yablonski, his wife and his daughter, until he finally obtained the conviction of Tony Boyle, the kingpin of the entire plot. Judging from his plans, Mr. Sprague seems determined to bring the same intensity to bear on his new responsibility.

title: Newman Is Back With Bach
description: Dazzling young talents not only light up the music scene when they appear. They also often ignite controversy and divide the public into warring camps, with their admirers becoming a cult. This has happened to Anthony Newman, an organist and harpsichordist, following his debut in 1967. It was obvious at the time that he was a musical personality of exceptional brilliance and temperament, and he quickly developed a devoted following. Yet he just as quickly found antagonists who attacked his style and scholarship in the works of Bach, which was his main repertory.

title: OUTLOOK FOR A RISE IN THE PRICE OF OIL PUSHES URANIUM UP
description: VIENNA, Nov. 25The prospect that the world will soon have to pay more for oil is pushing up the price of uranium and has caused a global, though covert, scramble to stockpile nuclear fuel, experts here say.

title: ExCongressional Aide Sentenced
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (AP)A former top aide to Representative William Clay, Democrat of Missouri, has been ordered to report to the Allenwood, Pa., Federal Prison Camp next Wednesday to begin serving a sixmonth sentence for defrauding the Government of more than $32,000 in a payroll scheme. The aide, Michael C. McPherson, was sentenced yesterday by Federal District Judge John Lewis Smith Jr., on a plea of guilty. Mr. McPherson's wife also had been arrested in the case, but charges against her were dropped after her husband entered his guilty plea.

title: Minnesota Suit Seeks to Block Governor From Seat in Senate
description: ST. PAUL, Nov. 25 (AP) Two men have filed suit accusing Gov. Wendell Anderson of violating state law in announcing that he will resign to allow Lieut Gov. Rudy Perpich to become Governor and name Mr. Anderson as Vice Presidentelect Walter F. Mondale's successor in the Senate.

title: Bomb Discovered After a Blaze In MedicalDental Group Offices
description: A homemade bomb was found at the offices of a medicaldental association on the Lower East Side yesterday afternoon, about 12 hours after the building it occupies was damaged in what fire marshalls said was a suspicious blaze.

title: Fashion For Texans: They Buzz Tiny Salado In Copters
description: SALADO, Tex.When the chirping sound of a helicopter echoes over this little ranching town of barely 600 people on the old Chisholm Trail, it usually means that a customer is arriving to see Grace Jones.

title: Peking Sends Army To Area of Clashes
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 25Chinese troops have been sent into cities, villages, schools and factories in Fukien, the southeast coastal province opposite Taiwan, after extremely important instructions from Chairman Hua Kuofeng, apparently designed to stop factional fighting, according to Fukien radio broadcasts.

title: Moroccan King for Atom Check
description: PARIS, Nov. 25 (AP)King Hassan 111 of Morocco said today that he was prepared to submit a nuclear power station he wants to buy from France to annual United Nations inspection to guarantee its exclusively nonmilitary use. At the end of a threeday official visit, he said at a news conference that although Morocco had no oil, it had 20 million tons of uranium deposits it could not afford to waste in its struggle to emerge from economic underdevelopment.

title: Music: Moonlighting String Trio
description: If the Metropolitan Opera Orchestra has one of the heaviest schedules of any ensemble, that has not stopped three of its members from doing chamber music on the side. They are Judith Yanchus, violinist; Marilyn Stroh, violist, and Yves Chardon, cellist. They make up the String Trio of New York, which played a wellbalanced program in Carnegie Recital Hall on Wednesday night.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: TODAY, NOV. 26

title: Meadowlands Proposal to Recycle Garbage Running Into Opposition
description: LYNDHURST, Nov. 25Plans by the Hackensack Meadowlands Developmen Commission to build a baler and a recycling plant to handle garbage disposal may be rejected.

title: Broadcaster's Group to Appeal Court Ban on TV Family Hour
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (UPI)The Natiortal Association of Broadcasters has decided to appeal a judge's ban on television's family viewing hour.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: Englishman Wins Jumping
description: AMSTERDAM, Nov. 25 (AP)David Broome of England, riding Bally Will Well, won the openingday's jumping event of the 19th annual Jumping Amsterdam Horse Show today. The show, which ends Sunday, has drawn most of the world's major riders.

title: Business Records
description: BAJER INDUSTRIES, 9 East 37th. Street, N.Y. ManufacPurer of lighting fixtures. The Charter Group Ins owns 100 percent of the stock of the debtor. Debtor owns 100 percent of the stock of Systems Consultants Inc. Liabilities, $1,475,006; assets, 901,360. Signed by Keith Stern, vice president.

title: Green, Hayes and Marsh Lead With 66's
description: MIYAZAKI, Japan, Nov. 25 (UPI)Hubert Green, launching the defense of a title he captured last year, fired a sixunderpar 66 today and shared the openinground lead with a fellow American, Mark Hayes, and Australia's Graham Marsh in the $200,000 Phoenix tournament.

title: Tips on Tickets
description: Previews of The Night of the Iguana begin tonight at the Circle in the Square, West 50 Street between Broadway and Eighth Avenue. The play opens officially Dec. 6 and runs until Feb. 20. Performances tonight and tomorrow at 8 P.M. Matinee tomorrow at 2 P.M., Sunday at 3. Regular performances thereafter Tuesday through Saturday at 8, matinees Wednesdays and Saturdays at 2, Sundays at 3. Tickets, $8.95 for previews, $9.95 regular season. Telephone, 5810720.

title: Applications to Professional Schools Ebbing
description: The burning desire among young people to become physicians, lawyers and dentists apparently has begun to flicker, and admissions applications at many professional schools are ebbing from their record levels.

title: Boston Doctors Say Stabbed Man May Have Suffered Brain Death
description: BOSTON, Nov. 25 (AP)The condition of a Harvard football player, stabbed Nov. 16, has deteriorated to a point where a machine used to monitor brainwave activity shows electrical silence, doctors have reported.

title: CRIES UNLIKELY IN MEDICAL ABUSES
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif. Nov. 25 Despite repeated allegations of fraud, corruption and illegal Influence peddling, appears unlikely now that there will be criminal charges brought against the regulators or operators of California's $100 millionayear prepaid health programs.

title: Monitoring Agency For Budget Studied By New York City
description: New York City officials have begun examining proposals for setting up the mandated new office that is designed to help the City Council and the Board of Estimate monitor the city's budget and spending.

title: Thailand Hands Over 26 Refugees to Cambodia Reds
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 25 (AP)The Thai Government has handed over 26 Cambodian refugees to the Cambodian Government on the ground that they were a threat to national security, a military spokesman said today.

title: Applications to Professional Schools Ebbing
description: The burning desire among young people to become physicians, lawyers and dentists apparently has begun to flicker, and admissions applications at many professional schools are ebbing from their record levels.

title: Common Market University Opens Amid Problems on Role and Aims
description: FLORENCE, Italy, Nov. 23After years of argument, frustration and fundraising, the European University Institute opened here last week with a colorful ceremony and the prospect of continuing problems.

title: The Pop Life
description: DORY PREVIN has been in town this week, but although she gave a couple of her increasingly infrequent performances Monday night at the Ballroom, her main business was not her languishing singersongwriter career. Rather, she was promoting her latest book, Midnight Baby, and firming up plans for her forthcoming Broadway musical, The Amazing Flight of the Gooney Bird.

title: Somerville Romps to Victory
description: Vic Holloway and Jay Axmann combined for five touchdowns to lead Somerville to a 426 victory over Bound Brook yesterday at Bound Brook. It was Somerville's 9th success in 10 games.

title: French Temper Inflation Move
description: PARIS, Nov. 25 (Reuters)The French Senate agreed to tone clown the special antiinflation levy on excessive rises in company turnover due to be reintroduced on Jan. 1, 1977, Senate sources said. Rejecting the advice of deputy Finance Minister Michel Durafour, the senators decided the tax will only be payable if the official index for manufactured product prices rises 2 percent or more in any fivemonth period after Jan. 1.

title: TURKISH QUAKE TOLL PASSES 3,000 MARK; SNOW SLOWS RELIEF
description: DIYADIN, Turkey, Nov. 25Hampered by snow and cold, Turkish troops and civilian relief workers struggled today to reach the isolated rugged reaches of eastern Turkey, where, officials feared, more than 3,000 people had been killed in an earthquake yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It is typical for Administration officials to point their fingers at women whenever unemployment rates remain unacceptably high. This past summer, increases in the unemployment rate juxtaposed with rapid employment growth once again directed official attention toward female labor force growth. For example, at a news conference on Sept. 3, Alan Greenspan, chairman of the President's Council of Economic Advisers, discussed the August increase in the unemployment rate in the context of the extraordinary pace of women's entry into the labor force. While no doubt there are many women who would be delighted to believe that they had played some role in Ford's defeat, we do not think that women can take full credit for unsettling the Administration's plans for a smooth economic recovery. The fact is that the majority of reentrants into the labor force in 1976 have been male.

title: Opera: The Mystery Of the Met's Tsclarmonde
description: THE METROPOLITAN OPERA, which does not perform Mozart's lesser works or anything by Handel, is currently spending its time on Esclarmonde, a minor effort by Massenet. Under the best of circumstances, Esclarmonde might seem long and trivial, which is an unfortunate combination, but when it is performed as indifferently as it was Wednesday night, the fact of its presence at the Metropolitan becomes a real puzzler.

title: Birds Fall Dead in Coast Town
description: SAN LUIS OBISPO, Calif., Nov. 25 (AP) Scores of blackbirds and pigeons fell from their roosts and died today for the second consecutive day, and the state authorities are searching for a cause.

title: The Republican Opportunity Under Carter
description: WASHINGTON  The Carter victory may well be a blessing in disguise for the Republican Party's progressive wing, for it marks the end of eight frustrating years during which party loyalty forced progressives to support a President with whom they were ideologically uncomfortable.

title: Tass Sees Last Gasp in Fund Drive For Russian Study Centers in U.S.
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 25 (AP)The Soviet press agency Tass said today that a fund drive for Russian studies at Harvard and Columbia universities was the last gasp of Kremlinologists who opposed dtente.

title: Hans A. Widenmann, 78
description: Hans A. Widenmann, a stockbroker and economist, died Wednesday at Community Hospital, in Montclair, N.J. He was 78 years old and lived in Upper Montclair.

title: 2 Collegians Get an A in Comic Books
description: Gary Berman and Adam Malin have this thing about comic books. So do tens of thousands of other Americans.

title: FAMILY OF BLAST VICTIM GETS A $660,000 AWARD
description: The dependents of a 25yearold man who was killed four years ago when a heating duct exploded in a Wall Street building settled a damage suit out of court with the building owner, its architect and the Consolidated Edison Company for $660,000, according to Abraham Fuchsberg, attorney for the family of the man, Peter Sandick.

title: Fed's Signaling on Rates Spurs Bond Price Surge
description: The Federal Reserve, which made headlines last Friday by lowering the rate it charges on loans to the relatively few banks that borrow at the central bank's discount window, actually has been signaling in a less blatant way that it wants interest rates to decline. The credit markets have picked up the signal, and they have just come through their strongest surge in five yearsenough of an advance in bond prices to push many interest rates to their lowest levels in more than two years.

title: TOP WEEKEND FILMS
description: 9 P.M. (2) French Connection II (1975). Oene Hackman, Fernando Rey. A thriller, as before.

title: Excess Capacity Afflicts Japan's Mammoth Shipbuilding Industry
description: TOKYO, Nov. 25Japan's oncebooming shipbuilding industry, which has led the world in construction of vessels for more than 10 years, is now struggling under the heavy load of surplus capacity, according to shipbuilding experts here.

title: Lockheed Experts Will Train Iranians Under U.S. Project
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Nov. 25 The Government has approved a $200 million threeyear program under which American civilian experts are to train thousands of Iranian airmen in such humble but important jobs as supply management and inventory control.

title: Mic keyYou'll Be in Stitches
description: Heighho, heighho, It's off to sew you gowith the new Walt Disney Characters Needlepoint Book (Random House, $8.95).

title: Leftists Demonstrate in Cairo For Right to Organize a Party
description: CAIRO, Nov. 25 (Reuters) About 500 leftwing students demonstrated outside the People's Assembly today, demanding freedom to form political parties more to their liking than the left, right and center parties recently authorized by President Anwar elSadat.

title: illustrating the American Ideal
description: Americans have become so used to absorbing images of themselves from television that some probably have forgotten that there are other ways. A reminder that artistillustrators, with their printed pictures, were the dominant image makers throughout most of the nation's history is available this weekend at the NewYork Historical Society, Central Park West and 77th Street.

title: Hartwick Tops UConn
description: In a game that neither team wanted to play on Thanksgiving Day, 1lartwick defeated Connecticut, 20, and became the first team to reach the National Collegiate Athletic Association soccer semifinals. An N.C.C.A. committee had ruled that the game be played yesterday after the teams could not agree on a time before the Sunday deadline.

title: 3 F.B.I. Men in Stakeout Were Shot, Apparently by Their Fellow Agents
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25A team of inspectors from the Federal Bureau of Investigation's headquarters is trying to reconstruct a shootout in which three bureau agents were wounded last week, apparently by other agents, while trying to avert a robbery at a New Jersey bank.

title: A New York Event That Is Made in Hoboken
description: If the parade is made in Hoboken, where Manny Bass designs and builds the floats and storybook characters for Macy's, it has to be produced on the streets of Manhattan, and 28yearold Nancy Mallory Williams handles that job.

title: Bridge:
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 24Two young experts from Philadelphia led the field into the final session of the blueribbonpair championship at the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals here tonight. The two, Jay Apfelbaum and William Edelstein, held a substantial lead in the field of 60 pairs, with 30 deals remaining to be played.

title: Friday
description: Showing some encouraging local responsibility, WCBS Channel 2 has a new project called A Woman Is  with Bess Myerson. Five separate program units, presented more or less monthly, will explore five different stages in a woman's life, from adolescence through old age. Each unit will contain one film essay offered at 7:30 P.M. on a Friday, to be followed the next week by five talk shows at 9:30 A.M. with Miss Myerson expanding on the film's themes.

title: Laotians Oust French Reporter But Say They May Relent Later
description: PARIS, Nov. 25 (Reuters)Laotian authorities in Vientiane have expelled the correspondent of Agence FrancePresse, the agency announced here today.

title: Yugoslays Acclaim New Law on Labor As Step to Marxism
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 25Five days of national ceremonies began today in connection with promulgation of a new law under which Yugoslavia's leaders hope the nation will move more rapidly toward pure Marxist Communism.

title: Casals Exhibition At Photography Center
description: Remembering Casals, an exhibition of photographs, slides, films, videotapes and recordings relating to the late cellist Pablo Casals is on view at the International Center of Photography, 1130 Fifth Avenue at 94th Street, until Jan. 2.

title: Metropolitan Baedeker
description: LIKE THE MARINE creature that gave it its name, Oyster Bay, L.I., is a town whose development on the outside belies the treasures within.

title: Long Branch Is Too Much For Red Bank
description: Long Branch scored twice within one minute in the second period to take command in a 4020 victory over Red Bank yesterday in Red Bank.

title: Dance: Cliff Keuter In PostAvant Style
description: THE CLIFF KEUTER Dance Company has been in existence since 1969, but in recent years it has enlarged its scope and perhaps taken on a slightly new image: It is now less selfconsciously avantgardist, and possibly owes a larger debt than in the past to classic ballet.

title: Emlyn Williams Evokes Touch of Poet
description: Erniyn Williams, marking his 71st birthday tonight, will stand on the stage of Theater Four and, contradicting his distinguished appearanceelegant suit and tie, neat white wavy hairwill describe himself to the audience this way:

title: Budget Director, a Critical Post
description: Presidentelect Carter has reportedly chosen a Georgia banker, Thomas 13. Lance, to be director of the Office of Management and Budget in his Administration. Although the post of budget director is often overlooked by the public, it is an appointment critical to the success or failure of the Carter Administration.

title: Elizabeth Brown Is Married to Henry E. Crampton
description: Elizabeth Vanderbilt Brown of Darien, Brown, was married yesterday to Henry E. Crampton, a retired executive of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company. The ceremony was performed in the First Presbyterian Church in Greenwich, Conn., by the Rev. George Pera The beide is a daughter of Mrs. John L. Vanderbilt of Englewood, N.J. Her first husband was institutional director of the New York Stock Exchange. Mr. Crampton's first wife, the former Elizabeth Jessup, died.

title: Warsaw Pact Leaders Meeting To Shape Policies Toward West
description: BUCHAREST, Rumania, Nov. 25The leaders of the seven membernations of the Sovietled Warsaw Pact began two days of closed consultations here today to coordinate their policies in dealing with the West.

title: Huge Zinc Find Troubles Crandon, Wis.
description: CRANDON, Wis.The approach of winter in this section of clean water and clear air has brought a dull, monotonous grayness to the countryside, save for the green of the spruce, fir, red pine and aspen nestled among the talk of crandon wis tall, leafless birch trees, wose white bark form background for the evergreens. The scene is complemented by an overcast sky as the north woods area awaits the icy blasts from Canada that will soon paint the landscape snowy white.

title: Mexicans Using U.S. As Haven for Dollars
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 25  Apprehensive Mexicans carried hundreds of millions of dollars over the border into Texas before the Central Bank of Mexico moved Monday to curb the flow, according to Texas bankers.

title: Canadian Concern Says It Paid Agent Fees to Lichtenstein Bank
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 25 (AP)Atomic Energy of Canada Ltd. paid $2.4 million into a Liechtenstein bank account as its share of fees to foreign agents on the sale of a nuclear reactor to Argentina, Alastair Gillespie, Energy Minister said here yesterday.

title: U.S. AND MEXICO SIGN TREATY ON PRISONERS
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 25The United States and Mexico tonight signed a prisonerexchange treaty that will enable several hundred Americans serving prison terms here to complete their sentences In the United States.

title: Raymond P. Snow, 101
description: WEST PLAINS, Mo.. Nov. 25 (A.P)Raymond Perry Snow one of the last survivors of the SpanishAmerican War, is dead. He was 101 years old.

title: Fairfield Prep Reaches Final; Salvati Excels
description: Fairfield Prep gained a berth in the first Connecticut football playoffs as Steve Salvati led the Jesuits to a 307 victory yesterday over Stamford. Salvati scored four touchdowns on short runs and collected 166 yards rushing in 34 attempts.

title: Tips on Tickets
description: The Big Comicon Creation Convention begins at noon today at the Statler Hilton Hotel, Seventh Avenue and 33d Street (opposite Madison Square Garden). It will be open tonight until 2:30 A.M., tomorrow from 10 A.M. to 2:30 A.M. and Sunday from 10 A.M. until 6 P.M. Tickets, available at the door, are 84 for single day or $10 for the entire convention.
