description: Time, in somber and witty garb, was the subject of Linda Tarnay's program The Seasons on Friday evening at American Theater Laboratory. The most humorous manifestation and the strongest was Primavera, featuring Miss Tarnay as a pregnant overseer of revels.

title: The Old Patronage Game May Be Dying in N. Y. City
description: Over the years, patronage has been frontally assaulted, pontificated upon by editorial writers, attacked root and branch by reformers and legislated, all to no avail. Now a painful cure for it, at least in sonic places, seems to be in the offing: Starve it to death. There seems, however, to be some question as to whether patronage or the cities it afflicts will expire first.

title: Cheryl Marie Grant Wed to Louis Tancredi
description: Cheryl Marie Grant, president of Carter .Grant Productions, producer of television shows, was married yesterday morning to Louis Tancredi, board chairman and president of Scenic Services Inc. of Los Angeles, designer and manufacturer of sets for motion pictures, television, concerts and commercials. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Charles 13. McDermott in St. Michael's Roman Catholic Church in Union, N. .J.

title: New York Getting Special Cleanup
description: A special Sunday sweeping and cleaning program for major shopping streets throughout New York City will start today. Mayor Beame said yesterday.

title: Alicia M. Kershaw To Be Bride in May Of Clifton P.A. Rose
description: Alicia Marshall Kershaw. who is in her second year at the Yale Law School. and Clifton Peter t,tawa Rose, a thirdyear student there, plan to be married in May. Their engagement has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Warren F, Kershaw of Clinton Corners, N. Y., parents of the bridetobe, whose fiance is the son of Mr. and Mrs. John Desmond Rose of Auckland, N. Z.

title: Miss Breed, Lawyer, Bride Of Douglas Hill
description: Alexandra Taylor Breed, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. James Roy Breed of Poughkeepsie, N. Y., was married there yesterday afternoon to Douglas Porter Hill, son of Mr. and Mrs. Elswood Smart Hill of Rochester. The Rev. Herman Harnielink 3d performed the ceremony in the Reformed Church. A reception was held at the Vassar Alumnae House.

title: The Sitcoms Are Easier to Weather Than the Cop Shows
description: Some of usbecause in our surliness we were watching NBC's Captains and Kings degenerate, week by week, into Gothic shriekhave only just now gotten around to finding out what Tony Randall's up to on his new Thursdaynight ABC sitcom. He's up to being a judge with two children and a housekeeper, which is fine with me: The situation comedy is a nice place for the middle and professional classes to be made fun of, and still to muddle through. The premise of such shows is that a teacher or a doctor or a lawyer or a psychologist or a TV producer or a college professor may be adequate at his job but not entirely competent at life. This allows the great American viewing public to get even with those people who are always telling us what to do or think, without in any way implying that they might be untrustworthy in their professional roles, unless of course they are women.

title: The Golf Clinic
description: Each year Golf Digest compiles a list of most improved club golfers from across the country. We ask local professionals to send us the names of their winners and include reasons for imnrovement.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: reasonable, as the Roselle Board of Education charged. The Commissioner of Education, Dr. Fred G. Burke, ordered the board to submit an acceptable plan for integrating the schools in the district by. April of this year. When the board failed to submit an appropriate plan, the Commissioner ordered implementation of his own plan beginning in the school year that started this September.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: OFTEN, I take the last train from Manhattan to Glen Cove. As I walk up Cedar Swamp Road from the Glen Street station, I pass tbe Sons or Italy lodge hall on the edge of Glen Cove's Little Italy. At 2 A.M., the streets of toe Italian quarter are deserted and silent; I find myself remembering my early life in this community. I cross the road to pass the Coles School and glance at the inscription over the main entrance: Who Dares to Teach Must Never Cease to Learn.

title: Elizabeth Black Stewart Wed To Clinton Brown in Buffalo
description: Elizabeth Black Stewart and Clinton Egbert Brown were married yesterday afternoon in the Westminster Presbyterian Church in Buffalo by the Rev. Warren W. Lane, a cousin of the bride,

title: Fashion: Paris report
description: For a woman whose life centers around the swimming pool or the beach six months of the year, there's plenty of fashion news in the French spring and summer readytowear collections. If every night there's a costume party or the opening of a new, lively discothque she's got to be seen at, ditto. But if she works all day and is glad to put her feet up when she comes home, and maybe once or twice a week invites some close friends over to share her cooking, then she'd better look elsewhere for ideas for what to put on her back.

title: Colleges Now Are Recruiting For More Than Athletic Reasons
description: Kathleen Sweeney, a physician's daughter, was the kind of high school senior that college recruiters see in their dreams, She was a National Merit Scholarship finalist, had a combined score of 1,530 of a possible 1,600 on the College Board test and was the highest ranking female student in New York State last year on the Regents examination.

title: GARDENING
Carol Shaskan Married to Lawrence Horn
description: Carol Jan Shaskan, a legislative representative in Washington for the National Association of County Governments, was married in New York last evening to Lawrence Alan Horn, a lawyer with the general counsel's office of the Securities and Exchange Commission in Washington. Rabbi Maurice Davis performed the ceremony at the Pierre.

title: Letters
description: Dreams for sale

title: CALIFORNIA JUSTICE FIGHTS RETIREMENT
POINT OF VIEW
description: One of the unique characteristics of the American system is our method of checks and balances in. both Government. and business. This monitoring device cannot prevent all abuses or illegal acts, but it is aimed aL detecting and ultimately deterring them, for no method has ever been devised that would totally prevent violations of law or guarantee good business practices.

title: Stereotyping of Indians Decried at Conference on Native Americans
Mary D. Gale Is Married To Richard P. Davisson
description: Mary D. Gale and Richard P. Davisson, who received M.B.A. degrees this year from Harvard University, were married yesterday morning in Southport, Conn. The Rev. Loring Ensign, pastor of the Congregrational Church of Southport, performed the ceremony at the Pequot Yacht Club, of which the bridegroom is a member.

title: The Feds Seem City's Only Hope For $1Billion
description: New York City officials remain publicly optimistic about finding the $1 billion they need to pay bondholders deprived of their money under the city's illegal moratorium scheme, but neither the officials nor anyone else has produced the evidence for their optimism.

title: Calling Dr. Wescoe
Steel Renews War on Imports
description: WASHINGTON  America's steelmakers, who have seldom shied in the past from seeking Government protection against lowcost foreign steel imports, are on the warpath again. This time, however, they say their enemy is not just cheap steel but unfair trading Practices by foreign steelmakers that have the same result: keeping import prices low and undercutting the domestic price structure.

title: ART VIEW
description: The Guggenheim Museum, which lacks the gallery space to keep a significant part of its collection of modern paintings and sculpture on permanent public view, contrives from time to time to do the next best thing. It interrupts the usual succession of temporary loan shows with a sizable exhibition drawn from its own collection. In this way, we are given an opportunity to reacquaint ourselves with some of the works we already know, new visitors get to see some of the things they may have heard or read about and all of us have a chance to catch up on what the museum has been acquiringbehind the scenes, so to speakwhile the temporary shows have been coming and going.

title: Best Sellers
description: Mass Market. Paperbacks

title: The Region
description: New York City's welfare Institutions and system of higher education, contending that they already have been cut to the bone in two years of fiscal emergency, are planning publicity campaigns in an effort to stave off further reductions in funding for the services they provide.

title: Surge by N. Michigan Beats Delaware, 2817
description: NEWARK, Del., Nov. 27 (AP)Steve Mariucci threw one touchdown pass and directed Northern Michigan to two others today in the final eight minutes to give. the Wildcats a 2817 victory over Delaware in the National Collegiate Athletic Association Division 11 college football quarterfinal playoffs.

title: Myron Jonas, Agency President In the Graphics Field, Dies at 72
description: Myron Jonas, president of the Myron Jonas Company, a Manhattan advertising agency, from 1927 to 1972, when he retired, died Thursday at the home of a son, Dr. Saran Jonas, at 60 East End Avenue. He was 72 years old and lived on the East Side of Manhattan.

title: Scavenger Uses Minisub to Recover Loot
description: FRESNO, Calif., Nov.27 (AP)Bob Tostenson is a scavenger, but hardly a garbage man. Although it is no 9to5 job, he is confined to his scat in a small work area.

title: U.S. Banking Regulator, Recently Retired, Joins Concern That Owns a National Bank in Chicago
Not the Same as Single
description: IN the last few years, there has been a proliferation of singles groups. Singles throng to the ubiquitous rap sessions, the standard fare at most such meetings. Topics for discussion range from the innocuous to the inane. A Long Island Unitarian Church singles rap session recently offered the topic: Is It Love or Is It Plumbing? To what purpose? Who knowsperhaps, during the wineandcheese period following the rap session, one lonely soul would meet another lonely soul across the crowded room.

title: Single Blessedness
description: Poor neurotic dear, she must be afraid of a real relationship, or else she'd have a husband. Pinched and bigoted thinking of this sort is going out of style, and high time, but not fast enough to suit Margaret Adams and Catherine Breslin. Their polemics, Single Blessedness and The Mistress Condition, are spirited defenses, in startlingly different styles, of singleness as a modus vivendi for women.

title: SelfInspection And Car Inspection
description: IF we in New Jersey would take care of ourselves with the same rigor we inspect our cars, we would be healthier and live longer. The state ought to set up health screening stations adjacent to motorvehicle inspection stations. While an inspector in a blue uniform checked your brakes, a technician in white would measure your blood pressure.

title: The Sorcerer Of Bolinas Reef
description: By the time Charles Reich's The Greening of America was published in 1970, Woodstock, poetry against the war, and Bob Dylan had passed by. The expansive mood of the 1960's had become heavy and autumnal. Maybe the Vietnam War had aged it, or maybe the wheel had simply turned. When Reich's articles began to appear in the Yale Law Journal, and then, to a flurry of attention, in The New Yorker, they resembled a rearguard manifesto, announcing a revolution that was waning. An overnight best seller, The Greening of America gave a sort of retrospective legitimacy to the outburst of styles that had dazzled America during the previous years, and may have added a year or two of life to the fading youth movement.

title: St. John's Five Wins Lapchick Final, 8765
description: Glen Williams had only one of his sore thumbs (the left) wrapped in bandages before the championship game of the second annual Joe Lapchick tournament: at St. John's last night and his reasoning was simple: I couldn't bandage both, because I needed my other hand to shoot with.

title: Jazz: Ella Sings
description: Norman Granz, who gave up his touring jazz concerts, Jazz at the Philharmonic, in 1957except for a shortlived revival in 1967brought a new touring jazz troupe to town Friday evening at Carnegie Hall for two shows. This one is called the Pablo Jazz Festivalfor Mr. Granz's current record company, Pablo Records  but three of the four headliners were veterans of Jazz at the PhilharmonicElla Fitzgerald, Oscar Peterson and the Count Basie orchestra.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in the Arts and Leisure Section:

title: REPORT FROM PARIS
description: PARIS Beaubourg, the futuristic $180million complex for contemporary art and culture that has been oddly implanted in the heart of old Paris, is slowly nearing completion amidst heated debate over its conception, its architecture and high cost of operating.

title: Lag in Nassau Case Involving Kickbacks Held Disillusioning
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Nov. 27The District Attorney's office, the courts and the criminaljustice system are losing cerdibility in the eyes of the public because of the long delay in trying five Hempstead Town officials on kickback charges, according to Denis E. Dillon, the Nasau County District Attorney.

title: LIGGETT GROUP DISCLOSES PAYMENTS TO FOREIGNERS
description: DURHAM, N.C., Nov. 27 (AP)Liggett Group Inc., parent company of the Liggett and, Myers Tobacco Company, has disclosed $99,000 in questionable and possibly illegal overseas as payments by two of its subsidiaries.

title: ONE OF TWO GIRLS SHOT IS IN SERIOUS CONDITION
description: One of two girls who were shot without apparent motive early yesterday as they sat on a porch in a quiet residential street in the Bellerose section of Queens was in serious condition with a bullet lodged in her back.

title: Italian Papers Decreasing Pages In a Campaign to Win Price Rise
POLITICS
description: THERE is something about gatherings of public officials in an election year that inspires a hunger for inside political wisdom that is insatiable. If the gettogether lasts for more, than a day or two, as did the recent Atlantic City conference of the League of Municipalities, the available information wears thin, and rumor, gossip and outright invention are called upon to fill the gap.

title: Alalia Kempner Is Married
description: Alalia Morse Kempner, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward M. Kempner Jr. of Livingston, N. J., was married last evening to Frederick Thaler, son of Mr. Mrs. Joseph Thaler of Merrick, L. I. The Rev. Clark Olsen performed the ceremony in the Morristown (N. J.) Unitarian Fellowship. The bride, who will keep her maiden name, is a psychiatric nurse at Butler Hospital in Providence, R. I. Her husband is in his final year at the Brown University School of Medicine.

title: Talking At the Boundaries
description: Ever since he began publishing in the midsixties, David Antin has been a remarkably interesting and intelligent poet. He was, early on, peripherally associated with the poets who were attempting a revivification of the art through the employment of what was then called the Deep ImageRobert Kelly and Jerome Rothenberg foremost among thembut attention to his work revealed that his association with them was more a matter of friendship and geography than it was a matter of esthetics. Hr. Antin was not then interested, nor is he now, in what one calls (loosely, God knows) the imagination. That is, invention and the making of images or replicas assume no place in his poetic. His concern has always been with allowing his language to seek its own form and allowing that form to stand as his content. How can we know the dancer from the dance? Yeats asks.

title: Robert Powell Weds Ellen Daniel Simons
description: Ellen Daniel Simons, a trainee in the national banking group at Citibank, was married yesterday afternoon to Robert Lane Powell of New York who is in the operations division of the Chase Manhattan Bank, The Rev. John Harmon performed the ceremony in St. Paul's Episcopal Church in Philadelphia.

title: Group at the Voice of America Asks Independence From U.S.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP)A group of journalists and broadcasters at the Voice of. America is calling for independence from the United States Information Agency and insulation from the State Department, a Voice offical has disclosed.

title: Notes: AutoTrain Is Expanding Services
Helping the Retarded Hold Jobs
WIDENING ARRESTS WORRY ARGENTINES
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 27The uncertain fate of hundreds of people who have vanished in murky antisubversive operations here torments a growing number of Argentines, who want the military to account for their prisoners.

title: Keeping The Home Fires Burning
description: Probably one of the mostwanted features desired for any home that does not already have one is a real wood burning fireplace. Building one in an existing house by using traditional brick and masonry is an expensive, major alteration that makes it a prohibitive improvement project for most homeowners, Even when this is not a deterrent, many will find that experienced masons who are familiar with the specialized techniques involved in designing and building a proper brick fireplace and chimney are almost imnossible to find in communities.

title: Carter Sets His Goals on Jobless
description: Just as Jimmy Carter's rise from obscure former governor to Presidentelect was extraordinary, his transition from Presidentelect to President is so far unusual. Unlike others in his position, who have generally tended to be reticent on significant matters until they take office, Mr. Carter, in a visit to Washington last week, made major policy pronouncements and commited his Administration to the achievement of specific important goals.

title: Building a better bug trap
description: There are several million distinct insect species, maybe 250 million individual bugs for every one of us, As far as human beings are concerned, about 99.9 percent of these are benign, and a few, like bees, are indispensable. But the rest, perhaps a couple of thou. sand species, are pests: Either they eat the same things we do, or they eat us.

title: Stage: Blood Knot in Hartford
News of Realty
description: The F. W. Woolworth Company has announced it will open five Woolco stores in Suffolk County, N. Y., in March. They will add more than 500,000 square feet of new retail space to this chain of fullline, promotional department stores. The move will mark Woolco's introduction into New York State.

title: Industry Beckons M.D.'s
MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: The push to lower interest mates produced dynamic gains in bond prices and continued advances in stock prices last week. Bonds generally moved to their highest levelsand lowest yieldssince 1974, spurred by crediteasing signals from the Federal Reserve, the nation's money manager. In the stock market, the yieldsensitive utilities rose to their best levels in three years, with the Dow Jones utility average finishing the week at 102.76.

title: Letter to the Editor 1  No Title
A Sudden Problem in The North
description: There are enough ominous problems to worry about in this cruel world Without borrowing trouble. It's altogether likely, therefore, that not one American in a thousand has ever bothered himself about the nation's northern border. Why should anyone?

title: Algeria Is Preparing for Presidential Election After Two Referendums Strengthen Boumediene's Position
description: ALGIERS, Nov. 29With a level of political debate not heard here for many years, Algeria is preparing for its first presidential election since Houari Boumediene seized power in a coup 11 years ago.

title: Arsenal Aides to Be Relocated
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 27 (AP)Nearly half the 2,237 employees of the Frankford Arsenal are being offered jobs .in other areas, a spokesman said yesterday. But 900 other workers who do not want to relocate. will receive layoff notices Monday, said Edmond Corcoran, arsenal information officer.

title: Genghis Khan
description: For most people today Genghis Khan is little more than a name. And yet the infant who was born, in Mongolia around 1155, clutching a highly symbolic clot of dried blood in his tiny hand and called by his father Temujin, was certain to leave his mark on history. That he himself foresaw the impact he was to make is suggested by his own early decision to substitute for Temujin the more resonant name of Genghis Khan or Ruler of the World. Just what this impact would amount to is the theme of Peter Brent's excellent book.

title: Patricia Brous Is Engaged
description: The engagement of Patricia Sue Brous, a student at the Downstate Medical School in Brooklyn, to Mark Illan Silberman, a student at the Georgetown University Medical School, has been announced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Richard Brous of Hewlett, L.I. Mr. Silberman is a son of Dr. and Mrs. Zolly Silberman of Woodmere, L.I.

title: Author's Query
description: For a third volume in a series on Indiana authors I would like information about any Indianans who have published hooks from 1816 through 1976. the author should be an Indiana native or have lived in the state for a considerable amount of time.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Since 1972 James McClure has been represented by a series of four police procedural novels set in South Africa. He was born there, knows the ambience as no stranger can, and his books featuring Lieut. Tromp Kramer and his Zulu assistant, Mickey Zondi, have been among the more interesting crime novels of the decade as much for their insights tlito South African society as for the actual crime and mystery elements.

title: Slam! Crash! Racquetball!
description: Tennis doesn't give you enough exercise; squash does, but like the grand dukes and transAtlantic liners, it can't last, says national squash champion Victor Niederhoffer. The game for Americans to watch is racquetball. In 10 years, he says, it will be bigger than tennis. Indeed, a boom is already under way. Though no one in Brookline, Bronxvillc or Bryn Mawr may have ever seen racquetballa rowdy child of bigcity gymsmuch of the rest of the country seems to have hecome addicted.

title: New and Noteworthy
description: THE CONSERVATIONIST, by Nadine Gordimer. (McGrawHill. $3.50.) An industrialist, who has his way with women and about everything else he wants in whitedominated South Africa, stumbles on a dead black man and his moment of truth; a beautifully rendered novelistic compound of lyrical intelligence and political purpose.

title: David G. Breinig, Retired Head Of Hoboken Paint Company, 96
description: David E. Breinig, who was president of the Breinig Paint Company in Hoboken, N. J., when he retired about 25 years ago, died Wednesday at a convalescent home in Killingly, Conn. He was 96 years old and lived'in South Woodstock, Conn., where he had moved from New York when he retired. His grandfather founded the paint company, which has been merged with a larger company, in 1876.

title: ART MAILBAG
description: Defending Shahn

title: Library That Isn't May Find It Wasn't
Movies in Spain Starting to Deal With Civil War
Kempf Hogan Fiance Of Chrystine Jones
HOME CLINIC
description: ONE worthwhile way to spend a winter afternoon indoors is to label all valves and plumbing lines in the basement or attic. All too often when an emergency develops that calls for the quick shutting off of a water, gas, or hotwater valve, time is lost looking for the right one. To prevent this, each such valve should marked with a tag telling whether it controls a hot or cold water line, a heating line or a gas line, and it should tell which rooms or fixtures it supplies. It Is best to use tags of one color for all coldwater lines, another for hot water, a third for heating lines, and so on.

title: Article 4  No Title
2 Held After Capital StandOff
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP)A twohour standoff between the police and two armed men holding three hostages in an apartment building ended quietly when a hostage talked the men into surrendering; the police said. This woman with her threeMonthold baby helped talk them out, Deputy Chief Maurice T. Turner said after the siege ended last night. No one was hurt during the incident, which began when the two suspects, Dwayne Dark and Andrew Dean, both 25 years old, allegedly tried to rob two undercover officers during a narcotics sale.

title: Real Life
description: A single photograph found in the ruins of Troy, or in the loot of a Hun, home from the sacking of Rome, might provoke a rewriting of the fiction of history: runofthe mill commercial photos, merchants in front of their shops, a figure framed in a doorway, the studio portrait of a family rigid before the powder flashes. How lifelike they lookand how, like life, we are left with an ambiguous impression. In the fading photograph there is a disquieting presence that speaks to the observer like the voice in a seance. We gaze into it at our own peril. If we scrutinize it closely, if we attend its message, if we ponder its vibrations, we become vision aries. Unavoidably we begin to see what is not visible to others. Michael Lesy is one of this number. The more he looks the more he imagines.

title: Food
description: It is scarcely news at this late date to say that the food processor is the greatest thing to happen to the wellequipped American kitchen since refrigeration. Only a few short years ago, the dishes presented here would scarcely have been possible for the home cook. A mousse (and a pain de poisson, or fish loaf, which is a kind of mousse) was something reserved for professional kitchens, laboriously prepared by beating and pounding and sieving by hand. The scallop mousse is a gossamer affair with a fine, creamy tomato sauce; the French fish loaf is an equally delectable delicacy and may he served hot or cold. Either of these dishes can he prepared by using an electric blender, but it is more timeconsuming and the product will be trifle less elegant.

title: Crowded Agenda for N.A.S.L. Meeting
description: Expansion, relocation of franchises, division alignment, alternatives to the penaltykick tiebreaker and the size and composition of rosters will be the main items of discussion when the North American Soccer League owners reconvene their annual meeting in Chicago on Thursday. The owners of the existing 20 franchises discussed some of these matters but no decisions were made at a meeting in Bloomington, Minn., last month.

title: John Colangelo, Law Student, Is Fiance of Denise C. Linen
description: Mr. and Mrs. Edwin K. Linen of Port Chester, N.Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Denise Camille Linen, to John B. Colangelo, son of Mr. and Mrs. Daniel Colangelo, also of Port Chester.

title: DANCE VIEW
description: TORONTO Canada is a curious country. I happen to love it, but I cannot respect its odd feelings of insecurity and inferiority. It.is not quite so bad in this respect as Australia, another country I love, but it is bad enough. Why Canadians worry about what they have and have not got in the world of culture totally puzzles me. In CBC they have the best television network in North America well, let us say, the least bad. In the Stratford Festival In Ontario they also have the best drama company in North America. The orchestras are perhaps not so hot, although I am told that Anthony Davis is doing a good job with the Toronto Symphony. The opera is perennially promising rather than promisingly brilliant (mind, this summer I saw a firstrate Queen of Spades, with Jon Vickers, in Ottawa). The museums tend to be imaginative. The architecture often innovative. Of all North American cities, modern and notsomodern, I have an ungovernable penchant for Chicago, but Toronto is, nowadays, looking pretty good. It is developing so rapidly that you might imagine it was in Texas. And then there are its three ballet companies.

title: Detention of Hundreds Under South African Security Laws Becoming Focus of Dissent
Industry Expected to Press Plan To Export Alaskan Oil to Japan
Ann S. Barket Becomes Bride Of Eric Kolvig
description: Ann. Shelly Barker and Eric William Kolvig, who teach English literature at the Oakwood School in Poughkeepsie, N.Y., were married yesterday in the chapel of Middlebury College. The Rev. Wallace W. Anderson, a Congregational minister, performed the ceremony.

title: Susan Snaper Is Wed To Victor B. Shousha
description: Susan Dorothy Snaper, daughter of Eleanor Kilgallen of New York and Wilbur Snaper of Rumson, N. J., and a granddaughter of James L. Kilgallen, a veteran reporter with the Hearst Headline Service, was married yesterday in Woodchester, England, to Victor B. Shousha, a charlered accountant with Randall & Payne in Cheltenham, England. The Rev. Aloysius Murray performed the Roman Catholic ceremony at the Dominican Priory.

title: Divorce Reforms Proposed
New York Council Unit Schedules a Hearing
description: The following public hearing will be held by a New York City Council committee this week:

title: In Germany, Strauss Will Go His Own WayRightward
Birth Expectations Found Down Among Younger Married Women
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI)Young married women today expect to bear two children, one fewer than young married women did nine years ago according to the Census Bureau.

title: To Help the Voters Choose
Sunday Observer
description: I cannot name this person. He is much too famous: If I breathed his name, you would accuse me of namedropping, which is not the point here at all. The point is that he is extraordinarily famous. A star, a veritable star in his field, which I will not identify either. He could be a rock star, a film star, a star of sport, of television. It doesn't matter. The point is that he is famous.

title: 3 IN CARTER'S TRIAL TELL OF ALIBI STORY
description: PATERSON, N.J., Nov. 27Three former friends of Rubin (Hurricane) Carter testified today that prior to his first trial in 1967, they had been asked to testify falsely to having been with him at the time of the three murders he is accused of having committed.

title: Einstein Is A ScienceFiction OperaPlay
description: At exactly 11 P.M. last Sunday evening a pillar of white light rose from the stage at the Metropolitan Opera House and disappeared slowly into the sky. A few minutes later a spaceship landed, an intricate threestory assembly humming with light and sound. As the light formed laoyrinthine patterns of dots, blinking and changing like a panoply of fireworks, clocks in glass coffins began to levitate and a weightless spaceman flew across the stage. This was the climax of a mystical, monumental theater piece, Einstein on the Beach, the Robert WilsonPhilip Glass opera, which had its American premiere at the Met (where it will be repeatea tonight).

title: The Mercenaries
description: The mercenaries are a small counterforce organized to obliterate several staging areas for terrorists across the border from Rhodesia. In view of the recent news coming out of southern Africa, you can't have an adventure novel more topical than this. Giles Tippette, author of The Bank Robber and The Brave Men, has sketched a plausible task force whose members range in character from hero to psycho. When one of the latter kills his commander in chief, it falls to an American exAir Force pilot named Cody Ravel to lead the expedition, which he does in the best Alistair MacLean tradition.

title: ARBITRATION BACKED IN POLICE DISPUTES
description: After a statewide study of police and firefighter disputes a special panel from Cornell University has recommended the Continued use of binding contract arbitration as the final step in impasse situations.

title: If Mr. Carter Fails, That Would Make It Unanimous
9 Cuban Refugees Go on Trial in Miami Tomorrow, Putting Focus on Terrorists' Activity in South Florida
description: MIAMI, Nov. 27Nine Cuban refugees are to go on trial here Monday in the murder of Luciano Nieves. an exile leader who had advocated a United States dialogue with Cuba.

title: A Harlem Millionaire, 73, Chooses a Quiet Life of Work and Family
description: Lloyd E. Dickens is 73 years old and lives in Harlem in a onebedroom apartment that is as plain and unimpressive as his realestate office a few blocks away.

title: Orsinian Tales
description: Ursula K. Le Guin, one of the most accomplished of contemporary science fiction writers, has written a provocative collection of short stories that are not science fiction by any conceivable definition of the term. Having said this, I must add that these Orsinian Tales share many of the virtues of her best science fiction. As in her novels The Dispossessed and The Left Hand of Darkness, she writes in quiet straightforward sentences about people who feel they are being torn apart by massive forces in society technological, political, economicand who fight courageously to remain

title: A Scholar's Destinations:
25 Ethnic Groups Unite for a Book
description: ACOLLECTION of essays by members of 25 ethnic goups in New Jersey, some of whose local histories have never before been documented, will be published early next year by the state's Bicentennial Commission.

title: Karla S. Hay Bride in Akron Of Law Student
description: St. Paul's Episcopal Church in Akron, Ohio, was the setting last evening for the marriage of Karla Sherer Hay, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Karl S. Hay jr. of Akron, to Robert Carver Diserens 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Diserens Jr. of Mount Kisco, N. Y. The Rev. George E. Ross performed the ceremony.

title: Carter's Program Will Face A More Assertive Congress
A Rich Pilgrim Makes Friends
description: PLYMOUTH, MASS. FROM where she plays the role of a Pilgrim in a restored 17thcentury village here, Florence Bosworth can see a Pilgrim of very different sort. The village looks out on Pilgrim 1, the nuclear generating plant owned by Boston Edison.

title: RHODESIA LOSING WHITES IN A RISE OF EMIGRATION
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Nov. 27 (AP)More than 1,000 whites left Rhodesia during October and arrivals of new white settlers dropped to the lowest level in the 11 years since Rhodesia broke from Britain rule, the Government reported yesterday.

title: Miss Wareham To Wed Feb. 26
description: Barbara Wareham, who is with the investment management group of Citibank, and John J. Kavanagh Jr., a vice president and director of consumer products marketing at Citibank. plan to be married Feb. 26. Mr. and Mrs. Simon H. Wareham Jr. of Scarborough, N.Y.. have announced their daughter's engagement to the son of Mr. and Mrs. Kavanagh of Greenwich. Conn.

title: Filipino Wives Can Stay in Army
description: MANILA, Nov.26 (Reuters)President Ferdinand Marcos has signed a decree Forbidding the dismissal of women members of the armed forces when they get married, To qualify, the 539 members of be Women's Auxiliary Corps must have completed five years Service.

title: Design
Bermuda Option: Away From the Hotels
The Public's Interest
description: Although the great majority of the top executives of major American corporations made clear their support for Gerald R. Ford over Jimmy Carter during the election campaign, Presidentelect Carter obviously bears them no grudge. On the contrary, he has been going out of his way to let business executives and bankers know that he is eager to get their adviceon both policy issues and Cabinet appointments. He wants what he calls their constant input on economic matters and legislation, including tax matters.

title: Exploring the Effects
STAMPS
description: The southern part of Africa has been making world news and philatelic news, and also evoking memories of a distant past to kindle nostalgic emotions for many collectors.

title: The Secret Lover Of Elmtree
description: Greg Yardley is 17 and adopted. He has a brother and sister, a parttime job at his father's gas station and the usual adolescent passions and problems.

title: For Ry Cooder, There's Always a New Song
A Critic's Jottings: On Being Gripped Versus Being Touched
Psst! There's Innovation Afoot In Loudspeaker Designs
New &
ROADSALT USE CURBED BY WATERSUPPLY HARM
description: BOSTON, Nov. 27. (AP)The state has announced plans to cut its use of road salt this winter because of concern that salt washing into water supplies may hurt people with high blood pressure.

title: At Least Part of the NationMining StatesBenefits
description: WASHINGTONEver since World War Il, the United States has been like the proverbial pack rat, storing away critical raw materials just in case another long war should come along and once again the nation would be cut off from foreign sources of supplies. It has been an expensive exercise in preparedness, which has been of considerable benefit to the mining industry. Whether it also continues to benefit the nation is a question now being raised within the executive branch. Last week it was the subject of hearings by a Congressional committee on defense production.

title: The Pornography of Everyday Life
description: CINCINNATIWhen the Pentagon Papers were published, what disturbed me more than the deceits, the counterdeceits, the moral numbness and ethical shortcircuiting of our leaders, was the pornography of it all. The hubris of those men, thousands of miles away, making lifeanddeath decisions for others, manipulating the most modern tools of technology, using game theory with models so abstract they could reproduce one another in one joyless, screamless parthenogenetic act, But not once, these men, not once could they experience the epiphany of childbirthor the smell of burning flesh.

title: The Bravest Battle
description: On April 19, 1943, the remnants of the Jews in the Warsaw ghetto began their unequal and hopeless battle against the military might of the SS. It was the first armed resistance in all occupied Europe to challenge Nazi Germany's rule of the Continent. The news, when it seeped out, electrified the world. The hare events of the Warsaw ghetto uprising were soon transformed into a national epos, the drama of a beleaguered people's last stand. Before long, accounts of the significance of those eventsthe myth of an oppressed people taking up arms against insuperable odds to fight their omnipotent tormentors  outrivaied the accounts of the events themselves.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 21yearold Bronx man was shot in the shoulder last night as he came to the aid of a 55yearold woman who was being robbed by four youths on the street, at Marcy Place and the Grand Concourse. The police said that Carlos Martinez was shot by one of the youths as he ran to the defense of Lydia. Pagan of 1276 Clay. Avenue, the Bronx. Tactical patrol police on duty in the area captured two suspects after the ineident. One was a juvenile14 year old. The ether was identified as Tyrone Davis, 20, of 1840 Harrison Avenue, the Bronx. He was charged with assault and robbery. The $2 taken in the robbery was recovered. by the police. Mr. Martinez was treated for a small caliber wound at Lincoln Hospital and released.

title: Dr. Joseph Robinson To Wed Miss Girard
description: Mr. and Mrs. Herbert A. Girard of Palm Beach, Fla., and Gastonia, N.C., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Marylin Eve Girard, to Dr. Joseph Daniel Robinson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Julius Robinson of Beach Haven, N.J. A summer wedding planned.

title: 4 Hurt as Car Crashes Into Crowd at Bath Rally
description: BATH, England, Nov. 27 (AP)Four spectators were injured, two seriously, when a Porsche driven by HansWalter Schew, the German champion, crashed today into a crowd watching the early stages of a British car rally.

title: Truckers Fight Toll Fees
description: IT apparently will take until next spring to learn whether a determined coalition of truckers. associations and automobile clubs can roll back the Red Sea.

title: Susan Wong and John Lee Wed at U.N. Church Center
description: Susan Wong, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Gin Foo Wong of Manila, was married yesterday afternoon to John Lee, son of Mr. and Mrs. James Lee of Brooklyn and East Hampton, L.I.

title: Revival in Jersey City
Patty Costello Is Toppling Tour Records Like Pins
description: When Patty Costello won the Professional Women's Bowlers Association national championship Nova 17, she improved on three tour records. The victory was her third national championship title (she won the event in 1972 and again last year), her fifth firstplace finish of the year, and the 15th career victory. And Miss Costello's season earnings rose to $23,635, only $2,912 below the mark set by Betty Morris in 1974.

title: Playing Tag for Better Communication
description: CENTERPORT VINCENT CAMPISI believes that every good teacher Is a bit of a ham. So when the Performing Arts Foundation posted a theatergames workshop at its headquarters here recently, Mr. Campisi, a fifthgrade teacher from the Main School in West Babylon, showed up to sharpen his skills.

title: The Porn Brokers
description: If you're looking for the latest in pornography, you won't have, to slink into one of those sleazy little storefronts with the Paintedover windows and the tall, ragged letters spelling out ADULT BOOKS. You can now find all the porn your heart desires in such popular literary emporiums as Bookmasters and similar stores nationwide.

title: BRIDGE
description: The bridge beginner has trouble focusing on the importance of aces and kings in his hand and the dummy. As his skill increases so does his vision: He begins to worry about queens, jacks and tens. And when he becomes an expert he uses a microscope, studying minutiae that an ordinary player would certainly overlook. With the bridge equivalent of an electron microscope, he may even perceive the significance of an eightspot before the bidding is over, as West should have the diagramed deal.

title: Favored Royal Ski Takes Remsen With Late Surge
description: Gerry Cheevers couldn't make it to Aqueduct yesterday to see his favorite horse run in the $82,575 Remsen Stakes.

title: Price of Albany Lobbying Tops $3 Million
Edgar Bronfmans Have Child
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Edgar M, Bronfman of Yorktown Heights, N.Y., last Sunday at the Lenox Hill Hospital, Mrs, Bronfman is the former Georgiana E. Webb, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Webb of Finchingfield, Essex, England. Mr. Bronfman is chairman and chief executive of the Seagram Company Ltd., distillers. The child has been named Sara Rosner.

title: MAJ. GEN. MILES REBER, 74, EXCOMMANDER IN EUROPE

Home Clinic

description: HONG KONG, Nov. 27Teng Hsiaoping, the Chinese leader who was purged both in the Cultural Revolution and again earlier this year, appears on his way to another. comeback, analysts here believe.

title: Nonlessons of the campaign
description: After every Presidential election there is an irresistible temptation to extract lessons from what has happened. Unfortunately, such lessons can be poor guides to the future. From 30 years of postNew Deal history, commentators concluded that an incumbent President could not be ousted in the absence of a great depression; then Johnson was forced out in 1968,

title: Yemen Charges Air Intrusions Near the Entrance to Red Sea
description: SANA, Yemen, Nov. 27 (Reuters)Yemen today charged that enemy aircraft had twice violated its air space in the last 10 days near the Bab elMandab Straits at the southern end of the Red Sea.

title: ART
description: FIRST reaction of the exhibition of paintings and silkscreens by Roger Shimomura at Long Island University's C. W. Post Gallery is simply that they are Japanese works by a Japanese artist and that they are a modern tribute to traditional themes and styles of Japanese art. We see the familiar protagonists of the martial arts the samuraiperforming their timehonored rites in the midst of elegantly seductive courtesans and pastoral landscapes quietly composed with the inescapable mountains, huts and waterfalls.

title: FOOD
description: FRANCE is expected to Import around 1.3 metric tons of American potatoes this year, a considerable share of which will hav,e been grown on the Island. A lot of that will become pommel fritesfrench fries.

title: Card of Thanks
description: The family of Stanley E. Kagan thanks the many friends for their thoughtful expressions of sympathy.

title: Study Finds Stepchildren Content
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov.27 (AP)Stepchildren apparently are as contented and happy as children living with both their natural parents, a study shows.

title: Richardson Says Yugoslavia Safeguards U.S. Technical Secrets
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 27Yugoslavia is taking adequate steps to prevent American technical secrets sold to this country from falling into Soviet hands again. Secretary of Commerce Elliot L. Richardson said today.

description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 27The rumors and political hysteria of recent weeks are slowly abating as President Luis Echeverrfa Alvarez prepares to leave office Wednesday, but Presidentelect Jose Lopez Portillo is inheriting an angry and militant middle class, which no longer seems willing to be ignored as a silent minority.

description: Fiction

Paul Hough Marries Iris A. Mastrangelo
description: Iris Antoinette Marie Mastrangelo, a geneticist with the Department of Agriculture in Beltsville, Md., was married yesterday to Paul VanCampen Hough of Port Jeffferson, L.I., a senior biologist at the Brookhaven National Laboratory in Upton, L. I.

title: The Annual Neediest Cases Appeal Begun in 1912, Opens Next Sunday
description: The 65th annual appeal for The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund will open next Sunday. The appeal traditionally begins on the third Sunday before Christmas Day.

title: A Third Victim of Explosion At ChewingGum Factory Dies
description: CHESTER, Pa., Nov. 27 (AP)A third victim died today of burns suffered in New York City chewinggum factory explosion last Sunday.

description: THE New York, Susquehanna and Western Railroad has decided to compete on its own against the other freight railroads in New Jersey.

title: Yanks to Sign Jackson
description: Reggie Jackson, the most glamorous name among baseball's free agents, reportedly will sign a fiveyear contract with the Yankees in a day or two for less than $3 million, Details in Section 5.

title: Music in Review
description: Though it marked her New York solo debut. Nina Barwell's flute recital Tuesday night at Carnegie Recital Hall reflected the skill and assurance of a seasoned performer. A student of JeanPierre Rampal now based in the Boston area, Miss Barwell devoted the first half of her program to works by Telemann, Couperin and J. S. Bach. All the notes were cleanly articulated, and Miss Barwell's terraced dynamics, supple phrasing and tasteful rubato kept the music interesting and affecting. Peter Wolf was the excellent harpsichordist.

title: World Within Walls
description: The walls of Donald Keene's title were those abstract but nevertheless powerful barriers raised by the Tokugawa rulers of. Japan in order to protect their country from foreign contamination. They were effective for over 250 years, from the Battle of Sekigahara in 1600 until the Meiji Restoration in 1868an era of repressive government, but also an era of internal peace. Within those walls a highly organized society grew up.

title: News Summary
description: SUNDAY, NOVEMBER 28, 1976

title: Cohane Cited for Contribution
description: BOSTON, Nov. 27 (AP)Tim Cohane, noted sportswriter and author who is now associate professor of journalism at Boston University, was named today as winner of the New England football writers annual. George Carens Memorial Award for contributions to college football. Co, hane, sports editor of Look for 21 years before the magazine folded, has been associated with college football since his undergraduate days at Fordham the early 1930's. He will he honored at the writers annual awards dinner Mon day night.

title: Sharon Carter, Editorial Aide, Married to John Dennis Dunn
It's Nutcracker Time Again
description: When December comes, we drive up the New Jersey Turnpike toward Manhattan past the green Statue of Liberty, solid and luminous against the darkening sky. We are on our way to Lincoln Center for the New York City Ballet's production of The Nutcracker (which begins its 1976 season Thursday night).

title: THEATER MAILBAG
description: Should Playwrights Ever Explain?

title: 3 Arrested After Protest At Station of Policeman Who Shot Brooklyn Youth
What to Do With Tennis Balls That Are No Good for Tennis
description: With the advent of fall and my summer tennis season over, I found myself with more than 30 used tennis balls. At that point the big decision was: Should I donate the balls to the pro, which meant they would be destined to a life in the ball machine or should I burn them in the incinerator?

title: The Bee Gees Are Back and They're Having a Ball
description: Two years ago, the Bee Gees were a pop group that had lost its fizz, a relic from the 60's with a slowly eroding foliowing. Despite record sales topping 50million units, Barry, Robin, and Maurice Gibb were so discredited as creative musicians that the prejudice of one British disk jockey on hearing their latest release was typical: That's a great record. If you hadn't told me it was by the Bee Gees, I would have said it was a hit. This Thursday, however, the Bee Gees are performing the most prestigious concert of their 20year career, a Madison .Square Garden debut celebrating one of the most surprising comebacks in modern pop history.

title: Hitting the Road to Share the Fun of Cycling
description: WINTRY weather might chill the enthusiasm of many bicyclists, but this is the month when the Nassau Wheelmen fire the gun for their Sundaymorning touring prgram.

title: Housekeeping: Men Take Over
Gloria M. Sirignano Wed to E. L. Mauro
description: Gloria Marie Sirignano, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. George A. Sirignano of Mount Vernon, N. Y., was married yesterday evening to Eugene Louis Mauro of New York, son of Mr. and Mrs. Francis Mauro of West Hempstead, L. I. The bride's uncle. State Supreme Court Justice P. Raymond Sirignano. performed the ceremony at the Sirignano home.

title: Of Special Interest
description: Last month, the British actor, playwright and recitalist Emlyn Williams was in town for an alltoobrief offering of his monologue Dylan Thomas Growing Up, which is based mainly on the poet's prose works and which was enthusiastically received by Clive Barnes. Brilliant . . . He catches the poet's essence . . . One of the most interesting actors in the world, declared Mr. Barnes, adding, It is a rare occasion. Don't walk, run. The occasion, it turns out, is thankfully, not so rare: Mr. Williams is back and has unpacked his Dylan at Theater Four until Dec. 12. But one had still better run for tickets. (See Theater)

title: Beame Backing A Carey Ouster Of Cunningham
description: Mayor Beanie has in effect doomed any chances of Patrick J. Cunningham may have of staving off his ouster as Democratic state chairman. Governor Carey has made it clear that he does not want Mr. Cunningham, who was social as well as political intimate of the Governor.

title: Leleta Naugle Is Married to Dr. Philip Serafim
description: Leleta Naugle, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. John E. Naugle of Chevy Chase, Md., was married in Washington ,yesterday to Dr, Philip E. Serafim of Bethesda, Md., and Athens, son of the late Evangelos D. Serafim, a lawyer who practiced before the Greek Supreme Court, and the late Mrs. Serafim, a landscape artist known as Amalia Serafim.

title: Virginia City's Bars to Be Cut to 20
description: VIRGINIA CITY, Nev.. Nov. 27 (AP)This old mining town, which once offered its residents 110 saloons, has 30 left. Even that. is 10 too many, according to a new ordinance.

description: The marriage of Clarke Emmons, daughter of Lieut. Col. Clark Emmons, U.S.A., retired, and Mrs. Emmons of Winter Park, Fla., to Maj. Harold Ira Friedman, Army Medical Corps, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Friedman of New York, took place yesterday evening.

Still waiting for war
description: MATSU. A landing craft pulls alongside the decrepit ofd Americanmade troopship to ferry the passengers the remaining few hundred yards to the beach. Civilians and soldiers jostle up and down the gangplank from one vessel to the other while little motorboats, manned by frogmen in red swimsuits and windbreakers, hover about in the choppy seas, ready to retrieve anyone who might fall overboard.

title: Claiborne Honored Again
description: RALEIGH, N.C., Nov. 27 (AP)Coach Jerry Claiborne of Maryland finished the regular season with an 110 record, the Atlantic Coast Conference championship and a record 20 consecutive conference victories. The impressive showing resulted in his being named today as A.C.C. coach of the year for the third time in the last four years. Claiborne received 54 of the 114 votes in balloting.

title: North South Talks: Pianissimo But Still Going
description: PARISAfter nearly a year of negotiations over a better shareout of the world's wealth, indications are growing that some kind of arrangements will be pieced together to avoid a blowup in the relationship between rich and poor countries.

description: HOW can our legislative leaders allocate millions of dollars annually for the care of criminals, while the needs of their innocent victims go unsatisfied?

title: Sports Arouse Exultation in the Industrial Crescent
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 27He stood gazing down at the blueandwhiteclad Penn Stale cheerleaders, raptly, his long teenager's hair ruffling in the wind, his redandwhitestriped blouse freshly pressed for a night's work as a pretzel vendor at Three Rivers Stadium.

title: Theodor Rosebury Is Dead at 72
description: Dr. Theodor Rosebury, bacteriologist, specialist in venereal disease and writer, died Thursday at his home in Conway, Mass. He was 72 years old.

title: New York City Went Quite Far With Its Definition
description: There were echoes of judicial battles long ago when the New York Court of Appeals last weekend held the city's debt moratorium unconstitutional. The majority and a dissenting judge disagreed about what both called the police power of the state. That is an elusive concept that used to be a subject of fierce contention in the Supreme Court of the United States.

title: Grarnbling Wins Before 76,188 At Superdome
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 27 (AP)Grambling's Doug Williams connected on a 35yard pass play with Carlos Pennywell for the only touchdown as the Tigers beat Southern University, 102, in the Bayou Classic before the largest crowd ever to attend a sports event in the Louisiana Superdome.

title: Angola's Marxist Leaders Battle Rebels and a Crippled Economy

description: A convicted bank robber has won an appelate decision granting him a new trial because the judge in his case had refused to appoint a fingerprint expert to assist the defense.

title: Half of Amtrack's Riders Travel On New Amfleet or Turbo Trains
description: Amtrak, the national rail passenger service, has issued a new report showing that 78 percent of its passengers on conventional shortdistance trains now ride in Anffleet or Turboliner coaches less than three years old.

title: Tableware That's Also Ovenware
description: The name of Villeroy & Boch is new to America but old to Europe where it is synonymous with fine porcelains, plain pottery, floor tiles, Mettlach steins, flatware, glassware and plumbing fixtures.

title: LatterDay Pilgrims To MontSaintMichel
description: Thirteen centuries ago, legend has it, the Archangel Michael appeared to Aubert, Bishop of Avranches, and commanded that a sanctuary to his honor be built atop Mount Tombe in a wooded area on the Normandy coast. The sanctuary was begun in 708, and while construction proceeded, Aubert sent emissaries to Italy to collect relics from Monte Gargano, where the archangel had also appeared. When the emissaries returned they found that the sea had rushed in and swept away the forest, leaving the hilltop and its sanctuary accessible by land only when the tide was out.

title: Bengals Battle Streaking Steelers,
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 27One might assume that a National Football League team like the Cincinnati Bengals, which holds a twogame lead over a division rival, the Pittsburgh Steelers in this case, at such a late date in the season would have little reason to be nervous. Hardly so. The Bengals play the Steelers here tomorrow and the team is certain to be tense when it comes on the rockhard AstroTurf of Riverfront Stadium.

title: New York Health Officials Say System Encourages Unnecessary Hospital Admissions
Sports Editor's Mailbox: Blame Finley
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: CAMERA VIEW

description: EATONTOWN TODAY, at so, Mrs. Allan Spitz leads the quiet, happy life of an Eatontown housewife, but 50 years ago, as use Marvenga, she was Broadway's reigning operetta queen.

description: MONROE, La., Nov. 27 (AP)One of 24 high school football players burned by lime during a playoff game in Gonzales was hospitalized here today with first and second degree burns.

title: Juvenile Detention A Synonym for Prison?

PEOPLE
description: Lots of people think of Captain Hook in Peter Pan when they hear the name Cyril Ritchard. But theatergoers know him to he a man of many parts. On Friday he will be appearing at Riverhead High School and on Dec. 10 at Huntington High School  each time joining the Long Island Symphony to narrate Shakespeare's Midsummer Night's Dream to the music of Mendelssohn. The program will move to the John Cranford Adams Playhouse on Dec. 12, when George Roseanother versatile performer, currently in the revival of My Fair Ladywill take over as narrator.

title: Susan Untermeyer Wed to R.W. Stemetzki
description: Susan Joy Untermeyer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Martin Untermeyer of West Orange, N.J., was married yesterday to Robert W. Stemetzki, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Stemetzki of Nesquehoning, Pa.

title: Katherine Johnston, Georgetown Senior, Fiancee of Floyd Camalier, Villanova '77
description: The engagement of Katherine Anne Johnston to Floyd Davis Camalier has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Ernest Simpson Johnston Jr. of Chevy Chase, Md., parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Aloysius Camalier Jr. of Potomac, Md.

title: Newark to Test Children's Eyes
description: AN eyescreening program for all Newark youngsters between the ages of 3 and 5 is to begin next Saturday in an effort to detect such serious vision problems as amblyopia, or lazy eye. The project, the largest of its kind to be administered in New Jersey, is expected to serve as a model for the development of similar visual tests for preschool children in other communities in the state and across the nation.

title: Banker Rejects Idea Redlining Is Cause Of Housing Decay
description: A leader of the New York banking industry last week denied widespread charges that savings banks had contributed significantly to neighborhood decay in New York. City through redliningthe practice of refusing to make mortgage or homeimprovement loans in an area.

title: Parole Board Replacement Sought

description: A constitutional crisis is the last thing Prime Minister Callaghan's hardpressed British Government needs at a time when it should be centering its efforts on stabilizing the pound and reviving the economy. Yet Britain seems to be heading for not one but two, perhaps three, long and divisive constitutional wrangles that will take up most of the debating time in the new session of Parliament that began Wednesday.

title: Navy Trounces Army 4th Year in Row, 3810
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 27The outcome was the same, but the hero was new today as Navy made it four straight over Army with a 3810 victory in their 77th meeting.

title: Greece and Turkey Begin to Relax Tensions in the Aegean Dispute but Problems Remain
description: ATHENS, Nov. 27After more than two years of tension, Greece and Turkey have taken the first small step toward improving their relations and reuniting the southeast flank of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

title: GARDENING

title: U.S. Agency to Build Windmill With 200kw. Electrical Output
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP)Returning to an old answer to energy problems, the Energy Research and Development Administration says it will build and test a modernized windmill generating 200 kilowatts of electricity at Clayton, N.M.

title: Paper Back Talk
description: Gambles. This is movie tiein time on Publishers Row the season when most paperback houses take a flyer on the films Hollywood is releasing to cash in on the yearend holiday spirit. If a firm has on its backlist a book from which a movie is derived, it releases a large new printing, wraps it up in a cover aglitter with references to the show, and often inserts a section of still photographs. Sometimes it commissions a freelance writer to do a novelization or an account of how the film was made.

title: The Chronicler of London's InCrowds
Bailey's New HortusMasterwork for Horticulturists
description: Memories of Liberty Hyde Bailey (18581954), dean of American horticulture, have been renewed with publication of the longawaited new edition of his dictionary of cultivated plants of the United States and CanadaHortus Third, the biggest of the three editions published. The new Hortus, revised and expanded by the staff of the Liberty Hyde Bailey Hortorium at Cornell University, presents to interested plantsmen a full and detailed spectrum of the amazing range of our cultivated plants as of 1976, America's Bicentennial year.

title: While Arab States Seem to Relent, Its Enmity Toward Israel Seems Implacable
description: TEHERAN, IranTarlq Aziz, Iraq's Information Minister, spoke distinctly and patiently to a recent visitor to his Baghdad offices, like a schoolteacher giving an oftrepeated lesson.

Miss Alcott Wins in Manila By One Stroke
description: MANILA, Nov. 27 (AP)Amy Alcott, a secondyear pro. picked up five strokes on Donna Caponi Young today and won the $100,000 Far East open invitation Ladies Professional Golf Association tournament.

title: Polonaise
description: By Piers Paul Read. 347 pp. Philadelphia and New York: J. B. Lippincott Company. $10.

title: Friedgood Defense Lawyer:
description: HE is a man of many masks; he can purr like a pussycat when charming a witness, roar like a lion when frustrated by a prosecutor and adopt a conciliatory position between the two if balked by a judge.

description: NEW DELHIMohammed Beg, who grows wheat on a hard, dusty plot of land northeast of Karachi, devoutly wishes that Pakistan would find some oil.

description: State and Federal health officials have announced the discovery of a nonfatal case of swine flu in a small town in Missouri, and they are now trying to find out whether the single case was passed from one person to another.

description: WITH the money crunch binding our household budget these days, the taunting refrain Let. em eat cake! has a hollow ring, indeed. So it is that Entenmann's Thrift Store may be considered high on the list of homeeconomics hints..

title: An Auction of Dead Boats At Times Yields a Bargain
description: It was billed as an auction, but nobody came, not even the auctioneer. And it was cold. The wind picked up a chop on Great River and cut through the marshes of Oakdale on Long Island's South Shore. Besides, the boats were dead, abandoned by owners who felt the vessels weren't worth the pastdue storage charges.

title: Socialists Hear Third World Has Forced New Order
description: GENEVA, Nov. 28Developing countries have already forced the emergence of a new political order based on their power to negotiate over raw material supplies, President Carlos Andrs Perz of Venezuela told the world's Socialist parties here today.

title: 2 Communist Leaders Detained in Spain
description: MADRID, Nov 23 (Reuters)  Two members of the Spanish Communist Party's executive committee were arrested today while handing out party membership cards and detained for several hours, legal sources said.

title: Peking Calls for Restraint in the Nationwide Campaign Against the Four Purged Radicals
description: PEKING, Nov. 28 (Reuters)China appealed for discipline and restraint today in the nationwide campaign against followers of the purged Gang of Four. The appeal, in an editorial in the Jenmin Jih Pao, warned that people who had made mistakes should be cured, not killed.

title: Fuel Oil's Price Up 0.6 Cents,U.S. Says
Birmingham's New Image: Art Center
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala.The gathering in the private dining room of a Birmingham country club one day last week might have seemed more appropriate to New York or San. Francisco than Birmingham. Yaacov Agaih, fresh from signing his latest work, a 30 by30foot relief on the facade of the city's Sye Foundation Hospital, dined with members of the city's substantial arts community chatted with curators and collectors, sketched portraits on dinner plateS, raising. their value well past that of a set of Wedge. wood, and ehded. the evening by doing bit of body painting. on a guest's white shirt, thoughtfully adding his prestigious signature. the arm.

title: Makeup: The Magic Of Wands
description: Wouldn't it be nice to grab a handful of cylinders, wands and tubes, dump them all in a pencil case, take off for an indefinite period of time, and still look as attractive as artifice will allow?

description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 28A biological war has begun in the wetlands of Louisiana between a foreign legion of weevils and the wildly multiplying water hyacinth.

title: Coop Sales Rise Is Hailed As Healthy Economic Sign
description: Last year, a family with an attractive, threebedroom cooperative apartment in a good building on East. 72d Street put it up for sale. In three months they got only one offer and it was so far below what . they had paid that they decided not to sell.

description: Crossbreeding is an old and honorable practice in musical composition, which, in more ways than one, might, he called the science of mixing strains. title: Policemen Picketed In Orderly Protest Over Killing of Boy

description: Piaf . . A Remembrance, a new play by David Cohen, based on the life of the late French singer and including 15 songs made famous by her, will be.presented by Michael Ross and Eddie Vallone on Jan. 24 at the Playhouse, 359 West 48th Street. The Finnishborn actress Juliette Koka will play the title role, marking her New York stage debut. Rehearsals will begin Dec. 13 under the direction of Lee Rachman.

title: Susan Smirnoff, Editor, Is Married to Scott Charles

The new $26.9 million order also includes four diners and six coachbaggage cars.

title: Hospital Closes Building
description: Officials of Greystone Psychiatric Hospital have abandoned a 50yearold building in Trenton after spending $335,000 to renovate it. Morris Foye, the administrator of the state mental hospital, said the building, with its dank and deteriorating rooms, had been closed and most of its 160 patients transferred to another building. At least $335,000 was spent to renovate the building, state officials said, and the cost would rise to more than $500,000 if an elaborate firealarm system was included.

title: Rosalind Russell Dies of Cancer

description: Tom Livingston a short black man with a broad smile and precise manner, sat in an easy chair in his living room and let his mind drift back to the day he heard that the Emerson plant would be closed.

title: World News Briefs
description: VIENNA, Nov. 28 (AP)A report by Amnesty International today said that 25,000 to 100,000 people have been jailed in Iran for political reasons and that the Iranian secret service frequently used torture in interrogations.

title: Yankees Met Jackson's Price And Standards
description: Reggie Jackson might have rejected a king's ransom from the Montreal ENpos. hut when he formally signs a fiveyear contract with the Yankees today, he will clutch in his hands a package that at least must he considered a princely sum.

title: Move to New Synagogue Ecumenical Affair
description: PERTH AMBOY, Nov. 28  Eighteen months ago, when the synagogue that had housed Congregation Shaarey Tefiloh since 1903 went up in flames, Protestants, Roman Catholics and Jews formed a human chain into the burning building to save the congregation's Torahs and other sacred objects.

title: 3 Sales to Test If Bond Interest Is Still Declining

description: The Vermeer Quartet's concert yesterday afternoon at Town Hall, a part of the Peoples Symphony Concerts series, offered a rather too genteel approach to music better served by greater intensity and nassion.

title: Muriel Rafalsky Is Married
description: Muriel Stiefel Rafalsky of New York, widow of Richard Rafalsky, was married yesterday in New York to John Morley Goodwillie, also of New York. Justice Theodore R. Kupferman of the State Supreme Court, Appellate Division, performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Robert D. Steefel. The bride's first husband, Dr. Milton Rosenbluth, died. Mr. Goodwillie heads his own marketing firm. His two previous marriages ended in divorce.

title: Warriors Rout Hawks in First Road Triumph
description: ATLANTA. Nov. 28 (AP)The Golden State Warriors, led by Rick Barry, grabbed an early lead and easily beat the Atlanta Hawks, 13298, in the National Basketball Association tonight.

title: Slaying Suspect Called Outcast Who Sought Friends

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The Government that Jimmy Carter will inherit on Jan. 20 is not the one Lyndon Johnson left behind.

title: Clemson Gains Semifinals

description: MOSCOW, Nov. 28 (Reuters)The Soviet Union's top leaders have accepted an invitation to visit Venezuela. A communique issued at the end of a visit here by President Carlos Andres Perez of Venezuela said the date for the return visit, by the Communist Party leader, Leonid T. Brezhnev, President Nikolai V. Podgorny and Prime Minister Aleksei N. Kosygin, would be decided at an opportune time.

title: Farrell Tops Tottenville for Unbeaten Year
description: Monsignor Farrell played the final schoolboy football game of the year in the city yesterday and completed an undefeated season when it beat Tottenville, 219, at Farrell's field on Staten Island.

title: Ottawa Beats Saskatchewan In Grey Cup on a Late Score

title: A Quebec Family Thinks of Fleeing Minority Status

title: Thailand's Village Scouts Prove To Be Too Zealous for Leaders
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 28The Village Scout movement, begun about five years ago to help border policemen hunt for Communist insurgents, has grown so fervid that it has apparently alarmed its leaders. They have decided to call a halt to recruiting and training next month to reassess their policies and aims.

title: A Tearful Parting Between a Man and HisToys
description: For 20 years Archie and Emma Stiles filled the bookshelves, closets and cupboards of their roomy Victorian house with the sort of castiron fire engines, circus elephants and chinahead dolls they say they had never owned as children.

title: Bomb Found Near Swedish Plant
description: VARBERG, Sweden, Nov. 28 (Reuters) The police today defUsed a 44pound dynamite bomb found next to the Ring bals nuclear power station on a peninsula near this town on Sweden's west coast. The police said the bomb could have damaged power lines and transformers but not the two reactors. A Goteborg newspaper received an anonymous letter last night saying dynamite had been planted at Ringhals.

Bel Tor Blissful, owned by Mary Peacock of Chester Springs, Pa,, and Pamela Hall of Mahopac, N.Y., was named best of 3,494 dogs in Convention Hall today at the Boardwalk Kennel Club fixture. It, was the largest show to be held in the East this year.

title: FRANK FOSTER SHOWS OFF HIS INVOLVEMENT IN JAZZ

title: Turkish Province Mobilized to Aid Quake Victims
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Nov. 28The Turkish Government announced drastic emergency measures in earthquakeravaged eastern Turkey today, and Commerce Secretary Elliot L. Richardson of the United States indicated in a statement here that Washington was ready to provide further aid for the victims.

description: Feb. 13, 1970, is a date that most workers at the Emerson Electric Company's television and radio plant in Jersey City will never forget.

title: Lenz Captures Run
description: Henry Lenz, an 18yearold senior at Memorial High School in West New York, N. J., won the Metropolitan Amateur Athletic Union junior eightkilometer crosscountry championship yesterday at Van Cortlandt Park. Lenz heat Jose Bautista of C. W. Post College by 20 yards, covering the 4.8 mile distance in 25 minutes 53.8 seconds. Post won the team championship with 41 points.

title: Bach Works Are Played By Newman
description: Anthony Newman's singular approach to Baroque style in general and Bach in particular has been stirring up audiences for some time. Perhaps we are just getting accustomed to Mr. Newman's ideas or he is, as he says, mellowing, but his first concert of four devoted to Bach's keyboard concertos at Tully Hall yesterday afternoon was so stylish and impeccably played it could hardly have offended anyone.

title: O'Donnell Wins 10Mile Walk
description: Michael O'Donnell, 17 years old, representing the Long Island Athletic Club, captured the Adolph Arnold Memorial Trophy on the boardwalk in Coney Island yesterday by winning the 66th annual Coney Island 10mile walk in 1 hour 32 minutes 42 seconds. Don Johnson, 59, from the Shore Athletic Club, was second. All 54 starters finished.

title: Imperative For Rhodesia
description: The evident agreement on a deadline date for Rhodesia's legal independence under African majority rule is a significant breakthrough for the monthlong negotiation in Geneva. At the showdown, the two most intransigent of the four African political leadersundoubtedly under pressure from the black governments bordering Rhodesiaaccepted with minor amendments a British proposal fixing March 1, 1978, as the latest date for the formal birth of the nation that will be called Zimbabwe.

description: Despite last year's extensive restaging and restoration of cuts, the Metropolitan Opera's 25yearold production of Verdi's La Forza del Destino is still a very spotty affair, and he situation did not show many signs of improvement at the season's first performance on Saturday night.

Strauss Jr. The bridegroom is the son of Eunice Lent Karnofsky Hendler of Hewlett, LI., and the late Hyman Karnofsky, a lawyer in Buffalo.

Lautin, son of Dr. and Mrs. Arthur Lautkin, also of Manhattan. Rabbi Ronald Sobel performed the ceremony at the Tamcrest Country Club in Cresskill, N.J. The bridegroom's surname was changed.

description: The State Consumer Affairs Division announced new consumer disclosure regulations that will require auto dealers to include shipping and dealer preparation charges in all advertised prices. The division's director, Virginia Annich Long, said the regulations had been put into effect but would not be enforced until Jan. 1 to allow dealers to familiarize themselves with the rules.

description: MARSEILLES, France, Nov, 28 (Reuters) Emmanuel Vitria, Europe's longest surviving hearttransplant patient, celebrated the eighth anniversar yof his operation this weekend. Mr. Vitria, who is 56 years old, now leads a campaign to get blood donors for Marseilles hospitals.

description: Eight days after the explosion in a Queens chewinggum factory, 15 victims are in a struggle for life, suffering from the intense complications that follow severe burns.

description: PARIS, Nov. 29 I wish my father had stayed here instead of returning to become again a puppet in the hands of the Pathet Lao, said the son of former Prime Minister Souvanna Phouma of Laos.

title: Boat in Yard Kills Jersey Girl, 4
description: BRICK TOWNSHIP, N. J., Nov. 29 (AP) A 4yearold girl died yesterday after a fiberglass boat that had been propped against a tree fell on her while she was playing. The police said that the girl, Tara Dalby of Brick Township, died during surgery at Point Pleasant Hospital. Preliminary findings indicated massive head injuries as the cause of death, the authorities said. The girl and her 6yearold brother had been playing outside the residence of Mr. and Mrs. Mitchell, where they had gone with their father for a visit.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29In a surprise move that. created new confusion about the law on capital punishment, the Supreme Court. announced today that would decide whether it. is consitutional for a state to make the death penalty mandatory for anyone convicted of killing a police officer.

description: Dr. Samuel Yochelson, a former Buffalo psychiatrist who, since 1961, had directed research on criminal behavior at St. Elizabeth's Hospital in Washington, died Nov. 12 in St. Louis of a heart attack. He was 70 years old and lived in Chevy Chase, Md.

title: Holiday Donations Lag at College
description: STORRS, Conn., Nov. 29 (AP)A University of Connecticut custodian who has raised $34,000 over the last 18 years to buy Christmas gifts for hospital patients is having difficulty making collections this year. The custodian, Theodore Serwanski, said he had put only eight collection canisters in university dormitories this year because last year 25 of them were stolen. Also, contributions so far amount to only $250, compared with at least $1,000 at this time in past years. Asked why contributions were so poor, Mr. Serwanski said: Take a look at the pinball machines. I think the world of the students and faculty here, but I'd like theth to open up their hearts just a little bit.

title: Latin Universities, Once Strong, In Political and Academic Decline

description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Nov. 29 (AP)Drew McDonald scored four goals, including the deciding one last night as Stanford downed the University of California Los Angeles, 1312, for the Naliana! Collegiate Athletic Association water polo championship.

title: LEW D. FELDMAN, 70, BOOK DEALER, DEAD

description: WASH1NGTON, Nov. 29 (AP)The level of both exports and imports dropped in October, the Government said today, recording the ninth trade deficit in 10 months this year.
