description: TRENTON, Nov. 29Two New Jersey officials called on the National Park Service today to establish boat transportation between Liberty State Park in Jersey City and the Gateway National Recreation area to make the beaches and parks there more accessible to residents of the Garden State.

title: Notes on People
description: Philip Agee, the former Central Intelligence Agency operative who last year published an expos of the intelligence community called Inside the Company, denied in London yesterday that he was a threat to British security, and he appealed to Merlyn Rees, the Flame Secretary, to rescind a deportation order against him. Mr. Agee told Mr. Rees that he would appear before an independent threemember panel set up to advise the Home Secretary on the proposed deportation. He asked for two weeks to, prepare his case. Mr. Agee also turned over to the Home Office a petition hearing 10,000 names, condemning the deportation order issued Nov. 17. He has been told that he would have to leave Britain, where he has lived for some time, for maintaining contacts with foreign intelligence officers that are harmful to British security.

title: The U.N. Today
ALBERT CAQUOT
description: PARIS, Nov. 29 (AP)Albert Caquot, who invented a stabilized captive balloon that gave French forces superiority in aerial observation in the early stages of World War I, died here yesterday. He was 95.

title: A House Is a Portrait, a Plan, a Work
description: Few people are indifferent when it comes to their homes, and many are so houseproud they would as soon show you a snapshot of their home as their children.

title: Stage: 2 Playlets From Canada
Mozambicans Are Being Prepared For Wider Rhodesia Guerrilla War
European Leaders Awaiting Carter Administration
description: THE HAGUE, Nov. 29The European Common Market leaders held their yearend conference here today and told one another, in effect, that they could do little except mark time until they learn the intentions of the new United States Administration and of the oil producing countries.

title: Albany Leaders Hope to Cut Welfare Costs
description: ALBANY, Nov. 29The Republican and Democratic leaders of the New York State Senate agreed today that cutting welfare and Medicaid costs would have top priority during the 1977 session of the Legislature, but they disagreed on approaches.

title: Summary of Actions by High Court
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Zachry, Metzger Share N.L. Rookie Award
description: For the first vicar in the 30year history of the National League's rookieoftheyear award, the honors were shared by two players. In balloting by 24 members of the .Baseball Writers Association of America (two from each National League city), Pat. Zachry of the cincinnati Reds. and Butch Metzger of the San Diego. Padres each received 11 votes. The., other two votes went. to Hettor Cruz a third baseman for the St. Louis Cardinals.

title: Carter Will Be Able to Influence High Court, Despite Nixon Legacy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  Jimmy Carter will begin his Presidency faced with a conservativeleaning Supreme Court forged in sizable part by Richard M. Nixon. Unavoidably, Mr. Carter is bound by the Nixon legacy  but only partly. fortable margin over the five needed for majority, and the current Court seems settled in for some time to come.

title: Manson Leaving Warner
description: Arthur Manson, who became vice presidentworldwide advertising and publicity of Warner Bros. last January, is leaving the company at the end of the year because of differences concerning the administration of his department.

title: Market Place
description: When a company announces a new energy source using available materials not used before to produce energy, there is likely to be a stock market reaction.

title: U.N. Aide Warns of Starvation Peril to Million Uprooted Angolans
description: LUANDA, Angola, Nov. 29 (UPDA million people, one out of six Angolans, are estimated to have been uprooted by the country's civil war and many are running short of food.

title: Artificial Turf Presents Real Problem in N.F.L.
Csonka Surgery Today
PARDONS BOARD HEARS GILMORE'S CASE TODAY
Jersey Legislator Guilty of Bribery On Liquor Supply
Scottsboro Boy Picks Up Alabama Pardon
Lost Connecticut Boy Is Found Unharmed
description: HARTFORD, Nov, 29Craig Reuel, 7 years old, who was the subject of an allnight search after being lost on Rattlesnake Mountain in Plainville, Conn., walked out of the woods to safety about 9 A.M. today in Farmington, about two and a half miles from where he disappeared.

title: U.S. and Jordan in Wheat Deal
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Nov. 29 (Reuters)The United States and Jordan signed an agreement today to supply Jordan with 50,000 tons of wheat valued at $5.5 million. Under the agreement, the United States will finance purchases of wheat with a 20year loan.

title: Between the Acts
description: The twoparty system seems at the moment to have turned into a whatandahalf party system. The what party, of course, is the old Democratic Party, but calling it by its old name tells us very little about it. The real question is, What is it?

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 30, 1976

title: Repairs Specified on Oil Pipeline
JERSEY LEGISLATOR GUILTY OF BRIBERY
description: tion to influence that company's conduct in a way that might be construed as violating laws against the restraint of trade or fair competition.

title: UNESCO Debate Over the Press Put Off 2 Years
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Nov. 29 (UPI)The United Nations Educational Scientific and Cultural Organization agreed without voting today to put aside for at least two years a resolution on the dissemination of news, averting a floor fight between the document's Soviet backers and United States opponents.

title: BIG 3 STEELMAKERS JOIN IN PRICE RISES
description: The nation's three leading steelmakers. the United States Steel Corporation, the Bethlehem Steel Corporation and the Republic Steel Corporationannounced yesterday that they would go along with the 6 percent increases on sheet and strip steel announced last week by the six other leading producers.

title: Toll in Kenya Train Crash Put at 12
description: KATHEKANI, kenya, Nov. 29 (UPI)At least 12 people were reported killed early today when an exppress train ran onto a flooded bridge whose rails had been swept away, crashed through it and Plunged into a river.

title: Canadiens Widen Lead On Brisk Scoring Pace
description: While the Islanders firstplace lead was slowly slipping and the Rangers lastplace gap was slowly narrowing, the Montreal Canadiens were making a shambles of the National Hockey League standing. The champions cornpleted a pertect threegame road trip and pulled 17 points ahead of secondplace Los Angeles in the terribly unbalanced Norris Division. The other division leaders fell hack. The Islanders lost three of four games and saw their Patrick Division margin fall to 5 points over onrushing Philadelphia; the Boston Bruins dropped one of three in the Adams Division as Buffalo pulled to within 12 points with two games in hand, and the St. Louis Blues and Chicago Black Hawks continued their musicalchair act in the weak Smythe Division with the Blues gaining a 3 point advantage.

title: Islander Tickets on Sale
description: Tickets for the second half of the New York Islanders' home season will go on sale today at the Nassau Coliseum and all Ticketron outlets. Dates included are Jan. 1 (Vancouver) through April 2 (Botson).

title: Hyland to Study Liquor Industry On Use of Rebate
description: TRENTON, Nov. 29Attorney General William F. Hyland said today that he had directed an investigation of the huge New Jersey liquor industry to find out if it was common practice to take kickbacks and rebates.

title: Reviewing the Budget
description: Perhaps spurred by the Charter implementation hearings, City Council President Paul O'Dwyer and Majority Leader Thomas J. Cuite have finally moved to establish a new legislative Office of Budget Review, mandated under the Charter reforms enacted last fall.

title: DR. JULIUS A. HAIMAN
description: Dr. Julius A. Haiman, an ear, nose and throat specialist, died Friday at Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 84 years old and lived at 166 East 61st Street.

title: Founder of Religious Sect in India Is Sentenced for Killing Defectors
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 29 (Reuters)An Indian railway clerk who founded a mysterious religious sect was sentenced to life imprisonment today for murdering six defectors from his movement.

title: Television
Jersey Legislator Guilty of Bribery On Liquor Supply
description: NEWARK, Nov. 29Matthew Feldman, president of the New Jersey State Senate, pleaded guilty today to charges that he had paid $6,400 in bribes to assure that his liquor distribution company would be the exclusive supplier to the Emersons Ltd. restaurant chain in New Jersey.

title: BILL RATES DECLINE TO A FOURYEAR LOW
description: Even though some segments of the credit markets appeared to be resting yesterday after the strong Thanksgiving rally, some shortterm interest rates continued to decline and Treasury bills were auctioned at their lowest rates in more than four years. However, it was increasingly believed that interest rates now were going to remain steady until the Federal Reserve signaled its next step toward easeand that will depend on trends in the economy and the money supply.

title: Jet Hit by Lightning Returns
description: BOSTON, Nov. 29 (UPI)A Trans World Airlines 707 jetliner landed here about eight hours behind schedule last night after it was struck by lightning and repairs were made in Shannon, Ireland. No one was injured. The jetliner, TWA flight 753 with 124 passengers aboard from London to Boston, landed at Shannon to refuel because of a fuelers strike at London's Heathrow Airport.

title: STATE IS CRITICIZED IN MOPEDS DISPUTE
description: A new state law legalizing slowspeed motorcycles and motorbicycles for the first time goes into effect tomorrow with the State Department of Motor Vehicles already trying to put the brakes on the program.

title: CARTER BID TO CURB APPOINTEES IS HINTED
description: AMERICUS, Ga., Nov. 29Jimmy Carter's official spokesman hinted strongly today that the Presidentelect was close to a decision to ask Congress to pass laws that would prevent or discourage appointees in the Carter administration from later taking employment with business concerns that do substantial business with the Government agency the appointee served.

title: Carter Staff Urged To Prepare Moves To Avert Famines
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 29A noted international development expert today urged the administration of Jimmy Carter to place the prevention of famine high on its foreign policy agenda, saying that the world food crisis, like the energy crisis, was far from over.

title: Changing the Guard
description: In the last week, changes in ownership were announced for three famous journals in the Englishspeaking world. These changes were hopeful auguries, for in each instance fresh financial strength was brought to the aid of publications whose existence has been threatened by real or potential deficits.

title: Post for Mrs. Abzug With Carter Urged
Losses on Road Of N.B.A. Clubs Affect the Line
description: Inflation has come to the National Basketball Association betting line. The phenomenon of the inability of teams to win on the road has increased point spreads to as high as 13. Of the 202 games played thus far, home teams have won 75.7 percent.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Thanks to both circumstance and Presidential prerogative, Mr. Carter will have an immediate opportunity to begin influencing, indirectly, the Court when he takes office even though he will have no vacancies to fill.

title: Carter's Aides Back Delay on B1 Until Broader Issues Are Settled
HIGH COURT TO HEAR CHALLENGE BY NIXON
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 29The Supreme Court agreed today to hear former President Richard M. Nixon's challenge to the 1974 statute that gave the Government control over his Presidential papers and tape recordings.

title: Relief Official in Turkey Is Said to Have Lost Job For Criticizing Quake Aid
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Nov: 29The mayor of a village at the heart of Turkey's earthquake disaster zone whit, Was dismissed from a relief coordinating committee was removed because of his criticism of Government relief efforts, Turkish journalists said here today.

title: Jackson Signs Yankee Contract For Five Years and $2.9 Million
description: Last June, 24 hours after the Yankees engineered a 10player trade with the Baltimore Orioles, players from the two teams collided in the lobby of a Chicago hotel.

title: Now It's Harris Creative
description: With the departure of Alice Westbrook to become a creative director of Ogilvy & Mather, Chicago, Westbrook/ Harris former executive vice president in that city, has changed its name to the Harris Creative Group. Robert N. Harris, fomer executive vice president of North Advertising, is president.

title: McGovern Urging U.S. to Withdraw Veto Against Vietnam Entry in U.N.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (AP)Senator George McGovern urged today that the United States withdraw its veto of Vietnam's application for admission to the United Nations.

title: About New York
description: Willowbrook must be expunged, we all agreed, back when the startling pictures of institutionalized neglect glimmered on the TV screens as a reminder that someoneour government? us?was packing away thousands of people like tarnished attic fixtures because they were deemed retarded.

title: Arab Emirate Government Quits
description: ABU DHABI, United Arab Emirates, Nov. 29 (Agence FrancePresse)The Federal Government of the United Arab Emirates has resigned, three days before the expiration of the provisional constitution set up when the federation was formed five years ago.

title: MINORITY GROUS ASK FOR GATEWAY ROLES
description: The Gateway National Recreation Area was the target yesterday of black and Hispanic complaints of insufficient representation in planning, jobs and contracts, at the same time that Rockaway and nearby Brooklyn communities charged Federal busing proposals would make their lives a nightmare.

title: De la Renta's Spring Show All Color, Silk and Flare
description: I'm tired of seeing women in men's clothes, Oscar de la Renta observed in a quiet moment after his spring show.

title: Medicaid Mess, Cont'd.
description: The disclosures of profiteering and callous dispensing of shoddy if not dangerous medical services by New York's Medicaid mills leave no doubt that legislative controls are urgently needed. State and city health authorities agree that the regulatory provisions proposed by Assemblyman Alan G. Hevesi should provide a foundation for reform of an intolerably corrupt business that thrives on exploitation of the poor, the sick and the elderly.

title: Bridge:
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 29A powerful TexasCalifornia sextet captured the Reisinger boardamatch team championship here late last night, concluding the Fall National Championships of the American Contract Bridge League.

title: Harvester Has 4thQuarter Profit In Contrast With Loss a Year Ago
description: The International Harvester Company, a major producer of farm equipment and motor trucks, reported yesterday a profit for the final fiscal quarter. A year ago the company had a large deficit resulting from a loss of $40 million of the Wisconsin Steel division.

title: Recording of Porgy Completed by RCA
description: RCA Victor has completed recording the current Broadway production of Porgy and Bess, with Clamma Dale and Donnie Ray Albert singing the title roles. The company won the recording rights over competition from Columbia and Deutsche Grammophom

title: Laura Walker Is Wed to Theodore Danforth
description: Laura Brevoort Walker, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Grenville Kane Walker of New York and Southampton, L.I. was married yesterday to Theodore Nelson Danforth of Locust Valley, L.I., and Fisher's Island, N.Y.

title: Hills to Shut Down Eight Supermarkets
description: BRENTWOOD, L.I., Nov. 29Hills Supermarkets Incorporated announced today that it would close eight unprofitable stores next Saturday, five of them in Suffolk County and one in Nassau.

title: HIGH COURT TO HEAR CHALLENGE BY NIXON
ICE AGES ATTRIBUTED TO EARTH ORBIT SHIFT
Parley on Rhodesia Takes Up Question Of Interim Regime
description: GENEVA, Nov. 29Participant's in the conference on Rhodesia's future, unable to agree on a date for the transfer of political power from the white minority to the black majority, formally shelved the issue today and began discussing the creation of an interim government instead.

title: SPECIALISTS' TRADING IN OPTIONS ALLOWED IN DECISION BY S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The Securities and Exchange Commission approved today a proposal by the Philadelphia Stock Exchange that would permit specialists there to trade in listed options on the securities in which they deal.

title: Pitt Is Voted Best in East In Football
William L. Butcher, Banker, Dead
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 29William L. Butcher, retired chairman of the board of the County Trust Company and a major figure in the postwar industrial and corporate development of Westchester County, died today at White Plains Hospital after a short illness. He was 69 years old.

title: Soviet Airliner Crashes On Takeoff in Moscow
Southern Lebanon: Gunfire, Open Fences, Busy Markets
CARTER BID TO CURB APPOINTEES IS HINTED
description: AMERICUS, Ga., Nov. 29A spokesman for Jimmy Carter indicated today that the Presidentelect was close to a decision on measures that would prevent or discourage those appointed to positions in his administration from later takOng jobs with private concerns that do substantial business with the government agency the official had served.

title: Swinnerton, at 92, Still Writes a Book a Year Between Chores at His Pickwickian Cottage
description: CRANLEIGH, Surrey, EnglandPeople keep asking Frank Swinnertou for his reminiscences of Charles Dickens, who died in 1870. But he cannot help them because Frank Swinnerton is only 92.

title: New York City Gets Its First Snow of Season
description: The city received its first dusting of snow yesterday afternoon as a stream of chilly Canadian air moved into the area and sent temperatures tumbling toward the freezing mark.

title: Fortepiano in Comeback for Dudley's Haydn Recital
description: The revival of interest in old instruments, long since freed of the taint of antiquarianism that made many musicians regard it suspiciously, has now brought the fortepiano hack into consideration. This is the 18thcenturyViennese instrument that served as link between the harpsichord and the modern piano in the evolutionary scale, although because it. has hammers that, strike rather than pluck the strings it represents a clean break with the harpsichord tradition and is more truly descended from the clavichord. Essentially a less powerful piano, the fortepiano, or hammerflgel, as the Germans call it, has been late in acquiring a following, possibly because it has been either dismissed as an unsuccessful prototype or cherished merely for its quaintness, like a ModelT that still runs.

title: Article 9  No Title
City Ballet's Choreographers Put Their Best Foot Forward
description: Before plunging headlong into the lucrative snowbank of The Nutcracker, the New York City Ballet gave final look, for the next five weeks at least, at its unequaled repertory. Over the weekend, its two resident choreographers were at their varied best at the State Theater.

title: Article 1  No Title
Benching of Caster, Giammona Reflects Problems Plaguing Jets
Booming South Korean Economy Clouded As Indicators Lag After Months of Growth
description: ANYANG, South KoreaTwo years ago, Kim Ki Chang's new business was floundering. lie was trying to sell topaz jewelry to women here, in a land where the average family income totaled only $481 a year.

title: Everyman's Bloody Mary
description: The L. Rose division of Cadbury Schweppes U.S.A. which already sells lime juice and grenadine, is attempting to extend its sphere of influence. Its new entry is Rose's Bloody Mary Mixer in 24ounce bottles that is going on sale on the West Coast. Ted Bates & Company is the agency.

title: Solomon Beats Gottfried for S. Africa Title
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov. 29 (UPI)Harold Solomon retained his South African open tennis championship today when he defeated Brian Gottfried, 62, 67, 63, 64, in a threehour, allAmerican final. It was a rematch of last year's final.

title: INDECISION IS SHOWN BY CHINESE IN PURGE
South Korean Shift Of Intelligence Unit In U.S. Is Reported
Taxes &
description: Among other things, the Securities and Exchange Commission's highly controversial version of inflation acCounting is setting the stage for a test of how smart the stock market is.

title: Cadillac Fairview Corp. Makes Highest Bid for Irvine Co.
Article 7  No Title
Witness Who Gave An Alibi to Carter Recants Testimony
description: PATERSON, N. J., Nov. 29A former friend of Rubin (Hurricane) Carter testified today at Mr. Carter's retrial on murder charges that she had lied for him on the witness stand nine years ago. She had testified then that the former boxer was with her when three persons were killed in a Paterson tavern.

title: PENSION FUNDS SHUN BUYING MORE BONDS FROM NEW YORK CITY
Feeling Blue..
description: A few days after the Presidential election, I was approached in the subway by a couple of men who couldn't find the D train. As I steered them on their way, one of the men asked in a deep Southern accent: How do y'all up North feel about having a Georgia boy for President? I mumbled something noncommittal which didn't seem to satisfy the second man, who said: Yeah, it must be hard for y'all to see the. South back on top again.

title: ItalianAmericans Get a 2d Magazine
description: Last month IAM, the first national magazine for ItalianAmericans, made its debut. Now the charter issue of ItalianAmerican Identity, with a January cover date, is in the mails.

title: Yoshimura Jury Told of Arms
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 29 (AP)The prosecutor in the trial of Wendy Yoshimura, once Patricia Hearst's companion as a fugitive, said today that he would show the jury a frightening arsenal of weapons found in a Berkeley earaee in 1972.

title: U.S. Hailing New Mexican Leader
Court Won't Decide On an Import Levy Imposed by Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (AP)The Supreme Court refused to decide today whether President Richard M, Nixon had the authority in 1971 to impose a temporary 10 percent surcharge on imports to help curtail a national economic crisis.

title: Commerce Department Delays Index Report
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (AP) The Commerce Department has postponed for one day the release of a key report on the economy.

title: DoubleTracked Scars
description: In a letter published on this page today, a correspondent calls attention to a few of the many glaring defects in planning and construction of the Interstate Highway System. It still may not be too late to correct at least some of the system's obvious deficiencies in safety and beauty, and to insure against their replication in the 10 percent of planned superhighways that, presumably, are still to come.

title: Jackson Signs Yankee Contract For Five Years and $2.9 Million
description: Last June, 24 hours after the Yankees engineered a 10player trade with the Baltimore Orioles, players from the two teams collided in the lobby of a Chicago hotel.

title: Dow Declines by 6.57 to 950.05
description: News that the nation's three largest steelmakers had raised the price of sheet steel by 6 percent sent the stock market lower yesterday in heavier trading.

title: Auto Makers to Increase Output Despite Lag in Sale of 77 Models
description: DETROIT Nov. 29Despite flat auto sales since the newmodel year started in the fall, the industry is planning sharp production increases in December and the first quarter of 1977.

title: Ford to Propose $10 Billion Tax Cut Similar to One Already Rejected by Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  President Ford, fulfilling an oftrepeated campaign promise, will ask Congress in January to pass a permanent $10 billion tax cut, the White House said today.

title: Issue and Debate
Latin Universities, Once Strong, In Political and Academic Decline
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 26Throughout Latin America, the national universities are in political and academic eclipse.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Interstate Highways:

title: Connors Reported Out of the Masters
Thomas E. Mullaney
description: At his Nov. 15 news conference, Presidentelect Jimmy Carter said, in response to a question, that he would seek voluntary commitments from labor and business to try to hold down inflationary pressures. He added that by using existing mechanisms for discussion, including jawboning techniques by the President, he felt he could avoid any compulsory wageprice controls, barring an unforeseen national calamity.

title: PRESIDENT OF VENEZUELA VOWS SUPPORT FOR LISBON
description: LISBON, Nov. 29President Carlos Andres Prez of Venezuela, the first foreign leader to address Portugal's Assembly of the Republic, today pledged his Government's support for this country's struggling young democracy.

title: Supreme Court Refuses to Review Desegregation Plan in Wilmington
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The Supreme Court refused today to review, at least for the time being, the sweeping citysuburban school desegregation plan imposed on the Wilmington, Del., area last spring by a threejudge Federal court.

title: Edwin S. Smith, One of First N.L.R.B. Officials
description: Edwin S. Smith, one of the first three members of the National Labor Relations Board and a longtime supporter of SovietAmerican friendship, died on Saturday at a Riverhead, L. I., nursing home. He was 85 years old and had lived in nearby Sag Harbor since his retirement in 1964.

title: WellWishers Besiege Amy Carter's School.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29After 108 years, the Thaddeus Stevens School was suddenly fashionable today. One community group wanted all the students to come to trim its Christmas tree. A salesman for My Weekly Reader offered them all free subscriptions.

title: Godfrey Cambridge, 43, Dies on Set For Entebbe Movie in Hollywood
description: HOLLYWOOD, Nov. 29Godfrey Cambridge, the actor and comedian, died today of a heart attack on a movie set at Universal Studios. He was 43 years old.

title: TV: Crosby and Knight Specials Fail Despite All Good Intentions
description: Tis the season of specials, and CBS is especially busy this week. Among the mixed lot of offerings, tonight's The Ted Knight Musical Comedy Variety Special Special attempts something a little different. Tomorrow's Bing Crosby's White Christmas Special sticks to the traditional inclusion of the entire Crosby family. Both fail.

title: Dollar and Pound Firm
Museums Put Art to Work, From Totes to TShirts
Magazine Ad Revenues Up
description: October was another winner for the magazine industry. Advertising revenues increase 35 percent over October, 1975. while advertising pages increased 22 percent.

title: TESTIMONY DOUBTFUL AT BRONFMAN TRIAL
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 29Three key witnesses who were expected to take the stand in the defense of Mel Patrick Lynch, one of the two defendants in the Bronfman kidnapping trial, may not testify.

title: Officials Express Concern
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29Officials at the Council on Wage and Prices Stability expressed concern today that a price rise for flatrolled steel could weaken the already faltering economic recovery.

title: Article 6  No Title
...Feelin' Gray
Mother Is Stabbed In Court Anteroom
description: A 31yearold woman was critically wounded in an alleged knife attack by her husband yesterday afternoon in an anteroom of Family Court in Manhattan, where they and an 8yearold son had gone for a hearing on abuse charges against the father.

title: Woodcock Calls AutoPollution Key To His Rejection of a Cabinet Post
description: Worry over possible embarrassment to Presidentelect Jimmy Carter in deciding what to do about automobile antipollution controls was a key factor in the decision ofLeonard Woodcock, president of the United Automobile Workers, not to accept an appointment to Mr. Carter's Cabinet.

title: STEPHEN BERKELHAMMER SHARES HIS SOLO RECITAL
description: Stephen Berkelhammer's concert in Carnegie Recital Hall Sunday night was more in the nature of a chamber music program than a solo recital. Mr. Berkelhammer, who plays the oboe and recorder, Shared the stage with three guestsKarl Kraber, flute; Chris Finckel cello, and Dennis Michno, harpsichordand these four musicians proved, on the Whole, to be most compatible collaborators.

title: Sidney Laskin, N.Y.U. Professor Of Environmental Medicine, Dies
description: Sidney Laskin, professor of environmental medicine at New York University, died of a heart attack Sunday at Kennedy international Airport. He was 57 years old and lived in Spring Valley, N.Y.

title: Celebrity Spots Assailed
description: The use of wellknown. personalities in TV commercials has come under attack as a creative copout in the current issue of Checkout, a newsletter published by Marsteller Inc.

title: Witness for Friedgood Renounces Part of Testimony on Phone Call
description: MINEOLA, LI.. Nov. 29A defense witness testified last week that she had spoken to Sophie Friedgood on the telephone eight hours after the prosecution asserts that her husband, Dr. Charles E. Friedgood, murdered her. Today she testified that, when she told the doctor she had spoken with his wife, he advised: Keep it in mind. Don't tell anybody. You may be called to testify.

title: Article 3  No Title
Article 5  No Title
The Giants Triangle
description: Hostility between the Soviet Union and China and their armed confrontation along a 4,500mile border stimulated both countries to seek better, relations with the United States after the Ussuri River clashes in 1969. Speculation about a possible reversal of this trend is natural now that Moscow, since the death of Chairman Mao Tsetung, has been openly seeking a rapprochement with Peking. The national interest of both countries in avoiding nuclear war has convinced some policymakers in Washington that SovietChinese rapprochement is likely and, in fact, may already be under way.

title: BIG 3 STEELMAKERS JOIN IN PRICE RISES
description: The nation's three leading steelmakers the United. States Steel Corporation, the Bethlehem Steel Corporation and the Republic Steel Corporationannouhced yesterday that they would go along with the 6 percent increases on sheet and strip. steel announced last week by the six other leading producers.

title: Little Voter Fraud Found In New Mail Registration, But the System Has Bugs
description: New York City Board of Elections officials said yesterday that there was little evidence of fraud resulting from the state's yearold , mail voter registration system.

title: Dave Anderson
Colombian Coffee Price Expected To Increase to Over $2 a Pound
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Nov. 29 (AP)Colombian coffee will be priced at over $2 a pound within the next few days on the internationa market, the National Association of Coffee Exporters forecast today.

title: Alcoa Lifting Prices Of Can Aluminum By as Much as 11.2%
description: The Aluminum Company of America announced yesterday price increases of as much as 11.2 percent on the aluminum it produces for use in certain beer and carbonated beverage cans and specialty containers.

title: Treasury Bill Yields Decline at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 29Yields declined on Treasury bills in the weekly auction today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: DIGGS SAYS THAT CARTER MAY JOLT SOUTH AFRICA
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov. 29Representative Charles C. Diggs Jr. said today that the Government of South Africa appeared %not to have realized that the inauguration of Jimmy Carter might herald a new and tougher American. policy toward South Africa.

title: In Memoriam
description: GRAFFLouis. November 30, 1958. Sweet memory of a loving, kind father.

title: Brooklyn. Grand Jury Starts Inquiry Into Policeman's Slaying of Youth
description: A Brooklyn grand jury yesterday began an investigation into the shooting of a 15yearold boy by a police officer last Thursday night near a housing project in the East New York section.

title: An Iowa Mother Regains Custody Of 2 Children Taken to Israel
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 29 (AP)An Iowa woman has regained custody of her two children by order of the Israeli Supreme Court after they were allegedly abducted to Israel by their father.

title: Montvale Murder Suspect To Undergo Mental Tests
description: HACKENSACK, Nov. 29Harry De La Roche Jr., a lanky 18yearold military college student who found it difficult to make friends or communicate with his own family, was arraigned yesterday in the murder of his parents and two younger brothers. A judge then ordered him held pending psychiatric examination.

title: Benjamin Wright, Educator, Authority On Constitution Law
description: Benjamin Fletcher Wright, an authority on constitutional law and the fifth president of Smith College, died Sunday at his home in Austin, Tex. He was 76 years old.

title: Australia Devaluing Is Joined by Papua And New Zealand
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Nov. 29 (UPI)A devaluation of the Australian dollar caused similar devaluations today of the currencies of neighboring New Zealand and Papua New Guinea.

title: Tempestuous New Yankee
South African Actors Stop a London Show
description: LONDON, Nov. 29 (Reuters)An allblack South African musical came to en abrupt end tonight when demonstrators and members of the cast made a protest on stage Over low pay and their fears that they would be victimized by the South African Government.

title: Building Contracts Reach a New High
description: ?? contracts rose sharply in October to record levels, the F. W. Dodge. division of McCrawHill Information Systems reported yesterday, Contract totals ?? the month, at. $10.06 billion, were of percent above the level of contracts in the corresponding month of 1975.

title: JOHN THOMAS SCHNEIDER, FORMER FEDERAL OFFICIAL
description: John Thomas Schneider. a lawyer and former Federal official, died last Friday at a Washington, D. C. nursing home. He was 81 years old and a resident of the capital.

title: J. LOY MALONEY
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 29 (UPI)  J. Loy Maloney, 85 years old, former managing editor of The Chicago Tribune, died yesterday in Venice, Fla.

title: Youth Is Held on Charges Stemming From Shootings At Brooklyn Skating Rink
description: An 18yearold youth, David Fong, was arraigned in Criminal Court in Brooklyn yesterday on charges of possessing a dangerous weapon, and another 18yearold, Kam Wong, is scheduled to be arraigned in Caledonia Hospital late today or tomorrow as a result of a shootout Sunday afternoon that wounded three youths in the crowded Wollman Memorial IceSkating rink in Prospect Park.

title: Godfrey Cambridge, 43, Dies on Set For Entebbe Movie in Hollywood
A River Park West of Lincoln Sq. Endorsed by City Planning Study
Wheat Futures Off By Nearly 6 Cents
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 29 (AP)Wheat futures declined nearly 6 cents a bushel on the Chicago Board of Trade today.

title: Eleanor S. Duckett, Taught at Smith
description: Eleanor Shipley Duckett, a retired professor of classical languages and literature at Smith College, died last Tuesday at a Northampton, Mass., nursing home. She was 96 years old.
